commit_message: Initial commit of Tiled (Qt port).
Ignore generated files.
Added Map and Tileset classes and made a small start on XmlMapReader.
Added basic framework for the content handler for loading .tmx files.
Added ResizeHelper widget and ResizeDialog, to be used for map resizing.
Add icons to the main toolbar and ignore qrc generated cpp files
Added some map loading code.
Added MapScene, Layer and TileLayerItem. Implemented grid rendering.
Merged MapScene changes with added map loading code.
Added more map loading code and actually display the loaded map somewhat
A few resize dialog improvements
Only enable map resize action when map loading was succesful
Added some support for loading properties and set a title on the toolbar
Some more progress on property loading.
Add recent files functionality and add a few more icons
Some code polishment and changed organization to mapeditor.org.
Used dock widget for layers and only enable recent menu when necessary
Compile with QT_NO_CAST_FROM_ASCII and QT_NO_CAST_TO_ASCII
Added Dutch translation and some other small things.
Clear recent files, save disabled if there's no map, and resource file cleanup
Added loading of tileset images and made a start on layer data loading
Added loading of tile data and tile rendering
Make sure the tile layers are drawn in the right order.
Huge speedup in scrolling performance by only drawing what's necessary
Changed from QImage to QPixmap, since pixmaps are optimized for drawing
Fix loading of maps with gids higher than 127, interpret as unsigned char
Fixed drawing of tiles higher than the standard height
Fixed cleanup of previous map when loading a new one
Added support for gzip compressed layers.

Added detailed error reporting when loading a map failsAlso added an about dialog and fixed up some memory leaks, especially when annerror occurred, though tilesets are still being leaked since nobody takesnownership over them.n
Fixed leaks of layer data, tilesets and maps.Also enabled debug mode by default for easier debugging.n
Made map loading over twice as fast by optimizing Map::tileForGid
Added saving and restoring of the main window state
Got rid of Properties class, a QMap<QString, String> will do.Also implemented loading of map properties, I think.n
Added the option to hide/show the tile grid
Added displaying of layer names
Added initial objectgroup and object support
Fixed the location of an assert in Map::tileForGid.Now maps without tilesets won't fail to load, as long as they are not using anyntiles of course.n
Mostly cosmetics.Fixed leakage of QPen objects and load object properties a bit faster.n
Added a properties dialog that shows the map properties.
Layer is now a common subclass for TileLayer and ObjectGroup
Added support for tile spacing
Added support for opening a map from the command lineAlso added support for command line arguments --help and --versionn
Removed the word 'port', since it's meant to be a new version
Enhanced look of map objects and show name/type in tooltip
Added support for layer opacity and visibilityFor both TileLayer and ObjectGroup.n
Added support for loading and displaying layer propertiesFor both TileLayer and ObjectGroup.n
Introduced Tile class for storing tile propertiesWraps the previously used QPixmap.n
Fixed loading of tileset images that have an absolute path
Renamed 'decompress' module to 'compression'Should also have a method that does compression of data. Will benimplemented later.n
Added a writer for the tmx formatStill some features missing, but quite complete. Save action is nownenabled.n
Split save action up into Save and Save As

Added undo/redo support and editing of map and layer propertiesAlso includes updating the window title and whether the Save action isnenabled. Removed three TODO items in the source code, but added four. :)n
Display object names.

Added confirmation dialog about unsaved changesIt offers to save your current map when there are unsaved changes onnexit and when opening a file. Also added this confirmation for when thensession is closed, but I'm not sure how to test that.n
Add undo and redo icons. Add undo and redo to the toolbar.
Merged object name display and icons added by Roderic
Fixed boundingRect and name display for objects
Fixed popping up of confirmation dialog when canceling open fileconfirmSave() was called before the fileName.isEmpty() checkn

Added support for moving layers up and downComplete with updating scene and undo/redo support. However, the currentlynimplementation still leaves a bit of cleanup to be done. It seems we eithernneed some kind of wrapper class around the Map class which provides us withnall the necessary models and interfaces to make changes to the map, or wenneed to put all that stuff in the Map class itself.n
Changed the indentation of half of the header files for consistency

Introduced MapDocument class around the core Map classThe MapDocument wraps the Map class in order to avoid adding too much clutternto the base data structure. The MapDocument will provide an interface andnmodels around the Map and related classes that allow modification, and makesnit possible for GUI parts to update themselves accordingly.n
Moved the undo stack into the MapDocument classIt makes more sense there, and having an undo stack per map document also makesnit easier to support multiple map documents in the future.n
Added a clean icon for the undo view, and more icons for the ui
Added an empty Tileset dock which will show the tilesets
Added the new icons to the user interface
Made some progress with a tileset model and viewNothing to see yet.n
Added support for gzip compressed layer data
Added display of first tileset based on QListViewThe QListView almost does the trick, but it's unsuitable for several reasons,nso a nicer tileset view should be written.n
Display all tilesets of the map
Merged tileset branch with default branch
Added a brush preview cursor that displays where tiles are drawnOr would be drawn, if they could be drawn...n

Fixed showing and hiding of the brush cursor when appropriateThe previous workaround with a QGraphicsView turned out not to be necessary.nInstead, Enter and Leave events could be handled in a QGraphicsScene::eventnreimplementation.n

Added support for reading maps that use external tilesetsNo support yet for saving such maps properly. On saving, the tilesets will benembedded in the map currently.nnThe TsxTilesetReader is based on QXmlStreamReader. It's supposed to be fasternand more convenient to use than the SAX based QXmlSimpleReader.n
Hide scope names in Doxygen-generated documentationAlso added generation of Qt compressed help for display in Qt Assistant.n
Properly handle saving of maps with external tileset referencesAlso added a file filter to save and open dialogs.n

Added a tileset managerThe tileset manager introduces two main advantages. First, when opening a newnmap, it avoids loading any tilesets that are already loaded. Second, it willnmake sure that maps using the same tilesets refer to the same tile instances,nallowing the implementation of copy/paste between maps.n
Fixed handling of tile layers with an offset
Renamed .hgignore to .gitignore
Simplified handling of map object position
Converted DOS newlines to UNIX in COPYING file
Added opening of last map at same scroll positionShould be optional once a settings GUI is there in order to change thisnoption.n
Added the start of a tile selection modelWorking my way to copy/paste actions.n

Added Select All and Select None actionsFirst two actions that actually use the tile selection model. Made surenthe display of the selection is properly updated when the selectionnchanges.nnOf course these actions are useless at the moment since the selectionnisn't used for anything yet.n
Updated the DoxyfileDisabled FULL_PATH_NAMESnDisabled GENERATE_QHPnEnabled JAVADOC_AUTOBRIEFnEnabled SOURCE_BROWSERn

Added basic painting functionality to the brushIt's a start, but with a lot of missing pieces: the MapScene still needsnto be modified about tile layer changes, the user should still be ablento select which tile is used to draw and subsequent tile paints shouldnbe merged into one undo command.nnAlso, it's a bad idea to hardcode the brush logic in the BrushItem. Oncenanother kind of brush is added, a more generic Brush interface can bendeveloped.n

Introduced TilePainter in order to fix repaintsThe TilePainter wraps a TileLayer and allows modifications to be madenwhile sending the necessary signals for the map view to update. It alsonabstracts away layer position and does bounds checking.n
Make resizing of the map view more efficientSetting Qt::WA_StaticContents on the map viewport allows Qt to optimizenredraws when the size of the map view changes.n
Fixed two small memory leaksThe tile selection model wasn't deleted and the brush wasn't deletednbecause it wasn't added back to the scene when no map document existed.n
Made a better about box for the application.  I also made a larger version of the logo.  I tried to keep it as close to the original one as possible.
Replaced tabs with spaces (to match other files) in the files I made
Don't leak an About dialog on every use
Made the About dialog a bit smallerI just reduced the size hints of some spacers. Also got rid of thenwarning about unused parameter by not marking the main window title asnuntranslatable.n
Implemented drawing with selected tileThe TilesetDock now sends out a signal when the currently selected tilenchanges. This information is used to update the tile that the BrushItemndraws with.n
Made object type comparison case-insensitiveOf course different object types should be configurable, but that'snsomething for another time.n
Pedantic fixes regarding the position of & and *Following the Qt style.n
Added the ability to start a new mapNot very useful for now, since it is not possible to add a tileset ornlayer to the map. It comes with one tile layer by default though.n
Added new tileset dialog
Implemented creation of a new tileset and adding it to the mapThe tileset dock will also update based on a signal emitted from thenMapDocument.n

Fixed updating of firstGids when writing out the mapMapping tiles to their global IDs has now been moved from the map intonthe map writer, where it has also been fixed to update properly whenntilesets have changed.nnShould probably be generalized later, so that the behaviour is moreneasily shared by multiple map writers.n

Fixed recent file list to remember files by their canonical file pathAvoids duplicate entries for the same file, and avoids broken entriesnwhen Tiled was started from the command line with a relative path.n
Disabled the margin spinner for now, since it's not supported
Made the Browse button in the new tileset dialog functionalAlso inserted some intelligence for automatically setting the tilesetnname based on the selected image, if it wasn't edited by hand yet.n
Fixed crash on unloading a map with new tilesets addedForgot to add new tilesets to the TilesetManager.n

Fixed mouse move events and inefficient repaints with Qt 4.6Mouse tracking now needs to be enabled explicitly on the viewport. Also,na flag needs to be set to tell Qt to compute the exposedRect property ofnthe QStyleOptionGraphicsItem.n

Moved some code related to new tileset and map out of mainwindow.cppTrying to keep the size of mainwindow.cpp down. At the same time though,nI've moved dynamic adaption to language changes to the main window. Itnshouldn't be necessary for dialogs, since they are only temporarilyncreated anyway.n
The new tileset dialog now initializes with tile size from the map

Made it possible to drag around map objectsIncluding snapping to grid when the grid is visible. However, nonundo/redo yet. Also, map objects now interfere with regular tilenediting, so the objects should only be draggable when they're on thencurrently selected layer.n
Limit movable map objects to those in the selected object groupAlso fixed updating of brush visiblity when the current layer is changednusing the keyboard.n
Added undo/redo support for moving map objects
Fixed crash related to roaming pointer after changing layer orderAlso fixed a compiler warning and removed use of obsoletednQGraphicsItem::children() method.n

Fixed creation of undo command when a layer overlaps the moved objectThe presence of a layer caused itemAt() to not return the MapObjectItemnthat was being moved. The creation of the MoveMapObject command nownmoved into the MapObjectItem class, which is a nicer place.n

Fixed a crash on undoing object move after changing layer orderReferencing the MapObjectItem directly from MoveMapObject was a mistake,nsince the item gets deleted and recreated when the scene is refreshed.nIt should only reference the underlying MapObject, which is guaranteednto be still valid.nnThe updating of the map object items is now done through the mapndocument and the map scene.n
Added context menu for changing map object propertiesOnly applies to map objects of a currently selected object group.n
Show the kind of properties that are being editedThe properties dialog now displays for example Map Properties insteadnof just Properties as its title. The same applies to the related undoncommand.n
Made the grid a nice dashed pattern instead of solid lines
Added icon to new document actionAlso added the action to the main tool bar and set the default shortcutnon it.n
Enhanced icons in menus by using 16x16 optimized versionsActions that are also used in the tool bar get the larger 24x24 versionnadded to them, to make sure they look nice in both places.n

Made the position of the main window also persistentBy storing the the full geometry rather than just the size. Using thenrestoreGeometry method still makes sure that the window is notnpositioned off the screen when for example the resolution changed.n
Added an example map with a single object
Small code simplificationsThe virtual destructor and Q_DISABLE_COPY are already inherited fromnQObject, and the explicit constructor doesn't really add anything.n

Implemented resizing of map objectsWhen an object group is selected, the map objects of the object groupnnow gain a resize handle that allows you to resize the map object. Thenhandle will snap to the grid when the grid is enabled, similar to movingnthe object.n
Minor tweaks to indentation around layer data

Added support for removing map objectsSince you can't select map objects yet, they can for now only be deletednvia their context menu.nnThis also includes some of the work necessary for adding map objects,ncause of the undo functionality. However, the user interface allows nonway to add objects yet.n
Using my full name from now on
Make sure the saved order of map objects is preserved when undoingWhen undoing the removal of a map object, the object was inserted at thenend of the list rather than at its original location.n

Fixed repaint issue when drawing with high tilesThe region to be repainted didn't get adjusted to the maximum tilenheight yet, causing problems when drawing with tiles higher than thenmap's tile height.n
Allow changing the visibility of the map layersThe list of layers now has checkboxes that allow you to change thenvisibility of the map layers.n
Made dock widgets restorable from menu
Make sure that you can't edit invisible layersThis avoids quite some confusion.n
Added support for a margin around the tileset image
Removed the extra pixel for the gridSince the grid is rather light and not always visible, it's probablynbetter not to reserve any space for it.n
Got rid of an unused variable

Fixed moving and resizing of map objects with Qt 4.6For performance reasons, since Qt 4.6 the QGraphicsItem no longernreceives events about geometry changes like ItemPositionChange unless younexplicitly tell it you want those.n
Corrected the invisible layer table header

Improved updating of the scene in response to layer changesBased on layer{Added,Removed,Changed} signals from LayerTableModel,nforwarded by MapDocument. No need for a full scene refresh anymore whennlayers get added or removed.n

Some fixes to the updating of the current layerThe LayerTableModel was sending out the wrong indexes when rows gotnremoved/inserted.nnAlso, as explained in MapDocument::setCurrentLayer, we don't always getnnotified by the selection model when the current layer index changes.nThis can now be worked around by calling MapDocument::setCurrentLayer,nbecause it no longer checks whether the current layer actually changednbefore sending out the signal.n
Added ability to delete layersWith undo/redo working.n
Speed up the undo view by setting uniform item sizesSince the items are all the same height, the view can do optimizations.nHowever, one has to tell the view to assume uniform item sizes first.n
Added close actionNow you can close the file. This is mainly useful for debuggingnpurposes, until multiple open files are supported.n
Show the tileset dialog at its preferred sizeRemoved hardcoded geometry, which is font size specific.n
Made it possible to add new propertiesUsing a special row that contains <new property>, which adds a newnproperty when edited.n
Added deleting of map properties on pressing the Delete keyAlso allowed multi-selection so that multiple keys can be deleted at thensame time.n

Improved property editing with keyboardLeft and right keys now change the column of the current index, evennthough the selection mode is per row. This allows you to edit thosencells without having to resort to mouse clicking.nnAlso, it is now possible to start editing by simply starting to type.nPreviously you needed to press the edit key (F2).n
Implemented handling of tile-element map data
Some fixes to the tile-element layer data code* Detect and report too many <tile> elements correctlyn* Still set mTileId for <tile> elements inside a <tileset> elementn

Fixed triggering endless loop in grid drawing codeWhen drawing a negative line with a custom dash offset, it appears Qtncan enter an endless loop. Since in these cases the grid wasn't supposednto get drawn anyway, we can just avoid drawing negative lines.nnWith negative line I mean a line going from A to B, but where A isnhigher than B.n
Use the new default Save As and Quit shortcutsQt 4.5 added a default shortcut for Save As and Qt 4.6 added a defaultnshortcut for Quit. Using those ensures consistency on the supportednplatforms.n
A bit of MapScene cleanupRemoved an unimplemented method and took brush visibility out of thenpublic API (it isn't used from outside the MapScene).n
Made it possible to rename layers
Introduced convenience methods Map::layerCount and Map::layerAtBefore, the only way to access map layers was by using Map::layers,nwhich isn't so nice to read in most cases.n
Renamed LayerTableModel to LayerModelThe fact that it was a table model wasn't really significant. Since itnwas using only one column anyway, I also changed it to be a list modelnnow.n
Added license header fileMakes it easier to have it added automatically in for examplenQt Creator.n

Implemented adding of new tile and object layersSince the undo command for adding and removing a layer is so similar, annabstract base class AddRemoveLayer was introduced.nnAlso fixed an inconsistency in Remove Object and Delete Layer. Thenlatter is now also called Remove.n
Removed the map argument from the Layer constructorThe Map class already takes care of setting this when a layer gets addednto a map.n
Introduced a delegate for drawing the items in the tileset viewThis delegate fixes performance and spacing issues with the tilesetnview.n
Switched the tileset view and model to a tableThe tiles are now arranged exactly as they are in the original tilesetnimage, which is more convenient than wrapping them arbitrarily.n
Added Duplicate Layer actionImplemented cloning of map layers and objects and used it for anDuplicate Layer action.n

Made map resizing functionalComplete with undo/redo. Objects that fall outside of the new map arennot yet deleted though, and currently it doesn't handle layers that arennot the same size as the map correctly (they are simply resized to thennew map size).nnIt's a bit nasty that an ObjectGroup can't be resized without having anmap owner set. This is necessary because it needs to convert tile tonpixel coordinates. Maybe I should try to represent object position usingnfloating point tile coordinates instead of pixels...n
Fixed painting outside of a layer generating undo commandsMoved the contains check to TileLayer::contains, so that it can also benused from BrushItem, before creating the PaintTile command.n
Added Map::clone, mostly for completenessMight come in handy later.n

Changed MapObject to use tile coordinates instead of pixel coordinatesUsing tile coordinates makes sure we can resize an ObjectGroup withoutnit needing to be part of a map. Objects will also be able to adapt whennthe tile size changes.nnThe position and size of objects is still saved in pixels.n

Added support for adding new map objectsCurrently simply by dragging the left mouse button over the map scenenwhen an object group is selected, since we have no object selection yet.nnUnfortunately you can't edit the name and the type of the map objectsnfor now.n
Fixed compiler warning about initialization order
Simplified the tsx reader somewhatI'm convinced that it'd be good to rewrite the tmx SAX-based reader to anstream reader as well.n
Added the ability to edit the name and type of map objectsUsing an extended PropertiesDialog, the ObjectPropertiesDialog, thatnhas fields for the name and type.n
Added some icons and made layer properties available from the menu
Added tile brush previewAlso simplified the check before painting a little.n
Fixed a crash when loading a map with a tile selectedIt can happen that the selected tile is no longer valid after switchingnmaps, so be sure to reset it to 0.n

Use the 'raster' graphics system by default on X11Because the X11 native graphics system has serious performance problemsnwith drawing the tile grid.nnIt still allows people to override this, by not setting it when angraphics system is specified as a command line parameter. To launch withnthe native graphics system, you'd start Tiled as:nn  tiled -graphicssystem nativen

Made a start on abstracting map renderingThe tile layer rendering code should not be in TileLayerItem, sincenthere it can't be conveniently reused in other places.nnAlso, the way a map is rendered depends on its orientation. Currentlynonly orthogonal orientation is supported, but that is planned to change.n

Introduced stamp brush, created by right-click dragThe implementation got pretty messy unfortunately, will need to lookninto cleaning that up a bit later. Also, creating stamps from thentileset view is not supported yet.n
Turned off brief member descriptions in the documentation
Allow creating a stamp brush by dragging in the tileset viewThis is very convenient for placing connecting blocks of tiles on thenmap at once.n
Added a script that makes a source release

Updates to AUTHORS and TODO files and about dialogThe about dialog now states copyright belongs to me, since I wrotenpractically all of the application. Contributors are mentioned in thenAUTHORS file together with their contributions.n
Fixed some conversion issues from qreal to int
Removed some no longer necessary debug output
Compile on Mac
On Windows, we need to use the zlib that comes with Qt.

Fixed the minimum row and column size in the tileset viewThe horizontal and vertical headers were affecting the minimum size ofnthe rows and columns. Return a small size hint from the TilesetModel tonprevent this.nnMantis-task: 9n

Moved the conversion from gid to Tile* into the map readerIt didn't belong in the Map class, where it just complicated many placesnthroughout Tiled. It now also better handles corrupted or faulty tilenlayer data, popping up an error instead of exiting with an assertionnerror.n

Implemented zooming of the map viewBased on real-time QGraphicsView transformation. Seems fast enough innsoftware mode, and would be for free if OpenGL was used.nnThere seem to be some small painting glitches, but other than that therenare less issues than I had expected.nnMantis-issue: 2n
Exclude generated files from DoxygenExclude files generated by moc, uic and rcc.n
Enabled zooming with Ctrl and mouse wheelAlso made sure that the zoom actions are appropriately enabled/disabled.n

Fixed stamp creation when not dragging topleft to bottomrightNow it works in all directions.nnAlso disabled dragging around for the toolbar, since it's not verynuseful, and the toolbar looks cleaner that way.n
Fixed a warning and told Qt not to try painting a ObjectGroupItem
Fixed a compilation issue with Qt <= 4.5

Fixed handling of <object> elements outside of <objectgroup>Better not crash when this happens. Encountered it when trying to loadnan old map, from when the 'objectgroup' didn't exist yet.nnFor backwards compatibility it might be better to implicitly create annobjectgroup instead, but I'm pretty sure I'm the only one with thosenkind of maps lying around.n
Fixed tile drawing glitches when zoomed inIt shouldn't be rounding off floating point values, since then it cannfail to paint half a pixel.n
Fixed grid disappearing when zoomed inAnother case of cutting off a floating point value. Need to take thenceil instead.n

Separated out StampBrush, implementing the new AbstractTool classThe functionality of the stamp brush is now less intertangled with thenMapScene and BrushItem classes. This should open the way fornimplementing other kinds of tools.nnThe actual implementation of the StampBrush hasn't gotten much prettiernyet though.n
Updated the Doxyfile to Doxygen 1.6.1Mostly removal of trailing whitespace.n

Introduced the ToolManager and a tools tool barMaking adding additional tools possible by registering them with thenToolManager. They will be added to the tools tool bar, with which youncan select the active tool.nnHowever, the stamp brush is still the only tool, so it remains to benseen whether this is the right setup.n
Added an eraser tool that allows you to erase tilesMantis-issue: 1n
Preserve the stamp when switching toolsOnly reset it when switching maps.n
Changed Ui::MainWindow to be aggregated with a pointerMore consistent with the rest of the .ui files.n
Specified the version in a single place and raised it to 0.2.0
Fixed some stamp brush related crashesWhen the stamp brush was not the active tool, the map document was notnupdated correctly. This caused crashes when referencing the deleted map.n
Re-enable dragging about of the toolbarsEspecially now that there are two of them, it becomes more useful.n
Added ability to save a map as an imageWith options whether to take into account current zoom level or layernvisibility.nnOn request of the Pokemon community. :)nnMantis-issue: 18n
Added support for masking tileset images based on a certain colorMantis-issue: 3n
Made the names of the TMX map reader and writer more specificXmlMapReader renamed to TmxMapReadernXmlMapWriter renamed to TmxMapWritern
Merged the TMX and TSX readers into one QXmlStreamReader based readerThis gets rid of the depencency on QtXml and makes the code easier tonunderstand.nnMantis-issue: 8n
Made tileset image loading a bit fasterBy making copies of the QImage instead of the QPixmap, a conversion to anQImage for each copy is prevented.n
Added a first unit test, testing the map reader
Use icons from the system theme when possibleUsing QIcon::fromTheme() function that is added in Qt 4.6.n
Added a slider to change the opacity of the current layerLayer opacity is now handled by the QGraphicsItem::opacity propertynintroduced with Qt 4.5.n
Tiled now depends on Qt >= 4.5
Added a NEWS file listing the changes since 0.1.0
Fixed a conversion warning

Added a rectangular selection toolSupports replacing, adding (with shift), subtracting (with ctrl) andnintersecting (with ctrl+shift) the current selection.nnOf course, since the selection isn't used for anything yet, this tool isnuseless for now.n
Introduced an abstract base class for tile toolsThe AbstractTileTool is the new place for all the duplicated code in thenstamp brush, eraser and selection tool.n
Tweaked selection tool to allow selecting nothingBy taking the position between the tiles, a single click will now notnselect anything, which is expected behaviour for a selection tool.n
Snap to grid when Ctrl is pressedThis replaces the snap-when-grid-is-visible logic, which wasn't reallynobvious. The new behaviour is also more flexible, of course.n

Introduced tool status info in the status barCurrently this basically displays the current tile coordinates for anynAbstractTileTool. The selection tool also displays the size of thenrectangle while selecting.nnMantis-issue: 7n
Made paint operations take into account the tile selectionAlso, changes to the tile selection are now part of the undo stack.n
Fixed stamp brush getting a reset when switching toolsBug was introduced with the AbstractTileTool.n
Added keyboard shortcuts to the toolsThis feature exposes a bug when switching tools while the mouse cursornis in the scene. A fix will follow for that later.n

Changed the AbstractTool interface to be independent from mouse eventsTo solve the issue with not having mouse events when switching tools,nbut still needing to send enter/leave and position updates. Now thesenevents can be easily simulated.n
Keep the source directory clean from temporary filesBy specifying directories for moc, uic, rcc and object files.n
Use the built-in shortcuts for zooming in and out
Reorganized the TmxMapWriter to use private methods

Added initial support for copy/pasteThis implementation works by writing a TMX file to the clipboard undernthe text/tmx mime type. As such it also works from one map to another ornfrom one Tiled instance to another.nnThe tricky part is that sometimes new tilesets have to be added to a mapnwhen you paste a selection to it. Tiled tries to avoid this whenevernpossible, by checking whether the same or a similar tileset (thatndiffers only in tile properties) is already in use. For similarntilesets, the tile properties are merged.n
Implemented cutCurrently, this action makes for a much more efficient way to erasentiles than the eraser. Looks like the eraser can use some improvement.n

Fixed an issue with the implementation of TileLayer::copyPreviously, the function could return 0 or an area smaller than thenspecified region. These are confusing properties to deal with and werenthe cause of errors when undoing certain stamp brush painting or cutnactions.nnAlso, the QRegion variant of TileLayer::copy is now no longer slowernthan the QRect variant, so the latter is removed.nnA memory leak was fixed in PaintTileLayer, which forgot to clean up thencopied part of the target tile layer.n
Introduced a ClipboardManager for interfacing with the clipboardMoving most of the clipboard handling code out of the MainWindow class,nwhere it doesn't really belong.n
Fixed initialization of whether the clipboard has a map

Fixed unnecessarily creating a ChangeSelection command on pasteWhen pasting with no selection, there is nothing to deselect. ButnselectNone() would unconditionally create a ChangeSelection commandnanyway.n
Fixed loading of maps that use an external tilesetThese kind of maps can't be created with this version of Tiled yet, butnat least it can load and save them correctly.n
Bumped the version to 0.3.0, updated NEWS and README filesThe TODO file was removed in favour of tracking tasks with the Mantisnbug tracker linked from the website.n
Fixed tileset deletion by MainWindow due to missing include
Fixed map object artifacts when dragging and zoomed inThe line width is 3 but the shadow is shifted by one, so the additionalnwidth for the bounding box should be 4.n
Added scrolling the map view with the middle mouse button
Save layer opacity when it isn't equal to 1
Added two example mapsThe sewer example shows the use of a transparent color in the tileset,nwhile the desert example shows the use of tile margin and spacing.n
Explicitly add the src directory to the include pathNecessary on Windows, for some reason it doesn't get added by default.n
Confirm overwrite on the right moment for 'Save as Image' dialogProblem reported on IRC by CodyMartin.n
Added link to the website to the About dialog
Check the Qt version in the .pro fileAvoids confusing compile errors when people try to build Tiled withnearlier Qt versions, especially when they hit a Qt 3 qmake.n
Fixed reading of maps with non-binary-encoded layer dataWas broken due to a forgotten skip element, making it stop reading afternthe first tile and reporting the rest as unknown elements.n
Added Portugese translation
Fixed a compile issue on Mac OS X related to QXmlStreamWriterApparently the way the QXmlStreamWriter was moved from QtXml to QtCorenon the Mac means trouble for forward declarations.n
Don't create change selection commands when the selection didn't change
Enable command compression for the eraserThis is to make sure that when you drag the eraser to erase a largernarea, the consecutive erase commands get merged into a single undoncommand.n

Enable undo command compression for the stamp brushSame as done with the eraser. Multiple consecutive paint commands thatnare the result of one paint operation now get merged together in ansingle undo command.n

Fixed a crash when loading a map while holding CtrlThe map would have to contain map objects.nnWhen Ctrl was held, it always tried to snap to the grid, even when thenposition only changed because the map object item was being synced withnits map object. Now the snapping logic is skipped when syncing.n

Added initial support for map orientation to the map reader and writerMain difference is that now Tiled will refuse to load maps that arenusing an unsupported orientation (anything else than orthogonal).n

Turned MapRenderer into an interfaceMoved the current implementation into OrthogonalRenderer. Of course, theninterface will still need to be extended to cover everything that isnorientation dependent.n
Made a start on support for isometric mapsIntroduced a new MapRenderer, the IsometricRenderer. Only grid renderingnhas been implemented so far, based on the Java implementation.nnMantis-issue: 31n

Implemented isometric tile layer renderingThe implementation is similar to the one in Tiled Java, but optimized anbit further to draw as few tiles as possible.nnThere's still quite some stuff hardcoded for orthogonal maps that willnhave to be moved into the MapRenderer interface though.nnMantis-issue: 31n
Bumped version to 0.3.1
Merge branch '0.3'
A bit of documentation for the save as image dialog
Fixed the remaining issues with isometric tile layersMoved the mapping from screen to tile coordinates and the drawing ofntile selection into the MapRenderer.nnMantis-issue: 31n
Implemented duplicating of map objectsTheir context menu now has a 'Duplicate' item.n

Fixed a possible crash when rendering the brush itemCould happen when tiles extended beyond the height of the standard tile,ndue to a missing bounds check in the tile rendering code. The boundsncheck became necessary after the recent changes to support isometricntile layers.n
Added tileset file notification using QFileSystemWatcher

Some code cleanups related to automatic tileset reloading* No need to pass Tileset* as const in the signal, especially since we'dn  need to use a const_cast in that case.n* Fixed some unreliability when multiple files change, by restarting then  timer for each new file that changes.n* No need to remove paths from the watcher when deleting the tilesetn  manager. It should already not be watching anything, and it's about ton  be destroyed anyway.n

Added Offset Map... option to the map menu.This serves as a useful shortcut do doing things that are mostly possible butnmore tedious with cut/paste and offset-within-resize.nnThere is a dialog with a number of options:n- X and Y offsets to applyn- Wrapping to the other size on X and/or Y axisn- Which layers to apply ton  - All visible layersn  - All layersn  - Selected layern- Apply to whole map or within current selection area (if available)n

Some code cleanup related to offset map feature* Moved retrieving of affected layer indexes and bounding rect into then  OffsetDialog, to keep mainwindow.cpp a bit cleaner.n* Use QList instead of QSet since duplicate indexes are never inserted.n* Removed some unnecessary null pointer checks (a MapDocument always hasn  a map and a selection model).n* Renamed enumerators to comply with naming standard.n* Made the offset map dialog non-resizable.n* Use selection as bounds by default when there is a selection.n

Fixed a bug with map saving introduced with watching for tileset changesThe Tileset's file name is not supposed to be set to the file name ofnthe tileset image. The TilesetManager should be using the Tileset'snimage source attribute instead. I failed to notice this earlier.n
Made sure all translatable strings have a proper contextMainly involved getting rid of all usages of QObject::tr, which does notnset a proper context.n
Fixed a rare crash on startup due to a missing initialization
Marked Clear Recent Files as translatable
Updated Dutch translation
Fixed the context of Portuguese translationsAlso removed obsolete strings from Portuguese and Dutch translations.n

Improved the support for translationsNow a regular make command will use lrelease to make .qm files from then.ts files. Also, Tiled now looks for the translations relative to thenexecutable, so it is more likely to find them regardless of where it isnexecuted from.nnIt is also easier to add new translations and to update existing ones.nFor the latter you can now just run 'make ts' in the 'translations'ndirectory, which will run lupdate with the right parameters.nnqmake syntax has been largely based on the Qt Creator support forntranslations.n
Updated translation files to use relative locationsAvoids large diffs in the .ts files due to line number changes.n

Introduced a Preferences dialog with a few settingsThe Preferences dialog currently allows the user to choose the tilenlayer data format, whether to automatically reload tilesets when theynchange and the interface language.nnTo support the latter properly, a language manager was introduced thatninstalls the right translators for both Tiled and Qt and figures outnthe list of available translations.nnThis commit also adds support for saving tile layer data in thennon-binary XML format (Mantis-issue: 22).n

Fixed a bunch of strings to adapt to language change dynamicallyThese strings are part of the main window (mostly dockwidget titles) andnthus should be able to adapt to a language change dynamically.n
Wait a little bit longer when a tileset changesOn my laptop, 100ms is too fast and leads to read errors in libpng whennthe tileset is saved in GIMP. Waiting 200ms is also acceptable.n

Added a paint bucket fill tool to the toolbar.This tool will fill an area consisting of a given tile (or lack ofntile) with another tile or tile selection, respecting currentnselection bounds. The tool has a realtime preview when you mousenover the map area.nnThe bucket fill icon is from GIMP.n

Removed unused TilePainter::fill and skipEmptyTiles parameterAlso removed the initial memset from computeFillRegion, since a QVectornis already initialized by default.nnSet the Undo Commands context for Fill Area.n

Fixed a crash due to new size being invalid when resizing a map.If the width or height of the map was the default value in the resizendialog (currently 1), then the new size of the map was invalid untilnthe user changed the value of each axis in question.nnThis was because when ResizeDialog::setOldSize gets called, it setnthe value of the spin boxes, causing a callback in ResizeHelper tonset the new size. However, if the width or height was default, thennthe the spin box functions returned without triggering the callback,nleaving ResizeDialog::mNewSize unitialized (negative).n
Bumped version to 0.4.0 and updated AUTHORS and NEWS files
Made the TilesetManager independent of the Preferences classMakes it more reusable.n

Made writing out a DTD reference optional and disabled it by defaultApparently the reference makes the XNA XML parser crash. Since it alsonrequires special handling in Java, it is now disabled by default.nnIn response to merge request 1739 by Agent MOO.n

Fixed ignored expressions in TilePainter::computeFillRegion.They were part of an optimization that turns out to not work, but due tonthere being commas instead of ampersands they were evaluated and ignored.n
Fixed bug with fill region being off when selection bounds change.The bucket fill tool needs to clear its preview overlay when the selectionnbounds change, so the fill region does not become stale.n
Fill tool now works betterNow the origin of a repeating brush is at the top left of the fillednregion, instead of at the map origin.n

Added display color option to object group propertiesDifferent object groups can be displayed as different colors tonmake it much easier to distinguish which objects are parts ofnwhich groups when viewing the map.nnPer-type colors take precedence over object group colors.n
Added Spanish translation
Updated the Spanish translation
Fixed reversed logic for reloading changed tilesets optionOops. :-)n
Renamed Undo Stack to the more friendly HistoryIt already ended up being translated to the equivalent of history innthree translations, and it really sounds better that way.n
Fixed dynamically retranslating the System default language settingAs a string in the language combo box, it was particularly noticable.n
Added German translation
Update of the german translation.

Implemented support for objects on isometric mapsThis finishes the support for isometric maps, which will soon benpossible to be created using the new map dialog.nnIt also fixes some remaining issues with grid snapping when creating newnmap objects, where it was still depending on whether the grid wasnenabled or not.n

Fixed missing object layer properties on properties dialogWhen opening the properties of an object layer from Layer -> LayernProperties, as opposed to the layer right click menu, the object groupnproperties subclass was not instanciated.nnI added a static function to PropertiesDialog to create the appropriatensubclass for a given layer. It's called in both places now fornconsistent behavior.n
Simplified showing of properties dialog a bit
The new map dialog can now also create isometric maps

Made the movable shape of objects more accurateEspecially in isometric mode, a bounding rectangle was not accuratenenough, since half of the area would be outside the object. Now, thenregion that you interact with matches the painted shape exactly.n

Fixed usage of uninitialized variableDue to a wrong initialization order, the ResizeHandle could end up usingnmSyncing uninitialized, and might send a resize back to the map objectnitem while it's being constructed.nnHopefully this is what lead to the occasional crash on zooming ornscrolling the map view.n
Don't leak a QSettings instance

Made the tileset view zoomable with the scroll wheelThis is a quick hack that makes the tileset view zoomable with thenscroll wheel. For now, each tileset has to be zoomed separately and thenzoom level is not remembered.nnThe zooming functionality is shared with the map view through thenZoomable class.nnMantis-issue: 9n
Updated NEWS file with stuff added since the last update
Fixed translation context for name of bucket fill tool
Updated translation files to the current sourceString freeze for 0.4.0 is now considered active.n
Updated the German translation
Updated the Portuguese translation
Updated Spanish translation
Fixed compile with Qt 4.5It doesn't have QPainterPath::translate. Thankfully the functionalitynwas easy to implement manually.n
Updated Dutch translation
Adapt to icon theme also in context menusSo far only the icons in the main window menus were adapting to thensystem icon theme on Linux. Now the object and layer context menus donthe same.n
Added an application window icon

Got rid of the TileSelectionModel classSince it got reduced to a pointless wrapper around QRegion, it's betternto just get rid of it completely. The tile selection is now managed bynthe MapDocument directly.n
Implemented adapting to language change for the tools
A bit of include cleanup

Rearranged default dock widget layoutThe history dock widget is now tabbed together with the layers docknwidget and the tileset panel moved to the right by default.nnAlso fixed the enabled state of Offset Map action and opacity slider.n

Implemented painting of objects when saving as imageAlso fixed the save as image function to clear the map before painting,nto avoid garbage when the map doesn't occupy all pixels (which is nevernthe case for isometric maps, for example).n

Made a stamp captured using the stamp brush usable by the fill toolA quick hack, going through the MainWindow class. We should probablynintroduce a place that keeps track of the current brush at some point.n

Added ability to edit tile properties through a context menuNot the most user friendly since it can currently only be done throughnthe context menu and only for single tiles, but that's the samensituation the editing of objects properties is in at the moment.n
Final translations update
Support non contiguous selections in the tileset viewNot sure if this used to be a problem, but on testing it seems to worknfine and on inspection of the code I don't see why it wouldn't.n
Added Brazilian Portuguese translation
Added Japanese translation

Some fixes for building on Mac OS X* Include debug information without trying to link to debug Qt librariesn* Add an Info.plist file for including some meta-information in the appn* Add an icons file to have an icon in the dock and the findern* Build a universal binaryn* Use the 10.5 SDK (was the lowest available on the Mac I used)n
Don't show icons in menus and use the unified toolbar on Mac OS XLooks better.n
Include image plugins in static buildsThough for some reason the static check in the .pro file failed onnMac OS X, and needed commenting out when making the release.n
Added French translation
Added CSV encoding support

Added shift modifier to bucket fill tool.Holding shift will switch the tool to fill the current selectionnregardless of the tile boundaries within it. If there is no selection,nthe full layer is used.nnAdded callback modifiersChanged() to AbstractTool to assist tools innupdating if a keyboard modifier changes. This is achieved by installingnan event filter on the application so it works even if the map viewndoesn't have focus.nnRemoved unnecessary calls to currentTileLayer() innBucketFillTool::tilePositionChanged.n
Avoid using dynamic_cast to determine the type of event
Mention CSV layer support by Dennis in the AUTHORS file

Fixed drawing selection highlight where brush is not paintingBefore, the selection highlight would cover the entire bounds of thenbrush, whereas now it doesn't include the areas where no tiles will bendrawn.n
Don't create undo commands for Select All when it's not necessaryIt was also doing it when already the whole map was selected.n
Added Italian translation
Sort the list of languages in the preferences dialogLooks nicer, especially with the number of translations growing.n
Added a simple plugin managerIt loads both static and dynamic plugins, and provides a convenient waynto query for plugins that implement a certain interface.n

Added an Export action and a first simple pluginThe Export action allows saving the map in any format provided by anplugin that implements the MapWriterInterface, without changing thencurrent file name or marking the undo stack as clean.nnThe simple plugin is for The Mana World eAthena server collision files,nstored in a binary .wlk format.n
Added Czech translation
Merge branch 'origin/master'

Avoid incompatibility with Tiled Java in 'trans' attributeIn Tiled Java, there was no # in front of the color name. Putting itnthere causes a NumberFormatException when it tries to load a map. Let'snavoid this for now.nnMantis-issue: 34nMantis-issue: 44n
Make the string <empty> in UndoDock translatable. Also, provide the Czech translation for it
Made settings in New Tileset dialog persistent
Made settings in New Map dialog persistent
Use the standard shortcut for DeletePotentially more cross-platform than handling the Delete key directly.n
Only attempt to build a universal binary when Qt supports ppc
Declare Tiled as Editor of *.tmx files on MacOS XWhen launching Tiled from the console, it was spitting out a warningnabout its Info.plist not containing any valid value for thenCFBundleTypeRole.n
Fixed the selection drawn for the stamp brushIt broke when fixing the selection drawn for the fill brush inncca7086aff3beb77add2a58b58f36c94afce9d94. :(n
Bumped version to 0.4.1And updated the NEWS file.n

Also keep track of the maximum tile widthFixes repaint issues when tiles that are wider than the tile width ofnthe map are used. I'm not quite sure yet whether the result isnsatisfactory though.nnMantis-issue: 33n
Merge branch '0.4'

Another fix to brush item selection paintingMove the layer in setTileLayerPosition instead of moving it to the wrongnposition in updateBoundingRect. Also fixed BucketFillTool to positionnits layer correctly.n
Merge branch '0.4'
Added position fields to ObjectPropertiesDialog
Added object-resizing support to the ObjectPropertiesDialog.
ObjectPropertiesDialog update- UI is now defined in ui file, not in coden- Position and size editors are now groupedn- QDoubleSpinBoxes are now used for position and sizen

Further tweaks to the object properties dialogAdjusted the margins and the resizing behaviour, as well as specifyingnsomewhat saner minimum and maximum values. Also made sure that thendialog shows at its recommended size and removed an unnecessary call tonemitObjectChanged (since the undo command will do that).nnAdded Michael Woerister to the list of contributors.n

Added error handling to the New Tileset dialogWhile before it would happily add empty or unnamed tilesets to your map,nthe New Tileset dialog is now a little bit smarter and will inform thenuser when the image could not be loaded or when no tiles could be foundnin the image.n

Added undo for adding tilesetsBefore it was not possible to undo adding a tileset, which was quitenannoying when you realized you chose the wrong parameters. It is howevernstill not possible to remove a tileset that was already part of the map.n
Disable editing of tile properties for external tilesetsIt is not actually supported at the moment, since changes to the tilenproperties would never be saved.n

Added the ability to remove tilesets from a mapWhen the tileset to be removed is in use by the map, the user is askednto confirm the removal of both the tileset and all references to tilesnin that tileset from the map.n
Open local files when they are dropped onto TiledThis does expose a crash somewhere in the MapScene / AbstractTool that Inwill have to look into later.nnMantis-issue: 45n

Fixed crash when opening a map through drag-and-dropThe active tool was receiving events while being 'disabled' due tonchanges made to the scene while the mouse was on top of it, resulting inna null pointer reference.n
Added option to draw the tile grid when saving as imageRequested by Carlos Matarazzo.nnAlso made the save as image options persistent.n
Don't make a fill region if it won't have an effectIf the stamp is a single tile, and the tile the mouse is over matches it,ndon't compute a fill region.n
Fixed eraser working on invisible layers

Added a context menu to the layer dockAlso improved the default layer names generated by Add X Layer dialoguesn(which now say Object Layer 2 or Tile Layer 5 and count up based onnnumber of object layers or tile layers).n

Allow Delete to erase the current layer when focus is in the layer viewAdded an keyboard event handler so that the Delete key can also be usednto remove layers, when an item is chosen in the layer view.n
Added button controls to the layer dockSituated beside the opacity controls.n

General cleanups of previous commits* Fixed case of #include <QToolbar>n* Removed superfluous () for calling constructor without parametersn* Add spaces between if( and tweaked location of newlinesn* Shorten some lines to less than 80 charactersn* Moved layer actions toolbar below layer list and make icons 16pxn* Removed unnecessarily QString::number() calls for QString::argn* Removed shortcuts from right-click menu to make it a bit narrowern* Don't delete menu actions, since the menu will already do thatn* Fixed handling of other keys than Delete in layer view like Up/Downn* Corrected string for Duplicate Layer actionnnDoes not solve the code duplication issues yet.n

Removed the dialog when adding new layersThe layers now get a sane default name, so the dialog is less necessary.nWhen the layer view is visible, we automatically open the in-place layernname edit.nnThis also gets rid of a lot of duplicated code.n
Make sure the layer toolbar actions show tooltipsAll this duplication needs to go though.n
Extended installation instructions somewhatNow explains how you can go about installing Qt 4 development librariesnon Ubuntu, Debian, Fedora and Arch Linux.n

Made the static build mode more explicitOn Fedora, QT_SHARED is not defined for some reason, so Tiled assumes itnis being built against a static Qt while it really isn't, resulting innundefined references to the Qt image plugins.nnWorked around this problem by using a custom STATIC_BUILD define.n

Always enable the Save action when a map is loadedThere are several reasons why you may want to re-save a map withoutnactual modifications to the map, and you may want to save a newlyncreated but still empty map. Hence the save action should not bendisabled when the undo stack is clean.n
Explicitly clear the current selection on tileset view right-clickWhen there was a complex tile selection, it was not being cleared onnright-click.n

Made copyright statements more specificNow mentioning all contributors to each file rather than referring tonAUTHORS file. This is mainly due to this information otherwise gettingnlost when parts of Tiled are used in other projects.nnTo avoid confusion, the first line of each header is now the file name,nto signify that the list of contributors applies to that file.nnThe GPL headers have also been modernized, linking to gnu.org instead ofna postal address.n
Added Latvian translation to Tiled

Introduced the MapDocumentActionHandler to reduce code duplicationSeveral map actions, in particular those modifying the layer stack, werennow duplicated in multiple places. The new MapDocumentActionHandler isnnow the central place for defining and handling such reusable actions.n
Small cleanups

Make sure disabled tools do not get any eventsWhile the active tool was being disabled when there was no map, it wouldnstill receive calls. This lead to crashes since existing tools like thenselection tool were not prepared to handle this case.nnMantis-issue: 50n
Fixed fill tool working on invisible layersRely on brush item visibility logic from the AbstractTileTool, just likenthe eraser and stamp brush.n
Allow rearranging the tileset tabs in the tileset viewMantis-issue: 15n

Workaround a glitch when dragging a tileset tab aroundQTabBar::setTabText does not check whether the tab text remains thensame, and will always relayout the tabs. This caused a glitch whilendragging a tab when the tabs don't fit horizontally.nnThe fact is that while dragging a tab, the tab texts will already be upnto date, so there is no need to update them.n
Make tile and object context menu options a bit more specific
Allowed adding of new external tilesets
Added another example based on tiles by pfunked
Added file name to MapDocumentShould be the proper place to keep track of it.n

Added import/export of tilesets to tileset context menuThe new context menu actions allow you to convert an external tileset tonan internal one and the other way around.nnUnfortunately, editing of tile properties in external tilesets is stillnnot possible. It'll need to be temporarily converted to an internalntileset. This is because otherwise changes to the tileset would not getnsaved.n
Set a shortcut on the Export As commandSome people use this action quite often.n
Changed the perspective walls example to use an external tilesetAlso introduced some example tile properties, which is the main reasonnwhy external tilesets make sense.n
Suggest a file name when doing Save As (or the first Save)Only suggesting a folder was not very helpful, since that left manynpeople without any hint that Tiled maps should have the .tmx extension.n
Tweaked some error dialog titles a bitAnd marked default file name as translatable.n
Fixed the enabled state of the Export As action
Still show tileset import/export actions when not clicking a tile

Added support for input plugins to the file open dialogAlso enhanced the behaviour a bit, in that the selected file filter isnnow remembered for the open and export actions, and is the firstncriteria when determining which map reader/writer to use.nnThis adds quite some complexity. Let's hope I didn't break anything innthe process.n
Prevent saving an imported map under the same name in TMX formatThe Save action now pops up the Save As dialog when dealing with annon-TMX map that was loaded using a plugin.n
Moved Select All and Select None actions to the map action handlerJust trying to keep the size of mainwindow.cpp down by placing things innmore appropriate locations.n
Updated NEWS file and increased version to 0.5.0Also simplified the HTML used in the About Dialog so that it is lessndaunting for translators and doesn't contain hardcoded font sizes andnfamilies.n

Split a small libtiled off the Tiled applicationIt currently contains only the basic types like Map, Layer, Tile, etc.nThis is sufficient for allowing Tiled plugins to use these classes whennloading/saving maps.n

Make sure the symbols are exported from libtiledThis is needed on Windows, where symbols are not exported by default. Tonmake sure this gets some testing on Linux as well, visibility is set tonhidden there too now.n
Disable the Add External Tileset action when appropriate
Use qtLibraryTarget to adapt to system-dependent library name changesFor example it should on Windows call the debug library tiledd.dll.n
No longer force debug symbols in all builds
Specify the QMAKE_LFLAGS_RPATHOtherwise it wouldn't work for the Qt 4.6.3 installed on my system fornsome reason.n
Updated translation files to the current source

Added an install target to the MakefileThe relative paths to translations and plugins now work both inside thenrepository as well as for the installed binary.nnAlso changed around things a bit on Windows, untested.n
Prevent a crash when the clipboard has no mime dataOnly happened on Maemo 5 and may be a bug in that Qt port, but the checkncan't hurt.n
Make the rpath relative as wellMakes sure the tiled binary can always find libtiled, whether run fromnthe repository or from its installed location.n
Fixed some build issues on Windows and with shadow buildsAlso realized the the 'plugins' directory is also used for Qt plugins, sonmake sure to store the Tiled plugins in 'plugins/tiled'.n
Add forgotten tiled.pri fileShould have been part of commit 7d6ae8b72f378fb63802ffa77d34f75fbf9350b4n
Updated the Japanese translation
Fixed the map document actions to translate dynamicallyForgot about that when moving things there.n
Updated Dutch translation
Updated all translation files to the current source once moreMainly because they accidentally included a bogus string from a plugin Inused for testing.n

Avoid mixing debug and release dllsBy using qtLibraryTarget but no explicit separation of the resulting files,nit was easy to end up with mixed debug/release dlls, which caused Tiled toncrash on startup.nnBetter try to avoid the issue by using the same file name, so that a cleannbuild isn't mixing debug/release.n
Updated the German translation
Updated the Latvian translation

Added initial version of libtiled-java based on tiled-core.jarThese are the core classes from Tiled Java, which previously could benbuilt as tiled-core.jar. Now reintruduced as libtiled.jar.nnThe exact code is a mix between the 'default' and '0.7' branches in thenTiled Java repository.n
Make it compile, removing references to classes that are not includedShouldn't be referencing editor-specific classes like SelectionLayer andnTiledConfiguration.n
Ignore artifacts from libtiled-java build
Suppress compilation warning related to passing null to varargs methods
Removed layer locking and change eventsThey are only useful in the context of an editor, and pointless overheadnfor most games.n
Removed old Subversion $Id$ markers

Removed pointless interfacesThe MapReader, MapWriter and PluggableMapIO interfaces were only usefulnin the context of extending Tiled Java. The XMLMapWriter andnXMLMapTransformer were renamed to the more appropriate TMXMapWriter andnTMXMapReader.nnAlso removed the unimplemented BorderTileCutter class.n
Don't do the rpath thing on Mac OS X either
