Store the tileset image width/height in the map fileUseful for when you can't load the image just at the moment, but stillnwant to figure out where your tiles should be.nnIn the future it can also be used to be able to load maps correctlynafter extending the width of a tileset image, which at the moment messesnup the tile indices.n

Moved the TMX map reader into libtiledThis also meant a small redesign to still be able to check whether antileset is already loaded and to avoid duplicating tilesets onncopy/paste in the editor part.n

Introduced a Properties class to replace QMap<QString,QString>It also provides a 'merge' method which merges in another set ofnproperties, overriding existing values with new ones (contrary tonQMap::unite, which would insert multiple values).n
Introduced a base class for anything that can hold propertiesSimply called 'Object' since I couldn't think of anything better.n
Compile fix for mac buildLibtiled needs -lz since the map reader was moved to libtiled.n
Moved the adding of zlib include path on Windows to libtiled.pro
Allow dragging an image onto Tiled to add a tilesetMantis-issue: 46n
Simplify tiled.priThis turns out to be a no-op.n
Remember the selected layer across restarts
Adjust phony target hacks to gdb_dwarf_index addition in qt masterFollowing commit 9cc4a77886247fc2 in Qt Creator.n

Fixed compilation with Visual C++ 2008 ExpressIt doesn't recognize namespaced symbols in member function parameters, evennwhen the class is defined as part of that namespace. So add some explicitnusing directives.n
Make the map reader test compile againWas broken since moving the map reader into libtiled.n
Added Chinese translation
Merge branch '0.5'
Add -lz for anything that is not WindowsTurns out to be also necessary on Fedora, so let's just do it on allnUnixes.n

Removed unnecessary code to enable overriding the graphics systemIt is already possible to override the graphics system, since then-graphicssystem argument takes precedence over the graphics systemnspecified by the application.n

Added automatic mapping featureThe automatic Mapping feature can generate certain parts of the map.nIt uses a ruleset which needs to be predefined first.nFurther information can be found here:nnhttp://wiki.themanaworld.org/index.php/User:Argul/automappingnnReviewed-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijern
Code style fixes to the automapperAlso converted some explicit allocation/deletion to automatic memorynmanagement where possible.nnAdded Stefan Beller to the AUTHORS file.n
Fixed updating translations from a shadow build directory
Fixed shortcuts to move layer up/down in German translationKey names should not be translated.n
Add -lz for anything that is not WindowsSame as commit 81ee48b7d20f5bd15462279edca21cab86d8127d, but on thisnbranch the change needed to be made to a different .pro file.n
Added the DTD file for .tmx maps to the docsThis file was last changed Sep 2008 and probably somewhat out of date.nWill be updated later.n
Also added the XML Schema Definition by Olivier Beaton
Fixed the coding style of MainWindow::autoMapAlso fixed a crash when trying to use automap without a map loaded andnadded trimming of the lines in the rules file.n

Fixed inconsistency in naming of object layersIn libtiled and in the tmx file format, they are called object groupsnrather than layers. Even though it's more like a layer, this is thentraditional name, which has already spread to other libraries as well.nIt makes no sense to try and change it at this point.nnNot touching the UI for now.n

Added option to use OpenGL when availableDisabled by default for now, since it has some known issues. When usingnOpenGL the tile grid looks uglier and the main window switches to nativenwidgets (which causes flickering when dragging the splitters).n
Prefer local undo stack reference

Set an appropriate cursor on editable map objectsShould indicate that you can drag the objects around. Also overrides thenresize cursor shown on the resize handle when an object overlaps it,navoiding some confusion.n

Improved compareLayers in autoMapcompareLayers compares two tile layers.nThe first tile layer is examined at QRegion r1nThe second tile layer is examined at r1 + offsetnnWhen there are tiles at both places, these will be compared.nIf both are unequal, the compareLayers will return false.nnIf there is no tile in one layer, in the other layer there must be antile, which must not occur in the region of the first layer.nnThis implementation has the advantage to need less rules at all.nExample of a corner/curve in a wallnRuleRegion is a square of 2x2:nXXnXXnRuleSet: 3 tiles are the same, one is different (lower right):nWhere the X are, there should be generated Walls, where Y is, somethink elsenXXnXYnWhen having multiple floors you had to add this Rule as well previously:nXXnXZnnWith this patch it is possible to create this rule:n(empty place in lower right corner, so there can be anything except X) to be valid.nXXnXnnThis is one rule, but can handle multiple floors.n
Fixed the maximum sizes of the resize map dialogThe resize dialog should really use the same limits as the new mapndialog, which allows maps up to 9999 tiles in width/height.nnMantis-issue: 62n
Added a T-Engine4 map export pluginSee http://wiki.te4.org/t4modules:tiled_plugin for more information.n
Made .tmx extension checks case-insensitiveNo point in breaking when people save their maps as MAP.TMX.n
Fixed newline in German translation
Moved the TMX map writer into libtiledMakes it a little more reusable, for example for other tools that modifynTMX maps.n
Fixed another extension check that should be case-insensitive

Avoid conversion to/from QString for copy/paste handlingIt's still doing some conversion in the QXmlStreamWriter andnQXmlStreamReader, but this avoids two additional conversions that werenhappening in ClipboardManager and TmxMapReader.n

Optimized TileLayer::regionFor a large and complex 999x999 layer, the execution time of this methodnwent from 70 seconds to 15 milliseconds.nnWas responsible for UI lockups when editing huge maps, since it is usednin the BrushItem.n

Support multiple shortcuts on certain actionsUse setShortcuts instead of setShortcut, so that all standard shortcutsndefined for a certain action get picked up. This applies for example toncut and paste (Ctrl+X and Shift+Del now both work).nnAlso, Ctrl+= is now set as additional shortcut for zooming in, so thatnpressing Shift is not required on US keyboard layouts.n
Merge branch '0.5'Conflicts:ntsrc/tiled/tiled.pron

Avoid an unnecessary copy of the tile data after decompressingDecompress directly into a QByteArray instead. This brings decompressingna 1000x1000 tiles layer down from 9 ms to 6 ms on my machine, yay! Itnshaves off 300 ms for 10000x10000 maps, though.n

Fixed build issues when an older version of libtiled is installedHappened only when compiling against a Qt version installed to /usr/lib,nwhile having an older version of Tiled installed through the Ubuntu PPA.nnMade sure that the linker prefers the current version of libtiled rathernthan linking to a libtiled in /usr/lib. By using QMAKE_LIBDIR_FLAGSnrather than LIBS, we can make sure that our library search path isninserted before the -L/usr/lib.n

Compress directly into the QByteArray as wellThis is a followup on 9a808fc150ad10c9419864645741f36ed8864a57. It doesnnot make any noticable speedup since the compressed data is generallynsmall, but it does simplify the code a bit.n

Added quickstamp featureThe quickstamp feature allows you to store selections withnkeycombination Ctrl + <number>.nnThese selections are recalled just by key <number>.nnThese quickstamps are very similar to copy/paste, since they arenhold in the same datastructure, a Map*.nThe difference is, that they are only usable by the specific instance ofntiled, but the quickstamps-feature has more saving-slots.nnBecause of the similarity, some code of paste-functionality wasnsplit into another function, to make code reuse easier.n

Some cleanups in the quick stamp feature* Introduced TileLayer::usedTilesets to avoid duplicating this coden  between ClipboardManager::copySelection and MainWindow::saveQuickStampn* Removed unnecessary includen* Clean up the quick stamps to prevent assertion in TilesetManager on exitn* Fixed crash when trying to save a quick stamp right after starting Tiledn* Use static_cast on TileLayer::clone rather than relying on asTileLayern
Moved creation of objects into the Create Object toolCleans up the MapScene class and makes it possible to add other kind ofnobject tools.nnBased on the work of Lithander.n

Enable/disable tools as appropriateNow the tile-based tools are only enabled when a tile layer is selected,nand the create object tool is only enabled when an object layer isnselected.nnBased on this state, the tool manager makes sure that the currentlynactive tool is automatically changed to an available tool. It willnprefer to select the last tool that it switched away from, to make surenthe selected tool stays the same when switching layer types and back.nnTo avoid confusion, AbstractTool::enable/disable have been renamed tonactivate/deactivate.n
Fixed linking issues on WindowsKeep using LIBS variable on Windows since QMAKE_LIBDIR_FLAGS isn't usednthere. Should have read the documentation more carefully...n
Disable the depth buffer when using OpenGL for the map viewTheoretically slightly faster.n

Added tool to create tile-based objectsThis allows tiles to be placed as objects on object layers. This meansnthey can be placed in arbitrary positions and have properties assignednto them.nnTile-based objects can't currently be resized. Their size is determinednby the tile associated with them.n

Don't write out the name of an object when it's emptyJust rely on the default being no name, to save some space when placingnlots of objects without a name (not unlikely when using tile-basednobjects).n

Render objects from top to bottom instead of in creation orderNow the drawing (and stacking) order of objects is defined by theirnpixel y position, which is common in top-down games. In the future wenwill probably need to allow defining a custom order.n
Moved MainWindow::unifyTilesets to MapDocument
Moved the MapRenderer into libtiledSo that it can be re-used by other applications.n

Added a simple TMX Viewer application based on libtiledIt's not as minimal as I may have hoped, mainly due to still having tonwrite all the QGraphicsItem subclasses, but at around 200 lines of codenit's not too bad.nnCustomizing the graphics items and the map renderer will be necessarynanyway if you'd be writing a game that uses libtiled.n

Automap with multiple layersIn the feature Automapping, which is a rulebased support for mapping,nyou can have multiple RuleSet layers in files defining these rules.nnActually these Layers only need to start with RuleSet and can continuendescribing the purpose of that specific RuleSet layer.nnIn short: The automapping handles these multiple layers with a logic ornfor each position.nnSo when the automapping compares the RuleSet and the Set layers,nit will be checked if the set layer matches any ruleset layer forneach position.n
Fixed crash with selecting quickstamps without map loaded.trivial fix:nwhen selecting a quickstamp while no map is loaded, tiled would crash.n
Avoid performance issues with X11 engine in tmxviewer tooRendering map objects is very slow with the X11 engine, so default tonraster.n

Extended the automapping featureThis patch will support RuleSet layers as well as RuleNotSet layers.nnThe RuleNotSetLayers are new with this patch.nnBasically all matches between set and a ruleSet layer are consideredngood, while all matches between the set layer and ruleNotSet layer arenconsidered bad.nnImproved rules.txt:nYou can provide in rules.txt another txt file which contains rules.nThis can be done recursively in the txt filesn

Random automapping outputsYou can define multiple outputs for rules in automapping:nPreviously you defined the output layers by naming them rule_XXX, whereas XXXnwas the destination layernnNow you can setup multiple outputs by creating ruleYYY_XXX whereas XXXnis the output layer as well.  YYY is a unique name, without underscoren(_) describing the output.nnFor example you can have a rulesmap with such layers:nnruleRegions# define the location of the rulenruleSet# define the condition to be matchednruleNotSet # define the condition to be matchednnruleDoor_Ground# so either this two layers are chosen fornruleDoor_Fringe# this rulennruleNormal_Ground  # or this one is chosen.n
Updated the Tiled version in the Info.plist fileWhoops, forgot this the last two releases. Will need to remember thisnnext time...n
Make +/- work for zooming in/out also without holding CtrlBy popular request and for the sake of increased GIMP compatibility.n
Added copyright note, extended AUTHORSThe copyright notice applies to earlier changes.n
more comments in automap.h

Removed the type-specific map object colorsColors are now set per object group, which should in my opinion benenough. Tiled should probably still display the object group color innthe layer list, so that objects can easily be matched to their group.n

Update the current stamp when switching tilesetsA selection is kept for each tileset view, so when switching tilesets,nthe tileset dock still shows the same selection that was therenpreviously. However, the stamp wasn't being updated to reflect thenselection in the newly selected tileset.nnUpdating the stamp was preferred to clearing the selection, since thatnallows quickly changing between two stamps from different tilesets. Thenidea is that you would rarely change tilesets anyway if you didn't haventhe intention of drawing with tiles from that tileset.nnMantis-issue: 58n
Clarified the license and copyright of the shipped tilesets

Fixed crash in MapDocument::unifyTilesetsunifyTilesets was initially written for MainWindow::paste, in which casenthe tilesets in the map were not managed by the TilesetManager. Now itnis also used by the QuickStamp feature, which does keep references tonthe tilesets in the TilesetManager.nnThis fix makes unifyTilesets always assume the tilesets are properlynreference counted by the TilesetManager, and modifies MainWindow::pastento actually do that.nnTwo helper methods were added to TilesetManager to make adding/removingntileset references easier.nnReviewed-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>n

Support drawing lines and circles with the stamp brushWhen holding the shift key, you can click only a little points, andnthese points get connected with a straight line in between.nnHold the Ctrl key, to produce circles. Center is the last edited position.nthe current position determines the radius.nnLines and circles can handle bigger stamps. When having selected a stampn(>1x1) this stamp will periodically fill the line or circle. There willnbe no overlap between the stamps.nnMantis-issue: 51nReviewed-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijer <thorbjorn@lindeijer.nl>n
Small optimization in StampBrush::configureBrushWe only need an intersection check, not the actual intersection.n
Disable the frame around QGraphicsView for the tmxviewerLooks better that way.n
T-Engine plugin: Added support for longer strings and overflow beyond the random ASCII range
T-Engine plugin: Added a check for AddZone object groups

Tweaked the look of the map object borderRegular map objects now have a border of 2 instead of 3 pixels andndon't have rounded corners. Tile-based objects now use a border thatnis always 1 pixel regardless of zoom level.n
Making special character escaping more robust.
Provide a way to set a custom lib directorySo that lib64 can be used on Fedora.n
The color of map objects no longer depends on typeAvoid doing unnecessary updates when the type changes.n
Use the file name placeholder in the license header template
Corrected the French translation for 'Redo'Suggested by Mooglwy.n

Introduced the object selection toolAt the moment this tool allows selecting multiple objects and movingnthem. The context menu should still be updated to apply to the wholenselection.nnIt should also not allow removing objects while a move is in progress,nsince that leads to a crash.n

Reintroduced the event pointer to mousePressed and mouseReleasedThese functions will always match with mouse events, so I guess itndoesn't really make sense to hide that. The thing is that I'd need tonadd another parameter to mousePressed (screenPos) to make it possible tonuse context menus otherwise.n

Handle the map object context menu in the object selection toolNow it applies to all selected objects, apart from editing thenproperties. This also resolves a crash when removing objects whilendragging them around, which is now no longer possible.nnSome adjustments have been made to the selection modifier. Both Shiftnand Ctrl now add to the selection, and in both cases you can clicknsingle objects to toggle their selected state.n
Use a dashed line to indicate selected objectsBetter than changing their color to the selection color.n
Center the map when it is smaller than the map viewIs nicer than aligning it to the top left. Needed some fixes in thenorthogonal renderer to avoid setting a negative dash offset.nnMantis-issue: 71n
Add tmxviewer executable to .gitignore

Fixed plural handling by providing an English translation fileDoesn't happen automatically apparently, but works when an Englishntranslation file is provided that determines the two translations.nnAlso used the plural forms where appropriate in the context menu andnwhen moving objects.n
Added a New Layer dropdown menu to the layers dock
Added support for opening multiple maps in one sessionThis allows you to open multiple maps at once. They will be accessablenvia tabs.nnMantis-task: 5n

Have the DocumentManager provide a widget instead of deriving QTabWidgetThis is more flexible in the long run and avoids exposing the wholenQTabWidget API, which isn't generally safe to use.nnReviewed-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>n
French translation fixes
Fixed leaking of the TilesetView item delegateIt didn't have a parent.nnThanks to Stefan Beller for finding this one.n

Added a few signals to MapDocument and LayerModel* MapDocument::regionEdited   emited after the user made changesn* LayerModel::layerAboutToBeRenamed   emited before a layer is renamedn* LayerModel::layerRenamedemited after a layer is renamedn* LayerModel::layerAboutToBeRemoved   emited before a layer is removednnReviewed-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijer <thorbjorn@lindeijer.nl>n

Improved automappingImprovementsn * The whole automapping was sped up by dividing it into different parts.n   So most of the stuff is only executed when the very first automatticn   mapping is done. Lots of data structures will be reused in next uses.n * Automapping can be called with parameter QRegion, so that only a certainn   region is automatically mapped.n * This is attached to the map documents signal regionEdited, so it willn   be executed whenever there is user input into the set layer.n * The AutoMapperWrapper is now only called once for all AutoMapper classes.n   This means that undo/redo functionality will use up less memory.n * Renaming some functions for better maintainability.n * Rearrangement of the functions for better maintainability.n * Use layer add / remove and rename signals of the map document to keepn   the layer translation table up to date.n * Adjustment fo the rules via map properties:n   DeleteTiles will trigger a cleanup before applying that rulesetn   AutomappingRadius will set the radius around region, where then   ruleset should be applied.n * Adding a filesystemwatcher, which checks for file changes on the rulesets.n * AutomatticMappingManager is now in the style of other managers. It can ben   instantiated only once view its instance() method.n

Added new icons for insert objects / tile objects toolsBased on standard GNOME icons for 'insert-object' and 'insert-image'.nnAlso fixed the dynamic translation for the tile objects tool, which wasnbeing retranslated to the regular objects tool.n
Remove <new property> text when editing a new propertyConvenience thing.n

Removed 'Map' from the names of the DocumentManager methodsAlmost all methods of the DocumentManager pertain to maps, so it doesn'tnreally add much apart from length. The freed up characters were in twoncases used to make a method more clear:nn  closeMapDocument  -> closeCurrentDocumentn  closeMapDocuments -> closeAllDocumentsn

Simplified the DocumentManagerRemoved the complexity in the DocumentManager that was necessary to makensure there is always a map view and a map scene available, andnsimplified a bunch of other things.nnThis required some changes in the MainWindow class to make it ready fornwhen there is no map open.n
Prevented opening a file twiceNow it selects the existing document if a file is already open.n

Prevented creation of unnamed propertiesSince change 185a2fa1984d2892c978717c4b3ee7ec21ba5ee1, detecting thencreation of new properties was broken, causing unnamed properties to bencreated when cancelling the creation of a new property.n

Fixed two issues with handling non-existing filesErrors for non-existing tilesets no longer included the file name, sincenit was turning into an empty string. SimilarlynDocumentManager::findDocument did not handle non-existing filesncorrectly.nnBoth issues were due to failing to check the return value ofnQFileInfo::canonicalFilePath for being empty, which happens when thenfile doesn't exist.n
Make sure English is not listed twice in the PreferencesSince we now have an English translation file (for the plurals), itnshould no longer be explicitly added to the list of languages.n

Changed the default layer data format to use zlib rather than gzipSince zlib is generally easier to support and more suitable for thisnuse-case (gzip was meant for compressing complete files).nnThis of course breaks compatibility with some existing TMX libraries,nincluding Tiled Java.n

Fixed compile against Qt 4.5* QPointF didn't have manhattanLength() until Qt 4.6, but fortunately wen  can just use QPoint instead.n* The QByteArray constructor overloads used in compression.cpp were notn  even documented and apparently also introduced in Qt 4.6n* Some version checking added to tmxviewern

Add ability to run commands from TiledThis adds a button the to main toolbar that executes a command when clicked.nYou can setup and choose from multiple commands by using the popup arrow.nnThe token %mapfile within commands will be replaced with the current file.nnsystem-run.png from gnomenMantis-issue: 69n
Made sure zoom actions are disabled on startup without mapsAlso removed several superfluous calls to 'updateActions', which wasnalready being called in 'mapDocumentChanged'.n
Bumped the version to 0.6.0 and updated the NEWS file

Introduced a persistent 'Snap to Grid' modeNow it is no longer necessary to hold Ctrl all the time for snapping tonthe grid. When 'Snap to Grid' is enabled, Ctrl can be used tontemporarily disable it.nnFor consistency, the 'Show Grid' option was moved alongside the newn'Snap to Grid' option in the Preferences.n
Added IntelliJ IDEA project for libtiled-java

A bunch of random cleanups to libtiled-java* Removed obsolete list of MapObjects from the Map classn* Removed stuff that was only needed for the editor:n  - List of special layers from Map classn  - Methods from MultiLayerPlane: swapLayerUp, swapLayerDown andnmergeLayerDownn  - TileSet.generateGaplessVectorn* Removed some of the methods related to supporting images separatelyn  from tilesn
IntelliJ project updates
Merged MultilayerPane into MapThe separation of these two classes was only somewhat useful in thencontext of the editor.n
Removed the PluginLogger classWas meant to be used for error reporting done by Tiled Java plugins, butnin practice its implementation was never finished. Now it's no longernuseful.n
Removed unused includes & ordered the rest in automap.{cpp,h}No changes in program behavior, just less includes.n
Fixed a crash at automapping: missing set layersMissing set layers *should* lead to an error at the caller, but in casenthe AutoMapper class is called anyway, just don't crash!n

Reselect the last active map at startupThe map document, which was the current at quitting, will be activatednon startup.nnTherefore the writesettings() function needs to be moved to some pointnbefore calling confirmAllSave(). This needs to be done sincenconfirmAllSave messes up the last opened document. (It cycles throughnall opened documents and checks if there needs a questionare for saving,nso after that function you cannot detect the document, which was thenlast current document for the user.)n
Moved the source of libtiled-java into a 'src' directoryMainly since IntelliJ prefers the project structure that way, but itnalso makes the root of the packages explicit.n

libtiled-java: Cleanups and removals* Removed the drawing and scaling from the Tile classn* Removed support for images stored separately from tilesn* Removed Resources and Util classesn* Reorganized some classesn
libtiled-java: Removed the NumberedSet classReplaced it with a plain Vector<Tile>.n
libtiled-java: Ignore the IntelliJ build directory
libtiled-java: Added support for zlib compression

Added a start on tmxviewer-java along with some reorganizationNow there is a top-level IntelliJ IDEA project for java-utils,ncontaining both libtiled-java and the new tmxviewer-java.nnThe viewer currently only loads the map, there is no rendering codenyet.n

libtiled-java: Don't break when 'trans' attribute starts with a #Some versions of Tiled Qt used to start the 'trans' color attribute withna '#' to indicate that it's a hex value. This was later removed sincenTiled Java breaks on it, but there is no reason not to fix that now.n
libtiled-java: Added MapRenderer interface and OrthogonalRendererOnly contains basic functionality for now, but enough to allowntmxviewer-java to display orthogonal maps now.n

libtiled-java: Changed the license to LGPL and tmxviewer-java to BSDCurrently it is not possible to license libtiled-java as BSD since thenBase64 decoding algorithm falls under LGPL, hence it will be LGPL fornnow.nnThe tmxviewer-java example was changed to the Simplified BSD license.n
libtiled-java: Added ant build files to IntelliJ project
Merge branch 'libtiled-java'

Changed the license of libtiled and tmxviewer from GPL to BSDMaking it possible to use libtiled in another project regardless of thenlicense of that project or the way libtiled is used.nnPermission for this change of license was granted by all those whoncontributed code used in libtiled.n
Have the main toolbar follow the system styleShould be checked on other systems, but this makes the toolbar looknnicer on my GNOME installation. Now the 'Open', 'Save' and 'Undo' labelsnare visible.n
Added an action to close all files
Fixed compile against Qt 4.5For the last time.n

Improved window title and map document tab textThe window title now also displays untitled.tmx when the current mapnhas no file name, and doesn't have a dash in front of Tiled when nonmaps are open.nnThe text of the map document tab now contains a '*' character tonindicate whether it has any unsaved changes.n
Select the duplicated objects after duplicating the selectionMakes it easier to move them somewhere else while keeping their currentnarrangement.n

Only enable the object selection tool when an object layer is selectedEven though it will currently work regardless of which layer isnselected, disabling it makes the automatic switching between tile toolsnand object tools work properly.nnThe tool manager was also changed a bit to make sure a tool will benreselected when they become enabled after all tools had been disabled.nThis happened when opening a map after all maps had been closed.n
Added the additional property to addSpot and addZone.
Changed addSpot/addZone to allow longer titles, and implemented a second method for filling the additional property.

Improved errorhandling in automap.cppThe classes, which can produce errors have an errorString() function now.nnerrorString() is just a constant function, which returns a stringndescribing the error.nnEach function, which can produce errors, clears the error stringnfirst.n

Improved usability of lines/circlesNow the first click defines starting point / midpoint.nThe second click defines the end point of the line or a point on thencircle.nInstead of circles elipses can be drawn, too.nnThe stampbrush was modified, so it looks more like a statemachine.n

Fixed crash in automappingSome parts of automapping were ok with case insensitivity in tilenlayers, some other parts not.nnSo there were ugly null pointers when searching certain layers.nnNow all automapping is very case sensitive for the comparison of layernnames of the working map and at the rules maps.nnAlthough some layer in the rulesmaps (ruleset, rulenotset, ruleregions)nare still case insensitive, since they are not needed to match any othernlayers name.n
Made the set layer changeableNow the local string mSetLayer determines which layer is used fornautomapping.n
Updated the NEWS file once more
Fix saving of property fields when clicking OK while editing properties
Added F5 shortcut for running commands
Added Hebrew translationIncludes a workaround for the tileset view since it doesn't handlenright-to-left layout nicely.n
Fixed memleak in BucketFillToolWhen calling setStamp, the old stamp should be deleted.n
Fixed the automappingApparently the commit, which introduced mSetLayer to the automappingnclasses was incomplete. Now Automapping works again.n
Another small NEWS file update
Added a shell script to make the Windows releaseDoesn't zip up the release yet, but it still makes the process a lotnfaster and reproducible.n
Include relevant Qt plugins and the Qt translations in the releaseAlso added the qt.conf file, which is necessary to have Qt find its pluginsnand translations.n
Completed the Chinese translate file, changed some incorrect itemsSigned-off-by: zhaosting <zhaosting@gmail.com>n
Initial update of all the translation files for 0.6.0
Updated the Chinese translation
New batch of Czech translations
Quote the %mapfile in the Commands, so that filenames with spaces work
Updated the Spanish translation
Fixes to the Chinese translationBased on feedback from Bin Wu.n
Updated the German translationTranslation done by seeseekey and jurkan.n
Fix libtengine.dylib in mac release script to use local Qt libs
Updated the Brazilian Portuguese translation
Updated the Dutch translation
Also allow Backspace for deleting propertiesShould make it easier to delete properties on MacOS X.n
Updated the French translation
Merge branch '0.5'Conflicts:nttranslations/tiled_fr.tsn
Fixed move layer up/down shortcuts when using French translationKey names should not be translated.n
TextEdit command uses open so it launches in the foregroundSuggested by Mooglwyn
Fixed opening maps from the Finder with Tiled on MacOS XNeeded handling of the QFileOpenEvent.nnVerified-by: Jeff Blandn
Associate a type name and icon with .tmx files on MacOS XOriginally by Thorbjorn, modified by Jeff. Icon contributed by Mooglwy.n
Improved the icon for the object selection toolWell, at least I think it's an improvement. It's a combination of thenRectangular Select and the Object Layer icons.n
Updated the NEWS file for the 0.6.0 release
Added an accelerometer to the Save As Image action
Fixed another crash in automappingWhen rules were at the direct border of rulemaps, Tiled crashed.n
Allow opening many files at once
Require at least Qt 4.6Cleans up the code a bit. The Qt 4.6 release is now more than one yearnold so maintaining compilation against 4.5 is no longer worth it.n
Automapping: Fixed crash when using a ruleset without any output layersCreating such a ruleset is totally silly, but don't tell it to the usernthe hard way, just do it [=nothing].n

Automapping: Fixed width/height mixupHeight should be used for measuring y coordinate differences, width fornx coordinate differences. So exchange height and width, so that it makesnsense when iterating over x and y.n
Automapping: Removed commented and unused code

Automapping: Fixed case-sensitivity for different outputs per ruleThe possibility to have different outputs per rule was case sensitive atnthe wrong parts. The prefix must have been lower case to make the rightndifferences. Now it is ensured that the prefix can be any case, and onlynthe groupitem is checked for equality.n
Merge branch '0.6'
Allow drag-and-dropping multiple maps into Tiled, but no tilesets
Accept dropping tilesets onto the tileset dock
Added initial NSIS script for creating the Windows installer

Some small tweaks to the Windows installer* Leave out the version at Run Tiled actionn* Don't open the README.txt by defaultn* Put Tiled with uppercase in the start menunnReviewed-by: Mohammad Mehdi Salem Naraghin
Fixed removal of shortcut when uninstallingBroke in the previous commit.n
Make DocumentManager a globally accessible singleton
Automapping: Make sure to delete only allowed tilesWhen there is no tile in the set layer, DO NOT TOUCH that position.n(even for initial cleaning purpose)n

Automapping: Add missing layers only onceWhen there are missing layers in the working map andnyou have rules, which have multiple output possibilities,nthe missing layers should only be added once per name.n
Automapping: Adding the sewers exampleThe sewers example can perfectly demonstrate the automappingnas well.nnHere we have some rules for automapping.n

Circles: Fix starting pointThe actual starting point has been at the position, where the tilelayernvanished (= you pressed shift+Ctrl).nnThe starting point is now at the position where you click to start thencircle.n
Automapping: Fixing a memory leak
Fixed memory leak when using lines or circlesMantis-issue: 80nReviewed-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijern
Added Show or Hide all Other Layers action
Fixed qmake warning Unescaped backslashes are deprecated.

Avoid endless loop when tile size is 0Suppose you had manually edited your map file to have a tile size of 0,nthis avoids Tiled locking up when trying to draw the grid of annorthogonal map or the tiles of an isometric map.nnMantis-issue: 76n
Take into account layer opacity when saving map as imageMantis-issue: 81n
Merge branch '0.6'
Changed mac to macx for consistencyAlso, 'macx' is the documented scope for MacOS X.n
Windows installer: Make install location more explicitRather than adding Tiled to the installation path implicitly.n
Windows installer: Fixed name of plugins directory
Added actions to select the previous/next layer
Renamed move layer actions to Raise/Lower LayerShorter and more common.n

Move saving of documents from MainWindow to the MapDocument classThis allows areas of the code to save a document directly instead of goingnthrough the main window.nnDone-with: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijer <thorbjorn@lindeijer.nl>n

Various improvements to commands- Improved error dialogn- Added context menu to commandsn  - Move up / Downn  - Executen  - Deleten- Drag / Dropn  - Commands can be dragged (ie to a terminal)n  - Text can be dropped on commands to modify them (ie from a terminal)n  - Commands can be reordered by draggingn  - Drop stuff onto <new command> to make a new commandn- Code Cleanupn
Small arbitrary code cleanups

Re-save examples with current default editor settingsLeaving out the DTD, using zlib for encoding the layers and other smallnchanges like not writing out empty object names and storing the size ofnan image in the XML.n
Added ability to open multiple files via command-line argumentPatch was changed from std::vector<QString> to QStringList by Thorbju00c3u00b8rn.n
Fixed crash when passing empty string as command line parameterEmpty strings don't like at(0) to be called on them.n
Added shortcuts to switch documentsNow the common shortcuts Ctrl+PageUp and Ctrl+PageDown work to switch tonthe left or right document respectively.n
Updated the German translation
Add Droidcraft plugin to read and export the map files
Some small modifications to the Droidcraft tileset

Fixed problems with the tileset view after switching documentsDue to some connections not being cleared, the tileset view could handlena single tileset removal or addition many times.nnBefore 0.6.0, it wasn't necessary to disconnect the signals since thenprevious map document would always be deleted anyway.n
Remove tile objects when their tileset is removedSince now also MapObject instances can contain references to tiles,nwe need to check these when removing a tileset.n
Micro-optimization in TileLayer::isEmptyThere is no need to loop over x and y and then calculate the indexneach time. Rather just loop over all indexes directly.n
Added icon to Windows executable and installer improvements* The installer now has the Tiled logo in the headern* The entry in Add/Remove Software now has the Tiled iconn
Avoid compiler warningThe compiler is right that in theory this value might be uninitializedn(when the value of the enumerator is out of range). Added an assertionnthat this isn't the case.n
Improvements to script to build the Windows installer
Preparations for the 0.6.1 release
Added a separator between the tile and object tools
Changed the file name of the Windows installerMoved 'setup' to the end.n
Merge branch '0.6'

Force the use of scroll buttons for the tilesets tab barThe default on MacOS X appears to be to force the tab bar to be widenenough to hold all tabs. This is not the right behavior in this casensince we could have a lot of tilesets.nnSet the property explicitly rather than relying on the style.nnMantis-issue: 85n
Fixed object layers losing their color when resizing the mapThe color was getting lost when cloning an ObjectGroup, which affectednmap resizing and layer duplication.nnMantis-issue: 83n
Correct some shortcuts in the German translation
Fixed memory leak in ObjectPropertiesDialog
Tests for AutomappingHere are some testing maps in the tests directory,nwhich can be used for testing automapping.n
Move Quickstamps to QuickStampManagerThis patch moves most of the stuff of quickstamps from the MainWindow tonthe QuickStampManager.n
Removed '...' from Add Tile/Object Layer actionsThese actions no longer pop up a dialog so the '...' shouldn't be usednanymore.n
Fixed window title to update when saving a map with a different name

Automapping: remove unused codeThorbjorn found it when compiling with -Wunused-but-set-variable which isnnew in gcc 4.6nnApparently that code was well hidden and evolved there within development.nBye for now!n
Small optimization when reading binary tile layer dataAvoid one copy of the string, measured speed increase when loadingnuncompressed base64 data was about 0.5%.n
Adding an isometric grass and water exampleGrass and water tileset provided by Clint Bellanger.n( see http://opengameart.org/content/grass-and-water-tiles )nMap provided by Stefan Beller.n
Fixed Qt version checkThis was meant to check whether the Qt version was older than Qt 4.8,nand ended up checking whether it was 4.7.0 or older.n
Bumped version to 0.6.2
Added copy/paste support for objectsThis closes #2n
Improved positioning of pasted objectsThe objects are now centered on the mouse position when the mouse isnover the view, and on the center of the view otherwise.n
Renamed ChangeSelection to ChangeTileSelectionClearer now that there is also object selection.n

Renamed MapDocument::currentLayer to currentLayerIndexIt's returning an index, so this name is clearer. This will also allownre-introducing MapDocument::currentLayer as a helper function thatnreturns a pointer to the current layer.n

Reintroduced MapDocument::currentLayer, returning Layer*This simplified lots of code that previously had to check the currentnlayer index for -1 before being able to get a reference to the currentnlayer.n
Fixed updating of selected objects when removing an object layerCould lead to a crash when selecting objects after removing an objectnlayer of which objects were selected.n

Added merge layer down actionThis action works to merge either two tile layers or two object layers.nnIn the case of tile layers, the tile images are not merged. Any tiles innthe upper layer replace the tiles in the lower layer.nnThis closes #6n
Merge branch '0.6'Conflicts:ntsrc/tiled/mainwindow.cppn
Fixed crash when all tools are disabledIntroduced in 10a8b0e3b4290b8abcc642b6b481c11f54fb7673.n
Updated the Spanish translation
Adapted the README syntax a bit to work as MarkdownAlso renamed the file to make it recognizable as such.n
Noted that on Ubuntu, libqt4-opengl-dev needs to be installedNew dependency since Tiled gained the option of using OpenGLnacceleration for drawing the map view.n
Updated Japanese translation
Merge branch '0.6'
Fixed a rare memory leak when loading an invalid mapWhen loading an invalid map that contains empty tilesets, the emptyntilesets would get leaked due to no longer being referenced bynmGidsToTileset.n

Fixed problems with watching tilesets multiple timesWhen multiple maps used the same tile set, the QFileSystemWatcher warnsnabout being unable to watch the file. Also, when one of those maps isnclosed, the file is no longer watched even though it's still in use bynsome open maps.nnFixed this by wrapping the QFileSystemWatcher with a class that dealsngracefully with files being watched multiple times.n

Switched to an alternative implementation for merging layersThis implementation is more generic (the methods could be used to mergenany two layers, not just merge a layer down) and it is based onnpolymorphism, which makes it easier to adapt it for new layer types ornto changing conditions of when merging is possible.n
Added Crop to Selection actionThis adds a more convenient way of resizing the map down to a subareanthan using the Resize Map dialog.n
Moved the distribution scripts into the 'dist' directoryCleans up the root a little.nnThe make-dist-win32.sh was deleted, since it's no longer used now that anproper installer can be built.n
Fixed missing disconnect in MapDocumentActionHandlerOn the long run, this could slow down actions like switching maps,nchanging layer and changing the tile selection.n
Clarification of a comment in tileset.hDescribing more precisely which numbers are allowed as argument forntileAt in tilesets.n

Introduced horizontal and vertical flipping of tilesThis commit changes the TileLayer class to store Cell instances rathernthan directly referring to Tile*. The Cell class contains the Tile* plusninformation on whether the tile is horizontally or vertically flipped.nnThe MapReader and MapWriter have been adapted to store and restore thenflipped state as flags in the last bits of the global IDs (this meansnolder Tiled versions will refuse to load maps with flipped tiles).nnThe OrthogonalRenderer and IsometricRenderer have been adapted to rendernthe flipped tiles correctly.nnThis implements the first part of issue #3nnSponsored-by: Zipline Games, Inc.n
Introduced shortcuts to flip the current stampThe X key flips horizontally (along the X axis)nThe Y key flips vertically (along the Y axis)nnThis closes #3nnSponsored-by: Zipline Games, Inc.n
Initialize QuickStampManager::mMapDocument in the constructor
Tweak text editor command on macOpen -t will open the map in the preferred text editor instead of TextEditn
Fixed mac compilation for any SDK.
Fixed Windows installer to include the Tiled plugins

Updated the DTD that describes the TMX formatSome updates by IRC user Seisatsu and additional ones by me. Thisnversion will be called 1.1 since some stuff has been added.nn* The 'image' element can now optionally store the width/height of then  image it refers to.nn* The 'objectgroup' element can optionally contain 'properties' and alson  has an opacity and visibility. This has been the case for a long timen  already, so the DTD was outdated here.nn* The 'image' child has been removed from 'object', which was anyway onlyn  supported by Tiled Java 0.7.2 and has in Tiled Qt been replaced by an  reference to a tile (the new 'gid' attribute).nn* The 'name' and 'type' attributes of 'object' are optional.n
Introduced the GidMapper class to convert between gids and cellsThis brings the two conversions together and allows reusing thisnfunctionality in other map readers and writers.n

Added a Lua export pluginThis plugin exports the map a bit differently from the Lua export pluginnshipped with Tiled Java. The main differences are:nn* The layer data is saved as a Lua table rather than a gzip compressedn  and base64 encoded string. Other options may be added later.nn* There are no 'label' members, which seemed generally quite pointless.n  The map layers have a 'type' member serving that purpose, ton  distinguish between 'tilelayer' and 'objectgroup'.nn* A tileset now simply has an 'image' member, making this easier ton  reach than the previous anonymous nested table.nn* No quoting of keys, except for custom properties. Using comma rathern  than semicolon and not placing it at the end of lists, where it isn  optional.nnFor faster loading times a Lua exported map can be compiled with luacn(measured to be about 3 times faster).nnThis closes #20n

Removed the isometric tiles of which the origin is unknownIn theory distributing these images could be illegal since their originnis unknown. We can just remove them since we already have anothernisometric example tileset.n
Use Lua's boolean values in exported mapThis is important since Lua evaluates 0 to true.n
Bumped version to 0.7.0 and updated NEWS fileNot the release yet, but the plan has been made.n

Made the object context menu available in all object toolsBy introducing an AbstractObjectTool that implements the object contextnmenu, on which the select and create object tools are based.nnIt was confusing that you had to go back to the object selection tool tonbe able to use the context menu.n
Removed outdated notice from README fileI'm not feeling so ambitious with plugins anymore. Maybe it'll still benpossible in the future, but it's not a goal worth talking about.n

Add Execute in Terminal option to command dialog context menuOn Linux it uses GNOME Terminal if available, otherwise xterm.nOn Mac it uses a .command file to open the terminal and run the command.nnWhen running a Cocoa app from a bundle, make sure to invoke the executablendirectly instead of running with the open command if you want the outputnto show up in the terminal.n
Minor fixes to the make-dist-mac script
Added option to turn off grid in the tileset view
Display tile coordinates also when using object toolsIt's annoying to have to switch to a tile layer just to be able to getnat some tile coordinates.nnThis closes #32n

Allow hand scrolling while holding the spacebarRequired some hacking about with mouse grabbing, but overall seems tonwork nicely apart from the usual painting glitches with the stamp brush.nnThis closes #28n
libtiled: Added some assertions to TileLayer
Synced translation files with source codeString Freeze for 0.7.0 is now.n

Center on the origin of the map rather than the origin of the viewThis will probably avoid some confusion for new users who try to set upnan isometric map, since it will make sure the view is positioned on anninteresting part (where you can actually see the grid and draw on thenmap).n
Updated the Portuguese translation
Updated the Dutch translation

Automapping: Restructure internal data structuresThis replaces the translation table, which consisted of layerpointers ofnrulelayers to layers within the working map, by a translation table,nwhich translates the layerpointers of the rulelayers into indices of thenworking Map.nnThe set layer now is tracked by its index as well instead of a layernpointer.nnThe check mechanics, if the right layer at the specified index, also changed.nThat leads to dropping mAddLayers(since it's not used any more)nnAdvantages:n* the layer pointer changes sometimes (resizing, offsetting a map),n  so bug https://github.com/bjorn/tiled/issues/36 is fixed.nn* setupMissingLayers() will check if the indices are valid, if not thisn  is corrected by setting the correct index.n  If there is no such layer it is created before.n  So while the hot phase happens (automapping itself), we can rely onn  the indices, automapping is nearly the same speed (See disadvantages)nn* Signals, which keep track of layer renaming, can be dismissed,n  due to the checks in setupMissingLayers() now, because the index doesn'tn  change, but the internal layer pointer.nnDisadvantages:n* Slightly slower (looking up by index insteadn  of using the pointer directly)nnThe layer pointers for the rulelayers are still kept, since these arenassumed to not change.n(If the rulemap itself changes, the whole datastructures are wiped andnrebuild)nnSigned-off-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>nnremove mAddLayersn
libtiled: Added Layer::setPositionRenamed pos() to position() for consistency.n
libtiled: Introduced operator != for Cell
Automapping: Renamed mLayerSet into mSetLayerIndexThis is more descriptive than before, since it is only an int now.n

Automapping: Removed findTileLayerThe error message is unnecessary, so the needed functionality can benreduced to mMapWork->indexOfLayer(name);nnSigned-off-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>n

Remove objects that fall outside of the map on resizeSince the map never intersects with objects that have zero size, ancontains check on the object position is also done.nnReviewed-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijer <thorbjorn@lindeijer.nl>n
Fixed plurals in Hebrew translation

Fixed several issues related to restoring previously opened filesNow the list of previously opened files is stored separately from thenrecent file list, fixing several issues.nnThis closes #38nnDone-with: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijern

libtiled: Added TileLayer::computeDiffRegionThis will be used to reduce the history size of automapping. Also anstandalone feature to diff maps could be easily done with thisnfunctionality.nnReviewed-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijern

libtiled: Added TileLayer::setCellsMost of the code of TilePainter::setCells was moved tonTileLayer::setCells. This provides a convenient way to set cells withoutnemitting a region changed signal.nnReviewed-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijern
Automapping: Reduced the size of the historyThis resolves #29n
Automapping: Made live automapping more smooth in the exampleSetting mAutomappingRadius to 3, so the tiles within the over layer arencleared.n

Correct date in about dialog
Corrected a few errors in the German translation

Select stamp tool when selecting tiles in tileset viewWhen you have selected the eraser tool and now choose a new tilenselection in the tileset view, you obviously don't want to have theneraser anymore. So select the stamp brush now.nnThis resolves #26nnReviewed-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijern
Update the Czech translation

Added random mode to the stamp brushWhen random mode is activated, you can draw random tiles chosen fromnyour current stamp with the left mouse button. The random mode can benused for random fill tool as well later on.nnReviewed-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijer <thorbjorn@lindeijer.nl>n
Added Flare export pluginAn export plugin, which exports to simple ini format.nnSee http://clintbellanger.net/rpg/ for an overview.nSee https://github.com/clintbellanger/flare for sources.n
Converted DOS to UNIX newlines
Reduced the number of translatable strings in the Flare pluginUse parameters when reporting missing layers or properties.nnReviewed-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>n
Introduced a convenience constructor to GidMapperSetting up a gid mapper for some list of tilesets is probably a commonnoperation that deserves a bit of convenience.n

Small improvement to the Lua export plugin (incompatible)This changes the exported Lua file to return the map table rather thannassigning it to a global variable called 'map'. This allows the map tonbe loaded in Lua environments where global variables are not allowed,nand makes it easier to avoid naming conflicts between multiple maps.nnOLDnn  level1.lua:nnmap = { ... }nn  game.lua:nnrequire level1nprint(#map.layers)nnNEWnn  level1.lua:nnreturn { ... }nn  game.luannlocal level1 = require level1nprint(#level1.layers)nnThanks to Josh Lytle for the suggestion!n
Enable anti-aliasing for OpenGL modeIt's enabled by default in non-OpenGL mode too after all. Maybe somedaynthis should be an option due to the performance implications.n

Fixed a bug in the Create Object toolWhen the tool was deactivated while creating a new object, it would leaventhe temporary preview item behind, which would cause a crash when tryingnto interact with it later.n
Fixed class name in documentation

libtiled: Added support for associating a polygon with a MapObjectNow a map object can optionally have a polygon associated with it, whichnif specified replaces the width/height attributes of the object andnallows specifying a non-rectangular area.nnCurrently the polygon is always implicitly closed, but in the futurensupport for non-closed polygons (polylines) is also planned.nnIn the TMX format, polygons are stored in the same way as in SVG.nAn example:nn  <object x=514 y=311>n <polygon points=0,0 -64,32 0,96 128,64/>n  </object>nnThis commit only changes libtiled to support this feature. No editingncapabilities exist yet in Tiled.nnThis implements the first part of issue #61nnSponsored-by: Zipline Games, Inc.n
Added ability to move points of a polygon aroundComplete with undo/redo support.nnThis implements part of issue #61nnSponsored-by: Zipline Games, Inc.n

Added a tool for creating new polygon objectsIt's actually a new mode of the CreateObjectTool.nnThere are still many improvements to make to polygon creation andnediting, but this closes issue #61.nnSponsored-by: Zipline Games, Inc.n

Prevent resize and move handles from scaling and fadingNow the handles ignore the transformations applied to their parents,napart from their position. They also ignore the parent opacity now,nsince it's not very useful to have the handles fade out with the layernopacity.n
Use an overlay item when creating a new polygon objectThis overlay item makes it easier to see the created polygon so farnand the change still being made to it.nnSponsored-by: Zipline Games, Inc.n

Try to avoid triggering strange OpenGL rendering issueA selected polygon object that was extending beyond the top of the viewnwould become black in OpenGL mode. This glitch has something to do withnusing a dash pen which we can't avoid, but when using drawLines thenglitch at least becomes much more rare.n

Added recursive option for documentation.
Added 33% zoom level.
Let the compiler calculate the number of zoom factors
Automapping: RefactoringMove each of the classes into its own *.{h,cpp} filenn* Rename AutomaticMappingManager to AutomappingManagernn* make sure each class includes only neccessary includesn

Automapping: Added warnings* You will be warned about all layers,n  which have no use within a rulemap,n  when using the explicit menu entry for automapping.nn* Some comments added to automapper.cpp (structure of file)n  and automapper.hn  (documenting difference between error and warning strings)nn* renaming automap to autoMap for consistencynnSigned-off-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>n
Automapping: Coding styleNo change of functionality.n
Automapping: Added a shortcutRequested as part of #63n
Added support for polyline objectsThis updates libtiled to also support polyline objects and adds anseparate tool for creating such objects.n
Added a Delete actionThis fixes #59n
Set the DontAdjustForAntialiasing optimization flagThis should be a little bit faster. Currently I don't see any renderingnartifacts with this enabled.n
Renamed SelectionTool to TileSelectionToolMakes its purpose clear vs. ObjectSelectionTool.n
Updated the year in the license header template

Added a separate tool for editing polygonsAllows selecting multiple point handles and dragging them around. Thenpolygon points handles no longer show up for the regular objectnselection tool.nnSponsored-by: Zipline Games, Inc.n
Added lots of const keywords

Made reloading of images when they change more stableMake sure that each time a change is detected, the timer is restarted.nAlso, wait 500ms rather than 200ms after the last detected change beforenreloading the image.nnThis tries to avoid the problem mentioned at #44n

Adjust tile indexes when the tileset width has changedNow when the tileset width has changed, the tile indexes arenautomatically remapped so that the map still looks fine.nnThis patch was started by Adam Rippon, changed by Stefan Beller andnfinalized by Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijer.nnReviewed-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>nReviewed-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijer <thorbjorn@lindeijer.nl>n
Added a context menu for selected polygon nodesFor now this menu only allows deleting nodes and splitting segments innorder to add new nodes. It still does weird things with the selection,nthough.n
Added polygon/polyline export to the Lua plugin

Lua plugin: Changed the format in which polygons are writtenWhile the new format takes about twice the memory and is also twice asnslow to parse, it is more readable and hence the default.nnWhen speed and memory are really an issue, other formats can be enablednby modifying the code. Comparison benchmark:nnFormat  Memory inc. on dofile   Parsing time (x1000)File sizen---------------------------------------------------------------------nFULL93.01 K 1.08 s  22 KnPAIRS   69.43 K 0.86 s  18 KnOPTIMAL 34.60 K 0.62 s  11 KnnSponsored-by: Zipline Games, Inc.n
Added RangeSet template class by Ben LongbonsI've just adapted the code to the Tiled coding standards and wrote anlittle more documentation.n
Used the RangeSet class for Delete Nodes and Split Segments
Added action for joining nodes on a polygonThanks to Ben Longbons for his help with this, especially for thenRangeSet class on which the Join Nodes algorithm is now based.n
Delete a polygon object when it has only one node leftIt's not possible to select such an object anymore, so it's a bit sillynto leave it hanging around like that.n

Added support for defining custom object typesThe defined object types are be available for selection in the ObjectnProperties Dialog, and each defined object type has a customizable colornassociated with it so that the type of an object can be easilynrecognized.nnSponsored-by: Zipline Games, Inc.n

Removed the Context Help button from the titlebar of dialogsNo detailed context help is specified anywhere, so displaying this buttonnjust leads to disappointment. The context help button in the titlebar isnonly supported by Windows and KDE anyway, as far as I know.n

Added import and export of object typesSo that not every individual working on some project needs to manuallynspecify the colors for the different object types, but rather can importna shared xml file defining the types and their colors.nnWhen sometime in the future Tiled supports projects properly, thenproject file would probably be a nicer place for the object typendefinitions.nnSponsored-by: Zipline Games, Inc.n
Made sure to write out text files in text modeThis makes sure the correct newlines are used in the written file.n
Allow custom properties on tilesetsCloses #77n
Lua plugin: Write out the tileset properties
Fixed drawing of selection background on WindowsBase the ColorDelegate on QStyledItemDelegate rather thannQAbstractItemDelegate, so that the selected background is drawnncorrectly.n
Fixed assertion error in Object Properties dialogWould occur when no object types were defined. Probably a bug innQComboBox but easy to fix with a sanity check.n

Fixed reading of maps without tilesets but with a tile layerThis triggered an error even when the tile layer was completely empty.nThe error was introduced in 67515de5abea3972cc85c54738e31b6d71afc03b.nnReviewed-by: Ben Longbons <b.r.longbons@gmail.com>n
Bumped version to 0.7.1 and updated NEWS file

Center tile objects at the mouse on insertionThis fixes #67 without changing the TMX map format.nnThis means the bottom-left remains the origin of the tile objects evennthough plain rectangle objects have their origin in the top-left. Thisndifference was the reason for the wrong positioning of tile objects whenninserting them, which is now fixed by taking the difference into accountnin the Insert Tile Objects tool. The tool now centers the inserted tilenobject at the mouse position.nnThe reason tile objects have their origin in the bottom-left is becausentiles in tile layers are also bottom-left aligned within their gridncell. This in turn has its origins in top-down maps where this behaviornis usually desirable when working with tile images that are larger thannthe grid size.n

Added JSON plugin supporting both writing and readingIt can save tiles as Array or in base 64.nnNeed to make a way to ask user preferences on the saved file.n

Rewrote the JSON plugin* Made it conform to the coding stylen* Updated qjsonparsern* Improved error handlingn* Removed support for writing base64 tile data for nown* Small adjustments to the formatn* Added copyright headersnnThere is no support for polygons/polylines yet though.n
Implement framework for parsing command-line arguments
Moved the command line parser into a reusable class
Raised the tile size limit in the New Tileset dialogFrom 999 to 9999, which is also the limit applied to the grid size innthe New Map dialog.nnCloses #89n
Fixed compilation on VS 2008It does not support the operators 'and' and 'not'.n

Added support for tile rotationExtends tile flipping with clockwise and counter-clockwise rotation bynincrements of 90 degrees.nnTo support rotation, renderers need to handle the new FlippedDiagonallynGID flag.nnAdds new keyboard shortcuts 'Z' and 'Shift-Z' for brush rotation.nnCloses #19n

Fixes to tile rotation related to oversized tilesTiled has specific handling of oversized tiles that was not taken intonaccount in the tile rotation patch. Tiles that are larger than the mapngrid stick out at the top and right of a tile. This affects thenrendering code as well as the code that keeps track of the maximum tilensize used on a layer (in order to determine the area to repaint whenntiles are changed).nnAlso 'Left' and 'Right' are now used rather than 'CCW' and 'CW'. It'snshorter and should be clear enough.n
Delete .command files after use on mac
Cleanup in make-dist-mac.sh- Remove CONFIG += x86 comment due to Qt mac frameworks not having 32 bit coden- Autodetect plugins using lsn- Better outputn

Added a compile option to pass version informationThis lets you modify the version of Tiled within the building process.nThis is useful for daily builds.nnThe lines below show how to pass useful version information to the buildnprocess:nn  commit = $(git describe)n  qmake QMAKE_CXXFLAGS+=-DBUILD_INFO_VERSION=$commit -rn  maken

Fixed missing parenthesis

Improved handling of many tilesetsThe tab bar is discarded for a drop down. Toolbar added for import,nexport, tileset properties, and delete tileset. These entries arenremoved from the context menu on TilesetView. MapDocument gains a proxynfor setting Tileset filenames and emits a signal on a change.nnHandy button provided to get after tileset->setName(). Drop down isnuneditable between edit requests to assist switching the active tileset.nTilesets are sorted alphabetically in the drop down.n
More improvements to tileset handling* Tileset renames now have undo functionality.n* TilesetDock caches the selected tileset between document changes.n

Some code cleanups* Renamed UndoTilesetName to RenameTilesetn* Renamed UndoSetTilesetFileName to SetTilesetFileNamen* Renamed setTilesetFilename to setTilesetFileNamen* Renamed tilesetFilenameChanged to tilesetFileNameChangedn* Introduced TilesetDock::currentTileset helper functionn* Changed the label of the Rename button from '...' to 'Rename'n* Removed two duplicate linesn
Made the 'Show Grid' option in the tileset view persistentApart from being persistent, it now also applies immediately to allntileset views.n
Removed the no longer used mSelectedObjectGroupItem from MapSceneBasically AbstractObjectTool took over the job of keeping track of thencurrently selected object group.n

Introduced an option to highlight the current layerThe highlighting works by darkening the layers below the current layernand making the layers above the current layer more transparent.nnThis mode should help to make it clear which layer you're editing andnalso serves well for checking a map for errors. The mode can be togglednby pressing 'H'.nnThe degree of darkening or transparency is currently not configurable.n
Highlighting the current layer should be off by default
Small layout improvements to the Tilesets dock

Fixed tileset dock buttons to be disabled when appropriateThe buttons were not correctly disabled on startup. Also, crashes arennow avoided when somehow the actions do get triggered.nnThanks to @cjwillcock for spotting this regression and providing theninitial patch on which this one is based!n
libtiled-java: Some small code cleanupsRemoved redundant casts and use shorter for loops where possible.n
Added zlib1g-dev to the dependencies for building on Ubuntu/DebianThis package is required for using zlib directly.n

Avoid creating multiple polygon points at the same locationWhen creating a polygon or polyline, it was easy to end up with multiplenpoints placed at the same location. Since this is basically nevernintended, additional clicks on the same location will now be ignored.nnThanks to @Aranda for pointing out this issue and suggesting this fix.n
Fixed typo in the German translation

Added support for specifying a tile drawing offsetEach tileset can now define an offset that is applied when drawing itsntiles. This is useful when combining tilesets with a different baseline,nor lining up the base of the tiles with the tile grid.nnThis new tileset property is used to improve the tile positions in then'perspective walls' and 'isometric grass and water' examples.nnThis closes #16nnSponsored-by: Clint Bellangern
Renamed the diagonal flip flag to anti-diagonalThe actual flip performed is anti-diagonal, since it flips around thendiagonal. Just like horizontal flip is a flip around the vertical axis.n

Automapping: Made double wide rules possible* setupRulesMap, which reads in maps properties was rewritten ton  be more stable. It emits warnings in case of unknown properties.n  The capitalisation of the string properties is ignored.nn* when not having properties set, you need to have good defaultsn  (set in constructor now)nn* A new property NoOverlayingRules is introduced. This fixes #62n  Rules, which still apply, when they are shifted off by one, aren  handled properly now.nn  This is achieved by checking if the region, at which the rule shouldn  applied to, has not been touched by the current rule already.n  This additional check introduces needs a lot of time, so it is turned offn  by default, which also ensures compatibility to lower versions.nnSigned-off-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>n

Automapping: Added signals to indicate errors and warnings* When not using the explicit menu entry, you may want to get informationn  about errors and warnings as well.nn* In general errors and warnings are being delivered by signals now.nn* Rework of the warnings and error section to make it more accuratennSigned-off-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>n

Automapping: Code cleanup and refactoring* More 'const' key words addednn* Changed some methods to use objects byReferencenn* Renamed lots of internal variables to be more explainingnn* Replace all occurences of 'QList<QPair<TileLayer*, int> >' byn  IndexByTileLayer which is a typedef to QMap<TileLayer*, int>nn* Since QMap is not capable of storing the right order ofn  the needed layers, mTouchedLayers is changed from QSet to QListn  to still have access to the right order.nn* The private function setupMissingLayers() was refactored ton  setupCorrectIndexes(), so it only checks for the right indexes.nn* A new private function called setupMissingLayers() was introduced,n  which actually only checks for missing layers.nn* Rename private function setupRuleMapLayers to setupRuleMapTileLayersnn* Logic cleanups:nn  loop {n  if (foo) {n  instructions;n  }n  }nn  is written asnn  loop {n if(!foo)n continue;n instructions;n  }nnSigned-off-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>n

Automapping: Remove unused tile layers after applying rulesAdded a cleanTileLayers() function that removes all unneccessary addedntile layers. There is cleanTilesets() which provides the samenfunctionality just for tilesets.nnThis comes handy when using rulesets such as in The Mana World:nAfter all 'useful' rules, there are rules for error checking,nwhich i.e. covers if the automapping produces valid cave walls,nand does not break due to to small curves and abruptions.n(So you only need to check if the error layer is there afternhaving done the Automapping)nnSigned-off-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>n
Added a Rename Layer item to layer menuAlso it is added to the right-click context menu in the layerdock.nnFixes #94nnSigned-off-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>n

Added units and some explanations in New Map/Tileset dialogs* For clarity, the spin boxes now include a suffix for displaying then  unit of the value (mostly 'px', but also 'tiles' in the New Mapn  dialog).nn* In the New Tileset dialog, the 'spacing', 'margin' and 'drawingn  offset' properties gained a tool tip to provide a short explanation ofn  what they mean.nn* In the New Map dialog, a label was added that displays the resultingn  size of the map in pixels.nnConvinced-by: Stefan Bellern
Automapping: Fixed compilation for Visual StudioNo changes in functionality.nnFixes #98nnSigned-off-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>n

Added feature to copy position to clipboardDoes not show up in the menu nor on some button, since the position ofnthe mouse cannot be captured while clicking on a button, so only anshortcut works, which is Alt+C for now.nnFixes #69nnSigned-off-by: Stefan Beller <stefanbeller@googlemail.com>nReviewed-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijern
Added Russian translation

Added a command line option to disable OpenGLOpenGL drivers can still have their problems, especially on Linux but also whennrunning Windows inside VirtualBox. This option allows for recovering fromnenabling hardware accelerated rendering and not being able to start Tilednanymore.n
Added more file patterns to .gitignoreMost of these are probably generated when compiling with Visual Studio.n
Solved the zlib dependency problems on Windows by inluding the headersNow Tiled should compile out of the box with either MinGW or thenVisual Studio compiler.n
Merge branch '0.7'

Fixed a crash that could happen when removing the current layerThe current-layer highlighting code assumes the MapScene is up to datenwith the layer stack of its MapDocument, but when dealing with a currentnlayer index changed signal this wasn't always the case.n

Attempt to avoid the History view related crashAlways show the vertical scroll bar in the History view, in an attemptnto avoid the QListView crash that happens due to infinite recursion innsome layout/geometry code.nnA variation of QTBUG-14412 seems to be still around even in Qt 4.8...n

Introduced string conversion functions for Map::OrientationAlmost every map reader and writer will have to deal with converting thenmap orientation from and to a string. Automapping: Refactoring* Automapping now uses the coherentRegions implementationn  from Tiled::Utilsn  I am not sure which of both implementations is actually faster inn  finding the list of coherent regions, since there are multiple parametersn  to turn. (mapsize mattered in the current implementation, which does not inn  the Tiled::Utils implementation; the complexity and size of each region countsn  there; Overall the number of different regions count in both implementations)n  This change also closes #150.nn* remove Automapper::mapDocument(), since it is unusednn* Remove timer and filewatcher of AutomappingManagern  It was unused anyway. (No actual filenames were inserted into the watchlist.)nn  The Automapping data structures are all reloaded, when switching betweenn  documents, which is needed after modifying a rulesfile.n  But due to the documentswitching to the working map, you usually don't needn  the explicit watching for filechanges.nn  (In case of multiple instances of tiled running, whereas one instance modifiesn  the rulemaps and the other tries to use the updated rules on a workingmap,n  it will fail. As explained above that is no regression, this never worked)nn* Also Automapper::ruleSetPath() was deleted, since it is not being used now.n  Use of ruleSetPath was eliminated by removing the filewatcher above.nn* comments are adapted and correctednn* setupRulesMap renamed to setupRuleMapPropertiesn  In this function only the map properties of the rulesmap are parsed, hencen  its name.n

Automapping: multiple set layers are possible now (incompatible!)This commit will break existing rule maps, since the expected layernnaming of the rule maps changed. Instead of prefixing all layers in thenrulemap with 'rule', now the prefixes are depending on the function ofnthe layer.nn'regions' describes where rules are placed. (Previous 'RuleRegions')nAlternatively there can be 'regions_input' and 'regions_output' whichndescribe the 'input_*' and the 'output_*' regions respectively.nn'input<index>_<name>' replaces the 'ruleset<index>' layer.n'inputnot<index>_<name>' replaces the 'rulenotset' layer.ntThe set layers name in the working map can be specifiedntvia the <name> part. The <index> part now seperates differentntinputs. (So input* layers having different <index> parts will belongntto different input conditions.)ntdifferent indexes lead to multiple conditions. Only one conditionntneeds to be true and the rule gets applied. If the indexes are thentsame, then all conditions accross diffferent <name> layers must allntbe true.nn'output<index>_<name>' is the replaced name of 'rule<index>_<name>'nnThe clearRegion function was dropped and the erase function of tilelayersnare used now.nnThe prepareLoad functionality was put into the constructor.nThe return value of prepareLoad can be determined by checking thenlength of the error string.nnThe functions in automapper.cpp have been reordered to fit the workflow.n
Automapping: Add a preferences section* You can {en, dis}able the automapping while editing the set layer inn  the preferences dialog in the Automapping tab.n
Automapping: adding converter for rulemapsThe converter application is able to convert all rulemapsnas of now into the new (incompatible, but more powerful) rulemapnformat.n
Automapping: convert the example maps

Cleanups to the AutomappingConverter* Renamed classes/files to something more unique so that they're easilyn  distinguishable from Tiled sources.nn* Fixed several memory leaks. Some remain, but for a converter it's notn  very important.nn* Improved UI (resizable, QTreeView rather than QTableView, disabledn  'save' button until you've added files, etc.)n

Replica Island plugin: Read and write *.bin filesReplica Island is an open source, side-scrolling video game for Android.nThis plugin can read and write the *.bin files used with Replica Island.nnThis code was originally based on the existing Droidcraft plugin (hencenthe copyright notices), but it has since been almost entirely rewrittennto use QDataStream, which provides us with portable (de)serialization ofnlittle-endian floats.nnMost of the tilesets are taken directly from Replica Island, which isndistributed under the Apache License.  A few tilesets, including thenhotspot tiles, were created by hand.n

MapDocument::LayerType moved to Layer::TypeThe move of the layer type into the layer class allowsndetecting the type relying on an introduced type field of the layernclass.nnTherefore asTileLayer and asObjectLayer have been implemented asnnon-virtual functions in the layer class.nnAdditionally the functions bool isTilelayer() and bool isObjectGroup()nhave been introduced for cases when you do not need the object, but only neednto know if it is a certain type.n
Map::indexOfLayer has optional layer type argument
AutomappingConverter: fix file dialog filterAllow users to filter for (*.tmx).n

Automapping: sort rules within one rulefileAs in refactoring 72e2f77ec2afbcaa0d93b6b9f0c8e56244adf8e3nthe way how to obtain the ruleregions was changed to a way,nwhich thinks of regions instead of scanning the map for rulesnline-by-line. That approach might be cleaner in theory, but thenorder of rules within one rulefile is now unknown.nThe original intent never was to rely on rule ordering within onenrulefile, but users did rely on it.nnThis commit introduces a sorting of the rules within one rulemap, so thenorder is the same as it was before the rewrite of the Automapping.n
Automapping: Add assertions to setupRuleList()checking if mRuleInput and mRuleOutput match its indexes.n

Automapping: Support for Objects.The output layers are allowed to be object layers as well.nAutomapping still processes in tile coordinates, whichnmay yield inaccurate object handling.nnFor checking if objects are part of a rule or when checkingnif they need to be delete first ('DeleteTiles' set to 'true'),nthe object boundaries (rectangles) will be considered, which maynlead to problems, specially when using non-rectangular objectsn(polygon, polyline).nSince the tile coordinates are counted in integer,nthe object coordinates will be translated into these as well.nSo the rectangular boundaries are rounded to nearest integer.n
Automapping: add object examples

Automapping: Introduce AutomappingUtilsThe automappingutils.{cpp, h} files will have general methods, whichndo not fit into the Automapping classes, but also do not really fit intonthe API of the relevant used classes.n

Protect nameFilter() method from external useThis just makes sure that nameFilters() is used instead, since usingnnameFilter() fails to take into account that a plugin might supportnmultiple formats.n

Fixed a crash that could happen after pastingThis was a pretty nasty one to track down. At some point in time I had anreason to copy a layer's map pointer in Layer::clone, even though the clonednlayer is not actually added to the same map. Later on I decided this was notnnecessary (as can be read in the documentation), but somehow I forgot tonremove the line that copied the pointer.nnThe result was that the brush resulting from a paste ended up referring to andeleted Map instance.nnFixes #130n

Fixed object type getting erased on pressing EnterIt's not currently possible to add new object types to the model bynsimply typing new names in the object properties dialog (you need to usenthe preferences).nnHowever, the default insertPolicy for QComboBox is to try adding newnstrings to the model when Enter is pressed.
