Fixed zoom sensitivity for finer-resolution mouse wheelsThis is an attempt at improving the mouse wheel zoom sensitivity for micenwith finer-resolution wheels, like Apple's Magic Mouse.nnFor these mice, the change in the scale is based on the current scale and thenactual wheel movement, rather than going through a fixed number of zoomnlevels.nnFixes #92n

Fixed the anchoring at the mouse when zooming with wheelDue to the way Qt anchors at the mouse position, small rounding errorsnwould add up with each change in the view's transformation.nnRather than relying on that system, we now manually anchor at the mousenposition, only refreshing the scene position of the mouse when itnactually moves.n

Allow installer to continue without uninstalling previous versionSometimes users have gotten into the situation where they could not installnTiled because the installer detected a previous version, which could not benuninstalled.nnThis change makes the automatic uninstalling of a previous version optional.nThis also allows installing multiple versions of Tiled alongside each other.n

Fixed crash on closing a mapThis is a crash introduced withn1afabff912bd959e866f084e9c65d89a9cbcf8db. We can't always callnTerrainBrush::updateBrush since it expects the current layer to be antile layer, which is not the case when the map is being closed (and thenbrush set back to a null map).nnReviewed-by: Manu Evansn

Automapping: remove beforehand check if rules are used.D. Knuth: Premature optimisation is the root of all evil.nAnd he is right again.nnThe checks if rules are used have been done before all Automapping takesnplace, but a rule can alter the situation for the following rulesndrastically, so either we try to correct the checks if rules are appliednor just drop these checks.nnThe intention of the checking before was to speed up Automapping by onlynexecuting the needed rules, but as the checks would take more and morencode for just being correct, it might be better to remove the speedupnthings completely and have a smaller code base.nnThanks to Giancarlo Todone for spotting the bug.n

Automapping: Handle non existing input layers in working map.If there is an input layer required by the rule map, which does notnexist in the working map, the rules will not get applied, as the rulesnare not met.nnBefore there was no check if input layers existed, so you could crashntiled.nnThanks to Giancarlo Todone for spotting the bug.nnFixes #219n
Automapping: Correct comments in sewers rules file.Also two rules have been added, which use layers as input, whichnhave been generated by the rules before.n

Share the line drawing code between StampBrush and TerrainBrushI've introduced a new module called 'geometry' which now containsnrasterization of ellipse and line, as well as the 'coherent regions'nfunction which existed in the 'utils' module.n

Fixed resolving of symbolic links while loading mapWhen resolving references to external tilesets or images, it is importantnto avoid resolving symbolic links. It can cause the generated relativenpath when saving the map to be unnecessary complicated and possibly pointnto undesired locations.nnCleaning the path should suffice for determining whether two tilesetsnare the same in general.nnFixes #212n

Added an option to disable the use of RpathWhen Tiled is installed to a standard system location, it doesn'tngenerally need an Rpath to find the libtiled library.nnThis commit adds the option of passing `RPATH=no` to qmake to suppressnthe usage of Rpath in the tiled executable and its plugins.n

Save As dialog can save in all formats it is safe to save in* All Plugins, which can be read as well, can be used forn  saving as well.nn* MapDocument class contains a new member (mWriterPluginFileName),n  which determines in which format the map should be saved.n  (It needs to be set accordingly, when opening a new File)nn* The plugin manager has some more conversions.nn* MapDocuments setFileName (only used by its saving function)n  is private now.nnCloses #18.nnReviewed-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijern

Introduced a minimapThis is a quite stable running navigator or minimap.nnWith the help of MapRenderer a small version of the map is rendered intona buffer image. The minimap rendering is copied from the screenshotnfunction and offers several flags to finetune the rendering.nnFor detecting mapchanges I used the indexChanged-event offered bynQUndoGroup. That does a pretty good job. Minimap rendering can benexpensive as it has to draw the entire map. To prevent slowdowns duringnpainting an (optional) timer is used that drops all redraw calls untiln100ms are elapsed.nnThe overall performance impact seems to be okay. At least on my machinen(win7 64bit, quadcore i7 with good graphics card). This certainly needsnto be tested in different environments.n

Don't install libtiled header files by defaultInstalling the header files breaks our current Debian/Ubuntu packages.nSince there is no real need for the headers to be installed, it has beennmade optional and disabled by default.n

Optimized updating of the Tilesets dockWhen switching maps the Tilesets dock was doing a lot of work, whichnbecame noticeable with maps carrying dozens of tilesets. Two things werendone to make it fast again:nn* The dock widget is temporarily hidden while it is being updated, savingn  a lot of time that was being spent needlessly relayouting the tab bar.nn* The tileset models are being created on-demand, when the user actuallyn  switches to a certain tileset.nnNow even maps with over 50 tilesets perform reasonable. If needed, itncould be further optimized by also creating the tileset views on-demand.n

Automapping: Removed the no-tile exception (incompatible!)This change is motivated by issue #306.nThe no-tile exception made sense at times when the set layer wasnthe only input layer. (That is version 0.8.1 and before)nNow this exception causes trouble as Automapping does notnproduce expected results.nnThis commit finally makes the Automapping incompatible to thenAutomapping rules of version 0.8.1 and before.nHaving spare input layers produces a different behaviournnow than before.nHowever not all hope is lost, the Automapping on quite filledninput layers behaves the same as before, which I expect to be thenstandard usecase.nnCloses #306n

Change layer data format with an undo commandMakes sure the map is marked as changed, so that the user is promptednwhen forgetting to save this change.nnAlso moved the different formats enum from MapWriter to Map.nnFixes #307n

Fixed eraser skipping tiles when moving fastInstead of erasing just the tile below the mouse, erase all tiles betweennthe last and current tile position.nnThe same fix was applied earlier to the stamp brush in commitn9a397baa4c35c2a8e2f07b77d2b6e5949faf8d5c.n
Fixed view position reset when zooming after scrolling with wheelThe view reset its position when scrolling using the mouse wheel,nquickly followed by a control-wheel to zoom.n

Fixed saving new files to no longer trigger an error message

Performance fixes related to the Bucket Fill toolThe Bucket Fill tool would always immediately update its overlay item,nregardless of whether the tool was selected or whether the overlay wasneven visible. On large maps, this caused any change of stamp to becomenslow.nnAnother small improvement that was made was to avoid creating an overlynlarge fill overlay, which greatly improves the responsiveness when usingnthe fill tool on large maps in situations where the fill region isnsmall.n
Implemented handling of pinch gesture eventsFunctional for both the map view and the tileset view.n

Renamed Create Object tool to Create RectangleReflects its function better now that a host of other object types exist.nAn 'insert rectangle' icon is now used as well.nnThe 'insert ellipse' icon was improved for consistency and the tools werenreordered a bit to group all the 'shapes' together.n
Replaced icon for image layersWas using the 'paste' icon before, now it's based on GNOME'sn'insert-image' icon.n
Updated NEWS file

Marked Tiled as high-resolution capableThanks to Lou Rinaldi (https://twitter.com/LouRinaldi) for trying outnthis option! Qt appears to handle it quite well.nnThis solves most of issue #295, though the icons could still use largernversions as they are still scaled up.n

Fixed compile against latest Qt 5 (beta 2)* QAbstractItemModel::reset was removed, and needs to be replaced withn  appropriate calls to beginResetModel and endResetModel. This wasn  already the proper thing to do since Qt 4.6, so no ifdefs were needed.nn* Some functions of QHeaderView were renamed.nn* QRect::intersect was removed. It was actually misnamed, and the onen  time it was used in Tiled it had no effect.nn* Some of the functionality of QDesktopServices was moved to a new classn  called QStandardPaths.nn* The old Qt::WFlags typedef was removed. It should no longer have beenn  used anyway.nn* QChar::fromAscii was removed, but the code should have been usingn  QChar::fromLatin1 anyway.n
Ignore the automappingconverter executable
Removed two unimplemented member functions
Objects dock: Enter key displays the Object Properties dialog
Specify a parent for the Object Properties dialogMakes sure the dialog is positioned correctly and shares the task barnentry with the main application.n
Adding command-line export to tiled.exe
Fixed crash when switching terrain without tile layer selected
Fixed saving of terrain probabilities between 1 and 0The MapWriter was saving the floating point value as an int.n

Continue painting when switching between tile and vertex paintingDue to the way the line mode was toggled, any modifier change wasnresetting the brush behavior. This interrupted any current paintingnoperation.n
Implemented reading/writing of terrain properties

Implemented editing of terrain informationThis is done in a dedicated dialog to avoid complicated interactionsnwithin the main UI. The dialog can be opened from the tileset dock.nnThe TerrainModel now represents all terrain types of a map grouped bynthe tileset they appear in.nnThe terrain information overlay painted on top of tiles currently onlynsupports tiles in orthogonal mode. It does not adjust appropriately tonisometric tiles and may also have problems with orthogonal tiles thatndo not match the map grid size.nnAll operations are properly backed by undo/redo support.nnTransition distances are now recalculated on-demand. This removes thenoption of tweaking distances to achieve transition priorities. Thatnfunctionality will have to be added some other way (for example with anseparate list of transition cost modifiers).nnThis change also happens to close #294.n
Fixed compilation against Qt < 4.8By avoiding the 'theme' property that was added in Qt 4.8.n
Fixed compilation against Qt < 4.7Qt 4.6 did not have QList::reserve yet.n
Added a .gitattributes file for line endingsThis generally makes sure Windows users do not get in trouble when theyndo not have core.autocrlf set to 'true'.n
Use depend_includepath rather than setting DEPENDPATH manuallyBased on Qt Creator commit 700732683779a862091b19336ef980801e412395.n
Small tweaks to help and version output on console

Fixed possible crash when a tileset changesReviewed-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn LindeijernnNot every tileset watched by the tileset manager is displayed in eachntileset dock. Wrong assertion introduced in commit 0c89ea0e1568b66d8c.n

Fixed empty tileset view after removing a tilesetBug repro steps:nn1. Create new mapn2. Add new tilesetn3. Add new tilesetn4. Go to Tilesets dock and click Remove Tileset buttonnnThe first tileset should be deleted and the selected tileset should switchnto the second tileset. However, the tileset view is blank.n
Silence a GCC warning when compiling against Qt 5Actually we don't need to print an empty string to get a newline.nThe warning is due to -Wformat-zero-length.n
Added a TMX rasterizerRenders a map with a specified scale, without collision layer and objectngroups.n
Excluded some files from source releasesThey are only relevant when working with git.n
Don't display tilesets without terrains in the Terrains dockCloses #257n

Added image layer support to Lua and JSON pluginsThis also changes the transparentColor tileset property name tontransparentcolor in the Lua export for consistency (all the othernkeys are lowercase).nnCloses #320n
Removed context help button from Edit Terrain dialogThere is no context help so there should not be a context help button.n

Improved display of tileset names in terrain viewI'm not entirely happy with it, mainly since terrain names are no longernaligned when some of them have no tile assigned yet, but I think it'sngood enough.n
Fixed updating of tileset name in terrain list on undo/redo
Removed unused member variableDetected by clang++ (-Wunused-private-field).n
Fixed updating of Terrains list when adding/removing tilesetsThe TerrainModel was not correctly notifying views about these changes.n

Fixed crash when having multiple tilesets with terrainThe terrain brush will now refuse to look for ways to transition betweennterrains from different tilesets, which is better than crashing in thisnsituation.n
Removed explicit Rename Layer actionYou can now rename layers using F2 only when the layer list has focus.nThe advantage is that you can now also use F2 to rename objects ornterrains.n
Show/Hide Other Layers action now uses undo commandsNeeded for consistency with using undo/redo for toggling individualnlayer visibility.n

Fixed crash in terrain brush when dealing with unset tilesThis crash was introduced in 43fef0db20f3691714b88785c54211d47b23e7b0,nwhen the null check was removed from Tile::terrain.nnThe edge functions are only used by the terrain brush, so they have nownbeen moved there, with the null check reintroduced.n
Replaced 'unsigned int' with 'unsigned'I prefer brevity to verbosity in this case, they mean the same.n
Replaced 'uint' with 'unsigned'The 'uint' is apparently an old compatibility name, so let's not use it.n
Added shortcuts for undo/redo in Edit Terrain Dialog

Tried to make erasing terrain information less confusingNow the tileset view shows a gray overlay indicating where terrainninformation is specified, and the No Terrain button has been replacednwith one saying Erase, which does not affect the tileset view whenntoggled.n
Added 'E' as shortcut to toggle erasing terrain information
Fixed another potential terrain brush crashAfter change 43fef0db20f3691714b88785c54211d47b23e7b0 there were somenmore cases where a null check was missing.n
Only highlight the terrain when it's not no terrain
Added an action to create a terrain given its display tileConvenient shortcut to first adding a new terrain type and then settingnits display tile.n

Small terrain brush code tweaks
Removed unused New Image Layer dialog
Have lupdate remove obsolete entries
Updated all translation filesTo give an idea of the size of this update, the lupdate output for mostntranslations was:nnFound 517 source text(s) (130 new and 387 already existing)n
Removed newimagelayerdialog.ui from the .pro file as well...
Fixed typo Terain -> Terrain
Automapping: Improved error messagesAll strings not to be translated (i.e. special layer names for Automapping)nare enclosed with 'quote signs'.n
Fixed the plural handling in the Objects dockThe handling of different plural forms should be left to the Qtntranslation system, rather than hardcoding special forms for thensingular case.n
Removed a translation string by fixing a small inconsistencyAlso removed the unneeded Move Object To Layer, since it wasnimmediately overridden in ObjectsDock::updateActions anyway.n
Updated the Dutch translation
Updated German translation
Updated all translation files againI hope now we can enter string freeze.n

Unified image layer renderingThe image layer rendering was different for each map renderer. It seemsnto me that it is better to consider the image layer as simplynindependent of the tile or object layer projections, which is what thisnchange does.nnThis change also implies that image layer position is now in pixelsnrather than tiles. It is currently still not possible to change thisnposition in Tiled, so I don't expect that to affect anybody.nnAlso fixed the image layer item bounds, which resolves potential repaintnissues when changing image layer opacity or visiblity.nnCloses #317n

Cosmetic improvements to Tilesets dock and others* Show selected tileset in tilesets menu, radio button stylen* Show a large down arrow on the tilesets menu buttonn* Removed the space between the tab bar and the tileset viewn* Removed the space between views and the tool bar belown
Updated copyright year in About dialogAlso updated translation files for this change and marked thentranslation as done in the German and Dutch translations.n
Added Su00c3u00a9bastien Burillard as French translatorForgot that in commit 158918478fc9505e616d1d2ea08ed172f65c3980.n

Added a note about installing qt on Mac.

Fixed possible crash in TileDelegateThis crash is not possible to trigger when using the UI to add tilesets,nbut by editing the map or tileset file you can set up tilesets thatnhave a tile count that is not divisible by the column count. ThenTileDelegate was not dealing correctly with table cells for which no tilenexists.n
Removed ability to change terrain through the TilesetModelIt is no longer used and would not handle undo correctly.n

Remember the size and position for some dialogsSome dialogs were excluded from this behavior because they were eithernnot resizable or because it's probably better for them to always pop upnin the center (like Preferences, New Map and New Tileset).nnUnfortunately for some window managers this behavior is broken and Indon't know of a good way to fix that. On Xfce for example, the dialogsnwill move down by the height of their title bar each time they arenopened.nnCloses #339n

Fixed deletion of tilesets that are shared with open mapsWhen opening a map with external tilesets, it will share those externalntilesets when they are the same as those used in already open maps. Whennsome error is encountered while opening such a map, these shared tilesetsnshould not be deleted.nnThis patch makes sure that the map reader will only delete the tilesetsnthat it created itself while loading a map.nnFixes #312n
Updated NEWS file

Tweaked the default window layout* Mini-map is now tabbed beneath the Layers dockn* History and Maps docks moved to the right and are hidden by defaultn* Default window size was increased from 800x600 to 1000x700n

Flareplugin: initialize number base to 10 when reading maps.The default of flare maps is 10.nnThis commit removes the compiler warning:n........tiledsrcpluginsflareflareplugin.cpp:170:60:nwarning: 'base' may be used uninitialized in this functionn[-Wmaybe-uninitialized]n
Removed an unnecessary separator in the tileset dock
Fixed Object Properties dialog not remembering its sizeIt was always resizing itself to its preferred size, so the mechanismnimplemented in 28ea563 was not working for this dialog.nnFixes #339n
Open Object Properties dialog when double clicking on objectCloses #300n
Export/Import map background color to/from JSON

Depend on zlib directly when compiling against Qt 5libtiled.pro is now set up to auto-detect a zlib installation at itsndefault location. When it is installed somewhere else, then thenenvironment variable 'ZLIB_PATH' should be set to the directory where then'include' and 'lib' directories can be found that include zlib.nnWhen compiling with MinGW, it will choose the static library to avoidnthe need to copy a .dll around. When compiling with MSVC it will need thenzlib1.dll since I don't think the static library is compatible with thatncompiler. The MSVC build has not been tested yet.nnIt expects zlib to be installed by using the package available atnhttp://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/zlib.htmnnCloses #285n
Simplified IsometricRenderer::pixelToTileCoords
Import/export terrain information from/to JSONFixes #350n

Bump the maximum tile margin and spacing in New Tileset dialogThe maximum was at 99 pixels and somebody was hitting that limit. Thenmain reason for the maximum is because QSpinBox determines its sizenbased on the maximum value. With the current layout, the maximum can ben9999 and it will still be the same size, because it's aligned to thentile size spin box anyway which has that maximum already.nnCloses #359n
libtiled-java: Added zlib compression support to TMXMapWriter
libtiled-java: Do not output width and height for ObjectGroupIt's obsoleted.n

libtiled-java: Do not store firstGid in each TileSetInstead, they should be calculated on-the-fly when writing a TMX file.nLoading TMX files should parse the gids while the file is being loaded,nbut not persist them inside the TileSet.n

libtiled-java: Added support for caching tilesetsFor example, when reusing the TMXMapReader to load several TMX filesnthat all have the same tileset definitions, the loader does not have tonload the tileset images several times, thus making the loading processnmuch faster.n

Raised map size limits beyond all reasonAvoid crashing on map creation by not automatically creating a tilenlayer when its size would exceed a gigabyte, and warning the usernabout this fact.nnMaps that only use object layers work fine at this size.n

Added MapObject angle* Added support for angle in TMX, Lua and JSON pluginsn* Added support for angle drawing in orthogonal map renderern* Added angle to Object Properties windown* Adapted MapObject bounding box (only rect shape and tile object) inn  orthogonal map renderer to contain the angle arrown* Added a view option to enable or disable angle arrown* Polygon/polyline don't have angle arrowsnnConflicts-resolved-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn LindeijernnConflicts:ntsrc/libtiled/mapobject.cppntsrc/libtiled/mapobject.hntsrc/libtiled/mapreader.cppntsrc/libtiled/maprenderer.hntsrc/libtiled/mapwriter.cppntsrc/tiled/mainwindow.cppntsrc/tiled/mainwindow.uintsrc/tiled/mapscene.cppntsrc/tiled/mapscene.hntsrc/tiled/objectpropertiesdialog.uintsrc/tiled/preferences.cppntsrc/tiled/tiled.pron
Renamed object angle to object rotation
Added a 'snap to fine grid' featureAllows for objects to be placed accurately at sub-tile increments.n

Added a rotation handle to the map object itemThe item is now rotated rather than just showing an arrow.nnThere are still some problems with this:nn* Edit polygon tool does not cope with itn* Would feel less weird when objects rotated around their centern* This makes no sense for non-tile objects on isometric mapsnnCloses #11  (support for rotating objects)nCloses #325 (rotate object image)nnSponsored-by: Ben Walesn

Removed the option to show rotation arrowsIf they are to be drawn, it should be done by the map object item andnnot by each map renderer. For now I'm just removing it since it doesn'tnseem that helpful to me anyway when the objects are already rotatednthemselves.n

Allow objects to be flipped horizontally and verticallyFlipping is supported for tile objects and polygons, and for bothnorthogonal maps and isometric maps.nnFlipping currently does not take into account object rotation,nso horizontal flipping might mean something else for rotated objects.nAlso, when flipping groups of objects, they are flipped individually.nThese issues can be resolved later.nnCloses #58  (flipping for tile objects)nCloses #116 (applying tile offset to tile objects)nCloses #154 (flipping for polygons and polylines)nnSponsored-by: Ben Walesn
Apply flip and rotate shortcuts to selected objectsWhen applicable, the X and Y shortcuts will now flip selected objectsnand the Z and Shift+Z shortcuts will rotate them.n
Handle object rotation in Edit Polygon Tool
Merge branch 'wip/rotation'
Fixed compile against Qt 5A parameter was dropped from QCoreApplication::translate.n

Avoid using Windows 95 styleThe Windows 95 style is really ugly but somehow gets chosen by defaultnsometimes, even with Qt 5 where the much better Fusion style is available.nAvoid it on any platform but Windows.nnThe code was borrowed from Qt Creator.n
Allow cross-compiling Tiled using MinGWNeeded some small modifications.n
Merge branch '0.9'

Fixed object drawing order for image saving and mini-mapCurrently objects are always drawn top to bottom. For the regular mapnview this is taken care of by setting the 'z' property of the itemsnto their 'y' coordinate. However, when saving as image or when renderingnthe mini-map, the objects need to be sorted manually.n
Fix library directory orderThis moves path to -ltiled before system library locations, fixing thencase where libtiled from (older) installed version of tiled isnpicked up instead of newly built one.n
Ignore mac build artifacts
Fixed some plurals in English translationThe actions on polygon points were not translated yet. These are needednfor proper plural handling.n

Fixed line widths when zooming in Qt 5The grid and selection lines are not supposed to be affected by the zoomnlevel. In Qt 5, the default QPen width changed from 0 (which isnindependent of the current transformation) to 1.n
Merge branch '0.9'

Improved interface for rotating objectsThe logic was reimplemented in ObjectSelectionTool. This allowed fornrotating objects around their center as well as rotating multiplenobjects together.nnSponsored-by: Ben Walesn

Rotate objects around their center instead of the bottom leftThis makes the implementation a little bit more complicated, but itnshould be more intuitive overall.nnThis change is mostly about changing the interpretation of then'rotation' attribute and is not backwards-compatible. However, rotationnsupport was added recently so I don't expect anybody to depend on thenprevious behavior. Eventually the transformation origin could also benmade configurable, if there is a need for that.n

Implemented moving objects with arrow keysBy default the selected objects move by pixel. The Shift modifier speedsnit up to move by tile (or by subtile when fine grid snapping isnenabled). The Control modifier causes the event to be ignored, so thatnit can be used to move the view.nnThis behavior is similar to that seen in Inkscape and GIMP.nnCloses #342nnSponsored-by: Ben Walesn
Don't handle keys while moving or rotating with the mouseThe undo stack gets confused when that happens.n
Unduplicated the duplicate and remove objects actionsAlso shared the implementation of moveObjectsToGroup by moving thatnfunction into MapDocument.n

Made Tiled registering *.tmx as MIME-typeTiled now registers the MIME-type application/x-tiled based on the file suffixn*.tmx. It also registers itself as application being able to handle thisnMIME-type. This means systems following the freedesktop standard [1] will nowndisplay tmx files with a tiled icon and open those files with tiled.nn[1] http://standards.freedesktop.org/shared-mime-info-spec/shared-mime-info-spec-latest.htmln

Renamed the tmx MIME type to application/x-tiled-tmxThis should make it easier to add further MIME types of plugins.nnThe icon is not renamed to application-x-tiled-tmx in order to allownother plugins to depend on it in future too.n

Small tweaks to the desktop fileThe TryExec line makes sure that tiled is only listed if the executablenexists. Meaning that the desktopfile should not be displayed as an menunentry if the executable is missing in $PATH (for example if you installnwith a custom prefix).nnSetting the GenericName might have some use for some window managers /napplication menus (I was unable to find this displayed anywhere in thengnome-panel manu, but it cannot hurt).n

Flare export plugin: Remove checks for certain layers being thereThe flare engine evolved and supports 2 more layers optionally.nThe three layers which were checked being there, should still be there,nbut are not necessary. Also I cannot recall any errors due to missingnor miss spelled layers during flare development, so I think we do notnneed this check for flare.nnThe check for these three layers unintentionally hindered other projectsnusing this format, which is another reason to drop the check.n
Removed inconsistent zoom factors in tileset viewI prefer if there's a single set of predictable zoom factors for bothnthe map and the tileset view.n
Install the automappingconverter application

Flare export plugin: Remove checks for certain layers being thereThe flare engine evolved and supports 2 more layers optionally.nThe three layers which were checked being there, should still be there,nbut are not necessary. Also I cannot recall any errors due to missingnor miss spelled layers during flare development, so I think we do notnneed this check for flare.nnThe check for these three layers unintentionally hindered other projectsnusing this format, which is another reason to drop the check.nn(cherry picked from commit 58a3d5f57a82d41671cad9aa89825b38ddc49072)n

Merge branch '0.9'Conflicts:ntdocs/tiled.desktopntsrc/tiled/images/16x16/application-x-tiled.pngntsrc/tiled/images/16x16/tiled.pngntsrc/tiled/images/32x32/application-x-tiled.pngntsrc/tiled/images/32x32/tiled.pngntsrc/tiled/images/scalable/application-x-tiled.svgntsrc/tiled/images/scalable/tiled.svgntsrc/tiled/images/tiled-icon-16.pngntsrc/tiled/images/tiled-icon-32.pngntsrc/tiled/images/tiled-icon.svgntsrc/tiled/tiled.pron
Make the .bat file always check out with Windows newlines

Changes made in property dialogs now apply immediatelyThis affects the custom property editing as well as the editing of anynbuilt-in properties for classes like ObjectGroup, ImageLayer, Map andnMapObject. To make this possible, some new undo-related classes werenintroduced and some new notification signals.nnThis change is a preparation for allowing the property dialogs to benreplaced by a docked solution.n

Added a Properties dockwidgetDisplays properties of selected objects, tiles and layers at the moment.nDoes not display other stuff like size, height, color, etc. yet. My plannis to do that using the Qt Property Browser solution.n
Added the Qt Property Browser solutionA planned replacement for the current primitive property editing table.nnBased on qt-solutions revision 8926435d3f2b94ebfadc1bec5fd78cf0dfa5c2c8.n

Introduced a PropertyBrowser for in the Properties dockwidgetThe PropertyBrowser class extends QtTreePropertyBrowser and allowsnediting of custom properties as well as built-in properties like layernnames, object size/position, etc.nnThere is currently no way yet to add/remove custom properties.nnThe plan is to allow the Properties dockwidget to replace the Propertiesndialog.n

Set the tree widget as focus proxy of the tree property browserMakes the focus go to the tree widget when set on the property browser,nsince it's not very helpful for it to stay on the property browsernwidget.n
Renamed toolbar -> toolBar in ObjectsDockJust making it follow general naming convention and match QToolBar.n
Added actions for adding/removing a property to Properties dockAlso made Delete and Backspace work for deleting the selected property.n
Unset the current object when it gets removed

Update the current object in a few more casesNow the current object (displayed in the Properties dockwidget) alsonchanges when clicking object layers or objects in the Objects dock,nwhen clicking on a terrain and when clicking on a tile. Regardless ofnwhether the clicked object was already selected or not.n

Raise the Layers dock for editing a new layer's nameThis made the isVisible() workaround obsolete, which had also beenncopied to ObjectsDock and MapsDock where it wasn't needed in the firstnplace.nnI decided not to automatically show the dock, since being able to editnthe new layer's name is more of a convenience that's generally not worthnpopping up this dock widget for if it isn't already open.n

Used Properties dock instead of the dialog for tilesetsSupport was added to the PropertyBrowser for Tileset objects, obsoletingnthe separate Rename Tileset action since the name can simply be editednin the Properties dock.n

Disable the properties dock for external objectsTileset, and as a result Tile and Terrain instances, may be stored in annexternal file. Currently no changes are allowed when this is the case,nin order to avoid loss of information due to the lack of automaticnsaving of changes to such external files.n
Removed 'Tile Properties...' option from Tile context menuReplaced by the Properties dock.n
Removed 'Terrain Properties...' option from Terrain context menuReplaced by the Properties dock.n

Replaced Map Properties dialog with Properties dockNow the layer format can be configured in the Properties dock,nobsoleting the Map Properties dialog.nnThe map itself is now also the initial value for the current object.n

Pass the ownership of the map objectShouldn't try to free the wrapper yet though as layers are still owned bynit. The wrappers leak so (re)opening a lot of maps may end up consumingnmore memory than actually needed, should look into this.nAnyway, it's not script writer's responsibility to manage references.n

QtPropertyBrowser: Allow controlling whether to show text for bool valuesThis was a rather involved patch, but it avoids the need for usingnprivate API or duplicating QtBoolEdit (which is in a private header).nnApart from adding support for this QtBoolEdit option to thenQtCheckBoxFactory and the QtBoolPropertyManager, the setting can alsonbe controlled via the 'textVisible' attribute associated withnQtVariantProperty instances.n
Use the new attribute to hide the text of boolean properties
QtPropertyBrowser: Document the 'echoMode' attribute for string values
Moved up the 'Visible' attribute for objectsMore closely matches the location of this attribute for layers.n

Allow changing the image layer image in the Properties dockIntroduced a 'filePath' property with a special editor that featuresna small button that opens up the file chooser. It also colors the textnto make it clear whether the file path exists or not.nnThe VariantPropertyManager, VariantEditorFactory and FileEdit classesnwere based on the example from issue 18 of the Qt Quarterly [1]nn[1] http://doc.qt.digia.com/qq/qq18-propertybrowser.htmln
Removed layer property dialogsAll layer properties, including those of object layers and image layers,ncan now be edited in the new Properties dock.n

Added completion to defined object types to the Properties dockThis was easier than adding support for an editable combo box. Hopefullynit's just as useful in most cases. It might make sense to automaticallynadd suggestions for any already used type in the future.n

QtPropertyBrowser: Respond to each change of text in QtLineEditFactoryI've extended this editor to allow adding a QCompleter to the line edit,nbut when changing the value via the QCompleter only the 'textChanged'nand not the 'textEdited' signal is emitted.nn'blockSignals' is now used to avoid this signal when applying a changenof property value, like for all other editors.n
Removed remainders of the Properties dialogAll use-cases should now be fulfilled by the new Properties dock.nnCloses #146nCloses #356n
Merge branch 'wip/propertiesdock'

Added tile object flipping flags to Properties dockAllows inspecting whether any given tile object is flipped in eitherndirection, and to change it (though the 'X' and 'Y' shortcuts arenfaster for that purpose).n

Always start selecting objects when holding ShiftIt can be difficult to select objects when accidentally hitting anynobject will start a move operation. Now it's possible to suppress thenmove and always start a selection by holding Shift.nnThis matches the behavior of Inkscape.n
Fixed updating of image layerWhen changing the transparent color or the image of an image layer,nthe item was not resizing and repainting correctly.n

Fixed updating of image layerWhen changing the transparent color or the image of an image layer,nthe item was not resizing and repainting correctly.nnBack-ported from master branch commits:nn7ded5d6b9fba6d71740fc3ab0c5e2263c51707ec (small part)n479a288d3b4e6105b56a75283e435f79fbde715dn

Optimized hardware-accelerated tile renderingBy using QPainter::PixmapFragment the amount of API calls to draw thensame tile over and over again is much reduced. This leads to a smallnimprovement in rendering speed, which is mainly noticable on maps wherenlarge areas are filled with the same tile.nnThe minimum Qt version was raised to Qt 4.7 since earlier versions donnot have QPainter::PixmapFragment.n
Removed no longer needed Qt version checksQt 4.7 is now the minimum required Qt version.n
Used the CellRenderer in the StaggeredRenderer

Revert Rotate objects around their center instead of the bottom leftThis reverts commit 884184004dfa0f22a3130945cf7e86ddde01a0f9.nnWhile rotating objects around their center may be somewhat nicer whennediting the rotation property, it has the nasty side-effect thatnanything that changes the size of an object also affects its positionnwhen this object is rotated. This means that rotated rectangles arenshifting around when you resize them, and so do polygons while editingntheir nodes.nnIt may be possible to adjust the position to keep things on the samenplace, but for now I'm opting to keep rotating objects around theirnactual position.n

Force scroll bars in the map view to be always onIt's actually a bit annoying if they appear/disappear when zooming out anlot, especially since the map is centered which means it will shift anbit.nnThis also avoids some glitches when using OpenGL rendering.n
Fixed display of grid in tileset view on certain zoom levelsDue to inconsistent rounding the grid was getting lost at certain zoomnlevels.n

Fixed save in wrong format after opening a file using a pluginOn Mac, opening a file using a plugin was not setting the mapDocument'snwriterPluginFileName. This means that it would default to the TMXnformat.nnReplaced dynamic_cast with qobject_cast.nnCloses #389n
Merge branch '0.9'Conflicts:ntsrc/tiled/mapdocument.hn
Corrected merge errorShould have done a compile check, obviously...n

Fixed drawing of flipped tiles when using software renderingDue to a bug in QPaintEngineEx a negative scaleX or scaleY value resultsnin nothing being drawn rather than drawing a flipped image, like thenOpenGL paint engine does.nnWorked this around by manually drawing the fragment and applying thenscale to the transform rather than to the target rect.n

Optimized the shutdown processWhen closing Tiled it checks whether any maps need saving and it alsonsaves the currently selected layer and view position. In doing so it wasnmaking each of the open maps current twice, which causes all thenpanels to update and is generally much more work than actually needed.nnNow making maps current is avoided except for the case where the user isnprompted about whether he wants to save any changes, to make sure thencontext of the question is clear.nnTiled now shuts down instantly, even with many maps open. It can be anlittle disturbing at first.n

JSON plugin: Resolve relative paths of image layersRelative image reference of image layers were not being resolved by thenVariantToMapConverter, leading to images not being found when the mapnlocation didn't happen to match with Tiled's working directory.nnAlso made sure the path is cleaned from ./ or ../ parts.n

Updated link to Homebrew
JSON plugin: Updated qjsonparser to its latest master

Explicit object order with actions to change itThe raise/lower actions are currently only available in the objectnselection context menu.nnTODO: Make this new object drawing order behavior optional.nnSponsored-by: Ben Walesn

Introduced shortcuts for raise/lower actions* PageUp => raisen* PageDown => lowern* Home => raiseToTopn* End => lowerToBottomnnPreviously, PageUp and PageDown changed the selected layer. Those havenbeen moved to Ctrl+PageUp and Ctrl+PageDown.nnThose shortcuts in turn used to change the currently selected map. Thisnis also possible with Ctrl+Tab and Ctrl+Shift+Tab, but to make up for thenlost shortcuts, Alt+Left and Alt+Right were added.n

Introduced object group drawing order attributeThis attribute allows specifying per object group whether its objectsnshould be drawn top down (from top to bottom) or in index ordern(which enables manual ordering).nnThis change also fixes an issue where new objects could be invisiblenduring placement due to being drawn below other layers.n

JSON plugin: Store the draw order for object groupsAlso fixed the error reporting of the VariantToMapConverter and fixed annissue when reading .js files that are modified with a text editor thatnadds a trailing newline (by trimming any trailing whitespace).nnAnd simplified cleanup a little using QScopedPointer.n
Fixed compile with MSVC 2010MSVC 2010 math header does not come with M_PI.n
Fixed handling of per-tile external image referencesPreviously Tiled would load maps with per-tile external image references,nbut on saving the map all images would become embedded.n

Use a template to share the algorithm of TileLayer::regionThis way, TileLayer::tilesetReferences can trivially use the samenoptimized loop and it also becomes available for searching for othernconditions.n

Allow changing the drawing offset of a tilesetPreviously it was only possible to set this offset in the New Tilesetndialog, which is a little annoying for a setting that can really usensome visual feedback.nnAlso fixed updating of tileset name in the Properties dock on undo/redo.n
Fixed typo in copyright headers

Replaced Q_WS_MAC with Q_OS_MACQ_WS_MAC was removed in Qt 5, so some Mac-specific code was not gettingncompiled in. This change fixes icons appearing in menus and thenhandling of external commands on Mac OS X.n
Merge branch '0.9'
Added an option to disable building of the Python pluginHaving some issues with it on Mac OS X currently, which I'll look intonanother time.n
Fixed draw order for duplicated object layers
Allow creating empty tilesets and adding images laterSponsored-by: Jamie Rocksn

Updated the New Tileset dialog to reflect individual images optionThe dialog now features a combo box where the user can choose betweenncreating a tileset based on a tileset image, or a tileset that is simplyna collection of images. The images still need to be added later usingnthe '+' button in the tileset toolbar.nnThe drawing offset is no longer configurable using this dialog. It cannbe changed in the tileset properties instead.n
Bumped version to 0.9.1 and updated NEWS file
Exclude two hidden files from releasesThe license header file and the Travis CI configuration file are notnrelevant in source releases.n
Updated copyright year in Info.plist file

Fixed possible crash when resizing the mapWhen the 'mapChanged' signal arrived, it was only checking whether itncame from our current map document. In practice, it should always comenfrom our current map document, but what we need to check is whether thencurrent object is the map itself.nnAlso avoid another potential crash when objects change without having ancurrent context object.n
Avoid relying on dynamic_cast in libtiledIt's not needed anymore since the layer type is stored now. This allowsnlibtiled to be used without RTTI.n

A few minor Windows installer updates* Allow specifying a build directory separate from the repository rootn* Take the compiled translations from the build directoryn* Install LICENSE.APACHE.txt, which covers one of the pluginsn* Don't try to delete no longer existing LICENSE.LGPL.txtn* Commented out MinGW dlls since I'm using VS 2010 Express nown

Fixed tile flipping order for rotated tilesSince the scaling happens after the rotation, the scaleX and scaleYnfactors need to be swapped when flipping anti-diagonally.nnThis fixes a regression that appeared in commit f40431939986dcf71c.nnThanks to @mauvecow for finding this issue, and the initial patch.n

libtiled-java: Add required components for unit-tests* Run ant test to run all unit testsn* Unit-test source files are kept in test/, separate from the regular src/ source files.n* When building, unit test compilation output is also separated, since we want the unit test compilation to use debug=true.nnThis commit only includes rudimentary unit-tests, to verify that the unit-test harness works. Will add more actual unit-tests later.n

Added shortcuts for finishing and canceling object creationNow the Return / Enter keys will finish object creation, and Escape willncancel object creation.nnSuggested by @noc7c9 in relation to #495 and matches Inkscape behaviornfor creation of bezier curves / lines.n

Added support for changing the object line widthThis new setting in the preferences affects the line width used whenndrawing rectangle, ellipse and polygon/polyline objects.nnSetting the width to 0 will make the line 1 pixel wide regardless of thenzoom level.nnCloses #502n
Handle object draw order in minimap and save-as-imageObjects are no longer always drawn top to bottom.n

Fixed removal of polygon/polyline objects when resizing a mapThey were removed when their origin was falling outside of the map. Nownthey are removed when their bounding rect falls outside of the map.nnObject rotation is not handled yet, however.n

Adjust shadow offset to the line width and scaleWhen the object line width is set to 0 and lines of 1 physical pixel arendrawn, the shadow offset is now adjusted to the scale to avoid a gapnbetween the line and its shadow.nnFor line width between 0 and 1 pixels, the shadow offset is now alsonsmaller to avoid the gap.nnBased on feedback at issue #502.n

Brought back the actions that open the Properties windowEven though the Properties window is now a dockwidget that can be leftnopen, some people may prefer to keep it closed and only open it whennneeded. The old menu items were re-introduced to make it easier to opennthe Properties window in the right context.nnThis commit reverts parts of 480f1e245d392d52fd, 20eb8cc1de431c8f756 andnd178b4596e8504179b707617.n

Python plugin: Fixed several memory management issues* Fixed a problem with using a function call as argument to Py_XDECREF,n  introduced in my recent cleanup. Due to this being a macro the functionn  call was done twice, leading to a crash due to accessing null-pointer.nn* Provided a proper copy constructor for Tiled::Map because the generatedn  Python relied on it. The default copy constructor was not deep-copyingn  map layers, leading to a double-free when the maps were being deleted.n  This avoided the need to keep around references to loaded maps as welln  as the need to clone a map before saving it.nn* Don't manually delete references to plugin modules, classes and then  reference to the Tiled Plugin class. Python doesn't like that so nown  references are decremented as appropriate before calling Py_Finalize.nnSome problems seem to remain since valgrind wasn't entirely happy yet,nbut I hope it will not crash as often now.n
Set the ownership of the MapsDock file system model instancePoor orphan wasn't being deleted.n

TMX: Save width/height of individual tile imagesUseful in case somebody wants to process the file without loading thenimages but still wants to know the size of the tiles. Tiled currentlyndoes not use this information.nnCloses #538n

This can lead to problems later on (fornexample when saving the map at a different location).n
Made AutomappingManager and QuickStampManager no longer singletonThey don't need to be a singleton since they are only accessed fromnthe MainWindow anyway.n
Changed ToolManager to no longer be a singletonThis is done because I'd like to have two of them.n
Avoid relying on MapDocumentActionHandler in the toolsThis is in order to allow additional instances of the tools to operatenon a different MapDocument than the currently selected one.n

Allow drawing collision shapes on tilesThis change associates an ObjectGroup with each Tile on-demand and addsna new Collision Editor dock that allows editing this object group fornthe selected tile.nnCloses #552n
Made the ClipboardManager into a singletonThis makes sense since there is never a need for two clipboard managers,nand I want to access it from multiple places.n
Added cut/copy/paste/delete actions to collision editorUnfortunately the shortcuts don't work reliably due to conflicting withnthe same shortcuts working on the current map.n
Use a separate window for the Tile Collision EditorResolves shortcut conflicts for cut, copy, paste and delete.n

Worked around an issue with static child widgets of child windowsUsing static child widgets in child windows can cause a crash on exitnbecause there is a chance that they are still referenced after beingndeleted.nnIn the last commit the Tile collision editor was changed to a childnwindow and the MapView has a static viewport widget by default. This isnflag is no longer used to avoid the above issue.n
Manage the tool bar outside of the ToolManagerThis simplifies the code and provides more flexibility. It's also safernsince ownership over the tool bar is more clearly defined this way.n

Fixed resize helper rendering with Qt 5Due to the use of scaling it is necessary to make sure the pen isncosmetic. In Qt 4 the pen used to be cosmetic by default.n

Allow for more compact display of image collection tilesetsIt may still not be ideal, but instead of using the maximum tile size ofnthe entire collection for each tile it will now use the maximum widthnand height of only those tiles in the same column and row respectively.nnThis solution is only used when compiling against Qt 5.2 or higher,nsince older Qt versions only take into account visible cells so thendisplay breaks when larger tiles become visible by scrolling.n

Small optimization in image saving and minimap renderingThe Qt documentation mentions that rendering into annARGB32_Premultiplied image is significantly faster than rendering intonan ARGB32 image. It is indeed faster, but unfortunately only 10% by mynmeasurements.n

Removed a non-functional hack that was causing a crashThis code was meant to make sure positions and sizes of objects storednas part of tile collision information were in coordinates relative tonthe tile texture, ranging from 0-1. However, it is no longer functionalnsince the map's tile width and height are no longer used by the mapnreader and writer now that the objects store their positions in pixelsnrather than tiles.nnOverall I think it's anyway a better idea when the positions and sizesnare kept in pixels here and not stored in texture coordinates, sincenthis is consistent with the units used in regular object groups. Innaddition it is trivial to divide the values by the size of the tile tonobtain the texture coordinates.nnFixes #646n

Take draw margins into account for tile layer bounding rectWithout taking the draw margins into account, tiles sticking outside ofnthe layer's area fail to repaint correctly when changing layernvisibility or opacity.nnSome additional checking was required to make sure the bounding rectnupdates as necessary when a tile layer's draw margins change.n

Fixed merge errorShould have done a compile-test... fortunately there's TravisCI.n

Fixed another possible crash in the orthogonal rendererThis basically reverts the incomplete 5f6b5cadbd436183a5c530b868d andnfixes the problem a little more reliably.nnStarting point only needs to be bound to the first tile of the layer andnending point only needs to be bound to the last tile. As long as we donnothing when the starting point ends up beyond the ending point.n

Fixed a crash introduced by the repainting fixtileLayerDrawMarginsChanged should not be emitted for layers that aren'tnpart of the map for now, since the code handling this signal assumes itnis about a layer of the map.n

Fixed repainting issues when using tiles smaller than the grid sizeThe small tiles could cause the bounding rect of the brush preview tonbecome too small for painting its region as tile selection.n
Merge branch '0.10'
Added read-only properties for map size and map tile size
Fixed compileThe addition of Map::tileSize got lost in another change.n
Allow dynamically changing map tile width and height
Added hexagonal rendererOnly supports one variation of staggered hexagonal for now.nnThe length of the sides can't be configured yet and is currentlynhardcoded to 30.n

Allow configuring the length of the hex sideThis is the length of the straight sides of the hexagonal tile. It can'tnbe derived from the grid size because it varies depending on the exactnshape of the tile (which is rarely a mathematically sound hexagon).n
Added support for changing the stagger indexesThis adds the option of having the even rows shift to the right insteadnof shifting the odd rows to the right.n

Fixed the hexagonal renderer to be pointy toppedThis makes more sense with the current tile coordinates. Changing thenrenderer in this way seemed easier than to implement the kind ofnstaggering required for flat topped hexes. I'll get to that later.n

Derive the StaggeredRenderer from the HexagonalRendererThis fixes the grid rendering of the staggered renderer and adds supportnfor staggering the even rows instead of the odd rows.nnOf course it will do a little bit more work than strictly necessary, butnthis should be entirely irrelevant.nnCloses #765n
Fixed saving of stagger indexAlso, only save the hex side length for hexagonal maps, since it makesnno sense to appear for other map types.n

Store the stagger direction, even though only 'rows' is supported nowThis is mainly because I think 'columns' should be the default (it'snwhat Tiled Java did and as such may be supported by 3rd party librariesnthis way). Hexagonal maps created by this version of Tiled are now savednwith 'staggerdirection' set to 'rows' explicitly.n

QuickStampManager needs to be deleted before the TilesetManagerThis resolves an assertion in debug mode, which is meant to checknwhether all tileset references have been properly cleared. But when thenQuickStampManager is not deleted early enough, it won't have cleared itsntileset references yet.n

Fixed hit area for polygon nodes when editing polygonsThe nodes are ignoring view transformations, but this wasn't being takenninto account when determining which nodes were hit by a mouse click.nThis broke polygon node editing when zoomed out far as well as editingnnodes that were very close together.nnCloses #769 and #805n
Lua plugin: Write out Image layer positionThis is the position of the image in pixels, and it was missing from thenLua export format.nnCloses #761n

Merge branch '0.10'

Fixed Windows installer againThis reverts back to the old behavior, which is also broken but it'snless broken than without this change.nnThe problem is that _?= is setting the installation directory andnthereby breaking the uninstall if it is supposed to happen from andifferent directory than where Tiled is being installed. However,nomitting it breaks ExecWait, which causes the uninstall to run parallelnto the install process, deleting files that have just been installed andnleaving a broken installation.nnSo until there is a proper fix, I'm reverting back to the previousnbehavior.n

Added gid as attribute to MapObject class. Represents a tile whose texture is to be used for this object. Default value is -1. TMXMapReader now reads the gid attribute and assigns it to the MapObject. If gid attribute doesn't exist the value is set to -1.
MapObjects now store a reference to a Tile instead of the raw gid number. We get an exception if there is a gid with a non integer value.

Fixed several cases in which grid snapping was always appliedThe Isometric (Staggered) and Hexagonal (Staggered) map renderers do notnhave any way of converting between screen and tile coordinates withoutnrounding to the nearest tile. This caused object positions, polygon nodenpositions and object sizes to incorrectly snap to tile positions evennwhen no snapping is enabled.nnThe actual snapping is still a little broken for staggered maps, but atnleast now it no longer happens when you don't want it to.n

Unduplicated the grid snapping codeThe snapping behavior was meanwhile present in a huge amount of places,nand especially due to the handling of Control modifier and fine gridnsnapping this had gotten quite ugly.nnThis commit is not expected to change any behavior.n

Fix Japanese translation

Fixed Automapping of Tile ObjectsMap Objects are removed from automapping when DeleteTiles is used.nCode was already there for this but was comparing tile space with mapnspace.nTile Objects can be added to Object Layers through automapping.nnTile Objects having a bottom-left origin and zero width and height wasnproblematic for automapping.nI've added a convenience function MapObject::boundsUseTile() that willnuse the tile, if present, to build the boundary for a given Tile Object.n(Perhaps that function could be better named?)nNote: it's possible that the added functionaliy ofnMapObject::boundsUseTile() could just be rolled intonMapObject::bounds(), but I didn't want to (potentially) break legacyncode that may have relied on Tile Objects having an empty bounds. Forninstance, do we want Tile Objects to be written out to TMX with non-zeronwidth and height now?n

Merge branch 'master' into mapobjectresizev3
Renamed Save as Image action to Export as ImageThis is a better name for what it does.n

Handle two possible ways in which Export as Image could failThe most common way in which it failed on 32-bit systems was by runningnout of memory and crashing. Now Tiled should show a message telling thenuser to either reduce the zoom level or use a 64-bit version of Tiled.nUnfortunately I could not test the fix yet.nnThe other way it could fail, which is more likely on 64-bit systems, isnthat the resulting image would be too big for QImage to handle. In thisncase it would generally silently fail, but now it shows an informativenmessage when this happens.nnCloses #907n
Renamed getter to correct naming convention

Removed object name rendering from the MapRenderer implementationsThis was never a really nice place and it does not work well togethernwith the resizing and rotation. An alternative will be provided asnseparate non-scaling non-rotating graphics item.n
Renamed some anchors
Simplified keeping track of old object stateThis should be somewhat less error-prone.n
Made preview tile object slightly transparent

Made positioning of the resize handles more exactThis fixes some of the strangeness while resizing which was due tonsmall margins being added for taking into account the visualnrepresentation.nnResizing is still broken on isometric maps.n

Changed the way tile probability is appliedPreviously, choosing the wrong probabilities could cause the terrainnbrush to either fail to find any matches even though there were some ornto never use certain possible matches.nnNow, each tile has a default probability of 1 and the probability isnalways relative to the other tiles. So a tile with probability 10 isnchosen 10 times as often as a tile with default probability 1, while antile with probability of 0.1 is chosen 10 times less.nnA probability of 0 can still be used to make sure a certain match isnnever chosen.n
Switching map orientation should update the handles

Changed the look of the resize handlesNow they are arrows, which removed the need for using the differentnmouse cursors and adapts correctly to rotated items. The positioning andnlook of rotation handles has been tweaked to match.nnAlso, a change of selection is now avoided when one of the handles wasnclicked and the rotation origin indicator is hidden while resizing.n
Shift modifier puts resize origin in the middleThe origin indicator is now kept visible during resizing, reflecting thencurrent state.n

Fixed the grid snapping while resizingThe mAlignPosition was not set when starting the resize, but thensnapping code was relying on it. I decided it did not make that muchnsense to even use an alignment position while resizing, and I rathernjust snap the handle position to the grid. This seems morenunderstandable and possibly also more usable than the previous behaviornof snapping the size of the object to the grid.n

Small handle tweaks* Avoid setting hover state in the wrong situationnn* Make sure the corner handles are above the side handles when the itemsn  are small, with the bottom-right resize handle always on topn

Rewrote the resize handling for single items* Now works somewhat sanely for isometric objects, by performing then  resize in the virtual pixel coordinate space.nn* Now allows rectangles, ellipses and tile objects to be scaled up againn  even if their width or height was 0.nn* For multi-selection and polygons, the scaling factor is limited to 1%n  to avoid information loss when it reaches 0.nn* Shared grid snapping code between resizing of multiple or singlen  items.n

Don't try to link against python27_d in debug modeIn standard Python installations this file does not exist and I'm notnsure when it does. Anyway it should be fine just to link against thenregular library.n
Added Control modifier for preserving aspect ratio while resizingToggling grid snapping still possible, but with Alt key now.n

Allow dragging the origin indicator around before rotate/resizeThe position of the origin indicator is now used while rotating asnwell as when resizing with Shift modifier.nnCurrently the position of the origin indicator resets after thenoperation. This behavior could still be improved a little. For examplenInkscape seems to remember the relative origin position on a per-objectnbasis.n
Qbs: Don't link to zlib on WindowsShould not be necessary since Tiled relies on the zlib symbols exportednby Qt on Windows.n

Renamed some things in ObjectSelectionTool* Renamed Mode to Action, which is a little more appropriate and makesn  the name available for an actual Mode enum.nn* Renamed CornerHandle to RotateHandle, since it is only used forn  rotation.n

Always start moving the current selection when Alt is pressedRegardless of whether an item that was already part of the selection wasnclicked. I've noticed this behavior in Inkscape and it's quite usefulnwhen moving small items or items that are below other items.n

Don't deselect objects when Shift modifier is heldShift can be used to add or remove items from the selection. When nonitem is clicked while Shift is held, nothing should happen rather thanndeselecting everything.n

Allow the tile probability to be changed in the Properties viewSo far this property could only be set manually in the TMX file, now itncan be edited in the Properties view. It determines the relative chancena tile will be picked when it is one of multiple options for the terrainntool.n

Fixed some more updating issues when editing objects* When changing polygons using the split, join or delete nodes actions,n  the map view and node handles were not getting updated.nn* When rotating objects using the Z shortcut, neither the map view norn  the Properties view was getting updated.nnFixes #966n

Fixed live automapping updates when moving the mouse fastThe option Use Automapping, when drawing into layers was not workingncorrectly when the stamp brush was used and the mouse was moved fastnwhile painting.nnThis was due to wrong edit regions being emitted when fast mousenmovement caused the stamp brush to place the stamp multiple times on anline.nnThe automapping could be made a lot faster in this case by only emittingnthe edited region once for the whole line, but I'll leave that fornanother time.nnFixes #958n

Added tilecount property to TMX, JSON and Lua map formatsThis can be useful when implementing a map reader, since you will knownin advance how much space to allocate.nnIf the tileset image changed size since the map file was written, it maynof course contain a different amount of tiles. Care should be taken tonhandle that case correctly.nnCloses #806n

Made Backspace work for deleting collision objects and animation framesApple keyboards only have one backspace/delete key, which is received by Qtnapplications as backspace unless combined with the Fn key.nnSo for easy deletion of animation frames and collision objects, this action isnnow bound to both backspace and delete.n

Initial work on persistent tile stamps with variations* Added TileStamp class, which represents a certain stamp with a namen  and one or more variations with a probability each.nn* Added TileStampModel class, which provides the model that a view needsn  to display the list of available stamps and their variations.nn* Added TileStampsDock class, which is the extra view in the usern  interface for showing and managing the stamps.nn* Changed QuickStampManager to store its stamps in the TileStampModel,n  which allows quick stamps to be selected in the Tile Stamps view.nnIssue #969n
Added thumbnails to the list of tile stampsThe thumbnails are cached so that even very large stamps will not slowndown the rendering of the list.n

Made stamp brush and fill tool use the new TileStamp classTileStamp was changed to be explicitly shared to ease memory management,nsince there is no well defined owner for tile stamps. This also avoidsnneedless copying of the stamp data, as was previously done.nnThe actual behavior of picking random variations while painting ornfilling is not implemented yet.n

This especially speeds up the applying ofn  automapping rules.nn* Line drawing was improved a bit by always keeping the initially placedn  location stable, by reversing the points if necessary.nn* You can now click multiple times with the stamp brush in order ton  trigger the picking of a random variation.nn* Fixed a memory leak in the terrain brush.nnIssue #969n

Accepting this event is just telling Qt that indeed we want tonoverride the shortcut, and the actual handling of the local shortcutnshould happen on the KeyPress event.nnThis did not actually have any effect, because after the first callnthere is no longer a selected property. Use shared pointers for managing Tileset instance lifetimeThis was a rather tricky change to do, and I tried to do it both with anQSharedPointer as well as QExplicitlySharedDataPointer like I used fornthe TileStamp class. I even tried to use a std::shared_ptr for somentime, because I thought it could avoid depending onnQEnableSharedFromThis from Qt 5.4. I hope the current approach is thenright one in the end.nnThe idea is to simplify tileset lifetime management. Previously this wasndone through the TilesetManager and MapDocument classes, but that madenworking with plain Tiled::Map instances (like the tile stamp variations)ncumbersome. When you deleted a Tiled::Map, you could never really bensure wether its tilesets should be deleted or not.nnThe TilesetManager is still around, since it also implements watchingnthe tileset images for changes.nnNow that tilesets can be properly shared between maps, this shouldneventually simplify the work required to add missing tilesets to the mapnwhen you paint on it with some tiles from elsewhere.nnThe Python plugin is unfortunately disabled until it has been somehownadapted to use these shared pointers.n

Raised minimum Qt version to 5.1Raising the version mainly in order to use functionality in recent Qtnversions more comfortably. Also, maintaining compatibility would benmostly a waste of time since the provided binaries for all systems arenalready based on Qt 5 and no serious issues are known.nnThis also changes some remaining plugins to use QSaveFile instead ofnQFile, which avoids writing a truncated file in case of error or runningnout of space.n

Use a lowercase application name, except on Windows and OS XThis is just for consistency on Linux, where applications usually storentheir preferences in lowercase paths. Unfortunately, this will cause oldnsettings to be ignored on Linux.nnAlso, we now rely on the QPA to set the application display name in thentitle bar.n

Improved stamp rename handling* Ensure the renamed stamp is visible in the view (its position mightn  have changed due to the sorting).nn* When searching for an available file name, consider the currentlyn  used file name for the stamp an option as well (even though that filen  exists). This avoids needlessly adding a number to the file name whenn  a rename is done that does not affect the saved file name (like whenn  adding characters that get filtered out of the file name).n

Use tile probability in random modePreviously it was only used by the terrain brush.nnA convenient RandomPicker class was introduced to share the code ofnpicking random cells, tiles and stamp variations between the stampnbrush, terrain brush, bucket fill tool and tile stamp.nnCloses #190n

Add encoding and compression to Lua and JSON formatsThis brings the same advantages of using compression in the TMX formatn(smaller file size, faster saving/loading) to the Lua and JSON formats.nnOne caveat is that now by default, the Lua and JSON formats will benusing base64 + zlib compression rather than their native arrays. Tonalleviate this I might consider changing the default layer format tonCSV.nnCloses #343n

Ungroup position and size propertiesThe main reason for this change is that changing the position or sizenwould set the respective property for all selected objects. Now, onlynthe individual x, y, width or height properties get changed.nnIt also simplifies the Properties view and makes it take up less space.nnAny color properties are now also collapsed by default, since Ingenerally expect people to use the color picker anyway.nnCloses #892n

Preserve default file type when doing Save AsThere was a bug where the writer plugin file name was used as filter,nwhich doesn't work. Now, a best effort is made to turn the plugin filenname into a fitting name filter.nnThe solution will not always work when a single plugin exposes multiplenname filters. This is an issue that will be addressed soon by a largernpatch.nnCloses #1049n

Improved the plugin systemThe previous plugin system worked by direct inheritance from interfacesnlike MapWriterInterface and MapReaderInterface. This proved problematicnbecause it was not possible to implement conflicting interfaces or tonimplement a single interface multiple times. The latter affected thenfunctionality of the Python plugin.nnIt was solved by having the plugins add objects to the PluginManager whennthey are initialized. This way, they can add any number of objects thatnimplement the available interfaces. In this case, the plugin itself onlynextends the new Plugin class.nnIn addition, MapWriterInterface and MapReaderInterface were merged into ansingle MapFormat class. This simplifies implementation of formats that arenboth readable and writable. It also makes it easier to save a map in thensame format as it was loaded from.nnThe changes affect especially the Python plugin in a major way. It is nownpossible to implement Python scripts that only support exporting the map.nHowever, reloading of scripts is (temporarily) not supported.nnCloses #897n
Re-enable Python script reloadsBased on watching the script directory for changes. A manual action maynstill be preferable at some point, but plugins have currently no way ofnadding such actions.n

Removed MapFormat::nameFiltersThis plural version was really only added for the Python plugin in ordernto support multiple map formats added by multiple scripts. However, thenPython plugin now instantiates a PythonMapFormat for each script, makingnMapFormat::nameFilters obsolete.nnThe JSON plugin still needed some adjustment, since it also exposesnessentially two different map formats.n

Qbs: Disable the Python plugin in unsupported configurationsOn Windows, the Python plugin does not build in debug mode, nor does itnbuild with Visual Studio. And of course it won't work if Python is notninstalled at all. Now the plugin is automatically disabled in these cases.nnIn addition the plugin unfortunately does not compile when Python 2.7.10nis installed rather than 2.7.9. I'm not sure about a good way to checknfor this, so for now a comment about this will have to suffice.n

Fixed stamp brush issue when dealing with partially filled stampsRecent changes in how the stamp brush operates exposed an old issue innTileLayer::merge, which did the wrong thing when a layer was merged at annegative offset.n

Fixed issue with editing properties of tiles captured from the mapOnly the current object was being changed, which left the selectedntiles list point to any previous tiles selected in the tileset view,nwhich were the tiles to which edited properties would actually getnapplied.nnThis mechanism does now provide a way to edit properties of tiles fromnmultiple tilesets at the same time, which does not handle thenrestriction of not being able to edit external tilesets properly. Inthink it's rare enough to not need checking right now, but it's ansituation that I aim to resolve before the next feature release.n

C++11 modernization of loopsModernized some C++ loops with the help of clang-modernize and somenmanual editing.n

Layer data format deprecation and change of default* Default layer data format is now CSV. The aim is to have a moren  accessible format by default to avoid scaring away users with ann  unreadable map file.nn* XML and Base64 (gzip compressed) are now deprecated and no longern  shown in the New Map dialog. The reasoning behind this is that CSV isn  always better than XML in terms of readability and storage size andn  zlib is always preferred over gzip for non-files.n
Enable the tile grid by defaultI'm not sure why I once changed the default to off. I think it helps tonsee a grid when first creating a new map, so I'm turning it on byndefault again.n
First step in dealing with broken referencesKeep the raw data around a bit longer than MapReaderPrivate::readImage.n

C++11: Pass constructor parameters by value and use std::moveThis avoids invoking copy constructors for temporary values passed intonthese constructors.nnCopy constructors are generally more expensive than move constructors,nthough minimally so in case of QString since it does reference counting.nnThis is more about getting used to the style than anything else. Changesnwere done using clang-modernize.n

Load tile images after loading the mapIt is still done as part of MapReader::readMap, but making progressntowards handling broken links better.nnThis change breaks auto-adjustement of tile indexes in the event of antileset image becoming wider. This should be reimplement as an optionalnthing to do after loading, after asking the user.nnA downside of this change is that the map reader can now no longernreport invalid tile references, because it does not know a reference isninvalid until it is too late. Fixed an issue with identifying similar image collection tilesetsImage collection tilesets were trivially seen as similarnin most cases, as long as they were using tiles of the same size. Now,nthey need to have the same number of the images and all of the imagesnneed to refer to the same image file.nnCloses #1113n
Merge branch '0.14'

Fixed backwards compatibility issue with tile object sizeNow that tile images may be loaded later on, the default size of tilenobjects should be set later as well.nnIt's not entirely correct this way since like this you can't storenexplicitly 0-sized objects, but that's a problem to deal with later.n

Merge branch 'wip/terraingenerator'Merging this because the tool is generally useful, and having it onnmaster will make it easier to keep it up to date.nnAlso I was reminded about this tool by the release of a nice graphicalntool doing basically the same thing by Darek Greenly (@Zielak):nnhttp://darekgreenly.com/auto-terrain-generator-for-tilednhttps://github.com/Zielak/AutoTerrainGenn

Use a map instead of a list to store tiles in a tilesetThis solves two problems:nn* Invalid large tile IDs don't cause a huge amount of memory to getn  allocated for expanding the list of tiles.nn* Tile IDs can stay stable when tiles are removed from Collection ofn  Images tilesets. This avoids invalidating other maps using the editedn  tileset. (issue #1118)nnFor now, it also introduces some problems:nn* The tileset view does not know how to deal with non-consecutiven  tilesets and currently displays empty entries where gaps exist.nn* An invalid tile reference can cause an empty tile to get created,n  because at the time of resolving it we can't know that it is invalid.n
Fix isometric rendering bugRemoves a previous issue where the render logic rounded odd tile heights.nnCloses #85n

Don't keeps track of tile sizes and offsets in TileLayerThis was an optimization done to keep down rendering overhead, howevernwhen tile images and offsets can change dynamically keeping thisninformation up-to-date becomes time-consuming since it means we'd oftennhave to scan all tile layers for which tiles they are using.nnAs an alternative, a TileLayer now keeps track of which tilesets it isnusing. This information only changes when the tile layer itself isnchanged, making it much easier to keep up-to-date.n

Allow changing tileset image parametersImplemented via a dialog, reusing the New Tileset dialog. The dialog cannbe opened via a small Edit... button in the tileset properties view.nAdding this button was sadly the most tricky part of this change...nnChanging the tileset parameters can lead to less tiles in the tileset.nSince the tile instances are directly referenced, white placeholders arenkept around when this happens. These should be made more distinguishablenare should probably be hidden in the tileset view.nnCloses #331 (Unable to change tileset image source in UI)nCloses #773 (Allow editing tileset parameters)nCloses #507 (Changing transparent color of a tileset image)n

Added Types for Custom properties

Allow changing the image source of individual tilesThis only applies to tiles in an image collection tileset. Brokennreferences to individual tile images are now no longer raised as an XMLnparsing error.nnAlso, an image-missing icon was introduced which shows in the tilesetnview for tiles which images could not be loaded, and in the propertiesnview for when the referenced file isn't found.nnIssue #913n

Don't raise an error for broken image reference of image layerThey can be ignored, allowing the user to fix them up after loading thenmap. In general though, the user should be notified when some imagesncouldn't be loaded.nnIssue #913n

Don't raise an error when a tileset image isn't foundFor now it will just load the map. The used tiles won't render in thenmap view but will show with a missing image icon in the tileset view.nnUsing the previously added Edit Tileset functionality, the user cannrestore any broken image reference.nnIssue #913n

Added ability to change the reference to an external tilesetBy changing the Filename property in the Properties view. Thisneffectively replaces the tileset.nnIf the map uses tiles that are not present in the new tileset,nplaceholders will be created to avoid the loss of data.nnThis change is necessary in preparation of allowing the loading of mapnfiles for which some external tileset references could not be found.nnIssue #913n
