Allow opening map files with broken references to external tilesetsNow I think a map with broken references to external files will alwaysnload and the user can correct any broken links. What is still missing isnclearer feedback to the user when the map is opened.nnCloses #913n

Inform users about broken links and allow repairing themNow, when a map is opened that referred to some files that could not benfound, an embedded widget is shown that displays those files and allowsnthe user to choose whether to ignore the problems or to point to the newnlocations of the files.n
Show the broken links widget above the map viewIt's often useful to see the map while fixing broken links.n

Update the list of broken links based on relevant signalsThis avoids doing more work than necessary in most cases and makes surenthe list is correctly updates when changes are made through other partsnof the interface, like the Properties view.n

Improve the automatic adjustment when changing tileset image width* Now it's optional. When opening a map and a change of tile columns isn  detected, the user is asked whether he wants the map to be adjusted.nn* Now it has undo, which is handy when you applied the correctionn  accidentally to a map that didn't need it.nn* Now it also works for external tilesets.n

Offer to adjust tiles in open maps when tileset width changesWhen the tileset image is automatically reloaded, and it turns out thatnthe number of tile columns in the image changed, it makes sense to asknthe user whether he wants tiles references in open maps to be adjusted.nnUnfortunately, at the time the pop-up shows up, the map view will stillnbe showing the old tiles. This makes it a little hard to decide whethernadjusting is needed. User will be tempted to click No but end up withna messed up map...nnCloses #742n

Make Travis CI build on Ubuntu TrustyOtherwise it defaults to 12.04 LTS, which does not have Qt 5.n

Avoid showing checkboxes in the layer combo box on WindowsThe Windows style will render checkboxes for the layer items in thencombo box, even if they can't actually be used in that context.nnA proxy model was used to remove the checkable flag and checked statesnfrom the items.n

Fixed possible crash when removing layersWhen the layer got removed, the LayerModel emitted appropriate signals,nwhich caused the current index in the new layer combo box to change.nThen Tiled tries to set the current layer based on that, but since thenMapScene had not been notified yet about the layer removal, its attemptnto update the current layer highlight failed with a crash.nnIn fact we don't want the layer combo box to change the current layer atnall, unless the user actually activated an item there. So use itsnactivated signal instead of the currentIndexChanged signal.n

Fixed updating of current layer index in case of removing layersWhen removing a layer, the order of events caused the current layernindex to end up different from the layer item selected in the Layersnwidget.nnI wonder a little since when this bug exists...n
Fixed automatic removal of broken links widget when fixing linksBroke due to an optimization done earlier that avoided a completenrefresh of the list.n

Small cleanups and removed useless findTileset methodThis findTileset overload was part of an early but dangerous loadingntime optimization. We can't share instances of embedded tilesets amongnmaps. For optimizing loading time it would still make sense to sharentileset images for the same file.n
.gitignore updatesMain change is to add wip/, which is where I've started to put temporarynwork in progress checkouts (using 'git worktree').n

Some tweaks to avoid needless deep copiesQt containers are implicitly shared, until you call a non-const membernon them. This happens for example when you iterate the container andndon't make sure to call the const versions of begin/end, or access annitem with [] instead of at().n
Split a Document superclass off from MapDocumentTo be used for an upcoming TilesetDocument class, meant to wrap externalntilesets.n

Moved the TilesetManager and related files to libtiledThis is necessary to fix issues with sharing external tileset instancesnamong maps. Without this, plugins have no way of referring to alreadynloaded tilesets.n

Initial addition of TilesetDocumentProviding an undo stack for tilesets, as well as keeping track of whichnmap documents refer to a certain tileset.nnThe class isn't being used anywhere yet, but it's meant to enablenediting of external tilesets.n
Moved changing properties up into Tiled::DocumentThis is because properties can be changed on either maps or tilesets,nwith tilesets to be wrapped by TilesetDocument.n

Fixed crash in tmxrasterizer and tmxviewerFor maps using external tilesets, the plugin manager is invoked in ordernto look for any plugins supporting the file format. But currently thentmxrasterizer and tmxviewer do not load plugins and do not instantiate anPluginManager, leading to a null pointer reference.nnThis change avoids the crash in this case, but it would be interestingnto support plugins also in these applications eventually.n
Fixed tmxrasterizer not reporting write errorsNow it writes out a somewhat useful error message and indicates failurenin its exit code.nnFixes #1145n
Merge pull request #1126 from RySchmitt/Fix-Isometric-1Fix isometric rendering bug

Unified layer offset handlingThe image layer stored its pixel offset in its x/y properties while thentile layer and object layers stored it as offsetx/offsety. Now allnlayers use offsetx and offsety and the Move Images tool is now callednthe Offset Layer tool and works on all layers.nnThis changed the storage format for the TMX and Lua formats regardingnimage layers, which now use offsetx/offsety instead of x/ynproperties.nnCloses #1130n
Qbs: Tag the plugin.json files as qt_plugin_metadataThis makes sure the plugin file is updated as needed when thenplugin.json file is changed.n

Allow plugins to be enabled/disabledProject-specific plugins are now disabled by default. All plugins can benexplicitly enabled or disabled in the preferences. This should resolve anmajor source of confusion among new users. It is also useful to avoidnextension conflicts, for example there were two plugins that exported ton.lua files.nnWhich plugins are enabled currently also affects the --export-map andn--export-formats command line options. Since this can actually be usefulnI'll keep it that way for now.nnThis change also adds feedback in case plugins fail to load. In thisncase the error message can be found in the tool tip of the entry in thenpreferences dialog.nnCloses #1088n
Fixed badge style consistency again

Moved the AutoMapping while drawing toggle into the menuThis makes it easier to enable/disable it, which some people are doingnfrequently, for example while editing and testing the actual automapnrules.nnCloses #1152n

Fixed tile stamp thumbnails for stamps using oversized tilesWhen a tile stamp used tiles that extended beyond their cell, this partnwould be cut off in the thumbnail. This was a regression since Tiledn0.14. Now the thumbnail takes into account such tiles again, andnactually even more accurately than before.nnCloses #1146n

Allow panning over the edges of the mapUnfortunately, I could not get zooming in/out working properly. This isnvery tricky to get right with QGraphicsView due to built-in behavior.nnAnother thing that is needed now is to indicate the edges of the map.nnCloses #245n

Fixed mouse coordinate conversion for hexagonal rendererThere was an issue when dealing with odd 'tile side length' values,nwhere the tile layer rendering was inconsistent with the coordinatenconversion from mouse to tile coordinates.n

Merge branch '0.15'

Changed installer from NSIS to MSI (baed on WiX)Every once in a while somebody would report a problem with the installer,neither crashing or becoming unresponsive. Hopefully using a more standardninstaller format for Windows will avoid such issues.nnMSI should also handle upgrades better. Rather than running thenuninstaller for the already installed version, it should be smart bynoverwriting new files and then removing files that should no longer benthere.n

AppVeyor: Adjusted to new MSI installer* Removed installation of NSISn* Fixed build artifact names for the installern* Use a version based on the build numbernnThe build number makes sure the daily builds have incremental versionnnumbers, which is necessary for upgrading to work nicely with the MSIninstaller.n
AppVeyor: Overwrite WixModule.qbs with a patched up versionTo support WiX 3.10, which has only three parts in its version number.n
Updated NEWS and bumped version to 0.15.1
Merge branch '0.15'

Integrated WinSparkleWinSparkle is an auto-update solution for Windows applications using ansimilar mechanism to Sparkle on OS X.nnIn this change, it is automatically enabled for Tiled daily builds,nwhich can now check for the availability of new daily builds as well asndownload and install them when desired.nnIssue #1089n
Don't check for updates on every startupThe updater is supposed to work in the background by default.n
AppVeyor: Upload appcast-win-snapshots.xmlWhile only copying the MSI installer to files.mapeditor.org.n

WinSparkle: Use separate appcasts for 32 and 64-bit daily buildsThis stops the 64-bit build from overwriting the file uploaded by then32-bit build, and makes sure Tiled only downloads updates of the samenarchitecture.n

Windows installer improvements* Removed the (32-bit) and (64-bit) from the name. Only one versionn  of Tiled can be installed at the same time and I'll make sure it saysn  the number of bits in the About dialog instead.nn* Installing any version of Tiled automatically uninstalls any installedn  version of Tiled. And the uninstall is done first to avoid issues withn  downgrading.nn* Set an icon, URL and install location for the Add or remove programsn  window. Disable 'Repair' and 'Modify' actions.nn* Refresh the Guid for all Components to fix an issue I was having withn  uninstalling.nn* If installation directory is passed on the command line, don't overriden  it with a possible stored installation directory in the registry.nnMost improvements thanks to the blog post at:nhttps://helgeklein.com/blog/2014/09/real-world-example-wix-msi-application-installer/n

Update OSX install instructions for QTSince Tiled requires QT to be above version 5, you need to install qt5nwith homebrew, not qt (which is version 4). Also since qt5 is keg-only,nit must be linked with the --force flag to be added to the path.n

AppVeyor: Limit the daily builds to the 'snapshot' branchThis should avoid publishing new installers that trigger an automaticnupdate for changes that are irrelevant for Tiled itself.nnThis branch will also be used by the Tiled daily builds for OS X.n

Added Object Types editorThis new editor allows not only defining your object types and the colornof objects of that type, but also specifying the default properties forneach type and their default value. This makes setting values for thesenproperties more efficient and makes it clear what properties an objectnof a certain type can take.nnPreviously specified property types and their colors are preserved andnsaved to the new location when changing them.nnThis change also contains some related fixes:nn* Fixed updating of properties view when the object type is changed.n* Fixed updating of properties view when changing the predefinedn  properties for the currently selected object.n* Disallowed removing or renaming of predefined properties when in then  object properties view.nnCloses #367n
Prevent possible copying of MapReader and MapWriterThese classes would double-free if they were copied, so make it clearnthat this is not allowed.n

Object Types Editor: Fixed small size of tool buttonsChanged the tool buttons to actions sitting on a tool bar. This fixesnhit area of the QToolButtons to be not overly small. Unfortunately, itnis not possible to insert a tool bar using the Qt Designer, so it had tonbe coded manually.n

Made property types work in the Object Type editor* Code cleanups and simplifications (use QVariant in more places)n* Use 'string' and 'float' instead of 'QString' and 'double' type namesn* Improved the Add Property dialog layoutn* Remember last used type when adding new propertiesnnCloses #365n
Fixed saving of objecttypes.xml when its directory doesn't existJust try to create the directory when it's not there yet. If it stillndoesn't work, show a somewhat more useful error message.n

Object Types Editor: Some OS X tweaks* Reduced layout spacing between tool bars and views.nn* Marked menu bar as non-native. Doesn't look very nice, but it's bettern  for now than replacing the main menu bar at the top when this editorn  is focused.n
Fixed compile with MSVC 2013Seems like it needs a few more members defined to keep the templatesnhappy, compared to GCC and clang.n

Add a properties dock for the Tiled Collision EditorYou can now edit properties on the object group and objects in thenCollision Editor.nnA couple of issues:n- It would be nice to be able to select objects even if the Tileset isnexternal but the MapView is disabled in this case.n- If I try to keep the MapView enabled then the toolbar actions have tonbe disabled, except for the ObjectSelection tool. I couldn't get this tonwork -- but I'm new to Qt.n- The ObjectSelection tool is no longer just about selection but allowsnyou to position, scale, and rotate the object that is currently selectednwhich further complicates this.n- It would also be nice to be able to go from selecting an Object to thenObject Group easily. Right now this is only achieved by selecting a newntile (in which case the ObjectGroup for that tile is selected in thenPropertyBrowser until you select an object.n

Collision Editor: Select the object layer when no object is selectedAlso simplified the code a little, made it remember the size of thenproperties dock widget and disabled the main window context menu on thendock widget.n

JSON format: Save and restore the custom property typesI'm not entirely happy with the way the properties and their types arenstored for the tiles, but I won't change it now because it would breaknbackwards compatibility.nnRelated to #1131n
Made the Add Property dialog a little wider

Added a reset button for color propertiesThis allows resetting these colors to invalid once set.nnCloses #446nCloses #1062n

QtPropertyBrowser: Improvements to color properties* Avoid emitting a valueChanged signal with 'black' when setting then  color to 'invalid'.nn* Hide the icon and show Not set when the color is 'invalid', insteadn  of pretending that it is set to black.n
Fixed compile when using qmakeIt's not using the precompiled header on Linux and OS X.n
Prevent segfault when adding new property to many tiles.

Implemented terrain erasing functionality* You can now capture no terrain from the map and use this to erasen  terrain.nn* You can also do this via a new Erase Terrain button in the Terrainsn  view.nn* When capturing a terrain from the map, the change of terrain is nown  reflected in the selection of Terrains view.nnAll in all this improves handling of terrain tiles that transition intonnothingness. They are best used with multiple layers, one for eachnterrain type.nnCloses #1111n

Fixed restoring of painter transform in orthogonal rendererThere was an early out in OrthogonalRenderer::drawTileLayer that couldncause the painter transform to be not correctly restored. Now thentransform is only modified after this early out.nnThis problem showed up as a missing highlight color when erasing ansingle tile of terrain.n

Fixed assertion failure on exitBy deleting the MapEditor before the TilesetManager, we make sure thatnthe TileStampManager is deleted before the TilesetManager as well, whichnwas otherwise still holding references to loaded tilesets.n

Fixed changing tile properties in tileset editorAlso updated several places where the enabled state of actions wasnstill based on whether a tileset was external or not.nnAnd did a workaround for saving of tilesets. They were being savednas an external tileset reference due to having a filename set.n
Removed the context help button from the Patreon dialogThis affects Windows only (and possibly KDE). The button is pointlessnsince there is no context help anywhere in the dialog.n

Updated WinSparkle

Don't reuse a previous Tiled instance when no arguments are passedI think it would be entirely reasonable to always reuse an existingninstance, when Tiled would support opening multiple windows. But sincenTiled doesn't, launching the application again is the only way of puttingntwo maps next to each other. Relying on the --new-instance parameter fornthis is too obscure, especially for Windows users.nnWe can still support the file manager use-case, as well as the use-case ofnopening extra maps from the command line, by reusing a previous instancenin case any files are passed on the command line.n

Removed executable from the FileDescription for tiled.exeTurns out this description is what Windows displays on the task bar whennright-clicking the icon of a Tiled window, for the item that allowsnlaunching another instance. This should just say Tiled and not Tilednexecutable.n

Windows installer: Removed the [ProductName] start menu folderApparently this value substitution does not work for that field for somenreason. The Tiled executable can just sit at the top level anyway, sincenit's so lonely otherwise.nnAlso switched the registry key from HKCU to HKMU, which is supposed tonadapt to single-user or multi-user installations. However I don't thinknthe installer currently provides the user any choice in that.n

Optimized selection of many objectsWhen selecting many objects at the same time, Tiled was getting very slownto respond to selection changes. This was caused for a large part by thenway the Objects view was synchronizing its selected items.nnNow, instead of calling QItemSelectionModel::select for each selectednobject, it is called only once with the complete selection. In mynmeasurements with 500 selected objects, this took the execution time ofnthis function down from about 1300ms to about 300ms.nnThis change also fixes an even more serious problem when switching mapsnwith many objects selected. This lead to long unresponsive periods duenforgetting to set mSynching to true.n
Update tiled_ru.ts

Sparkle: Display UI on manual update checkWhen the user manually checks for updates, there should be a progressnbar and a message even if there is no update found.nnTo get the update check to actually work in the Preferences dialog, thendialog could not be application modal. I don't think the Preferencesndialog actually needed to be modal, anyway.nnUnfortunately, Qt on OS X has a bug that allows child windows tondisappear behind their parent window. So now the Preferences dialog canngo behind the main Tiled window...n

Fixed assertion on exit when keeping preferences openThe PreferencesDialog destructor was re-instantiating the Preferencesnsingleton, which in turn re-instantiated the TilesetManager andnPluginManager singletons. Then, when the plugins got destroyed, theynwere trying to remove their objects from the newly instantiatednPluginManager, but then it failed an assertion because it didn't knownabout these objects.nnLesson learned: singletons are tricky beasts, and accessing them fromndestructors is especially dangerous.n

Fixed potential crash and too much switching to Terrain BrushWhen switching maps and the new map did not have a tile layer selected,nthe Terrain Brush ran into an assertion failure because it was notnimmediately getting deactivated.nnAlso, the automatic switching to the Terrain Brush was too aggressive,nleading to this tool being selected by default when any terrain wasnpresent.n

Added orthogonal example map using many featuresThe goal is to have a set of examples that allow quickly verifying thenlevel of TMX support in some library or framework, or for people to testntheir own code with.nnThis example uses many features not previously used by existingnorthogonal examples:nn* CSV tile layer datan* Object layer with ellipse, polygon, polyline and tile objectsn* Tile flipping (both on tile layers and for tile objects)n* Custom property typesn

Qbs: Added generation of 7-zip archive for WindowsIt is not built by default. Instead it can be triggered by -p archive orn--all-products (this one will also build the installer).nnAlso configured AppVeyor to upload the archive and synchronized thenlocation of the Windows snapshots with the OS X snapshots.nnRelated to issue #366, but right now this is not a special versionnregarding where settings are stored and it does still include the updatencheck, which will download the MSI installer. Especially that last thingnshould be changed before this can be distributed (for example through thenitch.io app).n
AppVeyor: Always enable SparkleSparkle was only getting enabled for snapshot builds and not for releases.nThis means Tiled 0.16.0 for Windows is not actually checking fornupdates...n
Bumped version to 0.16.1 and updated NEWS file
Merge branch '0.16'
Added custom property type 'color'Valid custom color properties will export in the format #AARRGGBB.nWhen the color is not set, an empty string is used.nnCloses #1275n
Added option for removing invisible objects in resize dialog. (#1186)Closes #1032
Coding style and UI layout tweaks* Simplified settings usagen* Adjusted variable and function names to avoid Objsn* Improved layout of Resize Map dialogn
Added support for editing multi-line string propertiesAll custom properties are now multi-line enabled. A text editor can benopened with a '...' button placed alongside the line edit.nnCloses #205n

.mailmap: Add Stefans corporate email addressWhile Google encourages to continue using an existing identity when havingncontributed already, I chose to switch my email addresses. This makes itneasy later on to identify the copyright holder of the respective patch.nnSigned-off-by: Stefan Beller <sbeller@google.com>n

Automapping: Better map boundary handlingWhen comparing the automapping rules against the set layer, any out ofnbounds condition would abort the checking.nnWe'd want to be careful however: Assume there are a empty tiles outsidenthe map boundary and carry on with the comparison.nnFixes 1224.nSigned-off-by: Stefan Beller <sbeller@google.com>n

Fixed updating object drag cursor when exiting resize handlesWe can't use item-specific mouse cursors in combination with manuallynupdating the viewport mouse cursor based on graphics scene mouse events,nbecause of the way QGraphicsView saves and restores the viewport cursor.nnIn addition, we could no longer rely on the default drag functionalitynfor the origin indicator because it would grab the mouse in case it wasnbelow another handle. So now a MovingOrigin action was added thatnimplements that part.nnCloses #1277n

Various object selection tool improvements* Reduced the start drag distance to make moving, resizing, rotating andn  selecting more responsive.nn* Reset the start position to avoid the jump when starting to move orn  rotate.nn* For resizing, take into account the mouse position on the handle ton  avoid an initial jump and to have the handle below the mouse againn  when finishing the resize.nn* Avoid resetting the origin indicator position when switching betweenn  resize and rotate modes, or when performing a move or rotate action.n  This allows the origin to be reused for multiple rotation adjustmentsn  as well as to be used while resizing. The origin is still reset in toon  many situations, but it's an improvement.n
Multi-line property editor tweaks* Added resize gripn* Removed context help button (on Windows / KDE)n

Fixed shortcuts for some tools when language is set to DutchThe 'W' and 'S' shortcuts were ambiguous since they both applied to twontools. Now the shortcuts are no longer customized and instead match thenones used in English. This avoids conflicts and makes the keyboard shortcutnreference more useful.nnCloses #1280n
AppVeyor: Print out Qbs version

OS X: Improved the way Sparkle is used in qmake* Works with Sparkle expected at /Library/Frameworks, rather thann  needing it to be installed in the Xcode.app directory.nn* Prints error when Sparkle isn't found at /Library/Frameworks.nn* Uses QMAKE_BUNDLE_DATA to ship the Sparkle.framework rather than an  QMAKE_POST_LINK hack.nnThis change fixes the OS X snapshot builds again, which otherwise brokenwith every Xcode update.n
Added scripts for building fedora dailies (#1282)The script needs to be invoked with a copr api token as the parameters.
Bumped epoch of tiled.spec (#1283)I apparently pushed a build with a version number of 9999 while testingrntito. So I need to bump epoch in order to allow a clean upgrade path

Qbs: Enabled building a binary package for LinuxThis is the first attempt at getting binary packages for Linux working.nIt currently only works for Qt versions shipped by qt.io, not system Qtninstalls (which put files in different places).nnTo build a binary Linux package, you currently have to runn'TILED_LINUX_ARCHIVE=true qbs --all-products release'.nnIt also fixes some things for the Windows 7-zip snapshots, adding thennew example map and shipping more Qt translation files.n
Renamed NEWS file to NEWS.mdImproved formatting for the changelog.n

Qbs: Added some missing dependencies for Linux binary packagesThe XCB platform plugin needs Qt5XcbQpa and Qt5DBus. Also, the SVG imagenformat plugin needs Qt5Svg.nnThis also changes the Windows archive to include all image formatnplugins.n
Fixed loading of plugins for the Linux binary archive versionPluginManager lives in libtiled, and the TILED_LINUX_ARCHIVE definenwas only set for the Tiled project.n

Added a file path property typeFile properties are stored as relative paths in the TMX, JSON and Luanformats, and provide a button to browse for a file.nnThis change also fixes an initialization problem causing newly addednstring properties to miss the '...' button for multi-line editing.nnCloses #1278n
JSON plugin: Fixed loading of custom properties on terrains
Lua plugin: Added missing export of object layer drawing orderFixes #1289n
Merge branch '0.16'

Added %layername and %objectid to available command variablesAs suggested by thomas_rush on the forums.nnLong-term, the launching of external commands should be made possiblenthrough scripts which have full access to the current editor state.n
Fixed compile against Qt 5.6 when using MinGWUse the zlib shipping with MinGW instead of the one that was shippingnwith Qt (which is not available in Qt 5.6.0).n
Fixed build issues with Qt 5.6 on OS XDue to the way the Python plugin was adding its compiler and linker flags,nit was resetting other required flags.n
OS X: Moved including of icons from make-dist-mac.rb to tiled.proJust trying to reduce extra steps needed after regular build.n
OS X: Snapshots should now build against Qt 5.6
Updated minimum required Qt version to 5.2Apart from cleaning up the code a little, this opens some new Qt APIsnfor use by Tiled, like QCommandLineParser and QKeySequenceEdit.n
Fixed compile against Qt 5.6 when using Visual StudioThe Visual Studio version of Qt does ship with the QtZlib headers.n

Fixed cursor jumping while editing custom string propertiesSetting the text on a QLineEdit causes the cursor to jump to the end,neven when the text did not change.nnCloses #1292n

Enabled nested views and grouped draggingAllowNestedDocks allows more freedom in placing the various views, andnGroupedDragging makes stacks of views draggable as a whole (you need tongrab the tab if you want to drag a single view now).nnI may either revert or make these changes optional, depending on usernfeedback.nnCloses #1291n

Qbs: Fixed build issue related to Info.plist fileFor now, just moved the Info.plist file to the 'osx' section. I have notnchecked yet whether it actually does what is expected there.nnThis is happening with more recent versions of Qbs:nnerror: Cannot install '.../tiled/src/tiled/Info.plist', because it doesn't start with the value of qbs.installSourceBase '...'.n(cherry picked from commit 368a88edb3487e59fd732370189b6c08727b63f8)n
Fixed --export-map [format] optionWas broken since the format was interpreted as a file name and convertednto an absolute path.nnCloses #1307n

Automapping: Fixed a painting related bug affecting the top edgeWhen operations done by the AutoMapper affected the draw margins of antile layer (like, by putting tiles on a layer for the first time), thenTileLayerItem was not informed as necessary for it to take on thencorrect bounding rectangle. This could lead to the top row of tiles tonnot be painted at all.nnThis change also includes some small code cleanups, and an optimizationnthat avoids copying all affected layers twice.nnCloses #1308n

Session Management: Hook up the commitDataRequest signalIt seems that I simply forgot this many years ago. Since Qt 5.6, therenis a default session management, but it may be better to handle itnmanually. Now, this needs to be explicitly disabled in order to avoid itnfrom interfering.n

Fixed tile index adjustment when tileset images changes widthFor any tile layers that were not completely filled, the adjustment wasnbroken and ended up entirely messing up the map.nnThis happened due to unintentionally using a variable from a more localnscope, which was shadowing the intended variable.nnCloses #1242n

Tiled Fusion: Further improvements to the dark theme* Subtle gradient added to the tool barn* Dark inset background added to the tab barn* Outline colors of menu bar and tool bar tweakedn* Tabs are no longer rounded and no longer shift when selectedn* Unselected tabs have more contrast to the selected tabn* Minimap defaults to dark palette color for background, instead of grayn* Tweaked position of tab close button to be always right-alignedn

Tiled Fusion: Reduced height of tabs with close buttonsThe close buttons were making the tabs quite a bit higher, whichndidn't look nice. This patch adjusts the way the size ofnCT_TabBarTab is calculated, to avoid the close buttons affectingnthe height too much.n

Tiled Fusion: Darker text color for unselected tabsWhen the base color is dark, the text is light. Since the unselected tabs arenrendered darker, this means the text has a stronger contrast there. This isnavoided by darkening the text on these tabs.nnFor the light version this is not needed, because dark text already has a bitnless contrast on the darker tabs.n

Correctly preserve tile meta-data when tileset width is changedWhen the tileset image width changes, affecting the number of tilencolumns in the tileset, the user is asked whether the tile references innthe map should be adjusted accordingly. However, the meta-data storednfor each tile, like collision information, properties and animations,nwas not being adjusted, leading to corrupted data.nnThis change extends the behavior when tile indexes get adjusted, to makensure also tile meta-data and tile references from tile animations getnadjusted as appropriate.nnCloses #1315n

Take text colors for custom properties from the paletteBecause Qt::gray and Qt::black were hardcoded as colors for customnproperty names and values, they could be very hard to read with darkncolor palettes.nnNow the normal text color and disabled text color from the palette arenused instead.n

Replace %mappath with absolute path to map file's directory (#1347)

Avoid using direct Tile pointers in tile layers and objectsUsing direct Tile pointers has several downsides. For example, it isnhard to make sure they stay valid when tiles are removed from a tileset.nAnd when doing so, it could lead to data loss, for example when tilesntemporarily disappear when a tileset definition is changed or its imagenis resized. Currently, tile instances are being kept alive because therenmight still be pointers to them out there.nnInstead, the Cell now uses a combination of Tileset pointer and tile ID.nA lot of code has now been adjusted so that it does not assume that annon-empty Cell means that a valid Tile instance can be found.nnIn addition, when an invalid tile is encountered while rendering thenmap, a noticeable red marker is rendered instead.nnThere are still some Tile pointers used in the code. Depending on theirnlifetime, I may need to introduce a 'TileRef' struct that combines anTileset pointer with a tile ID, to replace those Tile pointers.n
JSON plugin: Added Node.js support to the JavaScript exportAllows doing:nnvar map = require(./some-map.js);nnCloses #1350n

Avoid saving unfinished objectsWhen pressing Save (Ctrl+S) while adding a new object to the map, thennew object would already be saved as part of the map, even though itsncreation can still be canceled (right-click or Escape) or it may stillnbe an incomplete polygon or polyline.nnPrevent this by adding the new object to a dummy object group instead.nnCloses #1348n

Fixed tile id adjustment for newly added tilesetsWhen changing the width of a newly added tileset image, the tile indexnadjustment was not kicking in because the expected column count remainednunspecified.n
Moved cut/copy/delete implementations to MapDocumentActionHandlerIt's easier to re-use them there and this place is anyway morenappropriate than having it in the overloaded MainWindow class.n

tmxrasterizer: Use smooth pixmap transform by defaultThis is to increase the default quality of the rendered map, especiallynwhen rendering thumbnails. It can be turned off separately from anti-naliasing using the new --no-smoothing parameter.nnAnti-aliasing remains off by default since it is usually not what younwant. It applies anti-aliasing to edges of primitives, including tiles.nThis creates visible seems at tile boundaries when the tiles are notnpixel-aligned.n

Added right-click to clear the selection to all tile selection toolsThe Rectangular Select, Magic Wand and Select Same Tile tools now allnclear the currently selected area on right-click.nnFor the Rectangular Select, when the right-click happens whilenselecting, it cancels the selection operation instead.nnThanks for Fedoration (IRC) for the suggestion!n

Enable HiDpi scaling and improved the quality of some iconsBy default, Tiled will now adjust its scaling factor to the DPI of thenscreen (without affecting font size, which is expected to be set upncorrectly system-wide). General code cleanup in MainWindowMostly to change its MapDocument* into a Document*.n
Allow scrolling past map edges with mouse wheelIt was already possible to go past the map edges using panning or thenmini-map. Now the mouse wheel allows this as well.n

Show all open tilesets in the Tilesets viewNow the tileset view shows all loaded tilesets, except for embeddedntilesets that are not part of the current map.nnTiled will automatically manage which tilesets are used by a map or not.nSome new action will need to be added for the purpose of removing ancertain tileset from a map.nnThe tilesets are shown ordered by name. Manual reordering is no longernpossible.n

Made random mode accessible againMoving the Random button to the main tool bar of the map editor.n

Added a context menu action to reset the size of tile objectsThis is useful after unintentionally resizing a tile object andndiscovering it later, or after the size of the tile graphic hasnchanged and you want to adjust the objects.nnCloses #1380n
Removed the 5 pixel margin for dock widgetsActually I think it looks better without the extra space and it makesnit easier to resize the views.n

Initial start page when no files are openThis change adds a special page that is shown when no files are open.nIt currently just helps the user to get started by providing buttons toneither create a new map or a new tileset.nnIt also adds the notion of globally registered actions, which is one waynof allowing this new page to trigger the New Map and New Tilesetnactions. The Id and the ActionManager are loosely based on code in QtnCreator, though I hope to keep things a bit more simple. It would bennice if eventually these registered actions could feature for examplencustom shortcuts.n
Made the New Tileset button in the Tilesets view functional againJust triggering this action through the new ActionManager.n
Fixed refresh of draw margins when tileset tile offset is changed

Fixed empty tileset view for the first opened tilesetIt would only create the view later, when switching to another tilesetnand then back. Due to the order of events, it failed to create thenTilesetModel instance.n

Immediately ask to save new maps and tilesetsIt will no longer be allowed to create some new unsaved file, becausenthis doesn't work nicely when other files are saved that reference thenfile. This particular problem currently only applies when saving mapsnthat reference some unsaved tileset, but the behavior will be the samenfor consistency.nnAlso fixed a small bug causing the extension mismatch warning to pop upnwhen canceling the Save As dialog.n
Updated TMX schema definition (#1385)Closes #509
Added back the 'New' button on the main tool barNow it pops up a menu so that you can choose between creating a new mapnor a new tileset.n

Added a Tileset menu providing access the tileset propertiesThis menu is only visible when the current document is a tileset.nSimilarly, the Map and Layer menus are now only visible when the currentndocument is a map.n
Made the zoom actions also functional in the tileset editor

Fixed issues with the Remove Tileset action* Disable the action, when the selected tileset is not actually listedn  by the current map.n* Use the right index.n* Avoid closing external tilesets that are open separately.n
TilesetDocument should keep a reference to the tilesetThis enables the reloading of the tileset image when it changes, as wellnas avoiding to load this tileset again when loading a map.n
Fixed crash when changing tile probabilityWas using the wrong document pointer.n

Fixed double loading of tilesetsWhen an external tileset was opened as part of a map, and then openednexplicitly, it would get loaded again and get listed twice in thenTilesets view. Now the previously created document is used instead.n
Restored ability to edit tileset parameters

GmxPlugin: Added support for several GameMaker propertiesIt is now possible to control the following room properties using customnproperties on the map:nn* speed (default: 30)n* persistent (default: false)n* clearDisplayBuffer (default: true)n* PhysicsWorld (default: false)n* PhysicsWorldTop (default: 0)n* PhysicsWorldLeft (default: 0)n* PhysicsWorldRight (default: width)n* PhysicsWorldBottom (default: height)n* PhysicsWorldGravityX (default: 0)n* PhysicsWorldGravityY (default: 10)n* PhysicsWorldPixToMeters (default: 0.1)nnAlso, added vsnap and hsnap properties based on the tile size.n

Use QOpenGLWidget instead of QGLWidgetBoth QGLWidget and QOpenGLWidget have a bunch of issues, but usingnQOpenGLWidget avoids a dependency on QtOpenGL and works better on HiDpindisplays.nnSome problems are still observed:nn* It's noticeably slower (Qt 5.4, OS X), but OpenGL is disabled on OS Xn  entirely anyway.nn* Whole application shifts about and flickers during window resizen  (Qt 5.5, Linux).nn* Responsiveness of whole application affected (Qt 5.5, Linux)nn* Viewport becomes entirely black when resized, but is repainted properlyn  upon other forms of interaction (Qt 5.7, Windows)n

Switch to uppercase for distributed filesI just think it looks better.n
Up/down buttons in objects dock + pixel coordinates for objects in status bar (#1384)* Added object move up/down in Objects dockrn* Added pixel coordinates to status bar when edit objects layer

Some improvements to the move up/down buttons for objects* Made sure up and down refer to the stacking order, so it makes sensen  for object layers using Manual rendering order. This does mean it non  longer matches with the Objects dock display order, but I think that then  display order needs to be reversed.nn* Used the icons from the theme when available.nn* Set tool tips and disable the actions when no objects are selected.nn* Fixed strange reordering happening when some set of objects is alreadyn  at the bottom or top. Just do nothing instead.nn* Used RangeSet<int> to replace the sorting and reduce the number ofn  ChangeMapObjectsOrder instances.nn* Replaced a bunch of 'foreach' loops with C++11 for loops.n

Remove Reflection from TMXMapReader (#1398)Replace reflection with Java XML Binding (JAXB), add more test maps to ensure maps load correctly with JAX-B and clear tile flipping flags to enable correct reading of GIDs

Introduced a ReversingProxyModelThis was way more work than I had anticipated, but this proxy modelnsimplifies the LayerModel and a few other places that needed to takeninto account that the layers were displayed in reversed order.nnIt will also be used to apply the same reversed order to the Objectsnview.n

Reversed the order of the objects in the Objects viewUsing the new ReversingProxyModel, which keeps the base model and relatedncode simple.nnThe objects are now displayed in the same order as the layers, with thenlast rendered object at the top instead of at the bottom. This is morenintuitive when working with manual object rendering order.n

Made safe writing of files optionalSince the safe (atomic) writing of files is unfortunately causingnproblems on network drives and in Dropbox folders, there is now annoption to disable it entirely.nnUsers should be aware that disabling it will result in partially writtennfiles in the event of Tiled crashing while saving or when there isninsufficient space available. When overwriting, the previous contents ofnthe file will become unavailable, so backups should be made.nnCloses #1402nCloses #1404n

Changed Alt-drag behavior to not override resize handlesBy holding Alt you can drag around the currently selected objects,nwithout fear of accidentally selecting some other object. So far itnwould also cause a drag operation even when clicking a resize or rotatenhandle. The handle now takes precedence.nnThe old behavior was especially annoying for people trying to use Altnwhile resizing in order to toggle the grid snapping.nnCloses #1425n

Added invert selection action (#1428)Closes #1423

Fixed crash when resizing map causes objects to get removedThis bug sneaked in due to a QUndoCommand getting immediately executedneven when pushed as part of a macro, whereas the code was relying on itngetting executed later (in using a modern for-loop that assumed theniterated container is not going to get modified).nnI expected execution to be later, since the beginMacro/endMacro arendocumented with a piece of equivalent code that would behave likenthat. Turns out it's not exactly the same, and I was a fool for assumingnit was.n

Fixed position of image layer after Resize or Offset MapWhile the image is not itself cropped, it is now at least shifted alongnwith the tiles and objects so that its position remains where it isnexpected to be.nnCloses #1418n

Allow setting up the orientation and grid size of a tilesetThis orientation (currently just isometric or orthogonal) allows thencollision editor and terrain overlays to take into account isometricntiles and transform the rendering and mouse input accordingly.nnUseful for when the collision shape should lie on the ground and tonbetter see which corner is meant regarding the terrain information.nnCloses #757 - Collision Objects are not projected while in Isometric ModenCloses #419 - isometric terrain overlaysn

GmxPlugin: Fixed positioning and support scaling for instancesThe origin correction was being applied to all objects, while it shouldnonly be done for tile objects. Non-tile objects already use a top-leftnorigin, just like in GameMaker.nnScaled tile objects now have their scaleX and scaleY attributes set upncorrectly.nnCloses #1426n

GmxPlugin: Export tile objects without a type as tilesNow tile objects without a type are exported as tiles. So far, all objectsnwithout a type were ignored. Unfortunately it is not possible to supportnrotation this way, for that you need an instance (and hence a type).n

GmxPlugin: Support horizontal and vertical flippingFlipping is now supported for tiles and tile objects (whether exported asninstances or as tiles).nnDiagonal flipping remains unsupported for now. It could be supported forntile objects exported as instances, by using the rotation.n

Moved Layer::width/height members to TileLayerIn general, layers do not have a width and height. The layer size isncurrently only relevant for tile layers.n
Fixed terrain brush for isometric staggered mapsAlso added an isometric staggered example map.nnCloses #427n
Merge branch '0.18'Conflicts:ntsrc/tiled/terrainbrush.cppn

Fixed encoding problems with command-line outputWith some languages on some systems, much of the command-line outputnwould be unreadable. This was seen on Windows with Chinese language. Itnwas likely caused by passing the result of qPrintable, which produces anstring with local 8-bit encoding, to qWarning/qDebug/etc, which expect anUTF-8 encoded string. The problem was not generally visible on Linux,nwhere the local 8-bit encoding is usually UTF-8.nnThe code was now changed to use qUtf8Printable where appropriate, asnwell as QDebug::noquote, because most of the old qPrintable usages werento avoid the quotes.nnqUtf8Printable and QDebug::noquote were added in Qt 5.4, so this is nownthe minimum supported version of Qt (previously 5.2).nnCloses #1381n
Some cleanups now that Tiled requires Qt >= 5.4
Travis CI: Fixed the build for pull requests from forksOnly try to push to itch.io from bjorn/tiled repo, since obviously thenencryption keys aren't available when building from forks.n
Travis CI: Update clang build to compile against Qt 5.4.2It was previously compiling against Qt 5.2, which is no longernsupported.n
Merge branch '0.18'

Unified New Layer menu actions* Layer context menu now has the actions grouped under a 'New' menun  item, as well as adding the Layer via Cut/Copy actions.nn* New Layer button now also features the Layer via Cut/Copy actions.n
Python plugin: Removed Layer.setMap from bindingsLayer::setMap is not meant to be called directly. The map isnautomatically set when the layers are added to the map.n

Improved DPI-awareness in many placesTiled now tries to adapt to the DPI of the primary screen as much asnpossible. This way, we can hopefully stop relying on full applicationnscaling as a compatibility solution. Using a global scale has severalndownsides, including painting bugs and overly fat lines.nnThe following things now adapt to the DPI of the primary screen (needingnrestart if it changes):nn* Hard-coded icon sizesn* Initial window sizesn* Rounded corners in Tiled Fusion stylen* Size hints of scroll areasn* Mouse wheel scroll speed on map view (though it still seems too slow)n* Resize and rotate handlesnnThe main thing remaining is to provide higher resolution versions ofnmost icons.n
When adding a new layer, insert it above the current oneIt is usually more useful for the layer to be inserted above the currentnlayer, rather than always at the top of the stack.n
More DPI-awareness in Tiled Fusion style* Fixed up the scroll bar slider width (was too wide on high DPI)n* Scale up tab close buttons as neededn
Fixed a warning from QObject::disconnectMake sure the active tool is deactivated before switching itsnMapDocument, rather than after.n
Replaced some foreach loops with modern for-loops

Added diagonal mirroring mode to terrain brushWhen holding the Alt modifier while using the terrain brush, thenmodifications will be mirrored diagonally (top-left / bottom-right).nnIn general, there could also be horizontal or vertical mirroring as wellnas a combination of those, but that will require adding a tool-specificnconfiguration panel somewhere (will have to be done eventually).nnThanks to 'Peter' for pushing for this feature.n

Added GroupLayer and GroupLayerItemA GroupLayer is a new kind of layer that can contain other layers. It isnmeant for organizing layers in folders in case you are working with mapsnthat have a large amount of layers.nnThe visibility, opacity and later also locked status of the group layernwill affect all child layers. Also the Layers view will allow collapsingngroup layers.nnThis change is only the start. The addition of group layers is expectednto affect a large amount of code.n
Added saving and loading for GroupLayersThe TMX, JSON and Lua formats now support saving and loading maps thatnuse group layers, using a simple nested approach.n

Terrain Brush: Changed the way the mirroring worksPreviously a crash could occur when using the Alt mirror modifier ofnthe Terrain Brush on a non-square map. The new mirroring approach isnactually not technically behaving like a mirror, but it works also fornrectangular maps and I think in general it yields nicer looking maps.nIt's actually doing a 180 degree rotation rather than a mirror.n
add some Chinese translation

Fixed a crash when duplicating an object layerWhen the object layer being duplicated was selected in the Objects view,nTiled would crash due to a null pointer dereference. This was caused bynmodifying the data before calling beginInsertRows innMapObjectModel::layerAdded.n
Fixed changing properties of multiple objectsDue to a duplicated variable (a leftover in MapDocument), propertynchanges were only applied to one object, rather than all selectednobjects.n
Updated NEWS file and bumped version to 0.18.1
Merge branch '0.18'

Windows Installer: Fixed selection of the right MSVC DLL once moreThe previous method was not working, probably because System32 is somenkind of magic directory, that contains 64-bit DLLs which actually looknlike 32-bit DLLs to 32-bit applications (probably including Wix).nnAlso added an icon to the Install button, indicating the installer willnrequire adminstrator permissions.nnCloses #1338n
Merge branch '0.18'
Added gmx plugin to Specfile (#1434)
Qbs: Fixed build system to handle 4-number versions

Fixed updating of values displayed in Objects and Layers viewsDue to a bug in the way the indexes were mapped by thenReversingProxyModel, the views were not updating correctly. Thisnaffected changes due to undo/redo or changes made elsewhere like in thenProperties view, which would not be reflected as expected in thesenviews.n
Fixed crash when deleting multiple selected objectsAlso when moving multiple selected objects to another object layer.n
Travis CI: Build snapshots against Qt 5.8 and use date as version
Merge branch '0.18'

Removed most usages of layer indexWith the introduction of GroupLayer, all code that was solely usingna layer index to refer to some layer needs to be updated. In most cases,nthe layer index was replaced by a layer pointer. However, a large amountnof code will still need to be adjusted to work on a layer hierarchynrather than a list of layers.nnThis change also makes the LayerModel largely aware of GroupLayers, sonit is now a tree model.n
Added Group Layer and Ungroup Layer actionsAlso fixes two small bugs in the LayerModel related to layer groups.n

Added support for group layers in the MapSceneGrouped layers are now displayed correctly in the map view. The mostncomplicated beast here was to fix the behavior of the highlighting ofnthe current layer.n

Added support for layer hierarchy to several actions* Select previous/next layern* Move layer up/downnnIntroduced a LayerIterator to simplify dealing with the hierarchy innmany places. Used it also to replace a buggy algorithm innMapScene::updateCurrentLayerHighlight.n
Fixed up restoring of previously selected layerStored number is now interpreted as global layer index.n

Handle layer hierarchy in Offset Map dialog* When selecting 'All Layers' or 'All Visible Layers', skip groups ton  avoid applying offset effectively twice for child layers.nn* When applying an offset to a group (or to an image layer),n  don't clone the original layer (avoids excessive memory usage).n

More adjustment to handle layer hierarchy* Added Layer::totalOffset, Layer::affectiveOpacity, Layer::isHiddenn* Added LayerIterator::toFront/toBackn* Adjusted MapReader, GmxPlugin, AdjustTileIndexes, ExportAsImageDialog,n  MapDocument::resizeMap, ThumbnailRenderer and MiniMap to iterate overn  all layersn

Unset Qt::AA_EnableHighDpiScalingOn OS X and Windows it remains the default for now, but on Linux Tilednwill now respect user's environment variables and won't scale by defaultn(at least on X), since it actually looks quite decent due to adjustingnto the DPI of the primary screen.nnA user can always choose to still use the DPI scaling by using thenQT_AUTO_SCREEN_SCALE_FACTOR, QT_SCALE_FACTOR or QT_SCREEN_SCALE_FACTORSnenvironment variables.n
Fixed the Show/Hide all Other Layers action for grouped layersAlso made amall simplification in LayerIterator.n

Fixed an issue with the Move Layer Down action on group layersWhen used on non-empty groups, it would try to move the group intonitself, leading to a crash. Now the LayerIterator::next/previous methodsnhave a flag that can be used to tell it not to enter groups.n
GmxPlugin: Added support for image collection tilesetsPreviously Tiled would crash when a map using tiles from an imagencollection tileset was exported as GameMaker 1.4 room file.n
Fixed the Move Layer Down action some moreThis change simplifies the implementation and reverts the additions tonthe LayerIterator, fixing some remaining issues.n
Support group layers in the Objects viewAlso simplified the way the model works by using an Object* as internalnpointer directly, instead of a custom allocated object.n
Fixed leaking of TilesetTerrainModel

Disabled precompiled header for debug buildsDuring development, using this precompiled header can actually slow downncompile times quite a bit since it causes more files to be recompilednwhen any of the included header files change.n

Attempt to work around MSVC Internal Compiler ErrorMSVC 2013 doesn't like this code, saying:nnsrctiledmapobjectmodel.cpp(354) : warning C4258: 'index' : definition from the for loop is ignored; the definition from the enclosing scope is usedn  srctiledmapobjectmodel.cpp(341) : definition of 'index' ignorednInternal Compiler Error in C:Program Files (x86)Microsoft Visual Studio 12.0VCbinamd64cl.exe.  You will be prompted to send an error report to Microsoft later.n
Fixed group layer handling in layer combo boxBased on TreeViewComboBox copied from Qt Creator. This means Tiled isnnow effectively GPLv3 instead of GPLv2 or later.n
Used the standard directory icon for the group layers

Avoid potential issues with initializing object IDsWhen child ObjectGroup layers would be added to a GroupLayer instancenbefore it is added to the map, the objects in the ObjectGroup would notnget their IDs initialized.nnDelegate the setting of map ownership to the Map class, so that the IDsnwill initialize also in such a scenario.n

Fixed handling of group layer offset* Display correct coordinates in status bar for tile and object toolsn* Fixed offset while creating objectsn* Fixed offset while placing and capturing tilesn* Fixed taking into account offset when determining repaint regionn* Fixed position of selection indicators and labelsn* Fixed ThumbnailRenderer to handle offset when computing boundsn
Added handling of group layers to tmxrasterizer

Keep selected layer and object pointers safeNow that layers can be grouped, the checks making sure that the currentnlayer and the currently selected objects are reset when necessary needednto be adjusted.n
Merge branch 'wip/group-layer'Conflicts:ntsrc/tiled/mapdocument.cppntsrc/tiled/mapobjectmodel.cppn
Added the group actions also to the main window menu
Replaced include guards with #pragma onceThanks to https://github.com/cgmb/guardonce!n
Updated copyright year in About dialog
Added some actions to the Tileset menu* Moved Tile Collision Editor and Tile Animation Editor over from Viewn* Added Edit Terrain Informationn* Added Add/Remove Tilesn

Fixed a potential crash when closing the last mapWhen closing the last map but leaving at least one (external) tilesetnopen, TilesetDock::setCurrentTiles would try to create a stamp based onnsettings from the current map, which resulted in a null pointernreference.n
Tried to improve the readability of MapObject class a little
Replaced more foreach with range-based forautomappingconverter now compiles with QT_NO_FOREACHn

QtPropertyBrowser: Font-property changes* Improved quality of font icon on high-DPI displaysn* Display pixel size if point size is not setn* Replaced point size by pixel size (ideally this would be an option,n  but this is quite involved and I don't currently need it)n

Added a Text objectThis Text object has already many features, including word wrapping,ncoloring and font options. The main thing lacking still is a UI tonchange its vertical and horizontal alignment properties.nnAnother thing that may be useful, is to have an option to adjust thensize to the contents, rather than the other way around. Currently, thentext is wrapped and clipped to the size of the object, which is not thenmost convenient thing depending on the use-case. It can also causenproblems when different native fonts are used or font rendering differsnslightly between systems.nnCloses #1429n
Travis CI: Specify the Tiled versionThis way the build version will show up correctly in the About dialognand on the command line.n
Rearranged snap-related menu itemsNow they are in a sub-menu and mutually exclusive.n

Fixed properties displayed when clicking nested layersOnly properties for top-level layers would get displayed. Clickingnnested layers could even cause a crash if there were more child layersnthan layers at the top level.nnCloses #1449n
Object Types Editor: Improved behavior when adding new types* Make sure to immediately apply object types when adding new onesn* Automatically focus the name field to ease editingnnCloses #1448n
Bumped version to 0.18.2 and updated NEWS file
Merge branch '0.18'
Travis CI: Use linuxdeployqt release 2Fixes shipping of image format plugins.n
Travis CI: Install additional Qt image format pluginsThis should add support for TIFF, MNG, TGA, WBMP and WEBP to the Linuxnbinary releases.nnCloses #1444n
Link to QtSvg when creating a Linux binary archiveThis should allow linuxdeployqt to detect QtSvg as dependency and shipnthe SVG image format plugin as well.n
Fixed up release day for 0.18.2

docs: Added link to tmxlite C++ parser (#1452)closes #1397

Added Tile.type and inherit tile object properties from the tileThis type is the same as used for objects, and tile objects withoutnexplicit type will inherit it from their tile. When the type isninherited, it is displayed in gray (in Properties and Objects view).nnCustom properties set on the tile are also inherited by tile objectsnusing that tile.nnCloses #436nCloses #1248n
Fixed a typo
Removed no longer needed public emitX functionsAll signals are public since Qt 5, so these functions are no longernnecessary.n

Fixed a possible crash when selecting objects while editing a tilesetBy undocking the Objects view, it is possible to select an object whilenediting a tileset. The code trying to center the view on the object wasnwould then crash because it assumed the map would be the currentndocument.n

Fixed a small regression regarding label color updatingWhile adding the Text object, the code got list that emitted thenobjectsTypeChanged signal, breaking the adjustment of the color of anynvisible object name labels when changing the object type.n
Added brief contributing guidelines
Tweaked donation link
Added short and consistent map format names to use with --export-map (#1454)Closes #1382
Added Swap Tiles actionThis swaps the usage of the two selected tiles on the current tilenlayer. It is only enabled when exactly two tiles are selected.nnChange rebased and amended by @bjorn.n

Made the Swap Tiles command work on the entire mapNot just the current tile layer.nnWhen swapping the tiles of a tile object, it automatically adjusts thensize of the object when the object matched the size of the tile.n
Hide Width and Height properties for Polygon and Polyline objects (#1464)Closes #1451
Use an eye icon instead of a checkbox for layer visibility (#1457)Closes #1127
Use eye icons from InkscapeAvailable under GPL 2.0 and I think they look prettier. Also, provide anhigher resolution version for increased quality on high DPI screens.n
Change current layer depending on selected objects (#1466)Closes #1424
Fixed crash when changing layer without a current objectIt would crash when deleting a layer, for example.n

Changed the eye icon againFound this more stylistic version atnhttps://github.com/gnome-design-team/gnome-icons/tree/master/inkscape-symbolicnnMade the eye background white because it works better on dark themes.nnAlso added a slightly bigger version of the dice icon.n

Tweaked setting the current object when switching layersWhen there is no current object, it's better to set it to the new layer.nThis makes sure the next layer properties are displayed when for examplendeleting a layer.n
Support 60 degree rotation for hexagonal maps (#1447)See http://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/rotate-hexagonal-tiles-60-degrees/1546/5n
Add Ctrl+Y as possible redo shortcutA lot of applications use Ctrl+Y for redo, so some users will expectnthis to work. On Windows, this shortcut seems to have been alreadynsupported by default.n

Fixed Offset Layers tool to wait with draggingThe Offset Layers tool caused an undo entry to be made by just clicking,nbecause it was immediately going into dragging mode when the mouse wasnpressed. Now it waits until the mouse has been moved by at least halfnthe QApplication::startDragDistance(), before it will start the dragnoperation.nnAlso fixed an issue where using a shortcut to switch to another toolnwhile dragging was preventing the creation of an undo entry for thendrag.n

Always update current stamp when a tile is clickedRegardless of whether it changed the selection or not. This makes surenthat the stamp is updated when clicking an already selected tile in thentileset view, which can be the case if the stamp was previously a stampnwith the same tile repeated, or when the stamp contained tiles fromnother tilesets.n
Check for duplicates when adding tiles (#1461)Closes #1227
Option to run commands from menu as well as edit them (#1463)Fixes #943
Use shared QAction instances for running commands (#1480)Follow up patch for #1463.
Added executables in tests directory to .gitignore (#1485)
Custom shortcuts for commands (#1482)Fixes #1456
Qbs: Removed obsolete dependency on Qt.openglThat was for Qt < 5.4, and Qt 5.4 is required for building Tiled now.n
Qbs: Added option to install the libtiled header filesExample:nn  qbs qbs.installRoot:/usr Tiled.installHeaders:truennIssue #1484n

Qbs: Install more files on LinuxThe following files were previously only installed by the qmake project,nand are now installed by Qbs as well:nn* MIME types filen* Application and MIME type iconsn* Man pagesn* Desktop filen* Thumbnailer filennIssue #1484n
Qbs: Added an option to disable the use of RPATHExamplenn  qbs build Tiled.useRPaths:falsennIssue #1484n
Added switchable columns to objects view (#1469)Closes #1462

Fixed handling of pinch gesturesWhile reading the API, it was clear that we should use totalScaleFactornrather than scaleFactor since it was getting multiplied with the initialnscaling factor. For some reason, scaleFactor must have been returningnthe totalScaleFactor in the past since the feature has been workingnfine at some point.nnI also noticed severe jittering of the view since it was gettingnrepainted twice, right after changing the scale and then again afternadjusting the scale origin. Fixed this by using AnchorUnderMouse, butnkept the origin correction since AnchorUnderMouse appears to be off bynone pixel per event, causing the view to shift slowly while pinching.nnCloses #1305n
Merge branch '0.18'

Made Ctrl+D duplicate objectsThis means it is now no longer a shortcut for Delete, but this matchesnthe behavior of some other applications, like Inkscape.nnBased on feedback from Hawken King on the forum.n

Improved the behavior of the tile selection toolIt is now easier to select tiles since it works the same way as whenncapturing a stamp. Any touched tile is included in the selection. Thenonly exception remains when you simply click, which clears the selectionnbecause selecting now only starts when the mouse has been moved at leastna little bit.nnBased on feedback from @eevee.n
Remember tileset zoom level in the tileset editor (#1479)Also, the zoom levels of the tilesets in the Tilesets dock are no longer connected.rnrnCloses #408
Updated French translation
Added an executable picker (#1488)Closes #942
A bit of cleanup related to commands* Use less nested layouts in CommandDialogn* Removed getters for specific command properties from CommandDataModeln* Renamed Command to Commands in the File menun
Flipping a group of objects now works as expected (#1481)This also affects flipping of single objects, which now takes the rotation into account.rnrnCloses #1475

Stamp brush now works better with staggered maps (#1496)Previously when using the stamp brush tool when in hexagonal mode, moving down rows would cause a stamp to behave strangely (not accounting for the stagger). This has been patched by shifting every other row of the stamp over in the appropriate direction when needed.
Implemented marching ants effect on selected objects (#1503)Closes #1489

Fixed fast movement of selection outline while dragging objectsIncrease the offset each time the timer fires, instead of each time the objectnis drawn.nnAlso reduced the interval from 250ms to 100ms again (it was 100ms in the PRnoriginally) since that does seem to look better. The smoother movement couldnactually be less distracting.n
Add libtiled/libtiled-static.pri (#1505)
Removed broken livecoding.tv badgeI'll add back a working version later.rnrnCloses #1506

Selection of underlying objects (#1494)This change allows using the Alt modifier key to select objects below rnthe currently selected objects. It can be used in combination withrnShift/Ctrl to add to the selection.rnrnAlso, when holding Alt there is a special context menu, allowing to rndirectly select any object at that location.rnrnCloses #1491

Support removal from selection when using Alt modifierIn general, I think it is useful to allow also removal from thenselection even when the user holds the Alt modifier (to target objectsnbelow the selection). It works in the way that when all objects undernthe mouse are already selected, the first object will get deselected.n

Fixed external tilesets changing into embedded ones on saveThis was due to a silly workaround. The workaround is still there, butnnow it at least shouldn't break things anymore. To be fixed properlynlater.nnThanks to M4rw on the forums for reporting this issue!n
Small fix to Alt-click selectionWhen the first and last objects were already selected, thensecond-to-last object would never get selected.nnThanks to @Acuion for noticing this issue.n

In the process of cloning however, the tile propertiesnwere not getting copied over.nnCloses #1513n

Fixed tileset reloading not updating tileset propertiesThe properties were forgotten in Tileset::swap.nnRelated to bce8cbb3193e6da00f97dd5f96bc8f066eeb416b.n

Fixed error reported by valgrindThe construction of mZoomable causes an event to be delived to thenTilesetView (probably QEvent::ChildAdded), causing the event override tonread the pointer before it was initialized.nnIt could not actually result in any issue since the event type was alsonchecked, but to keep valgrind silent it's better to reverse thisncondition.n

Fixed JSON tilesets getting saved in TSX formatThe problem was that when an external tileset was opened as part of anmap, there was no way for Tiled to derive the file format used by thentileset. Upon saving, it would default to using the TSX format, whichnwas wrong if the tileset was loaded from a JSON file.nnThis is now fixed by remembering the file format at the Tileset level,ninstead of in TilesetDocument (which libtiled doesn't know about).nnThe fallback to the TSX format has been removed, since actually itnshould always be defined.nnWhen reading an external tileset, there is still a fallback to TSXnformat because external applications like tmxviewer and tmxrasterizerndepend on it.  It would be good to find some alternative for thisnhowever, since this fallback is unable to set the correct format on thenloaded tileset.nnThis also fixes the Reload action being disabled for such tilesets andneven crashing Tiled when the file was changed on disk.nnFinally, a small fix was made to the Broken Links handling when you trynto replace a tileset that couldn't be loaded with itself.n
fixed objects offsetting while resizing

AutoMapper: Simplified some codeThis reduces code duplication between AutoMapper::setupTilesets andnMapDocument::unifyTilesets.nnOne difference is that now tile properties are no longer merged in fromnrule maps, but I think that was rather unexpected behavior in any case.nIf you want to share tile properties between maps, you should usenexternal tilesets.n

Various cleanups to fill region computation* Use QQueue for better code readabilityn* Use bool instead of quint8 to better communicate the purposen* Avoid memset (it's unlikely to be a significant optimization)n* Take some conditions out of the loop that adds news points to the queuen
Floor tile coordinates in status bartoFixed() rounds, which we don't want.n

Fixed fill tool for hexagonal maps with a staggered Y axisThis fixes the computation of the fill area for hexagonal maps using anstaggered Y axis (pointy-top hexagons). Maps using a staggered X axis andnisometric staggered maps still have problems and will be somewhat morenwork to fix.nnThis kind of map was easy to fix because the hexes connect with eachnother horizontally, which is a basic assumption made in the fill regionnalgorithm.nnIssue #883n

Fixed fill tool for hexagonal maps with a staggered X axisNow the fill tool should work fine for any hexagonal map. It also worksna bit better for staggered isometric maps, though it's too eager sincenit considers tiles to be connected diagonally as well for these maps,ndue to their memory layout.nnCloses #883n

Implemented drag-n-drop support in Layers viewThis makes it easy to move layers in and out of groups, as well asnchanging their order.nnThe change required fixing the ReversingProxyModel to map dropncoordinates correctly and fixing ReparentLayers to deal with the layernpotentially not changing its parent but only its position within thensame parent.nnCloses #1038n

Fixed 'Clear View' mode in case of multiple open editorsWhen both a map editor and a tileset editor are open, 'Clear View' wouldnhide docks from the other editor without ever restoring them again.nnThis was due to using isVisible instead of !isHidden before addingnwidgets to the hidden lists.nnAlso made MainWindow::toggleClearView work in case it is being callednwith true repeatedly, though currently that can't happen.n

Enable multi-property multi-object cut/copy/pasteNow you can cut/copy/paste multiple properties at the same time,naffecting all selected objects.nnThis turned out to be not so involved regarding the QtPropertyBrowsernsolution, but all the more involved on the general behavior side. Carenhad to be taken not to enable actions like cut/copy when it was notnclear what values would be taken or when the action could only benapplied to a subset of the selected property items.nnCloses #515n
Expose map and tile size as properties (#1561)

MapItem: emit mapChanged() after calling refresh()This allows QML code to be guaranteed that MapItem has a renderer bynthe time onMapChanged is called, which is necessary to be able tone.g. set a transform using e.g. pixelToScreenCoords().n
AutoMapping: Small optimizationThis 'cells' list is only used when 'listNo' is empty, so no need toncompute it when 'listYes' is empty.n

Fixed restoring of the map view for previously open mapsFor some reason the view was incorrectly adjusting its position in thenQGraphicsView::showEvent. Now a more reliable method is used, which alsonworks better when the size of the view is different from the last timenthe map was open.n
Prevent adding the same external tileset multiple timesWould assert in a debug build and probably cause issues in a releasenbuild as well.n

Allow adding external tilesets by dragging to the Tilesets dockFor now you can no longer add image-based tilesets this way, since usersnare encouraged to set up external tileset files instead. Maybe that cannbe restored later in some way, depending on the feedback.nnIssue #1031n
Accept images dropped on image collection tilesetsProvides an easy way to add tiles to the collection.nnCloses #1031n

Enabled editing of text alignment for text objectsAdditions mostly copied from Qt Designer sources. I think it would makensense to support Qt::Alignment in the QtPropertyBrowser solution, butnthat'd be a somewhat bigger project...nnThis was the last missing functionality for issue #1429, for now.n

Fixed ambiguous shortcut XX could mean:nn* Flip selected objects horizontallyn* Switch to Insert Text toolnnSince I'd like X to still perform the first action, the Insert Text toolnnow uses E for its shortcut. At the same time, the Edit Polygons tool,nwhich had E as its shortcut before, now uses O.nnThis technically breaks string freeze, but these shortcuts shouldngenerally not be changed anyway.n

Disable tab key navigation within the Tilesets viewIt's not useful for tab to iterate over the tiles in this viewn(regardless of the fact that it already no longer works, now that Tabntoggles Clear View).n

Allow default Tab key handling in views when an editor is openThis keeps expected and sometimes useful behavior, while in generalnallowing Tab to be used to toggle the Clear View action.nnCloses #1568n

Fixed views changing size when toggling Clear View modeJust hiding and then showing all views again seems to cause some layoutninformation to get lost or invalidated, which results in the views notnrestoring to exactly the same sizes they had before.nnFor a toggle like the Clear View mode this is not acceptable so I'venchanged the implementation to use saveState/restoreState instead. Onendownside of this, is that any views made visible during the Clear Viewnmode will become hidden when the mode is untoggled, but this is less ofna problem that the views changing size.n
Qbs: Install debug Qt plugins when doing a debug build

AppVeyor: Publish Tiled snapshots for Windows on itchAlso removed the Itch manifest, since it was preventing Tiled from beingnlaunchable at all (you could only launch the manual or the forum). Evennwhen adding an executable, the question of what to launch would pop upnevery time, which is just annoying.n
AppVeyor: Simplified Itch channel used for releasesAlso for consistency with the Linux channels.n
AppVeyor: Explicitly enable Windows installer buildWe don't want an installer to be created for the Itch build, especiallynbecause its version number is incompatible with MSI.n
Qbs: Raised the minimum Qbs version to 1.6Silences annoying warning about change in linker flags behavior.n

Take devicePixelRatio into account when calculating dash lengthFor cosmetic pens the size of the dashes needs to be manually adjustednto the DPI of the screen. For this, we take into account both thenlogical DPI and the devicePixelRatio.n

Make sure tileset is added when inserting tile objectsThis used to be a rare issue in Tiled 0.18 since the Tilesets viewnnormally didn't show tilesets that weren't part of the map. Startingnwith Tiled 1.0, the Tilesets view shows all loaded tilesets (exceptnembedded tilesets in other maps) and the tool should really just makensure to add the tileset when it isn't already there.nnCloses #1571nCloses #1176n

Fixed potential crash in Terrain BrushThe Terrain Brush could crash when you hold Shift while clicking outsidenof the map, and then keep holding Shift while moving the mouse inside ofnthe map. This was due to missing out-of-bounds checks.nnIn addition, the tool could crash when the layer size didn't match thenmap size. This scenario can't currently be achieved by using Tiled, butnthe TMX format supports it and such a map could be crafted manually orncreated with another editor.nnCloses #1181n

Allow selecting a folder to fix multiple broken links at onceWhen multiple broken links are selected, pop up a dialog to choose anfolder and search the chosen folder for files matching any of the brokennlinks.nnA few minor changes remain to be done after the string freeze, likenadjusting some texts and adding better feedback, as well as cleaning upnthe code.nnCloses #1412n

Fixed an issue with the symmetry mode of Terrain BrushWhen the rotational symmetry mode was combined with vertex painting mode,nthe painted corner was not rotated. This caused such edits to be not entirely symmetrical.n
Changed the Tile Collision Editor to a dockable viewAlso enhanced the resolution of some of the tool icons for HiDpinscreens.nnCloses #1160n

Fixed compile error with MSVC 2013This strange error popped up in MSVC 2013:nnsrctiledterrainbrush.cpp(379) : error C2327: 'Tiled::Internal::TerrainBrush::mMirrorDiagonally' : is not a type name, static, or enumeratornsrctiledterrainbrush.cpp(379) : error C2065: 'mMirrorDiagonally' : undeclared identifiernnThis didn't make any sense, and I fixed it by using a bit less fancy C++nfeatures (not sure what part broke it, though).n

Map and tileset views now implement their own zoom shortcutsThis makes it possible to have multiple views in the same window,nhandling the shortcut based on which one has focus.nnIn addition these views no longer require holding Ctrl for zoomingnin/out.nnCloses #1558n

Windows: Work around an issue with OpenGL in full screen modeWhen turning on OpenGL and using the full screen mode, menus and tooltipsnwere no longer visible. This is worked around by adding a one-pixel bordernaround the window.nnSeenhttp://doc.qt.io/qt-5/windows-issues.html#fullscreen-opengl-based-windowsnnSince this one-pixel border is annoying (it makes the top pixels of thenmenu bar not clickable, for example), it is only enabled when necessary.nnCloses #1576n
Include Sticker Knight example and Python scripts in Windows installerAlso fixed those things to be included in distribution as archive.nnCloses #819n

Windows: Fixed bringing existing Tiled window to foregroundWhen Tiled is associated with certain file types and launched from thenExplorer (or generally, with files names in its parameters), it tries tonopen these files in an existing Tiled instance when available.nnOn Windows, it failed to bring the window properly to the foreground, andninstead it would only be flashing on the task bar.nnCloses #1256n

Changing the type of a tile now affects all selected tilesPreviously it would only affect the last selected tile.nnThanks to @civilwargeeky for reporting this on the forums!nhttp://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/set-type-for-many-tiles-at-once/2397n

Allow creating tilesets by dropping images on the Tilesets view againThis used to be possible in Tiled 0.18, but the functionality was lostnand then only the ability to drop external tilesets was added. Now it isnonce again possible to create tilesets by dropping their image on thenTilesets view, which pops up the New Tileset dialog for choosing thenparameters.nnThanks to Simon Park for pointing out the importance of keeping thisnfunctionalityn(http://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/drag-and-drop-tilesets/2378)n
