QtPropertyBrowser: Fixed reset of font size when using font dialogFont dialogs generally deal with point sizes. When the font size is setnin pixels, convert to points before opening the dialog and then back tonpixels when the dialog is accepted.nnOne problem with this approach is that some font dialogs will round thenpoint size to the nearest integer, which means that simply opening andnaccepting the dialog can cause the pixel size of the font to change. Indon't currently see a way around this.nnCloses #1596n

testing through context menurnrn* Write object properties in the templaternrn* Renamingrnrn* Read the saved template grouprnrn* Write and read template name and propertiesrnrnExtracted some code from Remove writeObject function from TmxMapFormatrn- Print the size of the read objects for testingrn- Formattingrn- Rename the saving functionrn- Remove some commentsrn- Change the name of the saved filernrn* Add format setter and getter for templateGrouprnrn* Create skeleton for TemplateGroupDocumentrnrn* Rename TemplateFormat to TemplateGroupFormatrnrn* Add setting error string when reading a template grouprnrn* Code cleanuprnrn- Rename TtxTemplateFormat to TtxTemplateGroupFormatrn- Review related updatesrn- Return nullptr when a template group file can't be openedrn- Remove wrong DTD linkrn- Rename saving function from save as a template group to save as template grouprn- Use template group pointer in temlate group document constructerrn- Remove unneeded forward declarationrnrn* Update the template group formatrnrnAdded objectTemplate class, and used the object reading and writing functions.rnrn* Add tileset references to the template grouprnrn* Update saving to work directly Fixed several issues with the Properties dock* Handle correctly and somewhat more efficiently the case where an  property changes type.nn* Fixed insertion location for new properties in case some propertiesn  where inherited or only present on other selected objects.nnCloses #1611 by addressing the last mentioned issue, that a new boolnproperty can in some cases show up as an editable string at first.n

Revert the file format version back to 1.0This partially reverts ba7cffd12e61ec1a146141582a269b0a1fdb8ce4, whichnwrote out the Tiled version as the version attribute in saved TMX andnJSON maps. However, the patch version should really never be relevantnand a full version like 1.0.0 is causing problems in some librariesn(like PyTmx), which parsed the version as a floating point number.nnAdditionally, using the Tiled version as file format version was a badnidea, because the Tiled version may be something like 2017.06.12 fornsnapshot builds, which would say very little about the format in whichnit saves maps.nnSo, the TMX / JSON versions will now generally only change when therenwere actual changes to the formats, and they will stay a two-partnnumber. A new attribute tiledversion was introduced for those who'dnlike to know which version of Tiled wrote a particular file (similar tonhow it was already done in the Lua export format).n
Save zoom level used in Tilesets viewThis makes the zoom level for each tileset persistent, based on its name.nnThanks to nosty on the forums for pointing out this annoyance!n
Take into account layer offset when centering on an objectCloses #1600n

Avoid expanding symbolic links in Recent Files menu and Maps viewSymbolic links should not be expanded, otherwise relative filenreferences can be effected in undesired ways. For example, if yourntilesets are made accessible through a symlink, you'll generally wantnyour saved map file to use this symlink and not refer to them use theirncanonical path.nnSpecifically, if all your assets were opened through a symlink, thennlater opening them through the Recent Files menu or Maps view wouldncause the canonical path to be used, which could lead to tilesetnreferences saved in such a way that they are only valid on your localnsystem.nnCloses #1589n

Fixed labels for objects in grouped object layers.The option to show object labels on All Objects did not work fornobjects of which the object layer was in a group, since it didn'tnrecursively iterate the layers.nnAlso tried to suppress a compiler warning with a comment.n

Fixed hang when trying to fill with a pasted stampSince 688ec7d31c5efadb5be1525eb07772ebaa377e95 the size of a copied mapnis set to 0x0 instead of matching the tile layer's size. It was supposednto be irrelevant, but as it turns out TileStamp::maxSize was based onnthe size of the map instead of the size of the tile layer. This couldnlead to an infinite loop in fillWithStamp in bucketfilltool.cpp.nnCloses #1617nCloses #1624n

Introduced TilesetDocumentsModel and its sort-filter model companionThis model lists the tileset documents that are currently open, and thensort-filter version sorts them by name and filters out tilesets that arenembedded in other maps than the current one.nnThis model extracts part of the logic from TilesetDock, so that it couldnbe reused by an updated TerrainModel. The TerrainModel currently onlynlists terrains from tilesets that are already part of the map, but itnshould display all loaded external tilesets.n

Implement read/write support for the tBIN format (#1622)The tBIN format is used by the tile map editor tIDE and its renderingrnengine xTile. This plugin allows Tiled to read and write tBIN files withrna high level of compatibility. rnrnThe plugin is disabled by default, because the format does not supportrnall Tiled features. Using it unintentionally could lead to silent datarnloss.rnrnSupporting this format is interesting because it is used by Stardew rnValley (issue #1560).rn

Fixed reading of tileset column count for JSON tilesetsThis was causing image collection tilesets to always have 5 columns whennloaded from a JSON file, regardless of the value saved in the file.n

Limited the area processed by the Terrain BrushThis is mainly useful for making the brush work on infinite maps, but inngeneral it is good to prevent the tool from going crazy when it doesn'tnhave a complete set of transition tiles.nnThe area modified by the tool is now limitd to the maximum distancenbetween any two terrains, as counted by the number of transitionsnneeded.nnA 'checked' boolean was added to each Cell so that the terrain tool cannuse the chunked allocation logic of TileLayer, while still having anfast place to store whether it processed a certain location or not.nnThis helps a lot with issue #1632n
Fixed terrain brush eraser mode

Qbs: Only create a run configuration for Tiled itself by defaultThis avoids confusion for new users trying to run Tiled from Qt Creator.nThe other targets can be added in the Projects view.nnSee issue #1661n

Added keyboard shortcut for Save All, Ctrl+Shift+LThere doesn't seem to be a strong standard for which shortcut to use. Inwould prefer Ctrl+Shift+S because it's used in Visual Studio and QtnCreator, and consistent with Ctrl+Shift+W for Close All.nnHowever, Ctrl+Shift+S is already used as Save As on some platforms (e.g.nGnome), which instead use Ctrl+Shift+L for Save All, so we follow suit.n

docs: Fixed formatting of TMX element attributesSomething seems to have gone wrong when Pandoc converted these.nnAlso fixed layer.width and layer.height attributes documented as notnrequired, while they actually are required. And removed the group.x andngroup.y attributes, since they should never have existed.n

Added support for infinite maps (#1651)This change adds initial support for infinite (or automatically rnexpanding) maps. Such maps do not have a predefined size, and each tilernlayer only allocates memory for the part that is actually used.rnrnA lot of code needed to be adjusted to not rely on a fixed map or tile rnlayer size. Of course, some new issues may still be hiding.rnrnKnown issues are:rnrn* The storage format is based on the bounding rectangle of a tile rn  layer's content, which is sub-optimal for sparsely filled layers.rn* Automapping does not currently work for infinite maps.rnrnCloses #260

libtiled-java: Updated instructions on how to run the tests because these were skipped in the default debug-profile Maven profile.We cannot directly override the skipTests configuration parameter on the command line.nSee https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SUREFIRE-682.n

libtiled-java: Do not require TMX files to be namespaced when reading them.When elementFormDefault is set to qualified, the JAXB unmarshaller didn't read the TMX files correctly.nThe following error was printed by DefaultValidationEventHandler, indicating that elements without the proper namespace weren't recognized:n[ERROR]: unexpected element (uri:, local:tileset). Expected elements are <{http://www.mapeditor.org}group>,<{http://www.mapeditor.org}objectgroup>,<{http://www.mapeditor.org}properties>,<{http://www.mapeditor.org}layer>,<{http://www.mapeditor.org}imagelayer>,<{http://www.mapeditor.org}tileset>n

libtiled-java: Added support for manipulating non-consecutive tile IDs in a tileset.This implementation adds a new tiles field in TileSet whose values are synchronized on marshal and unmarshal operations via class defined event callbacks with the generated internalTiles attribute in TileSetData.nSee https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/javax/xml/bind/Marshaller.html.n

Fixed crash on reload mapThe simplicity of this fix is a little embarrassing. The issue wasnintroduced in commit 4eb4485dbc1b6a35e9440a87013aab88db25dc50 and I'mnunsure how it passed basic testing.nnCloses #1694nCloses #1659n

Fixed possible crash on undo/redo in collision editorWhen there was a collision shape selected, the deselection of thisnobject on undo/redo could cause the mCurrentObject to be set to thenObjectGroup instance right before it got deleted and stay around asninvalid pointer, which was accessed immediately afterwards when thennewly created ObjectGroup was set as current.nnSolved by delaying the moment at which mCurrentObject is set to nullnwhen layers get removed, which will hopefully not cause issuesnelsewhere.nnCloses #1695n

Only write gid attribute for non-empty tilesSo in the (deprecated) pure XML tile layer data format, empty tiles arennow written as <tile/> instead of <tile gid=0/>, reducing the filensize a little bit for largely empty layers.nnThis change works, because 0 is actually the default value of the gidnattribute (which is now also documented).nnCloses #1716n
Avoid iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile warnings for PNG filesUsed pngcrush -ow -rem allb -reduce ... on all PNG files causingnthe above warning.n
Fixed tool shortcuts to be usable while the tool bar is hiddenEventually we may add the tools to the menu as well, but for now usenQShortcut instances to keep those shortcuts working.nnCloses #1718n

Introduced FillMethod enum in AbstractTileFillToolReplacing two booleans of which only one shall be true, to more cleanlynsupport multiple fill methods.nnPossible the StampBrush should also use this enum, but it doesn't derivenfrom AbstractTileFillTool so it would need to be adjusted separately orna bigger change should be made.n

Improved the behavior of Bucket Fill when hovering same-tileWhen hovering a tile that is the same as the tile used for filling,npreviously the Bucket Fill Tool would stick with the last creatednpreview. Now the active preview is cleared.n

Made it possible to capture tiles while using fill toolsThere wasn't really any particular reason why a tile stamp could not bencaptured while using the Bucket Fill or Shape Fill tools, apart from itnjust not being implemented yet.nnIntroduced a CaptureStampHelper to share some of the code with the StampnBrush.nnCloses #790n
Fixed rendering issues after changing theme colorBy clearing the QPixmapCache, which avoids cached pixmaps from beforenthe color change being reused by the style.n

The warnings were:nnIn file included from moc_mapformat.cpp:9:n./mapformat.h:147:5: warning: 'qt_metacall' overrides a member function but is not marked 'override' [-Winconsistent-missing-override]nQ_OBJECTn^n

Fixed crash when saving two new maps using the same file nameFor new maps, the reader format was not being set, which causednproblems when these maps were reloaded, either manually or as a resultnof the file changing on disk (which can happen externally or because ofncreating another new map and saving it with the same file name).nnCloses #1734n

Fixed issues caused by paths not being cleanedHopefully without introducing issues due to paths being cleaned...nnNot cleaning the path here resulted in the same tile image beingnreferred to by different paths (like containing foo/.. or bar/..,nwhere foo and bar are both irrelevant due to the path containingn..).nnThis caused for example the automapping to not recognize that twonembedded tilesets were the same, if the files they were part of were notnin the same directory.nnCloses #1713n

docs: Fixup last commit

Made some 1-argument constructors explicitDetected by cppcheck pattern:nn  Class 'classname' has a constructor with 1 argument that is not explicit.nnThe idea is to prevent such a constructor to be accidentally used for annimplicit conversion, however unlikely. Most of the time I do thisnalready, but it had been forgotten in some places.n

Fixed initialization of some members* ObjectTemplate::mId is now set to 0 by the default constructorn* TemplateGroup::mFormat is now initialized to nulln* TerrainFilterModel::mEnabled is now initialized to truen* HasChildrenFilterModel::mEnabled is now initialized to truennJudging by the code, it seems no actual bugs were fixed here, but itndoes silence some cppcheck warnings.n
Rearranged members to make TileStampData 8 bytes smallerNot that it matters much, but it also silences two -Wpadded warningsnfrom clang.n

Windows: Fixed copy/paste pasting invalid tilesBe more strict before considering a file path to be a URL. In particular,nnever consider absolute file paths to be URLs.nnThis broke only on Windows, where the drive letters in absolute paths werenending up as the scheme of the URL, making it non-relative. Problemsnonly appeared when copy/pasting, because in this case absolute paths arenused by the map in the clipboard.nnCloses #1736n
Tiled Fusion: Made dots on splitter handle DPI-aware
Add dtiled to libraries doc section (#1739)

docs: Added a page about the various export formatsTiled supports a lot of export formats, some of which with a bunch ofncustom options and most with restrictions. This page aims to give annoverview.n

C++11: Modernized the RandomPickerReplaced rand() with std::default_random_engine and usednstd::uniform_real_distribution to generate random float or doublennumbers. Also made the real type a template parameter, to avoid somenimplicit float / double conversion warnings.n

Tweaked the New Map dialogThe radio buttons make it more obvious that there is a choice betweennfixed-size maps and infinite maps, and that the width and height fieldsnare only relevant for fixed-size maps.n
Fixed the state of the New Map dialog in case last map was infiniteThe Infinite radio button would fail to get checked.n

Fixed up initial dock widget configuration* Hide Wang Sets and Templates viewn* Make Properties view width adjust to DPIn* Increase default width of Tilesets view and Tile Stamps viewn* Group some views togethernnMakes the initial setup a lot less overwhelming / messy.n

docs: Updated the page about using the Terrain toolVery nice was also that I could remove a bunch of warnings at the end,nsince external tilesets can now be edited and the terrain overlays nownsupport isometric maps.nnCloses #1606n

docs: Updated version and other minor changesThe version has been updated to 1.1.0, to match the upcoming Tilednrelease. The manual already largely covers the new features in thisnrelease.nnMentions of Tiled versions 0.10 and older have been removed, on thengrounds that this version is old enough that such information is nonlonger useful. This excludes the TMX changelog of course.nnAdded a link to the GameMaker: Studio 1.4 export from the libraries andnframeworks page.n
Made files non-executable

GmxPlugin: Added support for setting scale and origin for instancesThe scale of instances was already determined automatically for tilenobjects, but now it can also be manually specified or overridden usingnthe custom properties 'scaleX' and 'scaleY'.nnIt is now also possible to specify the origin of the object using customnproperties 'originX' and 'originY'. These will affect the position of thenexported instance, taking into account the rotation of the object asnwell as its flipped state.nnCloses #1427n

GmxPlugin: Handle custom property inheritanceNow, object properties like scaleX, scaleY, originX, originY and alsonall properties that can be set on view objects, are inherited for tilenobjects, as well as for objects with a type (or have a type inheritednfrom their tile) and finally also from object templates.nnThis is essentially what you would expect, since those same values arendisplayed in the Properties view.n
docs: Document the new GameMaker export features

Fixed a problem with using Terrain Brush on infinite mapsThere was still an intersection with the size of the current layernremaining, that was no longer necessary and was causing the tool not tonwork properly on infinite maps.n
Fixed capturing of terrain on infinite mapsIt was still doing a no longer needed 'contains' check before looking atnthe cell under the mouse.n

Extend the scene rect as needed for infinite mapsThis fixes the most serious issue with infinite maps, which was that itnwas impossible to scroll towards newly painted area using the scrollnbars. It also fixes the size of the dark rectangle used to highlight thencurrent layer.nnIt does however introduce a new most serious issue, which is that thenupdating of the scene rect is interfering with the tools due to itncausing a shift in the map view. There is also something wrong with thenundo for the lines that may be drawn as a result of the shift.n

Fixed crash that could happen when painting outside current boundsWhen painting outside of the current bounds, the bounds of an infinitenmap will immediately increase. This currently causes the MapView tonimmediately shift, which causes another mouse event that causes anothernpaint operation. That invalidated a local pointer.nnTo avoid such problems, even when we may later find a way to avoid thenshifting of the view, the local pointer is now a strong reference.n

Fixed the view shifting when expanding an infinite mapThis change improves the behavior of the flexible scrollbars (whichnallow panning over the edge of the map) and changes the map view tonalways include a margin, to avoid the forced centering of the map.nnFor infinite maps, this avoids the shifting of the view when expandingnthe map, which interfered with the painting of tiles and caused problemsnwith the undo system due to generated mouse events happening while stillnhandling the actual mouse events.nnI'm quite happy with the current behavior, and I think it makes thenzooming work well enough that it could be made the default mouse wheelnbehavior (instead of requiring Ctrl).nnCloses #1727n
Changes to Wheel Zoom Option
Some tweaks to the mouse wheel zoom optionAlso made zooming with the mouse wheel without Control modifier enablednby default.nnCloses #1472n
Fixed mini-map rectangle and interactionWas broken by the extending of the scene rect for the map view. Now thenmini-map gets the scene rect directly from the map scene.n

Extended the --export-map command-line option* The source file can now be any readable format, not just TMX files.n* The target file can now be a TMX file as well.nnMost notably, this makes --export-map useful for those using JSON mapsnand for converting files to TMX format.n

docs: Small update to the reference regarding tmxparser

Fixed crash on startupAvoid the DocumentManager dependency in the NoEditorWidget constructor.nIt crashed due to infinite recursion, because the DocumentManagernconstructs a NoEditorWidget in its constructor.nnCloses #1819n

Refer to templates by file nameThis change removes the template group file and the related templatenID system. Instead, each template is stored in its own file. Templateninstances refer to the template by the file name. This greatlynsimplifies the system while providing almost the same functionality,nsince templates can still be grouped using folders.nnThe ObjectTemplateModel was rewritten based on QFileSystemModel.nnThe GidMapper now uses strong tileset references, to avoid tilesetsnloaded as part of templates getting deleted too soon due to the lack ofnanother strong reference.n
docs: Updated with recent changes to object templatesAnimations not updated yet, will wait with that until things arenfinalized for release.n

Fixed two compiler warnings* warning: C4805: '|' : unsafe mix of type 'int' and type 'bool' in operationn* warning: C4805: '!=' : unsafe mix of type 'QFlags<Qt::KeyboardModifier>::Int' and type 'bool' in operationn

Fixed QVariantMap-destructor related linker errorSomehow there was a problem with both tiled.dll and json.cpp.objndefining the destructor of QVariantMap on MSVC 2013:nntiled.lib(tiled.dll) : error LNK2005: public: __cdecl QMap<class QString,class QVariant>::~QMap<class QString,class QVariant>(void) (??1?$QMap@VQString@@VQVariant@@@@QEAA@XZ) already defined in json.cpp.objnjson.dll : fatal error LNK1169: one or more multiply defined symbols foundnnAvoided by making sure no QVariantMap needs to be destructed in thenJSON plugin, which unfortunately meant reverting back to the custom JSONnparsing and writing code, as opposed to using QJsonDocument.n

GmxPlugin: Added 1000000 to default layer depth of tilesTechnically this adds 999999 since so far the bottom-most layer usedn1 whereas it now uses 1000000.nnAlso documented this behavior and the related depth custom property.nnCloses #1814n

AppVeyor: Build Windows installer in second stepThere is currently a problem where the dependencies of the Windowsninstaller are not always being built before the installer itself.nTry to avoid this by first building the standard products and buildingnthe installer in a second step.nnIssue #1820n

AppVeyor: Take the 7-zip archive from the itch versionThe difference is that the version number is the date and the Sparklenupdate check is disabled, which is exactly what we want also for then7-zip archive.n

Travis CI: Tweaked the push to itch for macOS snapshotsPreviously the archive pushed to itch did not extract to a directory with .appnextension, which doesn't work correctly regarding launching the app and showingnthe right icon. Hopefully this way it works better.n
Qbs: Fix the clever hack for the Windows installer dependenciesThanks to @jakepetroulesnnCloses #1820n

Fixed crash when clicking a non-template file in the Templates viewIf a template failed to load, it would return the dummy ObjectTemplateninstance which doesn't have an object. This dummy should probably nevernbe returned from the ObjectTemplateModel, so now it will return nullptrnin this case instead.nnCloses #1823n

Made the Wang tools take into account tile probabilitySo far they only took into account the probability set on the color, butntiles also have a probability.n
Wang brush: Fixed an issue with painting in negative coordinate spaceThe tileLocalPoint would go negative, which made it choose the wrongnposition adjustment or direction.n
Start with current color when picking the Wang colorNot convenient when the color picker starts out with no color.n

Added file-related context menu actions in two placesIn the Templates view and the Tilesets view, the following file-relatednactions are now available in the context menu:nn* Copy File Pathn* Open Containing Folder...n

Don't forget original map size when disabling infinite mapTake the original map size as a minimum size. If the user really wants ansmaller map, there are crop actions for that.nnAlso fixed the updating of the enabled state of the Autocrop actionsnwhen toggling whether a map is infinite.nnCloses #1832n
doc: Documented the <grid> elementAlso added this and some other missing things to the JSON documentationn(though it's still far from complete).nnCloses #1687n
docs: Removed outdated warningWhile the manual isn't 100% complete, it is no longer in the process ofnbeing moved from the wiki and is already the place to refer to.n
Ignore generated doctreesNot actually sure what these are, but I'm positive they shouldn't benchecked in.n
Report errors in images referenced by template tilesetsAnd allow opening those tilesets so that the error can be fixed.n
docs: Added initial documentation about the Python pluginIssue #1760n
docs: Fixed warning to actually show upWas missing a colon.n
Reduced dependency on MapScene in EditPolygonToolThis is change is part of preparing for larger changes to the MapScenenclass, in order to enable showing multiple maps.n
Reduced dependency on MapScene in RaiseLowerHelperThis is change is part of preparing for larger changes to the MapScenenclass, in order to enable showing multiple maps.n
Reduced dependency on MapScene in ObjectSelectionToolThis is change is part of preparing for larger changes to the MapScenenclass, in order to enable showing multiple maps.n
Removed no longer used set of selected object items from MapScene

Moved most functionality of MapScene to the new MapItemThis graphics item should eventually enable the map view to shownmultiple maps. For now this is just a refactoring, the functionalitynshould be exactly the same.nnThis change does also appear fix a repaint issue, by scheduling updatesnin response to tile layer changes on the layer item instead of thenscene.n
Fixed compile with MSVC 2013It chokes on the use of [[clang::fallthrough]].n
Use Q_FALLTHROUGH, with compatibility header from KDevelopIt also comes with qAsConst, which will be useful as well.n

Fixed highlight current layer not darkening at 200%There was something preventing the QGraphicsItem used to darken thenlayers below the current layer from being painted, when the view wasnzoomed to 200%.nnI've reduced the size of the darkening rectangle such that it showsncorrectly even at maximum zoom level (25600%).n
Allow fixing broken tileset reference inside template (#1831)* Added Locate Tileset button to templates dockrn* Added broken links support for tileset references inside templates

Fixed strange problem with inconsistent template pathsUse QFileInfo::absoluteFilePath instead of QFileInfo::filePath, becausenthe latter could return a string starting with //, which resulted innthe same template getting loaded twice.n
Enable exporting of tilesets to Lua (#1835)Closes #1213rn
Travis CI: Specify tag_name in GitHub deploymentMay avoid issues with duplicate draft entries.n
Added action to reset to default window layout (#1809)Closes #1794
Bumped version to 1.1.0 and updated NEWS.md file

Relaxed assertion on tile stamps in light of upcoming changesThis makes it a little less annoying to switch between branches.nOtherwise debug builds hit this assertion on startup as soon as you havensaved a multi-layer stamp from the wip/multi-layer branch.n
Fixed some issues with translatable strings* Q_OBJECT macro needed to have the right context for 'tr'n* QT_TR_NOOP can't be used out of context (needs QT_TRANSLATE_NOOP)n

Prevent setting tiles from embedded tilesets on object templatesThis causes the template file to be saved with an embedded tileset,nduplicating all its meta-data. It is not a supported scenario.n
docs: Added Panda 2 to the list of HTML5 game enginesAlso sorted this list by name and fixed a broken link.n

Made Delete and Backspace keys work for deleting terrain typesAlso made Backspace work for deleting layers, in addition to Delete.nThis is done because especially users on macOS may expect that to work.nnCloses #1841n

Fixed potential crash when zooming out too muchProbably only affected users who enabled OpenGL mode. Limit the size ofnthe batches to avoid a crash. Apparently Qt is going over some limitninternally without splitting up the batch as needed.nnCloses #1824n

Fixed potential crash after deleting layers* When deleting an object layer, there remained some roaming pointers ton  related object items that could cause a crash later on.nn* When deleting a group layer, roaming pointers would remain to layern  items and object items created for any child layers.n

Automapping: Don't fail if an input/inputnot layer isn't foundInstead of immediately failing if an input or inputnot layer is notnfound, it now checks against an empty dummy layer. This behavior is morenintuitive.nnPart of issue #1520n

Automapping: Simplified and optimized the code somewhatThese changes were done while adding a StrictEmpty mode, but I'm notnconvinced adding that mode is the right approach. Still, I think thencode is a little simpler now.n
Automapping: Fixed compile for Qt < 5.8Small syntax error.n
Automapping: Small moving of codeJust changing the order so that no forward declaration is needed for thenlocal static function.n

Automapping: Added a StrictEmpty flag to input layersIn StrictEmpty mode, empty tiles in the input region match empty tilesnin the set layer. So when an input layer contains an empty tile withinnthe input region, this means an empty tile is allowed at that location.nAnd when an inputnot layer contains an empty tile within the inputnregion, it means an empty tile is not allowed at that location.nnWithout the StrictEmpty option, when no input layer specifies anyntile for a given location, and no inputnot layers exist, any tile thatnisn't used elsewhere on any input layer is considered valid. Also, whennan inputnot layer contains an empty tile, it is simply ignored. Thisnbehavior can be convenient, but it is not always desired.nnThe StrictEmpty mode can be enabled per input layer by adding a customnboolean property named StrictEmpty with the value true.nnSee also the following discussion on the forum:nhttp://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/automapping-check-for-empty-tile/965n

Tweaked code to avoid C++ compatibility warningsThis code worked with GCC, clang and even MSVC, but clang points out itnis relying on an extension to the standard. There is no real reason tonnot just name the type.nnwarning: anonymous structs are a GNU extensionnwarning: anonymous types declared in an anonymous union are an extensionn

Updated Dutch translationAlso made some small updates to the German translation.n
Another NEWS.md file update for Tiled 1.1

Take draw margins into account when calculating the scene rectThis fixes problems zooming in on parts of tiles that extend far beyondnthe boundaries of the map. This most commonly happens when editingncollision shapes of tiles that are much larger than a grid cell.n

Improved polygon node handles* Highlight hovered handlen* Round instead of squaren* Adjust to the DPIn* Don't use SizeAllCursor, since it makes it hard to do precisen  adjustmentsn* 40% easier to hitn
Minor polygon node dragging improvements* Reduced the start drag distance to make moving more responsive.n* Reset the start position to avoid the jump when starting to move.n

Support Alt and Shift modifiers in the Edit Polygons tool* When some nodes are selected, Alt + Drag forces a move of the existingn  selection. It avoids accidentally starting to drag another node.nn* Shift + Drag forces a selection rectangle, regardless of whether an  node was clicked (which would normally start dragging that node).n

Fixed Object Selection tool clearing selection on double-clickSince the double-click event was not being handled by the map scene, thentools only received the mouse release event. This caused the ObjectnSelection tool to clear the selection after a double-click.nnNow the double-click event is handled and delivered to the active tool.nCurrently, it's always routed to the press event, which fixes thenselection problem. In the future we could consider doing other onndouble-click, like switching to the Edit Polygons tool when double-nclicking a polygon.n
Hopefully final NEWS.md update for Tiled 1.1
Translations: capitalize WangSince it refers to a name.n
Updated Bulgarian translation(pulled from Transifex)n
docs: Added the new Shape Fill toolAlso added a separator between the filling modes and the stampntransformation actions.n
docs: Small tweaks
Fixed many float/double conversion warningsMostly changed things from float to qreal, which is what Qt usesnin its API, which is always double on the desktop.n
Flare plugin: Small float -> double adjustmentIn Tiled, object position and size is double, so it makes no sense tonapply float limits on loading.n
Lua plugin: Micro-optimizationIn most cases we know the needed memory for the escaped strings, sonpre-allocate this amount.n

Tile Collision Editor: Only allow editing of object propertiesThe properties of the (hidden) object layer containing the collisionnobjects can no longer be changed.nnThere was hardly a use-case for this, and it was confusing that togglingnthe Tile Collision Editor would cause the Properties view to no longerndisplay the properties of the selected tile.n
NEWS.md updated with Tiled 1.1 release date

Qbs: Enable compiling against Sparkle on macOSWhile compiling and linking is working, the solution isn't complete because thenSparkle.framework is not copied to the Tiled.app. I couldn't get that part tonwork with Qbs, so it needs to be done manually when doing a release.n
Fixed crash on load for template instances of non-tile objectsWhen loading a map with a template instance of a template that is not antile object, a null-pointer was dereferenced.nnCloses #1844n

Qbs: Fixed linking on Linux and install Sparkle.frameworkSetting 'cpp.frameworks' on Linux broke linking, so make sure to only use thatnon macOS.nnAlso, now Sparkle.framework is properly installed into the Tiled.app. Thenreason I previously was having problems with this was due to the automaticallynapplied file tags. Now the file tags are explicitly cleared to make sure thenfiles are only copied over. Thanks to @jakepetroules as always for his help.n
Travis CI: Updated to Qt 5.9.3

Windows Installer: Include the SVG image pluginAnd the QtSvg DLL upon which it depends. This plugin was already includednin the snapshots, but for some reason forgotten for the installer.nnCloses #1847n

Fix return in Tileset::orientationToString (#1846)This part should not be reached in theory.rnLet's return an empty QString anyways to be on the save side and to makernthe compiler happy.rnrnFixes 'Program returns random data in a function'.
Tile Collision Editor: Keep tile centered when resizing view
Tile Collision Editor: Display tool info text in status barEnables for example the display of hovered coordinates.n
Simplified stamp creation in WangBrush::updateBrushDue to TileLayer now allocating cells on demand, there is no need toncalculate the needed size of the stamp in advance.n
Tile Animation Editor: Allow changing duration of multiple frames (#1784)Also, the default frame duration can now be changed and is persistent across sessions.rnrnSee issue #1310.rnrnCloses #1330

Fix a few bugs in libtiled-java (#1840) * Make sure the properties of MapLayer is not nullrn * Prevent MapObject's from being added twice (once manually, once with JXB)rn * Don't need to read properties again (already read with JXB)rn * Null-pointer issues with MapLayer.getBounds if x/y coordinate is nullrn * Null-pointer issues when accessing objects list in ObjectGroup classrn * Add getProperty overload in Property class to allow a default valuern * Fix image loading issue in TMXMapReader when loading from an InputStream.rn   Apparently this function was setting `xmlPath` to a url, not a path.rn * Add code to write object group attributes (previously it was completelyrn   omitted). A writeLayerAttributes method was added to write common attributesrn   in both a tile-layer and object-group.rn * Fix writing of offsetx and offsety attributes.rn

Fixed possible crash while editing polygonsWhen the 'Edit Polygons' tool was deselected while hovering a polygonnhandle, it could crash after selecting the tool again.nnReason was that it did not unset the hovered handle after deleting allnhandles, leaving a dangling pointer.n

Allows extending of the polyline (#1683)Extending can be done by right-clicking the nodes on either end of a polyline.rnrnImplementation finished by @bjorn:rn* Fixed new polylines being drawn backwards after extending firstrn* Fixed extending polyline other than the one just createdrn* Enabled switching between tools using the ToolManagerrn* Fixed behavior when switching tools while extending a polylinernrnThe selection is cleared while extending a polyline. There shouldn't rnactually be a reason to touch the selection at all, but currently thernselection outline does not update as expected while extending arnpolyline.rnrnIssue #157.

Added option to show object labels for hovered objectsIt works, but I kept it off by default since it seems mostly annoying tonme. This change can also be the basis of more helpful highlighting ofnthe hovered object (issue #1190).n
Simplified codeLess dealing with MapObjectItem where we just need a MapObjectnreference.n

Handle Escape for all object tools* In Edit Polygons tool, Escape now clears the handle selection, orn  the object selection when there is no handle selection, or switchesn  to the Select Objects tool when there is no object selection either.nn* For all create object tools, Escape now switches to the Selectn  Objects tool.nn* For the Select Objects tool, Escape now clears the selection.n

Double-clicking on a polygon switches to Edit Polygons toolAlso double-clicking on polylines of course. This is a useful and fastnway of entering edit mode for polygons.nnPressed Escape in the Edit Polygons tool no longer clears the objectnselection. It now first switches to the Select Objects tool, wherenanother press will clear the selection. I think this is a little morenuseful and it works nicer in combination with this double-clicknbehavior.n
Templates view: Keep template centered when resizing view

Edit Polygons: Implemented interaction with segments* You can now select two handles of a segment by clicking the segmentn* Context menu also works on segmentsn* You can drag a segment directly to move the two segmentsnnIssue #157n
Edit Polygons: Double-clicking a segment insert a new pointThe new point can be immediately dragged away without releasing thenmouse button.nnCloses #157nCloses #1705n
libtiled-java: Fixed tile offset value not being considered (#1863)Fixed reading and used the value when drawing in orthogonal and isometric view.
Switch to tile stamp on pressThis fixes the little annoying problem, that you could not switch to antile stamp that was already selected, without first selecting andifferent one.n
Travis CI: Skip some unnecessary install steps for QbsWe just need Qbs for building Tiled.n

Fixed tools not being up to date on modifier keys after activationAlways call modifiersChanged after activating a tool, so that tools willnalso know when there is no modifier key pressed. Previously, when one ofnthe tile selection tools was deactivated while holding a modifier key,nthen the selection mode would still be affected after switching back tonthis tool without having any modifier keys pressed.n

Fixed hang when loading map file with empty layer dataSuch a map file is invalid, but it shouldn't cause a hang.nnIt did also affect valid JSON maps saved when using the new infinitenoption. It will now no longer hang, but layer data will still fail tonload. That'll be fixed next.n

JSON plugin: Fixed reading of infinite mapsIn change fca34d6ad4d1216a31bdbf757749aa3505bca9e8 I forgot to alsonadjust the VariantToMapConverter to handle chunked tile layer data,nprobably because I based those changes on the earlier adaption of thenLua format, which did not have a reader. This obviously causes problemsnfor those who use the JSON not only for exporting.nnThe JSON reader is now also capable of:nn* Reading non-infinite maps that use the chunked data format.n* Reading infinite maps that do not use the chunked data format.nnThis may not be very useful right now since whether chunked data formatnis used directly depends on whether the map is infinite or not, but innthe future this may change since the chunked format can also benpreferable for non-infinite maps.nnCloses #1858n

JSON plugin: Improved the JSON format (#1868)The tiles in a tileset are now stored as an array instead of as an rnobject. Previously the tile IDs were stored as string keys of therntiles object, now they are stored as id property of each tilernobject.rnrnSimilarly, the properties are now stored as an array instead of as an rnobject where the property names were the keys. Each property in thernarray is now an object that stores the name, type and value of thernproperty.rnrnThese changes should make the JSON format a lot easier to parse with rncertain JSON APIs. It avoids cases where the JSON format containedrnobjects that had no well defined set of members.rnrnThe version was bumped from 1.0 to 1.2.rnrnCloses #1585
docs: Adjusted JSON format to last-minute changetile -> idn
Avoid some floating point type conversions

Revert Tile Animation Editor: Allow changing duration of multiple frames (#1784)This reverts commit 7971fa87696d2965c1d6a44822fbca1ee1068223.nnThat change was not supposed to be done on the 1.1 branch, which is innstring freeze.n
Templates view: Keep template centered when resizing view
libtiled-java: Fixed tile offset value not being considered (#1863)Fixed reading and used the value when drawing in orthogonal and isometric view.
Bumped version to 1.1.2 and updated NEWS.md filePlanning release for tomorrow.n
Merge branch '1.1'Not merged (due to revert):nn  src/tiled/tileanimationeditor.cppn  src/tiled/tileanimationeditor.hn  src/tiled/tileanimationeditor.uin
Fixed Offset Map action for infinite mapsWhen used without selection it would clip the map to its boundaries,nwhich is not expected in case of infinite maps.nnCloses #1866n
Merge branch '1.1'
Avoid more compiler warningsThis code should never be reached, but this avoids a warning whenncompiling with GCC.n

Python plugin: Fixed issues generating Python binding codeAdded copy constructors where needed for the code generation to worknwith pybindgen 0.18.0 (somehow it worked with pybindgen 0.17.0 withoutnthese, maybe the check is new).nnSee pull request #1867n
Travis CI: Updated to Qt 5.9.4

Python plugin: Fixed issues generating Python binding codeAdded copy constructors where needed for the code generation to worknwith pybindgen 0.18.0 (somehow it worked with pybindgen 0.17.0 withoutnthese, maybe the check is new).nnSee pull request #1867nn(cherry picked from commit da9ba8f0c7138850b7c2b9b23e6544d0705a94ae)n

JSON plugin: Fixed loading of infinite mapsThe change 92875ab4fc77407a89e6f011b734d84718c14cd3, while fixing somenthings, still left an issue where loading an infite map in JSON formatnwould cause the chunks to get spaced out. This was due to the chunknlocation being taken into account twice while loading.nnCloses #1878n

Fixed crash when removing a tileset referenced by multiple objectsWhen removing a tileset that is still referenced by multiple (tile)nobjects, a crash could occur due to an iterator getting invalidated.nnThis change also fixes removal of tileset references for maps usingngrouped layers. Previously only references in top-level layers werenconsidered.n

Fixed Invert Selection for non-infinite mapsIt would generally cause a smaller or larger area than the map to getnselected, since it was based on the allocated bounds of a tile layerninstead of its defined size.n
Avoid selecting objects from locked layers when using Select All
Merge branch '1.1'

Fixed TileLayer::usedTilesetsDue to a scoping issue its behavior was rather strange. For an evennnumber of chunks, the returned tilesets would be the old set withnpotentially some new tilesets added. For an odd number of chunks, nonenof the tilesets used by even chunks would get counted.nnThis bug could lead to assertions, rendering issues and potentiallyncrashes. It was a regression introduced in fb8c380842915895c48549b0.n
Fixed potential crash on pasteWhen the pasted map contained more than one tileset that wasn't yet partnof the current map, a null pointer dereference would occur.n

Tweaked logic of finding similar tilesetsIf multiple similar tilesets exist in an automapping input or in a savedntile stamp, replace all of them with the first one.nnPreviously, in this case the current map would have multiple similarntilesets added to it, since for each of them it would only look fornsimilar tilesets within the set of existing ones.nnThis also unifies the logic of the unifyTilesets overrides after changen0b0921398989964ad43fb62c4941.n
Merge branch '1.1'

Enabled multi-selection in the Layers viewDisplays current layer in bold now, and allows selecting multiplenlayers. The list of selected layers is set on the MapDocument, butncurrently not used anywhere.n

Highlight selected layers instead of the current oneIt's a little confusing that the current layer is not necessarily anselected one. We may need to make sure that it is always one of thenselected layers, rather than synchronizing it strictly with the currentnindex in the Layers view.n

Enable multi-layer editing in the Stamp Brush* The Stamp Brush now captures from all selected layers on right-clickn  drag, creating a multi-layer stamp.n* In case of a multi-layer stamp, a multi-layer preview brush is built.n* The brush preview can now visualize multiple tile layers.n* The paint operation can now handle multiple layers, including to mergen  the undo commands.n* When painting multiple layers, the target layers are matched by name.n  New layers are created when no layers with the given name exist yet.nnWhile this is good progress, it's still only the start since many otherntools as well as many actions should still be adapted to handlenmultiple selected layers.nnIssue #282n

Fixed undo issues when layers and/or tilesets get added while paintingWhen a paint command gets merged into a previous paint command, it isndeleted along with its children. This is a problem now that we may mergencommands that have child commands for adding necessary layers and/orntilesets.nnCommands that may appear as children of commands that may be mergednshould implement the new ClonableUndoCommand interface, which allowsnthem to be cloned as children of the previous command in case ofnmerging.n
Enabled multi-layer erasing of tiles
Made the Offset Map action work with multiple selected layers
Made Select All work for all selected layersAlso changed Select None to always clear both tile and object selection,nregardless of the currently selected layer(s).n

Implemented multi-layer cut/copy/paste/delete* Copy now copies all selections:n  - Selected objects.n  - The selected tile area for each selected tile layer.nn* Paste now pastes both tiles (to the active stamp) and objects (to then  selected object layer, if any).nn* Paste in Place also works, creates layers when pasting multiple tilen  layers and some layers could not be found (same behavior as whenn  drawing with a multi-layer stamp).nn* Cut/Delete removes all selected objects and tile selection on alln  selected tile layers. These actions are blocked when any selected tilen  layer is locked.n
Unduplicate the multi-layer painting codeThis is a tricky bit of code that's not nice to sit duplicatednbetween the Paste in Place and Stamp Brush code.n
Fixed compile against Qt 5.6
Merge branch '1.1'
Added option to lock/unlock all other layers (#1883)Works similar to show/hide all other layers action.
AppVeyor: Updated builds to Qt 5.10 and Qbs 1.10
Disable API deprecated before Qt 5.7Fortunately, all usages of deprecated API were easy to fix up.n
Removed some data needlessly stored in each toolNow that each tool has a reference to its tool manager, it can get thenactive tile and object template from there.n
Enable warnings about using deprecated APIAlso removed QSignalMapper usages, which is deprecated since Qt 5.10nsince it can be replaced by C++11 lambdas.n
Removed some superfluous Qt version checksMinimum supported Qt version is Qt 5.6.n

Extended the functionality of the Create Polygon Tool* The Create Polygon and Create Polyline tools have been unified. Ton  create a polygon, you now have to close the shape explicitly byn  clicking on the first node.n* When the Create Polygon tool is selected, handles show at the ends ofn  selected polylines. Clicking these handles starts extending then  polylines from that end.n* While creating or extending a polyline, it is possible to connect itn  to an existing selected polyline by clicking on a handle at either end.nnA few bugs were fixed in the process:nn* Handle positions update as appropriate when undoing/redoing a changen  of layer offset.n* Extending a polyline is aborted when the polyline object is deletedn  or when a parent layer is removed (instead of crashing).n* Extending of a rotated polyline works as expected.n* Changes to a polyline that is currently being extended (for examplen  due to undo/redo) are handled correctly.n
Travis CI: Updated from Qt 5.9.4 to Qt 5.10.1

Objects view: Only center view on object on press or activationPreviously it would center the view on the selected objects as soon asnonly one object was selected. This caused the centering to happen atnunwanted events, like when removing the last object from a selection ornwhen joining two selected polylines.nnThis removes the opening of the Properties view when pressing Enter onnan object selected in the Objects view, which now centers on the objectninstead. I think this is not a bad change.n
Retain object order when copy/pastingThe same issue affected the Move Objects to Layer context menunaction and the Layer via Cut/Copy actions.nnCloses #1896n
Modernize appstream file- Use the current component formatn- Use recommended RDNS style app-idn- Add kudosn- Fix update contact and change to selfn
Rename data files to match app-id

Changed the default mouse wheel zoom settingTwo macOS trackpad users have noted that this setting makes for annannoying default behavior. Better leave it disabled until some solutionnto detect the device (mouse vs. trackpad) is found.n
Travis CI: Adjusted to .desktop file renameShould fix AppImage creation.n

Fixed setting of changed flag when flipping objectsRelated to issue #1895. However, it does not fix the whole problem,nsince in fact a gid can't be written for template objects that use antile from a tileset that isn't also part of the map.nnIn addition, there is a caching issue causing tilesets used by bothntemplates and the map to get loaded twice. This is why it currentlynwon't even work for loaded maps, even if the tileset used by thentemplate is part of the map as well.n
Fixed undo command name when changing flipped state in PropertiesThe command had an empty name.n

Removed manual reference counting of tilesetsRely on the QSharedPointer for the lifetime and add/remove tilesetsninstances from the TilesetManager directly from the Tileset class.nnThis fixes issues with tilesets getting loaded twice when they are usednby both a map and a template object, which happened as a result of thenmanual adding of references being too late.nnIn general this approach should also be more reliable and prevent doublenloading of tilesets in some cases.nnHelps with issue #1895 when the tileset used by the template is alsonpart of the map.n

Fixed repainting issues on undo/redo for new mapsWhen tilesets were added or removed from a map, the draw margins werennot invalidated as appropriate.nnThis meant the repainting issues would generally not occur when editingnexisting maps, since their draw margins were correctly calculated afternloading.nnCloses #1887n

Added support for showing multiple mapsCurrently it works as follows:nn* Load one or more world files. There are JSON files that need to ben  written manually for now.nn* When a map is opened, the scene asks the WorldManager which world then  map belongs to. If a world is found, the other maps from the world aren  loaded as well and shows in the same view, based on the positionn  specified in the world file.nn* The other maps are read-only. To edit them, they will need to be openedn  explicitly. In the future, more seamless editing could be implemented.nn* There is no way yet to quickly switch to another map in the same world,n  it still needs to be implemented.nnIssue #1669n
qmake: Fixed missing files in project
Fixed compile against Qt 5.6Be less fancy / optimal (Qt 5.6 has no QHash::erase that takes anconst_iterator).n

Adjust the map view boundaries to all maps in the viewEnables easy zooming in/out on any of the displayed maps, instead ofnjust the main one.nnAlso fixed updating the view in case tile animations are enabled andntiles in other displayed maps are animated.n
Made MapObject instances 16 bytes smallerMostly to reduce the amount of padding warnings.n
Add --export-tileset command line argument (#1872)

Fixed exporting of external tilesets to JSON or TSX formatsWhen you tried to export an external tileset to JSON or TSX format, itnwould export as a file with just a reference to the external tilesetnfile. Now it actually writes out the tileset like you would expect.nnThe File > Export As action only worked properly for the Lua format...n

libtiled-java: Fixed loading maps with multiple external tilesets

Fixed problem with embedding or exporting tilesets with Wang setsThe Wang sets were not cloned completely, missing their edge and cornerncolors. This would result in an invalid Wang set that would fail to load.nnSee http://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/tiled-fails-to-open-maps-with-embedded-tilesets/3040n

Some random cleanups* Pass shared pointer by const reference to avoid unnecessaryn  reference counting.nn* Removed explicit copy-constructor of Object, since the compiler willn  generate it by default.n
AppVeyor: Updated from Qt 5.10.0 to 5.10.1For some reason 5.10.0 was already removed, so builds are now failing...n
macOS: Fixed eye/lock icon display in Layers viewThis also slightly improves the clickability of the icons on Linux andnprobably Windows as well.n

AppVeyor: Updated from Qt 5.10.0 to 5.10.1For some reason 5.10.0 was already removed, so builds are now failing...nn(cherry picked from commit 8d342bd2ec1e3e0439075e27d08d3202ad209b1c)n

Added snapcraft.yamlThis snapcraft.yaml builds a snap for Tiled 1.0.3. That's the best Incould do for the moment, because more recent versions of Tiled require anmore recent version of Qt (5.6) than is available on Ubuntu 16.04n(5.5.1).nnBuilding a more recent version of Qt as a depencency is apparentlyndoable, but would increase the building time and maintenance for thensnap considerably. It is probably easier to patch up Tiled to buildnagainst Qt 5.5.1 again.nnAnother open task is to use qbs instead of qmake to build the snap. Anplugin for this is already available so that shouldn't be a huge issue.nnFinally, the Python plugin doesn't work for now, since I did not knownhow to set it up so that it can find its libraries.n
Indicate Tiled can open multiple files at once%f indicates that the program in question cannot handle multiple filenarguments, whereas %F can be a list of files. Tiled can open a list ofnfiles.n
Lowered the minimum supported version of Qt to 5.5Ubuntu 16.04 LTS uses Qt 5.5.1. Not requiring a more recent version ofnQt greatly simplifies the building of a snap package.n
Merge branch '1.1'Conflicts:nt.travis.ymlntsrc/tiled/layerdock.cppn
Build the snap from local source
Several small code quality improvementsBased on looking at some warnings from cppcheck and Coverity.n
Re-enabled Space for toggling layer visibilityAlso added Ctrl+Space as shortcut for toggling whether the current layernis locked.nnThese shortcuts only work while the layer list is focused.n

World: Added support for file name pattern matchingA pattern can define a regular expression, which needs to have twoncaptures to capture the X and Y values. It can then apply multipliersnand an offset to these values to derive the position of the map.nnAll files in the same directory as the .world that match against thenregular expression are considered part of that world.n

libtiled: Introduced an ImageCacheThis cache stores loaded images and the tiles that have been cut fromnthem, to avoid loading them again and again.nnOne problem with the cache currently is that when a tileset is loadednand then closed, the image file is no longer monitored for changes. Sonwhen the image is changed and then the tileset is opened again, thenoutdated cached version will be used. To avoid this problem, a timestampncould be saved.n

World: Added an option to show only adjacent mapsThis makes the feature usable with large worlds. Only adjacent maps willnbe shown, which doesn't provide an overview over the entire world butnstill allows making sure the map borders line up correctly.n
Add an application icon to the snap package

Fixed click to toggle layer to visible or unlockedWith recent versions of Qt this code worked fine, but with Qt 5.5.1ntrying to get the Qt::CheckState out of the QVariant always resulting innQt::Unchecked. Switch back to the static cast from int.nnThis bug affected the snap package.n
Merge branch '1.1'
Updated README.md for clarity and concision (#1914)Reworded the README.md file for clarity and concision. All original information was maintained.

Migrate properties set on tile collision layer to the tileSince Tiled 1.1, it is no longer possible to edit the properties of thisnimplicit object group, but some users may have set them in previousnversions. Migrating the properties to the tile seems like a helpfulnthings to do in this case.nnCloses #1912n

Fixed tiles placed by the terrain tool being considered differentTiles placed by the terrain tool have a hidden checked flag set, whichncaused those tiles to be considered different for tools like the bucketnfill, magic wand and select same tile, as well as causing Automappingnrules to not match for such tiles.nnThe hidden checked flag is now ignored when comparing cells.nnCloses #1913n
Automapping: Apply rules to selected area when there is oneSuggested on the forum and seems like a sensible thing to do.nnSee http://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/selective-automapping/3093n
Automapping: Report error when no output layers are foundA rules map without output layers makes as little sense as a rules mapnwith no input layers.n
docs: Grammar fixes (#1909)

Fixed text alignment values appearing at random in Properties viewForgot to remove the property from the alignment values map when it wasnbeing uninitialized. When this roaming pointer was re-used by anothernproperty, it caused the alignment value to be returned as its displayntext.nnCloses #1767n
Bumped version to 1.1.4 and updated NEWS.md file
Merge branch '1.1'

Don't reset stamp brush state when pressing AltThis way, Alt can be used to toggle the scrolling direction withoutninterrupting a Paint or Capture operation.nnAlso, while drawing lines or circles, pressing Alt no longer resetsnthe state when a start or mid point was already set.nnSee https://twitter.com/Lanbobyonson/status/978015338582376448n
Merge branch '1.1'
Updated automated builds to use Qbs 1.11Fixed the macOS build on Travis, which was already using 1.11 from brewnand thus broken due to a change in the command-line for choosing thenbuild config.n

Fixed erasing mode of the Terrain BrushRegression introduced in b3e461ba3629789b506a93b791eb2a1d03c8f193, whichncaused the checked boolean to be ignored in the cell comparisonsn(which is generally desired, except here).nnReported at http://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/deleting-terrain-with-the-terrain-tool-no-longer-works-in-newest-patch/3118/1n
Merge branch '1.1'
docs: JSON format documentation updatesMany updates and fixes, but this documentation is still not complete.nnCloses #1924n

Fixed crash after editing a templateA crash could occur when switching the selected file in the Templatesndock after editing a template.nnThis was happening due to a signal not getting disconnected in time,nleading to a null pointer dereference.n
Switch current layer when clicked in objects dock view (#1931)

Fixed rendering of eye/lock icons in Layers view* The selection was getting rendered on top of part of the icon, whichn  was especially noticeable since Qt 5.9.3.nn* Since Qt 5.9.3, the QHeaderView::minimumSectionSize was gettingn  applied, which had a default that was larger than the desired size forn  the icon sections. So now we also set this.n

JSON plugin: Made the reader more strictAn object was always considered a point or ellipse when a membernwith this name was present, regardless of its value. Now the value isnrequired to evaluate to true.nnFor polygons, polylines and text objects the type of the member is nownchecked in addition to its presence.nnCloses #1922n
QtPropertyBrowser: Removed unused private pointerSuppresses Clang compiler warning -Wunused-private-fieldn
Fixed object index when undoing Move Object to Layer actionCloses #1932n

Fixed compile against development version of QtQAction is included in the generated ui_noeditorwidget.h file, but itnisn't used there and may have been removed in the development version ofnQt. Better add an explicit include.n

Fixed shortcuts for flipping and rotating objectsThis was an unintended regression in Tiled 1.1.0. Due to moving thenplace where the shortcuts were defined, they only worked for tile stampsnand no longer worked for the Select Objects tool.nnNow there flipping and rotating actions are also added to the tool barnfor all object-related tools.nnThe fix became rather involved, because I wanted to avoid doing virtualnfunction calls in the constructors of the tools.nnA downside of setting the shortcuts on the menu bar actions is that theyndon't work when the menu bar is hidden. The same is true for any suchnactions at the moment. Maybe it makes sense to implement a genericnsolution to this, as was done for the shortcuts to the tools themselves.nnCloses #1926n

Show/hide columns using QTreeView APIMakes our code a little shorter. Unfortunately, it does not help to fixnissue #1928. But that will be fixed by updating (or downgrading) the Qtnversion, since it was a regression introduced in Qt 5.10.1 / 5.9.4.n
Fixed dynamic retranslation of tools and tool actionsWas broken in Tiled 1.0 by an unfinished refactoring.n

Improved fill behavior in case of selection on infinite mapIn case of having an area selected on an infinite map, the Bucket Fillntool will now allow filling the selection regardless of the currentlynallocated chunks of the layer.nnCloses #1921n

Hide the Visible property for tile collision objectsOnce a tile collision object has been made invisible there is currentlynno way to restore it. Better disable the ability to hide objects, atnleast until some other way to interact with hidden objects is added.nnCloses #1929n

Remove tile collision layer along with the last objectWhen removing the last collision shape, an empty objectgroup elementnwould stay behind in the saved file. Since this is not desired, it isnnow removed when all collision objects are deleted.nnI've experimented a little bit with using std::unique_ptr forncommunicating pointer ownership in this change. It became rather morenverbose and I don't believe any bug is fixed, but the ownershipntransfers are clearer now.nnCloses #1230n
docs: Tweaks to pages about terrains and Wang tiles
docs: Go a little more in-depth about the process of marking cornersCloses #570n

Large cleanup of WangSet and WangColor related code* A lot of Wang set index and Wang color index arguments were changed ton  WangSet or WangColor pointer arguments. This generally simplified then  code.nn* TilesetDocument now owns the WangColorModel instances, which aren  created on-demand. This resolves issues with undo commands, whichn  previously relied on the single WangColorModel instance owned by then  WangDock to refer to the right WangSet instance. Undo/redo aftern  selecting a different Wang set would misbehave or crash.nnThis refactoring is a preparation for fixing issue #1851.n

Adjust Wang tile data when tileset column count changesA change in the number of tile columns on a tileset image affects thentile indices. This means that when loading a map that was saved beforenthe size of the tileset image was changed, or when reloading an imagenwhile Tiled is open, we may need to adjust both map data and thenmeta-data stored with the tileset.nnThis already happened for most of the data, but not for any Wang tilenrelated data. This change implements that and partly resolvesnissue #1851.nnIt also fixes the test on whether to do the adjustment to also run whennjust the tileset file is opened, as opposed to opening a map that usesnthe tileset.nnThere is unfortunately still a problem when opening multiple maps thatnneed adjustment. In this case, the adjustment is only offered for thenfirst map. Fixing that will require adding more information to thentileset references in each map. Alternatively we could think aboutnchanging the tile indices entirely to make these adjustments no longernnecessary (for example, referring to the tiles by their x/y coordinate).n
Bumped version to 1.1.5 and updated NEWS.md file

Merge branch '1.1'Conflicts:ntsrc/libtiled/wangset.hntsrc/tiled/abstracttool.hntsrc/tiled/createmultipointobjecttool.hntsrc/tiled/createpolygonobjecttool.cppntsrc/tiled/createpolygonobjecttool.hntsrc/tiled/createpolylineobjecttool.cppntsrc/tiled/undocommands.cppn

Fixed broken shortcuts for toolsDue to the same shortcuts getting set on the original actions and thenQShortcut instances, they became ambiguous. This problem is now avoidednby narrowing the scope of the shortcut on the action.nnThis fixes a regression introduced in 687371657b911a5d976314471d6a5981.nnCloses #1937n
Fixed label in Templates view to be hidden by defaultIt caused an empty space below the tool bar until a template was opened.n

Fixed handling of sub-properties in Object Type EditorFor properties of type color, sub-properties are displayed for eachncolor channel. When editing these, there were new top-level propertiesnbeing added with the name of the sub-property. They showed up in thensaved file and in the Object Type Editor after a restart.nnThis was due to the property value changed handler getting called alsonfor these sub-properties, and not ignoring them as it should.nnCloses #1936n

Avoid crash when deleting an object right before dragging itWhen you start a drag operation by clicking an object, but press Deletento delete it before you move the mouse, the application would crash duento trying to use the deleted object.nnThis is now fixed by checking and clearing the roaming pointer to thenclicked object. The fix is not complete however, in that you could stillncause a roaming pointer by redoing the deletion of a layer that in turnndeletes the object. But that is rare and the fix is more complicated, sonI will fix that on master.nnCloses #1933n

JSON plugin: Ignore a data member of a tile layer when it is nullThis may help some people who are having problems avoiding the presencenof members due to the JSON library they are using.nnSee issue #1922n

JSON plugin: Added support for Wang setsDue to an oversight the Wang sets were silently ignored by the JSONnformat, which is a bad idea. The JSON format is meant to support allnTiled features.nnI've also added the new members to the JSON format documentation.n

Added unique persistent layer IDsEach layer now gets an ID that stays the same when the layer is moved ornrenamed. This can for example be used to associate external data withnthe layer.nnIt works the same way as the existing IDs for objects and tiles in imagencollection tilesets.nnCloses #1892n

Python plugin: Added support for Python 3The project files on longer have support for compiling against Python 2.nnAlso added MSVC 2017 support to the installer.n
Python plugin: Updated example scripts to Python 3
Python plugin: Forced sorting of pybindgen methodsSorting by name to try to keep them from moving around on eachnregeneration run.n

Python plugin: Fixed linking problems on Arch LinuxAnd probably fixed it on Ubuntu as well, with fallbacks to python-3.6nand python-3.4.nnThe problem on Arch Linux was that the -lpython-3.6m linker flag was innthe wrong place in the arguments, causing the Python plugin to notndynamically link to this library. This happens when directly passingnpkgConfigProbe.libs to cpp.linkerFlags.n

Python plugin: Fixed the MinGW buildAdded Qbs probe for finding the correct minor version for MingW.nnAlso removed the fallbacks to Python 3.6 and 3.4, since they are notnnecessary for a properly configured system (for example, on Ubuntuninstalling python3-dev pulls in the needed python3.pc file).n
docs: Minor adjustments for Python pluginNow uses Python 3.n

Python plugin: Fixed startup messages not appearing in debug consoleDelay loading of plugins until after the main window has been created,nto make sure the Debug Console is ready to log any messages.n

Python plugin: Fixed file change watching for main script filesWatch the actual script files in addition to the directory, which isnnecessary for the reload to work when using certain editors, likenSublime Text on Linux.nnNote that this does not watch any script files in subdirectories thatnthe scripts may depend on, so in that case the reload does not work yet.n
Fixed compile against Qt 5.5Compatibility needed because of the snap package.n

libtiled: Allow qrc-based tileset images (#1947)While irrelevant for the end users of Tiled as an application, thisrnallows those of us using Tiled as a library to have maps whose tilesetsrnare stored in resources.

Fixed terrain brush issue on staggered isometric mapsNeighbors can be two tiles away on a staggered map, which needs to bentaken into account when determining the bounds of the area to benprocessed by the terrain brush.nnCloses #1951n

Make sure deprecated Qt API is disabled for the plugins as wellThey missed the needed defines because of replacing them rather thannadding to it.nnOnly one case of qStableSort in the GMX plugin needed adjustment.n

Disabled Qt foreach macro everywhereUsing the C++11 range-based for instead.nnAlso avoided a few deprecated API usages in terraingenerator, whichnshowed up when the related defines were no longer overridden.n
Avoid deprecation warnings about QRegion::rectsWhen compiling against Qt 5.11.nnThis should also be slightly more efficient for rectangular regions,nthough that's unlikely to be noticeable.n
Use type-safe connect syntax everywhereExcludes only 3rd party solutions like QtPropertyBrowser andnQtSingleApplication.n
Fixed deprecated API usage on Windows

Avoid shipping dsa_pub.pem in Linux AppImage

Tile Collision Editor: Allowed using object templatesThis change adds a Templates view to the tileset editor, which allowsnfor selecting templates to place as tile collisions.nnPlacing tile object templates should still be prevented, because using antile from same tileset leads to recursive loading of the same tileset.nnThere is also a synchronization issue to resolve when the same templatenis selected in both the tileset and the map editor and then modifiedn(needs to synchronize, or actually use the same dummy document).n
Tile Collision Editor: Prevent tile object templatesThey can't be supported as tile collision objects in general, becausenthis could lead to dependency problems between tileset and templatenfiles.n

Templates view: Don't allow hiding the template objectSince we have a mechanism to disallow this now, let's use it here asnwell because I see no use in having a template that is hidden byndefault. Disallowing it can avoid some confusion.n
Share the ObjectTemplateModel between map and tileset editorThere is no need for multiple instances of this model, even though wenhave two Template view instances.n

Templates view: Fixed a synchronization issueFixed an issue with synchronizating template edits when the samentemplate is opened in both the map editor and the tileset editor, bynsharing the dummy MapDocument instance that is created for editing thentemplate.nnI think this is the first time that a MapDocument is shared betweennmultiple MapScene instances, but it seems to work fine.n

Travis CI: Don't include libpython3.4m.so.1.0 in the AppImageIncluding this file causes Tiled to run into a fatal error on startup onnsystems that do not have Python 3.4 installed. Without this file, onlynthe Python plugin will fail to load on such systems.n
docs: Documented the Worlds feature in its current stateTo be adjusted as this feature is extended.n
docs: Added image to page about WorldsAnd some other tweaks.n

Worlds: Report errors and refresh on load/unloadAdded error reporting when loading a world fails.nnAlso added a worldsChanged signal, which is used to immediately updatenthe map scenes. While refreshing a scene, existing MapItem instances arennow reused when applicable.nnIssue #1669n

Compensate for tile offset in Tile Collision EditorThe tile offset is now effectively disabled in the Tile CollisionnEditor, so that the collision objects are always positioned relative tonthe tile image, independently of its drawing offset.nnCloses #1955n
Keep objects selected when moving them between groupsAlso, disable the menu item for the current group, in case all selectednobjects are in the same group.n
Qbs: Fixed issue with creating Windows XP snapshotThese icu DLLs have disappeared now also in Qt 5.6.3.n
Worlds: Only jump to another map with left mouse buttonAvoids interfering with right mouse button interactions.nnIssue #1669n

Introduced a fancy new helper for iterating layersThe LayerIteratorHelper enables iterating the layer hierarchy (or allnlayers in the hierarchy of a specific type) using a range-based fornloop, without allocating an intermediate array.n

libtiled: TileLayer optimizations and fixes* Optimized TileLayer::copy and TileLayer::erase to not needlesslyn  process the empty area outside the layer's bounds.nn* Fixed TileLayer::flip, TileLayer::flipHexagonal, TileLayer::rotaten  and TileLayer::rotateHexagonal to update mBounds as needed.nn* Avoid some signed/unsigned conversion warnings.n

Phased out QScopedPointer in favour of std::unique_ptrstd::unique_ptr is essentially a better QScopedPointer, since it isnharder to misuse due to its strict support for move semantics.n
