Python plugin: Added some missing API to the Cell classNow cells can be compared, changed and the flipping states arenavailable.nnPrompted bynhttps://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/flip-value-in-export-python-script/3248n

Fixes to LayerIteratorCan't really remember how often I've been fixing up this tricky class.nEvery time I think it's working now. Would be a perfect case for somenauto-tests...nnThis fixes a crash when trying to iterate a map without layers with anrange-based for loop, because the iterator could return a nullptr evennthough it was unequal to the end() iterator.nnIt also fixes up LayerIterator::previous to keep going in case ofnencountering layers that aren't of the expected type.n

Made filling tools work with multi-layer stampsThis applies to both the Bucket Fill Tool as well as the Shape FillnTool.nnAlso applied similar logic regarding working on hidden layers as done innchange c87f8c4299e293256c08649914cd7a6d7f5b5477 for the Stamp Brush.nnIssue #282n

Highlight hovered objectRenders a transparent version of the hovered object in front ofneverything else, including a light outline. This way you can see whichnobject will be interacted with when clicking.nnHere are some improvements that could be made to this feature:nn* Make it optionaln* Also highlight objects when they are hovered in the Objects view.n* Highlight the hovered object also in the Objects view.n* Highlight objects while doing rectangular select so you cann  immediately see which objects will get selected.nnCloses #1190n
Use some more std::unique_ptrLess manual memory management!n
macOS: Don't build tiledquickplugin as a frameworkThis breaks the naming of the library and causes the plugin to fail to load.nnCloses #1945n

Qbs: Fixed some install rules for Tiled Quick and its pluginOne issue remains, which is that libtiled also needs to go into the Tiled Quicknapp bundle. However, it is already being installed into the Tiled app bundlenand I could not find a way to install the library to both locations using Qbs.n
Highlight hovered objects in the Objects viewObjects that are hovered in either the map view or the Objects viewnare now highlighted in both views.nnExpands on #1190n
Merge branch 'master' into wip/qtquickMainly to fix build issues on AppVeyor.nnConflicts:ntsrc/libtiled/map.hn
Made highlighting of the hovered object optionalIssue #1190n

Fixed small tab bar rendering issue on high DPI displaysTabs were rendering slightly too low because the overlapping distancenwas being scaled with the DPI, but the lines that the tabs are supposednto overlap were always the same size.n

Draw the grid below labels, handles and selection indicatorsThe tile grid should not render on top of object labels, selectionnrectangles and resize handles. But it did, since it was rendered as thenforeground of the map scene.nnNow the grid is rendered by a dedicated graphics item that sits belownthose things (but still above the tile selection item).n
Fixed object labels to adjust properly to the font DPINow the margins and the distance between the label and the object scalenwith the DPI.n
Merge branch '1.1'Conflicts:ntsrc/plugins/python/pythonbind.cppn

Fixed some problems with the hovered object highlight* Fixed synchronization of the hover highlight when the hovered objectn  changes.nn* Fixed position of hover highlight for objects in layers to which ann  offset is applied.nn* Fixed removal of hover highlight when object labels are enabled forn  selected objects.nnIssue #1190n

Fixed the background color of the Objects viewThe custom viewport was not having the right background role and did notnhave auto-fill background set, which caused the Objects view to show thenwindow background color.nnThe only reason for the custom viewport was to handle the leave event,nand I found that overriding viewportEvent provides a better way of doingnthis.n

Fixed hang when drawing the grid for infinite mapsAnd probably improved the grid rendering performance for non-infinitenmaps as well.nnThe new TileGridItem was using the wrong rectangle to determine wherenthe grid needed to be drawn.n
Small code optimizations in MapItem* Avoid unnecessary checks for detaching mObjectItems and mLayerItems.n* Use the fact that mLayerItems maps Layers to LayerItems instead ofn  just being a list.n

Fixed leaks and translation problems in Wang color modelmEdgeText and mCornerText were not deleted, and they were used asndisplay text even though they were not translated strings.nnReplaced those pointers with an enum and return translated strings fornthe display text.n
Fixed leaking of a LoggingInterface instanceA one-instance leak, but better just fix it because it shows up innvalgrind.n
Lua plugin: Include tileset column count in export (#1969)

Avoid iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile warningsFollow-up on f172a0d7010ff93335c0e39aea7fcc51e0432cee for some newnimages that have been added since then.nnUsed mogrify on these PNG files this time.nnThe affected files were determined by putting a breakpoint innqt_png_warning in qpnghandler.cpp.n

Fixed rendering of arrows on scroll bar buttonsWas broken for Tiled compiled against Qt 5.10 or newer, since it nonlonger included the fusion_arrow.png image.nnThe arrow is now rendered dynamically, using the relevant code from thenQt Fusion style.n

Tile Collision Editor: Fixed potential crash on UndoUndoing a change in the Tile Collision Editor causes the active tool tonget temporarily deactivated and the dummy MapDocument to be refreshed.nWhen the undo action was triggered while changing objects, the codenended up referencing roaming pointers.nnNow a bunch of variables are reset when the selection tool isndeactivated in order to avoid such crashes. A better fix will be tonproperly reset the current action when the tool gets deactivated, butnsince this code has changed in the meantime that will be implemented onnmaster.nnCloses #1965n
Merge branch '1.1'Conflicts:ntsrc/tiled/objectselectiontool.cppn

Object Selection Tool: Escape aborts current actionIf you are currently performing some action, then Escape will now cancelnthis action and bring the state back to when the action was started.nnThe current action is now also reset as appropriate when the tool getsndeactivated (for example by selecting to a different tool), or when somenobjects get deleted (which still shouldn't happen, but it can be donenand it shouldn't crash).n

Fixed crash when deleting the hovered objectThat was a pretty nasty one to introduce, since it's quite common tonstill hover the object you wanted to delete...nnIt should be enough to check whether the object is still part of annObjectGroup. The other reason the hovered object may be removed is whennits layer gets removed entirely. In that case it will still be part ofnthat layer, but since this is handled in onLayerAboutToBeRemoved, itnhappens before the object is actually removed.n
Edit Polygon Tool: Escape aborts current actionAlso fixed the abortion of the current move when any affected polygonnobjects are deleted. Finally, abort the current action when switchingntools.n

Travis CI: Build development snapshots for macOS against Qt 5.5Avoids regression affecting Qt 5.11, where it is not possible to resizenfloating dock widgets.nnCan be reverted once Qt 5.11.2 is released and available on Homebrew, or asnsoon as more serious problems are identified in this old Qt version.nnCloses #1962n
Qbs: Update to Qbs 1.11.1 for the automated builds
Qbs: Include libtiled in the app bundles by pulling it inThis way libtiled.dylib can be copied into both Tiled.app and Tiled Quick.app.nnThanks to ckandeler in #qbs for his help with this solution!n
Create Object Tool: Made memory management a bit more robustThis tool has tricky ownership logic. I tried to simplify it a bit usingnstd::unique_ptr and to document it in other places.n
Create Object Tool: Simplified virtual APIIn preparation for behavioral changes to object placement tools.nnThis mostly reduces duplicated code.n
Don't trigger object repaint when name changesThe name used to be drawn as part of the object item, but is now in itsnown item so the object item does not need to be updated when it changes.n

Create Object Tools: Show preview already on hoverNow the object to be placed appears on hover instead of on clicking,nwhich provides feedback about what's going to happen when you click.nnThis was a rather tricky change since it affects some complex existingnbit of code. I expect there to be some bugs to be ironed out.nnCloses #537n
macOS: Avoid unused function warning
Fixed grid always showing on startupEven when disabled.n

Create Object Tools: Fixed various issuesThese are mostly issues that became apparent after the tools werenchanged to show a preview on hover.nn* Remove object preview when current layer changes results in objectn  placement not being available (hidden or locked layer).nn* Synchronize on changes to object group offset and color.nn* Don't create preview for locked layers (even better may be to draw an  red-colored preview).nn* Fixed snapping of initial position for scalable objects.nn* Fixed modifiers passed in mouseMoved when tool gets enabled.nnIssue #537n

Fixed resize handle locations for multiple zero-sized objectsWhen multiple rectangle or ellipse objects with zero size were selected,nthe resize handles were not placed in the right location to allow themnto be scaled together.nnThis was due to the empty rectangles not uniting as I would have expected.n
Add new polyline object created by Delete Segment action to selectionAlso fixed a possible memory leak after undoing the action.n

Fixed handling of arrow keys on focused layer combo boxUsing the arrow keys with the combo box selected only changed the layernshown in the combo box, but failed to actually change the selectednlayer.nnCloses #1973n
Merge branch '1.1'Conflicts:ntsrc/tiled/objectselectiontool.cppn

Optimized deletion of many objectsDeleting many selected objects, either directly or as part of undoingnthe addition of those objects, was very slow. This was due to eachnobject getting removed individually and the large amount of code gettingnexecuted in response to the related change of selected objects.nnI've optimized this by supporting the removal of many objects at once innthe undo command, so that it can remove those objects from the selectionnin one operation.nnCloses #1972n

Use Qt 5.9 LTS instead of 5.10 for releasesQt 5.9 is an LTS release that is receiving more bugfix releases. Sincenwe're not really using any Qt 5.10 or 5.11 features there is littlenreason not to use this stable version of Qt. At the same time, there arenregressions and issues affecting Tiled functionality in newer versions.nnThis changes the Linux AppImage to Qt 5.9.6 and the Windows release tonQt 5.9.5 (5.9.6 is not available yet on AppVeyor).nnCloses #1928n

However, some stepsnperformed by the previously used script were still relevant for a properlynworking release.nnThis should fix issues with trying to launch tmxrasterizer or terraingeneratornon systems where Qt is not installed in the same location as on the machinenwhere the release was made.nnThe obsolete script is now removed.nnPrompted by https://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/tmxrasterizer-cannot-run-on-macos/3292n

Use Qt Quick Controls 2 & Qt Labs PlatformQt Quick Controls 1 is desktop-oriented, which Tiled (widgets) alreadynhas covered. If Tiled Quick is supposed to be for touch devices,nit is better off using Qt Quick Controls 2.n

Added several export optionsThese new options can be applied to all export formats, including whennusing the Export action to save a map to TMX or JSON.nnThe options are implemented by making a copy of the map and processingnthis copy to apply the selected operations before passing the map to thenwriter.nnImplemented export options:nn* Option to embed tilesets, which avoids needing to load external .tsxn  or .json tileset files.nn* Option to detach templates, which allows using the templates featuren  without needing to care about loading external template files. Ofn  course, when a lot of template instances exist it will make the mapn  file bigger.nn* Option to resolve object types and properties. This means copying downn  the type when inherited from the tile, and copying down customn  properties set on either the object's tile or the object's type.nnCloses #1850n

Apply export options also when exporting a tilesetThis is currently only relevant for tilesets where tiles have tilencollision info, and the collision objects use types or templates.nnAlso refactored the code to allow the export options to be applied fromnelsewhere. Next up is adding them to the command-line.nnIssue #1850n
Added export options to the command lineIssue #1850n
Qbs: Tiled Quick depends on the Tiled Quick PluginBut it should not link to it.nnThis makes sure Qbs compiles the Tiled Quick Plugin before trying tonrun Tiled Quick.n
Made Group Layer action work on all selected layersPart of issue #282n
Fixed compile against Qt < 5.7
Made Ungroup Layer action apply to all selected layersPart of issue #282n
Made Remove Layer action work on all selected layersPart of issue #282n

Fixed issue with Select Next/Previous Layer actionsIt could happen that it would only affect the current layer, but leaventhe list of selected layers alone. The action now sets the layer selectionnas well.n

Some fixes related to multi-layer selection* Fixed a potential crash after deleting a group layer. This happened duen  to the QGraphicsRectItem staying parented to its last LayerItem whenn  hidden, and then getting deleted along with that layer item when then  layer was removed.nn* Made sure the new current layer is selected after removing then  selected layers.nn* Made sure layers are selected by row.nnPart of issue #282n
Made the Raise/Lower Layer actions work with multi-selectionPart of issue #282n
Made the Duplicate Layer action work on all selected layersPart of issue #282n

Made Show/Hide Lock/Unlock Other Layers work with multi-selectionThese actions now show/hide or lock/unlock all layers not included innthe current selection, instead of only taking into account the currentnlayer.nnPart of issue #282n

Improved interaction feedback for switching between maps in a world* Added borders to the maps.n* Added hover highlight.n* Darkened other maps instead of rendering them partially transparent,n  which avoids confusion due to multiple layers starting to shown  through.n* Layers or tiles that go beyond the basic map size no longer contributen  to the interaction area of the other maps.nnStill, the main issue to address is the conflicting input handling betweennthe tools and the clicking of another map.nnThis change also adds the map border to single opened maps, which Inthink is generally useful (closes #630).nnIssue #1669n
Snapshot builds should link to latest docsThe default documentation currently shown is the stable version, whichnis based on the latest release branch, whereas latest is based onnmaster.n

Allow interaction with objects overlapping other mapsThis patch is a rather tricky workaround to allow interacting withnobjects and related handles that are overlapping another map. Clickingnthis other map would switch to that map, but by accepting hover eventsnin the graphics items that sit on top we can avoid that and allow thenmove and resize interactions to be done there as well.nnSince this affects the mouse handling in a bunch of places, we need tonkeep an eye open for possible regressions.nnThis patch also fixes the problem that you could not interact in areasnof the map below which another map was present. The current map nownsteals the hover events from the map below, so that the map below knowsnwhen to ignore the mouse press event.nnCloses #1983n

Fixed compile with MSVC 2013There's something about the Q_ASSERT macro in Qt 5.9.5 that causes thenfollowing compiler error in this context:nn  createpolygonobjecttool.cpp(483) : error C2059: syntax error : '}'n  createpolygonobjecttool.cpp(483) : error C2065: 'handle' : undeclared identifiern  createpolygonobjecttool.cpp(483) : error C2227: left of '->mapObject' must point to class/struct/union/generic typen  type is 'unknown-type'n  createpolygonobjecttool.cpp(483) : fatal error C1903: unable to recover from previous error(s); stopping compilationnnSince we don't really need this assert, I've chosen just to remove it.n

Integrated news from website in the status barCurrent there is no option to turn this off. Not sure if this isnimportant, but it could be added to the preferences.nnI didn't find a nice way to display the date of the posts, but I thinknit doesn't really matter.nnI'm not sure whether it is preferable to add the itch.io devlog or thennews feed from the Tiled website. The itch.io devlog currently is morenactive since it includes posts about snapshot updates. On the othernhand, I have more control over the posts on the Tiled website and thenway they are presented. I went for showing the posts on the Tilednwebsite for now, and will consider posting snapshot updates there too,nas well as improving the site a bit.nnCloses #1898n

libtiled: Fixed the version written to TMX and JSON map filesTiled 1.1 writes out TMX files of version 1.1, which most notably addednsupport for infinite maps (written out using chunks) and objectntemplates. Files not using those new features should have noncompatibility issues.n

Added 'version' and 'tiledversion' to tileset filesThere's no reason tileset files should not have version informationnwhile map files do. This information is now included for tilesets savednas TMX, JSON and Lua format.n
snap: Added 'network' interface to be able to read news feedAlso removed 'opengl' interface for the various other tools shippingnwith Tiled, since none of them use OpenGL.n

Updated translation filesGeneral statistics for most languages:nnFound 1105 source text(s) (78 new and 1027 already existing)nRemoved 17 obsolete entriesnSame-text heuristic provided 4 translation(s)nnThis marks the string freeze for Tiled 1.12n

tBIN plugin: Several improvements* Newly added float properties no longer raise Unsupported propertyn  type error (this was due to float properties being 64-bit in Tiled,n  but 32-bit in tBIN format).nn* Loading a tBIN map without any layers no longer crashes (not sure ifn  it's possible to save such files in tIDE, but better be safe).nn* Added some warnings (printed to console for now):n  - When not all objects are grid-alignedn  - When an object layer does not have a matching tile layern  - When objects are encounted that are not named TileDatann* Don't ignore objects that aren't perfectly grid aligned. Determinen  tile position based on the center of the object, which is usually then  location that was meant.nn* Made some type conversions explicit.nnCloses #1985n
Updated Bulgarian translation(pulled from Transifex)n

AutoMapping: Changed matching outside of map boundariesBy default, rules will no longer match when their input region isnpartially outside of the map boundaries (except on infinite maps, wherenthis behavior doesn't make sense).nnThis behavior can now also be explicitly controlled by adding a booleannMatchOutsideMap property to the rules map, since some people may desirenthe previous behavior even on bounded maps.nnUsing the property, you can try to disable matching outside of the mapnfor infinite maps, but I expect that will just break most rules rathernthan do anything useful.nnSee also: https://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/automapper-ignore-the-empty-void-beyond-the-perimeter-of-mapn

Fixed reading of infinite maps that don't use chunked layer dataThis affected the isometric_staggered_grass_and_water.tmx example, whichnhappened to be saved after infinite maps were introduced but before thenchunked data format was implemented.nnWith this change, the reader also supports bounded maps that use chunkednlayer data (though the writer doesn't support writing this yet).nnThe JSON format already supported maps using either chunked ornnon-chunked data, regardless of the map being infinite or not.n
Lua plugin: Include properties from templates (#1901)Properties are copied from the template, then merged with the instances'srnproperties before being written to the export.

Properties view now applies changes to all selected layersWhen having multiple layers selected, changing properties like thenvisibility or locked status now apply to all selected layers instead ofnjust the last selected one.nnThe same goes for custom properties, which are also aggregated based onnall selected layers, as was already implemented for objects.nnPart of issue #282n
Made Merge Layer Down work on all selected layersSkipping those that can't be merged down.nnPart of issue #282n

Made Offset Layers tool work on all selected layersThe tool makes sure that when a parent layer is moved, its children arennot moved as well, to avoid applying the offset twice.nnAlso made some other improvements, to reduce the chance of accidentalnuse:nn* Only drag on left mouse button, not on right mouse button.n* Show a SizeAll / hand cursor when pressing the mouse button.n* While dragging, allow right mouse button or Escape to abort the drag.nnAlso fixed a problem with updating a layer's opacity when Highlightncurrent layer is active and multiple layers are selected.nnPart of issue #282n

Fixed randomizing of terrain and Wang tilesWhen I modernized the API used by the RandomPicker in commitnb9655a37652ed55302a42, I made each instance seed its random engine bynrequesting a number from a new std::random_device. This appears to worknfine on some platforms, but on others (like apparently 32-bit MinGW onnWindows), the std::random_device will generate the same pseudo-randomnnumber sequence for each instance.nnThis affected the Terrain Brush, Wang Brush and the tile stamp variations,nwhich are all using a new RandomPicker instance each time they have tonchoose something randomly.nnFixed it by making each RandomPicker use the same random engine instance,nwhich could also have a performance benefit (in case std::random_devicenwas running out of entropy on some platforms).nnCloses #1949n

Fixed JSON templates not being visible in Templates viewWas broken by a change in initialization order between the creation ofnthe UI and the loading of the plugins. This caused the model used fornthis view to miss the JSON template format.nnCloses #2009n

Fixed Select None action to be enabled when there is any selectionThe Select None action clears both the tile and the object selection,nbut it was only enabled based on either selection, depending on the typenof the current layer. Now it always checks both types of selection.n
Fixed Maps view to show all readable map formatsSimilar bug as fixed in commit 52d5fdc52584db9da168187498f678bc52663198.n

Fixed crash after a world file failed to loadWhen a world file failed to load, a missing check was causing a nullnpointer to get added to the container for loaded worlds, which wouldnlater get referenced in WorldManager::worldForMap, causing a crash.nnProblem reported by email.n

Fixed disappearing of tile type on export/importWhen exporting or importing a tileset, or when enabling any exportnoptions that affect the tileset, the tileset is cloned. In the processnof cloning however, the tile types were not getting copied over.nnSee also change 8494cd6d4a02f4799c81e473a82048b5bd6b8bbe. Maybe there isna way to avoid making such errors so easily?nnCloses #2023n
Tile map can be assembled on UNIX system, but read on Microsoft Windows system. Replacing path separator when reading tileset or map file.

Fixed tool shortcuts when using Spanish translationTwo tools were using the shortcut G (Wang Brush and Eraser) and twontools were using the shortcut R (Rectangular Select and the BucketnFill Tool). When this happens, neither shortcut will actually work.nnResolved the conflicts by reverting to the same shortcuts used in thenEnglish language, which is anyway a good idea since those are thenshortcuts mentioned in the manual.nnSee https://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/keyboard-shotcuts-not-work/3506n

Python plugin: Made the Tileset API more completeAdded new functions to Tileset class:nn* Tileset.tileOffsetn* Tileset.setTileOffsetn* Tileset.loadImagen* Tileset.findTile (same as Tileset.tileAt, which is deprecated)n* Tileset.rowCountn* Tileset.imageSourceString (closes #2037)n* Tileset.setImageSourcen* Tileset.isCollectionnnFor tileOffset / setTileOffset, QPoint was defined. Also, the QPointFnand QSizeF definitions were fixed to use 'float' instead of 'int' forntheir setters and getters.n

Scripting: Added some methods to interact with the userBased on equivalent functions available in the browser:nn  tiled.alert (shows a warning dialog)n  tiled.confirm (shows a yes/no dialog)n  tiled.prompt (asks for a string)n

Fixed misbehavior when trying to open non-existing filesFor example, when opening a map with an embedded tileset and annon-existing file, the embedded tileset would be opened:nn   tiled some-map.tmx file-does-not-existnnWith scriptability, this also affects attempts to programmatically opennmaps (for example when using tiled.documentManager.openFile).n

Made TemplatesDock::setTemplate check whether the template was loadedOtherwise, it is easy to crash Tiled from a script by callingn`tiled.documentManager.templateOpenRequested(...)` with an invalidntemplate file (something that normally couldn't happen).n

tiledquickplugin: Some C++11 modernizations

Expose MapDocument.map as a propertyThis makes the map, along with its properties, available to JavaScript.nnDirect access to the map currently allows making changes withoutnnotifying the UI or involving the undo system. This easily leads tonerrors, so further work is required on the API for making changes. Thenaccess to the raw data should probably be read-only.nnExample snippet that changes the tile width, which explicitly notifiesnthe UI but still ignores the undo system:nnvar mapDocument = tiled.documentManager.currentDocumentnmapDocument.map.tileWidth = 16nmapDocument.mapChanged()n

Python plugin: Made the API more completeAdded methods:nn Tile.sizen Tileset.gridSizen Tileset.setGridSizen Map.renderOrdern Map.setRenderOrdern Map.tileSizen Map.infiniten Map.setInfiniten Map.hexSideLengthn Map.setHexSideLengthn Map.staggerAxisn Map.setStaggerAxisn Map.staggerIndexn Map.setStaggerIndexn Map.imageLayerCountn Map.groupLayerCountn Map.backgroundColorn Map.setBackgroundColorn Map.nextLayerIdn Map.setNextLayerIdn Map.nextObjectIdn Map.setNextObjectIdn GroupLayer classn MapObject.objectGroupn Layer.isTileLayern Layer.isObjectGroupn Layer.isImageLayern Layer.isGroupLayern Layer.asImageLayern Layer.asGroupLayernnCloses #1867n
Reload AutoMapping rules when they have changed on disk (#2029)Closes #1997

Scripting: Introduced EditableMap class for making changesThis is an initial attempt at providing an API through which scripts cannchange the map, while including those changes in the undo history.nnNow we can write a script like this:nnvar map = tiled.documentManager.currentDocument.edit()nmap.tileWidth = 16nmap.resize(Qt.size(16, 16))nnAnd the calls to those methods will use actual undo commands, so theneffect of this script can be undone by doing:nnvar document = tiled.documentManager.currentDocumentndocument.undo()ndocument.undo()n
Add qtdeclarative5-dev to dependencies (#2038)Fixes the error `Unknown module(s) in QT: qml`
Fixed compile against Qt <= 5.11It didn't have QSharedPointer::get yet.n

Scripting: Further work on the exposed APIAdded tiled.activeAsset property and tiled.openAssets to get a list ofnEditableAsset instances. Added EditableLayer class and used it to exposenthe layers from EditableMap and allow changing some basic properties.nnThis enables a quick and easy API for changing properties:nn  > tiled.activeAsset.layerCountn  45n  > tiled.activeAsset.layerAt(2).namen  Terrainn  > tiled.activeAsset.layerAt(2).visible = falsen  falsennAll while being integrated with the undo system and automaticallynupdating the UI based on the changes.n
Mention the file name in open file error dialogOften useful to know which file was being opened when an error occurs.n

Fixed tiled.activeAsset to not crash when there is no file open

Scripting: Added actions to modify the selectionAlso fixed the enum-based map properties, though they are stillnsub-optimal since they currently just work as integers.nnRegarding the selection, there is still no way to process it. Also, I'dnrather have exposed the selection as a value-type but functionsnmodifying such a value-type are not working as expected when the valuenis exposed as a property. Maybe I'll change it to selectedArea() andnsetSelectedArea(), when no better solution is found.n

Scripting: Exposed tile layer and tileset propertiesTile layer size and individual cells can now be queried, though there isnno way yet to change the tile layer.nnAll simple tileset properties are now exposed and some of them can benchanged directly (name, tileOffset and backgroundColor). No access tonthe tiles is provided yet.nnAlso it is now possible to remove layers using map.removeLayerAt(index).nHowever, this also introduces a problem if you try to change a layernthat was removed. This will probably just need to be checked against.n
Scripting: Added asset related signals  tiled.assetCreatedn  tiled.assetOpenedn  tiled.assetAboutToBeSavedn  tiled.assetSavedn  tiled.assetAboutToBeClosedn

Scripting: Allow changing the active asset by assignmentAlso added access to the fileName through the asset.nnThe document manager and its documents are now no longer exposed, mostlynbecause I think the API is too messy. The important functionality is nownavailable in a simpler way.n

Scripting: Added a value-type for working with regionsExposed EditableTileLayer.region() method for getting the non-emptynregion of a tile layer. The returned value can be modified and can benused to change the selected area of the map.nnA lot of overloads were necessary because Qt.rect actually creates anQRectF, and without supporting that specific class the script engine wasnnot picking the right overload.nnCurrently it's not possible to create a region object directly. Thisnshould be possible by wrapping its static QMetaObject, but I ran intoncrashes when trying to do new Region().n

Scripting: Added evaluation of startup scriptIf present, a startup.js script is now evaluated on startup. Thisnscript could define functions that can be called from the Console or cannconnect to signals.nnThe location of the startup script depends on the platform. The filenstartup.js is searched for in the following locations:nn  Windows: C:/Users/<USER>/AppData/Local/Tiled,n   C:/ProgramData/Tilednn  macOS: ~/Library/Preferences/Tilednn  Linux: ~/.config/tiled,n /etc/xdg/tiledn

Adjust map boundary to layer offsets also when group layers are usedFixes for example the area rendered by the mini-map in case a groupednlayer is offset, either by itself or via its parent group layer.n

Merge branch '1.2'

Fixed small issue in bounding rect calculation in mini-map rendererWas not taking into account tiles extending from nested tile layers.nThis issue is not visible anywhere, since this extension is only donenfor the thumbnails in the tile stamps, which never use nested layers.n

Adopted unique_ptr in map readers and some membersTile::mObjectGroup and ObjectTemplate::mObject are now unique_ptr, whichnhelps to communicate ownership and avoid leaks. Fixes leaking of objectsnwhile loading templates.nnIn the map readers, very often heap-allocated objects are returned bynfunctions, expecting the caller to take ownership. This now happensnexplicitly in a lot more cases.n
Python plugin: Added some functions for consistencyThough these functions seem pretty redundant to me.n
Scripting: Fixed message box functions to be callable againtiled.alert, tiled.confirm and tiled.prompt were no longer accessiblenbecause they ended up as private slots by accident.n

Scripting: Added tiled.log and tiled.errorThese currently just write an appropriately colored message to thenConsole window. In the future I'd like to introduce a panel thatncollects log messages as well as errors and warnings.n

Scripting: Resolved several potential crashes in layer handling* When a layer is removed from the map, any EditableLayer instance forn  that layer is invalidated.nn* Trying to change something about an invalid EditableLayer writes ann  error to the console (from Qt 5.12, throws a script error and includesn  a stack trace in the message when applicable). This is mostly necessaryn  because there is no undo stack to apply the change through.nn* EditableLayer instances can now be garbage-collected. When this happens,n  their cached pointer is removed so that the instance is re-createdn  next time it is requested.nnA remaining problem is to use an EditableLayer instances for a layernthat was not only removed but _deleted_. Then reading out any propertiesnwill still crash. Either the invalidation should clear the layer pointernas well, or the EditableLayer instance should keep the layer from beingndeleted, so that it could be used to add the layer again.n
Scripting: Don't print out undefined when there is no return valueDoes not seem very useful to me, it's mostly just adding noise.n

Scripting: Added Map.insertLayerAt and modifying of detached layersThis method currently allows adding a removed layer back to a map.nnAlso, it is now possible to modify layers that are not currently part ofna map. In this case, change are applied immediately without involvingnthe undo system. The layer is cloned when it is removed from the map, tonavoid any changes being visible when undoing the removal of the layer.nnThis change also resolves the possible crash when accessing propertiesnof a deleted layer. This is because before a layer gets deleted, itnwould first need to get removed from a map. From that point on, thenproperties are obtained from the clone instead.nnNow we have a small issue, in that EditableTileLayer instances managednby the scripting engine are keeping a TileLayer instance around, whichnin turn keeps its tilesets around. This currently triggers an assert innthe TilesetManager destructor. This could be fixed by explicitlyndestroying the ScriptManager before the TilesetManager.n

Scripting: Resolved assertion on shutdown with detached layersMake sure to delete the ScriptManager instance before the TilesetManagerninstance, so that the assertion that no Tileset instances still existnwhen the TilesetManager gets destroyed holds true also when there werenstill detached layers referenced by the JavaScript engine.n

Removed the Internal namespaceNever seen noticed any benefit from it, so good riddance!nnI kept it only for two classes in libtiled, which use the Internalnnamespace to separate a private class.nnThis change will affect the context of many translatable strings, butnthis mostly just causes them to be marked as unfinished since they arenstill matched by heuristic.n

Fixed compile issues with clang 5.0 and MinGW 4.9While this expression seems not to be problematic with more recentncompiler versions, these older versions do not like it and spewed thenfollowing errors:nnclang 5.0.0nnobjecttemplate.cpp:75:14: error: no viable overloaded '='nmTileset = tileset ? tileset->sharedPointer() : nullptr;n~~~~~~~~ ^ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~nnMinGW 4.9nnobjecttemplate.cpp: In member function 'void Tiled::ObjectTemplate::setObject(std::unique_ptr<Tiled::MapObject>&&)':nobjecttemplate.cpp:75:24: error: no match for ternary 'operator?:' (operand types are 'bool', 'Tiled::SharedTileset {aka QSharedPointer<Tiled::Tileset>}', and 'std::nullptr_t')n mTileset = tileset ? tileset->sharedPointer() : nullptr;n^nnWe still need the code to compile with those compilers on Travis CI andnAppVeyor (Windows XP build).n

Scripting: Enabled editing of object layers and object propertiesAdded functions/properties:nn  Map.removeLayer()n  Map.addLayer()n  ObjectGroup.objectCountn  ObjectGroup.colorn  ObjectGroup.removeObjectAt()n  ObjectGroup.removeObject()n  ObjectGroup.insertObjectAt()n  ObjectGroup.addObject()n  MapObject.idn  MapObject.namen  MapObject.typen  MapObject.xn  MapObject.yn  MapObject.posn  MapObject.widthn  MapObject.heightn  MapObject.sizen  MapObject.rotationn  MapObject.visiblen  MapObject.layern  MapObject.mapnnObjects follow the same logic as layers when they get removed from thentheir layer, in that any remaining EditableMapObject instances will getndetached. This allows those objects to still be changed and to later benadded back or added to another layer.nnThere are still a bunch of open issues regarding memory management whennadding/removing objects from an ObjectGroup that isn't currently part ofna map.nnThere are also some important object properties not editable yet, likenthe tile, polygon or text properties.n

Fixed compilation errors when using clangclang being a little more strict than GCC here, it did not look fornQFlags operators when there already existed some in the currentnnamespace. Fixed by making sure that, just like Qt, we declare ournQFlags operators in the global namespace.n
docs: Documented more of the scripting APIStill need to make sure all of the currently available API isndocumented, but took a while to figure out a nice style for it.n

docs: Documented most of the currently available script APIStill excludes documentation for value types such as rect, point, size,nregion and cell.nnAlso still lacking documentation of how to use the signals and about thenscript file that is loaded on startup.n
docs: Documented the startup script and how to connect to signals
Fixed Templates view missing from the Views menuWas missing while editing a tileset.nnCloses #2054n
Throw an exception here (#2045)Rather than printing a message to STDOUT and doing nothing, it would be much better if this method would instead throw an exception on illegal input.
Decoupled ObjectsView from the DocumentManagerWith the goal of making the ObjectsView reusable in thenTileCollisionDock.n
Fixed updating of modified indicator on open file tabsDue to a change in who was emitting the modifiedChanged signal, it wasnno longer finding the index of the tab to update.n
Moved ObjectsView to its own file
Tile Collision Editor: Added objects listAlso added shortcut Ctrl+A for selecting all objects.n

Tile Collision Editor: Added different modes for objects listThe following options are available:nn* Hiddenn* Show Rightn* Show BottomnnThe Hidden is the default for now, because I expect most people willnnot need this list. Of course, the selected mode and splitter positionnis remembered.n
Used #pragma once in a few more places

Tile Collision Editor: Added additional actions to the objects tool bar* Duplicate Objectsn* Remove Objectsn* Object PropertiesnnAlso fixed a bug on undo causing the objects list to show the objectnlayer item, since the root index was not getting set in that case.n

Scripting: Added support for map export formatsCurrently a map format defined in JavaScript can only export to anstring-based representation, but it's a start. Binary representationsnshould become possible when we upgrade to ES6.nnAdding support for reading map formats will first need support forncreating new things (maps, layers, objects, etc.) from script.n
Updated year in the default license header

Scripting: Added access to the custom propertiesThe EditableAsset class now inherits from the new EditableObjectnclass, which provides read/write access to the custom properties. Othernnon-asset classes like EditableLayer and EditableMapObject now alsonderive from EditableObject.nnThe readOnly property was moved to EditableObject, though the getternis virtual since at the moment only the assets can be read-only. Othernobjects are read-only when their asset is (the read-only flag isncurrently only used to prevent modifications while saving in a customnformat).n
Suppressed warning about conversion from float to int

Fixed remembering of last used export filterWhen exporting a map or a tileset, the format now defaults to the lastnused export format. This functionality was broken since Tiled 1.1.0.nnAlso, when exporting an embedded tileset, it now specifies a defaultnlocation (last used export location) and file name (based on the name ofnthe tileset).n
Updated README.md with some additional instructionsCovering some things I ran into on a new install.n

Added 'json1' plugin that exports to the old JSON formatFor those that need to use the old JSON format (usually for compatiblitynreasons), there is now a plugin called 'json1' that can be activatednalong with or instead of the regular 'json' plugin.nnThe JSON format was simplified in Tiled 1.2, but not everybody is in anposition to update the software they are using to adjust to the newnformat.nnCloses #2058n

Fixed Copy Path / Open Folder actions for embedded tilesetsEmbedded tilesets have no file name of their own, so these actionsnwere malfunctioning. In this case the actions now use the file namenof the map in which the tileset is embedded.nnFor future-proofness, the actions also won't get added if the filenname happens to be empty.nnCloses #2059n

Fixed compile when using MSVC 2013This compiler doesn't fully support C++11 and claims:nnsrclibtiledproperties.h(53) : error C2610: 'Tiled::Properties::Properties(Tiled::Properties &&)' : is not a special member function which can be defaultednsrclibtiledproperties.h(57) : error C2610: 'Tiled::Properties &Tiled::Properties::operator =(Tiled::Properties &&)' : is not a special member function which can be defaultednnI think these members aren't so important anyway since Qt does implicitnsharing.n

Scripting: Allow creating new stuff from scriptsThis change enables the following constructors from script:nnnew MapObject([name])nnew ObjectGroup([name])nnew TileLayer([name])   # Not very useful yetnnew TileMap()   # Not useful yetnnew Tileset([name]) # Not useful yetnnNewly created map objects can be added to new or existing object groups,nand newly created object groups can be added to an existing map.nnTilesets can't yet be added to the map, and it's also still not possiblento actually make a non-empty tileset.nnTile layers aren't very useful yet because you still can't modify them.nnThe map class is called 'TileMap' because in JavaScript, the global namen'Map' is taken.n
Used std::unique_ptr in a few more placesPreferred to returning raw pointers that expect a new owner, ornfunction/constructor arguments where it needs to be documented that theynwill take ownership.n
Python plugin: Fixed compileThe plugin was disabled in my development environment...n
Scripting: Added preliminary access to tiles in a tileset
Qbs: Build the autotestsAlso fixed a compilation issue, which I would have caught had thenautotests been included in the project already.n

Fixed compile of autotest when using clangClang is being a little bit more strict here than GCC it seems:nntest_mapreader.cpp:27:5: error: no viable conversion from 'std::unique_ptr<Tiled::Map, std::default_delete<Tiled::Map> >' to 'bool'nQVERIFY(map);n^~~~~~~~~~~~n/opt/qt56/include/QtTest/qtestcase.h:60:25: note: expanded from macro 'QVERIFY'nif (!QTest::qVerify((statement), #statement, , __FILE__, __LINE__))n^~~~~~~~~~~n
Fixed release date mentioned in NEWS.md

Scripting: Added mechanism for modifying tile layersTo avoid excessive creation of undo commands and emitting of signals,nedits to tile layers have to go through a dedicated edit object, andnneed to be explicitly applied when done.nnThis change enables the following example function:nnfunction fillFirstLayerWithFirstTile() {nvar tileLayer = tiled.activeAsset.layerAt(0)nvar tile = tileLayer.tileAt(0, 0)nvar e = tileLayer.edit()nnfor (var y = 0; y < tileLayer.height; y++)nfor (var x = 0; x < tileLayer.width; x++)ne.setTile(x, y, tile)nne.apply()n}n
Console: Fixed truncated text in case of '<' charactersNeeded to HTML-escape the string.n

CSV plugin: Fixed exporting of nested tile layersThe plugin was not updated when support for group layers was added innTiled 1.0, causing only top-level tile layers to get exported.nnSee https://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/tile-layers-placed-in-groups-arent-considered-for-csv-export/3719n

Travis CI: Update macOS builds to Qt 5.9.7Previously the builds were done against Qt 5.6.3, but the support fornscripting relies on more recent features.nnBarring possible regressions we should also benefit from a lot of othernfixes and improvements on the Qt size.nnAs a result of this, Tiled will now require at least macOS 10.10,nwhereas previous versions have required macOS 10.7.n

tBIN plugin: Fixed hang when locating missing tileset imageWas caused by trying to cut the tileset into 0x0 tiles, of which therenare infinitely many.nnNow the plugin uses Tileset::findOrCreateTile to create the tiles fornloading the tile properties, which does not affect the tile sizen(Tileset::addTiles does, because it's meant to be used by imagencollection tilesets).nnCloses #2068n

Scripting: Reset script engine when any startup script is changedShould probably be made optional, since the script engine context mayninclude non-trivial state that has been created through the Console, butnI think usually resetting the engine and reloading the startup scriptsnis what you want when the scripts are changed. It avoids having tonrestart Tiled while developing a custom action, format or tooln(eventually).nnAt the same time, FileSystemWatcher was made a little bit more useful,navoiding duplicate code between the WorldManager, TilesetManager and nownthe ScriptManager.n
CSV plugin: Include group layer names in exported file namesThis makes it possible to have multiple layers with the same name, butnnested in different groups.n

Scripting: Added Asset.macro for collapsing undo historyAlso made sure that errors than happen while scripted actions arentriggered are reported.nnFinally, the Layer, NewLayer and GroupLayer menus are nownregistered so that they can be extended.n

Scripting: Added support for changing image layersScripts can now access and change the image source and transparent colornused by image layers.nnAlso removed the obsolete and no longer used ChangeImageLayerPositionnclass.n

Scripting: Added support for group layersAlso solved a few ownership / memory management issues (hopefully).nn* The new EditableManager now keeps track of all editables, to make suren  there is always only one editable wrapper per instance and to make itn  available also to objects without associated asset.nn* Editables now attach automatically when they are added to a map or an  tileset, as opposed to doing this with manual calls.nn* EditableLayer and EditableMapObject can now take and release ownershipn  over their object while detached from an asset. This solves issues whenn  layers or objects get added/removed while not part of an asset.n

Scripting: Added initial support for scripted toolsScripted tools can change whatever is possible to change from scriptsnbased on input events.nnSome important features are still missing however, like the ability tonshow a preview of a change to tile layers or of the object the toolnplans to insert. Currently it's also not possible to set an icon or anshortcut for the tool, and registered tools are only available in thenMap Editor.n

Scripting: Fixing some issues* Prevent the creation of many EditableTileset instances upon shutdown,n  which only got created to check if their undo stack was empty.nn* Don't pass an EditableTileLayer as argument to the currentLayerChangedn  signal. If no script is connected to the signal, which is usually then  case, the created instance is owned by nobody and stays around, alson  keeping its tilesets loaded.nn* Attach tiles when they get added to the tileset. Actually at the momentn  tiles can't get added to a tileset yet.nn* Reverse the prototype relationship between the ScriptedTool instancen  and the object defining the tool, so that there is only a single objectn  reference on the JavaScript side.nn* Allow scripted tools to override updateStatusInfo.n
Scripting: Documented tiled.registerToolIncludes an example of an objects inserting tool.n
Scripting: Fixed registration of selected area object (#2098)Enables changing the tile selection through scripts again.
Added icons to objects in the Objects viewMakes it easier to identify the objects in the list, at least whenndifferent kinds of objects are used.n

Fixed position of tile object outline on isometric mapsWas broken for scaled objects, since the tile offset was not beingnscaled.n

Added option to show tile collision shapes on the mapCurrently only works for tile objects. Not yet implemented for tiles onntile layers.nnIt does however deal with flipping, scaling, rotating and tilesetndrawing offset. It also works on both isometric and orthogonal maps.nnIssue #799n
Fixed black outline on scroll bar of Console windowUsing the palette instead of CSS is both more efficient and makes surenonly the actual background is affected.n

docs: Fixed formatting error and typo in JSON spec (#2092)

tBIN plugin: Fixed loading of some tilesets on LinuxFile references in tBIN files can (or may always) be stored usingnbackslashes. This broke loading of tileset images that are not in thensame folder as the tBIN file on Linux.n

tBIN plugin: Fixed possible crash when images can't be foundA crash would occur when a tileset image failed to load and the mapncontained animated tiles from the affected tileset.nnThis change also makes a few small optimizations (avoiding copying andnlength calculations in some places) and improves the rendering ofnmissing tiles in case those tiles had properties or an animationnassociated with them.nnAlso fixed saving of tileset properties.nnCloses #2106n
Merge branch '1.2'
Remove an unmatched closing brace in README (#2110)

Added a file filter when loading a worldMakes it easier to select a .world file.nnHopefully nobody chose a different extension for his world files,nbecause that would now be a little annoying. But for this case at leastnthere is also an All Files filter.n

Made keyboard shortcuts configurable (#2111)This currently covers most actions present in the menus, but still rnexcludes those that are only available through a shortcut.rnrnShortcuts can be set, removed and reset back to their default. Changed rnshortcuts are stored in the user preferences. The shortcuts can also be rnexported to and imported from an XML file.rnrnCloses #215
docs: Added Qiso reference under the Corona SDK framework (#2112)Also added note against Dusk reference, as it hasn't been updated for over 4 years now.
docs: Added source field for JSON tileset object (#2114)

Python plugin: Disable this plugin by defaultDepending on which version of Python may be installed on the system,ntrying to load the Python plugin can cause a crash. Until we figure outnwhat's causing this and how to prevent it from happening, it's better tondisable the Python plugin by default.nnIssue #2091n

Improved keyboard shortcut settings* Added highlighting of conflicts, along with filtering to show just then  conflicting actions.nn* Search filter now searches all columns rather than just the first onen  (accept when prefixed with key:, in which case it searches only then  shortcut column).nn* Added error message when trying to load an invalid shortcuts file.nnIssue #215n
Fixed saving of tile stamps when using the Shape Fill Tool

JSON plugin: Fixed writing of position for objects without IDNormally all objects have an ID, except for object templates (where wendo not want to write a position), so this will rarely have been annissue. Where it went wrong, is when you load an old map where objects asnpart of tile collision shapes did not have IDs assigned yet, because ifnyou don't edit the tile collision shapes those objects will not get IDsnassigned. This in turn caused their position to not be saved.nnFixed by adjusting the check for whether an object is an objectntemplate.nnForum-topic: https://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/tmx-and-json-object-data-doesnt-seem-to-match/3899n
docs: Use CSV tables in JSON format documentationMakes the file easier to parse for automatic code generation, as wellneasier to write.nnIssue #925n

docs: Corrected and completed the JSON format documentation- Added definitions of Text, Grid, Tile Offset and Property objectsn- Added some missing attributesn- Corrected/updated some descriptionsnnCloses #925n
docs: Added missing only to JSON spec (#2115)

Shortcut settings improvements* Double-clicking to set a shortcut now works on the entire row, rathern  than just the Shortcut column.nn* Enter/Return keys now also trigger the setting of a shortcut.nn* Up/Down/PageUp/PageDown/Enter/Return keys can be used to interactn  with the shortcut list, even when the focus is in the filter widget.nnIssue #215n

Avoid compile warning with MinGW 7.3Make sure that Cell::setTile(Tileset *tileset, int tileId) is declarednas inline before it is referenced, otherwise MinGW issues thenfollowing warning:nnsrclibtiledtilelayer.h:156: warning: 'void Tiled::Cell::setTile(Tiled::Tileset*, int)' redeclared without dllimport attribute after being referenced with dll linkagen
MinGW: Ship a different libgcc DLL depending on the architectureMinGW 32-bit ships with libgcc_s_dw2-1.dll whereas MinGW 64-bit ships withnlibgcc_s_seh-1.dll (at least MinGW 7.3).n

Ship more Qt plugins* Ship style plugins, since native styles were moved inton  plugins as of Qt 5.10. This includes Windows Vista stylen  on Windows and Adwaita on Linux.nn* Ship the SVG icon engine plugin also on Windows, sincen  some icons are now in SVG format.nnCloses #1977n
AppVeyor: Move Windows builds to Qt 5.12 and MinGW 7.3Both 32-bit and 64-bit builds are now done with MinGW.nnWould be nice to still set up a Visual Studio build for testingnpurposes.n
Travis CI: Update Linux builds to Qt 5.12
Avoid detaching (or detach checks) in some placesWith the help from Clazy checks:nndetaching-temporarynrange-loopn
More cleanups based on Clazy checks (level 0)

Travis CI: Build macOS version against Qt 5.12Also updated Qbs to version 1.13.0 for the Linux and macOS builds.nnQbs 1.13 no longer needs Qt to be set up before running the build. Also,nqbs.installPrefix now has some platform-specific defaults that needed tonbe overridden.nnBuildings against Qt 5.12 does increase the minimum required version ofnmacOS to 10.12.n
Updated to C++14
C++14: Use std::make_uniqueWith some help from Clang-Tidy modernize-make-unique.n
Added actions to show/hide and lock/unlock the selected layersAs opposed to all the other layers, for which actions already existed.n
docs: Added the Point type to JSON specCloses #2116n
Python plugin: Add Tile.type() and MapObject.effectiveType() to the API (#2124)Closes #2123

docs: Clarify the meaning of the staggered orientation (#2118)There are three uses of staggered tiles: Staggered Isometric, Staggered Hexagonal, and Staggered Orthogonal (which is normal squares, but each tile has 6 neighbors instead of 9). So the name `staggered` could refer to either the Isometric or the Orthogonal meanings (hexagonal is clearly documented as using staggered axes in addition to the `staggered` orientation).
Python plugin: Allow retrieving the type of a property (#2125)
Fixed view boundaries to take into account layer offsetsAlso made the view boundaries update when layers get added/removed.nnCloses #2090n

Fixed map size when switching infinite offSwitching infinite off is now computationally significantly morenexpensive, but it will not be noticeable anyway. The important thing isnthat the map size will now tightly match the existing map's content,nrather than an approximation of it based on 16x16 chunks.nnAlso fixed some further issues with the map view bounding rect, whichnnow takes offset from group layers into account and updates the mapnborder rectangle when resizing the map in all cases (could previously benskipped if layer bounding rectangles were unaffected by the resize).nnCloses #2051n

Fixed the image cache to check file modification timeThis fixes problems for image files that are not watched for changesn(like the images used by image layers), or when the watching for changesnis disabled by the user. In that case, a restart of Tiled or explicitnreloading of the tilesets using the hidden Ctrl+T shortcut was needednbefore images would be reloaded. Manually changing the image source andnthen back, or just reloading the map was not enough since the imagenwould simply be taken from the cache.nnThe new behavior is that images will be reloaded whenever they are foundnin the cache, but with an out of date last modified timestamp.nnCloses #2081n
Merge branch '1.2'Conflicts:ntsrc/tiled/propertybrowser.cppn
TiledQuickPlugin: Small C++ and Qt modernizations
Bumped version to 1.2.4 and updated NEWS.md file
Merge branch '1.2'
docs: Documented the rect, point and region types (#2099)

Pass QSize and QPoint by valueBeen pointing out in pull requests that they should be passed by value,nsince they are the same size as a pointer so passing by reference justnadds a needless level of indirection and needless verbosity. Better makensure the existing code sets the right example.n

Tiled Quick: Fixed tile layer rendering for partly used layersThis was broken by the change in TiledLayer::bounds, which can returnnonly a part of the layer since the introduction of infinite maps.nnInfinite maps are not supported yet by Tiled Quick.n

Have snapshots show the itch.io devlog in status barThe plan of writing about development snapshots on the main websitendidn't really work out. Probably because it's just a bit more effort tonpublish updates there than to push out a devlog, and also because mostndevelopment snapshot announcements are small and don't feel worthy.nnBut it makes sense to highlight development snapshot updates to peoplenrunning the snapshots.nnAlso made the news button icon display a ! when there are more than 4nunread posts. Displaying 5 was misleading, since it never counts morenthan 5.n
Tiled Quick: Made panning the map more responsiveBy bypassing the animation when it isn't already running (the mousenwheel still uses the animation for smoothness).n

Show the availability of a new version in the status barWhen clicking the status bar button, a dialog pops up that tells younwhat new version is available and your current version, with buttons tonopen the download page or the release notes.n
Snap: Added qtdeclarative5-dev to build-packagesShould resolve build issue:nnProject ERROR: Unknown module(s) in QT: qmln

Made the New Version and News displays optionalWhen turned off, the information is also not requested from the network.nnTo manually check for new updates, the About dialog can now be opened,nwhich will always do a one-time check to update the added button.n

Removed Sparkle and WinSparkleAlso removed the related generation and uploading of appcast files.nnThis essentially reverses all the work done for issue #1089 over threenyears ago. While the auto-updaters may have done their job, in the endnthey caused too many problems as described in issue #2129.nnCloses #2129n
docs: Updated Preferences pageAlso swapped out New in Tiled 1.2 badges for Since Tiled 1.2 badgesnand added some New in Tiled 1.3 badges.n
Travis CI: Push macOS releases to GitHub automatically
Raised minimum Qt version to 5.6This means Ubuntu 16.04 LTS is now no longer supported, so the base fornthe snap has therefor been updated to core18.n

snap: Provide the desktop-qt5 partApparently Remote parts are not supported with bases, so I copy/pastednthis recipe from another snapcraft.yml that I found atnhttps://github.com/ShinjiruApp/Shinjiru/blob/ae1ba175b5394fbcd8e8c893daabeebe19522587/snapcraft.yaml#L23-L46n
snap: Added more build and runtime dependenciesNow the snap should be working again!n

snap: Some updates to snapcraft.yamlMostly cherry-picked from fbeb7085ce98b27715eda7cc54ebf89bbd233f27nand db79dbae8382639957abc1ea878e81459929b2ff, but still using thencore base instead of core18.nnThese updates enabled building a snap for Tiled 1.2.4.n
Added toggle button for Highlight Current Layer action
Changed the shortcut for AutoMap from A to Ctrl+MTo make it harder to trigger it by accident.n
AutoMap: Fixed handling of relative paths in rules.txtBroke in change 2eaed1fb593f7bb72e174ab664f73e86e2de8479 due to reusingna QFileInfo that actually wasn't instantiated with the same path before.n

Scripting: Enabled loading multiple scripts as part of extensionsTiled now searches a system-dependent extensions path, where eachnchild folder is considered an extension. The extensions path can beneasily opened from the Preferences > Plugins page.nnAn extension can contain multiple .js files at its root, all of whichnwill get evaluated. Extensions can also include icon files, which cannthen be used on scripted actions and tools.nnIssue #949n
Animation preview follows zoom factor for tiles (#2050)

Simplified management of attached editablesActually there appears to be no need to keep a map of attachedneditables, since all editables are now already available through thenEditableManager, where all attached editables can be looked up by theirnpointer.n
Updated website URL in About dialog to use https
Scripting: Support specifying an icon directly for toolsSame as for the name.n
Scripting: Moved creation of extension path to ScriptManagerBetter make it available on startup than to require the user to click tonit through the Preferences dialog.n
Tiled Quick: Added F11 shortcut for toggling full screen

Tile Animation Editor: Update preview scale immediatelyInstead of waiting until we have to update the current frame, the scalenof the preview is now changed immediately along with the zoom factor ofnthe tileset view.nnAlso fixed the scale to be applied when the preview is reset as well.nnFinally, the horizontal size hint of the preview label was set to ignorenso that high zoom factors don't break the layout.nnIssue #2050n
Added links to Patreon and Liberapay from GitHub

Worlds: Fixed handling of negative multiplierX/YIt was invalidating the pattern since the mapWidth/mapHeight propertiesndefaulted to values of multiplierX/multiplierY, without taking thenabsolute value, and negative map sizes are invalid.nnSo, a workaround for those affected would be to explicitly set thenmapWidth/mapHeight properties to the appropriate positive value.nnTiled-forum: https://discourse.mapeditor.org/t/negative-value-in-world-offset-value/3963n
Travis CI: Updated download URL for Qt 5.6.3

Introduced ChangeEvent to decouple changes from specific documentsCurrently we rely on signals to notify the UI about specific changesnthat can be made to objects that are part of a document. The MapDocumentnand TilesetDocument both expose a different set of signals.nnOne problem with this is that MapObjects can be part of both types ofndocument, since they are also part of the tile collision shapes that arenstored in a tileset document.nnBy having only a single changed signal and a separate hierarchy ofnChangeEvents, we can decouple the change events from the documents andnallow for example map object changes to be sent by both document types.nHopefully this change will allow making the Tile Collision Editor lessnhacky and enable scripts access to the tile collision shapes.n

Replaced layerChanged signal with LayerChangeEventAt the same time, introduced some flags so that handlers of the changenevent know what layer properties changed, which was used to avoid somenunnecessary updating.n
Added change events for add/remove objects

Scripting: Provide read/write access to tile collision shapesTo enable this, the last relevant change signal,nMapDocument::objectGroupChanged, was changed to thenObjectGroupChangeEvent, allowing an EditableObjectGroup and thenEditableMapObject to be changed so that they only need to refer to annEditableAsset rather than an EditableMap.nnThis means EditableTile::objectGroup can now return annEditableObjectGroup, and the Tile Collision Editor can use the changenevents to make sure its copy of the tile's object group is re-creatednwhen necessary.nnWhat doesn't work, is the selected property of map objects that arenpart of the tile's object group, since object selection still requires anMapDocument, and there is no way to access to the dummy document used bynthe Tile Collision Editor, which anyway uses a copy of the object group.nTo solve this, ideally there would not be a copy, but to avoid thatnwould require way too many other changes at this point.nnIssue #949n
Fixed possible crash on exitThe EditableTileset need to be deleted before the Tileset that it isnreferencing.n
