author_name: Jou00c3u00a3o Baptista de Paula e Silva
commit_message: docs: Added the new AutoMapping options (#2144)
Scripting: Added access to the tilesets of a mapTileMap.tilesetsnTileMap.addTileset()nTileMap.replaceTileset()nTileMap.removeTileset()nTileMap.usedTilesets()n
Added persistent history of commands to Console windowThe last 10 commands are remembered now.n
docs: Added Castle Game Engine to referenceA game engine using Object Pascal, which supports Tiled maps nativelynamong many other features.nnCloses #2074n

Scripting: Added access to more tile properties and terrainsTile.terrainnTile.framesnTile.animatednTile.terrainAtCorner()nTile.setTerrainAtCorner()nTileset.terrainsnTerrain.idnTerrain.namenTerrain.imageTilenTerrain.tilesetn

Added selection of tile layers in map view with Ctrl + Right ClickCtrl + Right Click can now be used to select the top-most tile layernwith content at the clicked location.nnCtrl+Alt + Right Click will select all layers with content at thenclicked location.nnCtrl+Shift + Right Click will toggle the selection of the top-most tilenlayer with content at the clicked location.nnCtrl+Shift+Alt + Right Click  will toggle the selection of all tilenlayers with content at the clicked location (this gets a little strangensometimes, so not sure if it's the best behavior...).nnAll existing tools needed to change to allow the abstract base for tilentools to implement this behavior. I'm not entirely happy with this andnmay look into improving the interaction model in general later.n

Start Zstandard compression + compression levelForward compression level to top methodnnLast fixnnFix compression method, now the zstd load and save correctlynnTry fix compression level but failednnTry morennFix for gzipnnDo zstd optional, some improvementsn
Fix bug when setting compression level
Properly save compressionlevel when using json

Bunch of coding style cleanups and minor changes* Preprocessor checks start on first columnn* Space between if( and after comma, { not on next line after ifn* Compression level int instead of unsigned intn* Compression level -1 used to mean default for compression methodn* Default compression method back to Zlibn* Don't arbitrarily refuse to set compression in Map::setCompressionLeveln* compressionlevel -> compressionLeveln* Don't pass member variable as argument to member function calln  in MapWriterPrivaten* Fixed applying of compression level to child layers in Lua exportn
tmxrasterizer: Load plugins to support additional map formats (#2152)
Added custom output chunk size option to map properties (#2130)Closes #2121rn

Further changes* Introduced Tiled::compressionToString to share creation of compressionn  method string based on layer data format.nn* Hide Base64 (Zstandard compressed) in Properties window and in then  New Map dialog when this compression method is not supported.n

Zstd configuration* Make zstd configurable in qbs/qmaken* Have linux builds compile with Zstdn* Directly use QByteArray for Zstd compressionn* Linux automated buildsn* OSX automated buildn* Windows automated buildn

Merge pull request #1888 from alphaonex86/masterAdd Zstandard + compression levelnnCloses #1886nnConflicts:ntsrc/libtiled/maptovariantconverter.cppntsrc/libtiled/maptovariantconverter.hntsrc/libtiled/mapwriter.cppntsrc/plugins/lua/luaplugin.cppntsrc/tiled/changemapproperty.cppntsrc/tiled/changemapproperty.hntsrc/tiled/propertybrowser.cppntsrc/tiled/propertybrowser.hn
Removed unconditional TILED_ZSTD_SUPPORT define
AppVeyor / Travis CI: Clone only a truncated master branch of zstd

Fixed exporting to a file name with multiple dotsFor example, you could not export a map as map-0.0.1.json because itnwould try to find a map format that used a 0.1.json file extension.nnAs a workaround for this issue, the format can be explicitly selected bynusing the file type filter in the file dialog. Then Tiled does notnsearch for a matching format.nnCloses #2149n
Merge branch '1.2'

Fixed a few things in the appdata.xml file* Fixed value for <metadata_license>n* Added <content_rating> (empty since this doesn't apply to Tiled)n* Added <releases>, listing the current releasesnnCloses #2150n
Keep same layer selected when switching maps in a worldBased on searching for a layer with the same name.n
Keep similar tileset selected when switching maps within world

Fixed some issues when switching between maps in a world* Selecting the same tileset didn't work, because it was happeningn  before the switch to the other map, at which point tilesets embeddedn  in the other map are actually not shown yet in the Tilesets view,n  so they can't be selected.nn* Synchronizing possible multiple selected layers was broken, becausen  once the switch to the other map happened, the Layers view wouldn  cause a selection change that reset the selected layers to just then  current one.nn* Fixed a few potential crashes, like when switching away from a mapn  without any layers or without any tilesets.n
Merge pull request #2087 from JustinZhengBC/BUG-2065Try to keep layers selected by name when switching maps in a worldrnrnCloses #2065

A few more corrections to the appdata.xml* Change order of releases such that the most recent one is at the topn  (required according to appstream-util validate)nn* Added <translation> tag (explicitly optional in specification, butn  required according to appstream-util validate)nn* Fixed 'url' in releases to use a tag instead of attribute.n

Fixed possible crash in AutoMapperThe AutoMapperWrapper searched layers by name, assuming their type innthe target map was the same as in the rule map. This change makes thensearch more specific, to prevent a crash when a layer with the same namenbut of a different type is present.nnCloses #2157n
Merge branch '1.2'Conflicts:ntsrc/tiled/automapperwrapper.cppn

Scripting: Enable executing of custom commandsWhile scripts can't execute just about anything, they can now executencustom commands that have been set up by the user. The command willnexecute in the context of the current document, like when triggerednmanually.nnThis change also fixes the copying of a few command settings likenworking directory, showOutput and saveBeforeExecute when copyingncommands.n

Improved how file system watcher handles replaced files (#2158)It appears that when files get re-created, the watcher can start rnhandling the filesystem change before the file actually gets recreated.rnSo the new version of the file doesn't exist, and never gets added backrnto the watcher.rnrnThis change moves the functionality of re-adding the file to the watcher rninto the timeout handler. In my tests, this gives it enough time for thernfile to exist again, and thus gets re-added.rnrnCloses #44
Scripting: Added functions to open, close and reload filestiled.open(fileName)ntiled.close(asset)ntiled.reload(asset)nnIssue #949n
Console: Focus the text input when the console becomes visible
Scripting: Added access to the properties of text objectsIssue #949n
use QHash instead of QList for Document::sDocumentInstances

Cache the canonical path of the DocumentThis avoids recalculating the canonical path in the destructor and innsetFileName. It also makes the canonical path readily available whennsearching the open documents for a particular file.n
Fixed layer IDs getting re-assigned when resizing the mapThis happened as well when toggling infinite on/off, since thatneffectively does a resize as well.nnCloses #2160n
Merge pull request #2159 from oncer/hash-documentinstancesUse QHash instead of QList for Document::sDocumentInstances.rnrnCloses #2156

Simplified the implementation of ReversingProxyModelInstead of implementing an entire custom proxy that attempts to reversenthe children, the new implementation just relies onnQSortFilterProxyModel and does a reverse sort on the row IDs.nnThis might be a bit slower theoretically, since sorting was not actuallynrequired, but it avoids a lot of tricky code and removes bugs in thatncode that affected future patches.nnIt's also nice to be able to apply a filter to it without needing tonchain together multiple proxy models.n

Added search filter to the Objects viewThanks to @thabetx for working on the initial implementation of thisnin pull request #1566. This patch takes some ideas from there, but it'snrewritten from scratch.nnThe biggest difference is that after changing the implementation of thenReversingProxyModel to be based on QSortFilterProxyModel, this patch cannnow apply the filter directly instead of needing to use another proxynmodel. This makes the patch a lot smaller.nnCloses #1467nCloses #1566n

Fixed adjacent maps within a world not being properly clickableDue to the layer bounding rect being only a rough approximation based onnwhich chunks are allocated, the clickable region of a map could extendnbeyond the map's boundaries, blocking clicks to neighboring maps.nnNow the bounding rect of tile layer items is now more precise fornfixed-size maps, like it was before change c9047b4f236fc68a06d.n

Restored optimization when rendering fixed-size tile layersUsing TileLayer::bounds() to determine the bounding rect of a tile layernitem avoids looping over large empty areas of a layer while trying tondraw it. Hence, for fixed-size maps the intersection withnTileLayer::rect() should be used rather than only using the fixed size.nnThis optimization was broken in change 651c3d0b39d7.n
Merge branch '1.2'

Fixed duplicated entries in Objects view after grouping layersWhen handling the layerAdded signal, it may be the first time wenretrieve the filtered child layers for a given parent layer. In thatncase, the layer that was just added is already in the list.n
Merge branch '1.2'
Merge pull request #2006 from vizor-games/libtiled-tile-read-fixVarious libtiled-java improvements.
Link zstd static library instead of dynamic library on Windows (#2173)
libtiled: Use less magic numbers in Tiled::compress
Fixed restoring of expanded group layers in Objects viewWhen switching between maps or when using the object filter and thennclearing it again, expanded group layers would fail to be restored.n

Tile Stamps view: Make it possible to bind shortcuts to create stampsThese shortcuts will however only work when the Tile Stamps view isnvisible. That is helpful anyway, since it gives visual feedback and whennsaving a stamp you can immediately give it a name.nnIt could be even more helpful when triggering the NewStamp action wouldnmake the Tile Stamps view visible, but that would currently requirenmoving those actions into the main menu.n

Added option to minimize output on exportThe new Minimize output export option causes the writers that supportnit to omit unnecessary whitespace. This change adds support fornminimized output for the TMX, JSON and Lua formats.nnThis option is also available on the command line by using --minimize inncombination with --export-map or --export-tileset.nnCloses #944n
Travis CI: Compile only the static libzstd.a for macOS (#2175)Fixes #2174.

AppVeyor: Removed Windows 32-bit buildLikely nobody really need the Windows 32-bit build since surelyneverybody is on Windows 64-bit by now. Except of course, those stillnusing Windows XP, but they have their own build already.nnSee https://thorbjorn.itch.io/tiled/devlog/92556/sunsetting-windows-32-bit-buildsn

Removed the automappingconverter toolIt was introduced with Tiled 0.9 because it changed the AutoMappingnsystem in a backwards-incompatible way. This was 6 years ago, so thentool has long lost its usefulness.nnAlso removed references in the manual to AutoMapping rules suitable fornTiled 0.8 and earlier.n
docs: Added note that <object> can have <point> as a child (#2177)This is noted in the section for <point>, but <object> was missing this as a possibility.
Fixed clickability of empty maps that are part of a worldFor empty maps, the union of the bounding rect of all the tile layersnstill yields an empty bounding rect.n

Added Issues view for displaying warnings and errorsThe plan is for this new view to replace existing error reportingnmechanisms in some places and to provide a place where errors reportednfrom scripts can be collected.nnEach error only shows up once, with duplicates being counted (currentlynnot displayed, but is planned to be).nnThe script function tiled.error() now displays the error both in thenConsole and the Issues view, and a new function tiled.warn() was addednto create warnings.n
Report AutoMapping errors and warnings in the new Issues viewFor now, they will also still be shown in the status bar or as a popup,ndepending on whether AutoMapping was triggered manually.n
Fixed invalid Zstandard compressed layer dataThe Zstandard compressed layer data could be invalid due to unintializednmemory being included at the end.nnFix by @alphaonex86.nnCloses #2178n
Merge branch '1.2'
Issues view: Display occurrences and fixed colors with dark theme

Scripting: Added TileMap enum values and Tileset.selectedTilesTileset.selectedTiles controls which tiles are selected in the tilesetneditor. It does not provide access to which tiles are selected thentileset view while editing a map.n
Tiled Fusion style: Reduced saturation of background color for views

Issues: Added optional activation callbackThis functionality is currently only used from scripts, which can pass anfunction that should be called when an issue is activatedn(double-clicked or selected + Enter key).nnAlso added scripting API for selecting and focusing objects in the TilenCollision Editor.n
docs: Clarify object rotation (#2182)Clarify the center of rotation for objectsrnrnAlso adds a note about rotation for tile-objects.

docs: Added technical details for font display (#2183)Explain in detail how fonts are laid out in the object. Also note in the documentation that fonts are clipped outside of the bounds of their object.rnrnThese details were determined from how Tiled handles text objects.
AppVeyor: Updated the version of Qbs to 1.13.1No longer need to run setup-qt.n

Travis CI: Rely on install script by Richard WeickeltSeems to be rather more convenient and hopefully faster than relying onna PPA (as done on Linux) or extracting stuff from the huge Qt installern(as done on macOS).nnAlso removes the need to compile Qbs ourselves. Now the Qbs releasednalong with Qt Creator is used.nnAt the same time the builds are now updated from Qt 5.12.3 to 5.12.4.n
Scripting: Added Tile.imageFileName propertyFor tiles that are part of image collection tilesets.n
Scripting: Report script errors also in Issues viewCould be fun to try hooking these up to opening the script at the givennline, though this would need some configuration support.n

docs: Specify defaults for name and type (#2185)It wasn't clear from the documentation whether the `name` and `type` fields could be safely omitted from TMX files. Giving them a default value makes clear that they can be left out.
Added export to Defold .collection files (#2084)
Fixed compile after merging Defold collection pluginA signature of an overridden method changed in the meantime.n

Scripting: Enable setting of Tile.objectGroupWhile it was possible to inspect and modify the object group, there wasnno way to replace it or to set it when there was no object groupnassociated with the tile yet.n
docs: Added documentation for defoldcollection plugin (#2186)
Fixed crash when unloading certain pluginsWhen disabling a plugin that does not derive from the Plugin interface,na crash would occur due to the use of the plugin object after it hadnbeen deleted.n

Extended the use of the new Issues viewThe following issues now show in the Issues view as well:nn* Errors and warnings reported by Python scriptsn* Errors output by custom commandsn* Warnings previously written to standard-error in the tBIN pluginn* New warning in tBIN plugin when animation frame durations differnnThis change also significantly simplifies the way the logging isnconnected to the UI, by making the LoggingInterface a singleton insteadnof adding instances of it to the PluginManager.nnThe AutoMapper uses new system to make its warnings and errors show upnin both the Console and the Issues view.nnIssues with callbacks reported from a script now get counted twice, sonprobably more refactoring is needed.n
Resolved the problem with issue duplicatesIssues with callback are no longer counted twice in the Issues view.nThe automatic prefixing of Error:  and Warning:  was removed.n
Issues view: Added icons instead of relying on the themeOtherwise icons only work on Linux.n

Replaced private slots: with just private:Apart from 3rd party code and the tests there is no reason anymore tonhave private slots being part of the QMetaObject, since we're no longernusing the string-based connect syntax and private slots are not callablenfrom scripts either.n
Fixed compile against Qt < 5.10Re-introduced a case of private slot because one method is used withnQMetaObject::invokeMethod, which until Qt 5.10 could not yet handlenmember function pointers.n
Fixed some image linksBroke recently when I simplified the folder name.n
docs: Added Tileson to C++ libsAlso removed a broken link.n
README.md: Replaced qmake instructions with qbs and mention PythonLong due update, since qmake was already deprecated on Windows and I'mnpersonally using Qbs on macOS and Linux as well.n
AutoMapping: Allow any supported map format to be used for rule mapsPreviously it would only load TMX files.n

Issues view: Added a few standard callbacks for C++ pluginsThe following callbacks are now available to C++ plugins and Tiled codenin general, which can be used to make reported errors and warnings morenuseful:nn* OpenFilen* JumpToTilen* JumpToObjectn* SelectLayern* SelectTilennSome of these are now used by errors and warnings reported by the tBINnplugin, the GMX plugin and the AutoMapper.n
Issues view: Fixed text color of counter and insertions of duplicates
Scripting: Added a way to change the currently displayed tilesetAlso added Cell.empty property for convenience.n
Added error and warning counts to the status barClicking this new area opens the Issues view.n

Fixed some connections in objects context menuThey became non-functional when I removed the private slots in changen415879a5c57d840ecd6, because the connections to their triggered signalnwere string-based.nnNow the connections are compile-time checked, but there are probablynmore issues like this.n

Report issues for missing tilesets and templatesDouble-clicking the issues opens a file chooser for locating the filesnelsewhere, and replaces the tileset / template for the map in which thenissue happened (this may be a little problematic, since multiple mapsnmay need their references corrected).nnI wanted to replace the broken links widget with this, but it does notncover all the functionality of that widget, and I'm not sure how to makenit do that. In particular the ability to select a directory to searchnfor all missing files is hard to give a new place.n

Issues view: Show warnings for custom file path propertiesA warning is now added if the custom file path property points to a filenthat does not exist.nnDouble-clicking the warning will generally select the relevant object,nbring the Properties view into focus and select the custom property,nthough this has not been implemented for all cases (see added todos).nnCloses #2080n
Reduced code duplication

Added shortcuts for next/previous tilesetI went for '[' and ']', which work good on a US layout. When necessary Inthink the defaults could be changed based on the language, or we choosendifferent defaults entirely.nnI considers Ctrl+Left/Right first, but that conflicts with cursornnavigation and view panning.nnCloses #1238n

Save the last export target and format in the map/tileset fileSaving this information in the file allows the export to be repeatednwithout prompt even after restarting Tiled. This is supported for bothnTMX and JSON formats.nnAt the same time, the export format is now remembered by its short namenrather than a smart pointer, which makes sure that when the right formatncan still be picked after loading/unloading a plugin or changing annexport script.nnThe fallback to TMX or TSX formats has also been removed, since it wouldnonly cause problems to silently export in these formats when anpreviously used format can't be found.nnThe export target is stored with a relative path, so that the settingnmay be generally useful also when the file is shared.nnIssue #1610n
Removed option to include a DTD in the saved filesIt's been off by default since years and I think there is no point innturning it on, especially since there isn't even an updated DTD.n

Added Ctrl+Space as shortcut to trigger object types dropdownNormally the object types dropdown appears when you start to type, butnby pressing Ctrl+Space you can now trigger the dropdown also withoutntyping something, in which case you see the full list of object types.nnEven better would be to replace the QLineEdit/QCompleter combo with anneditable combo box.n
Use an editable combo box for the Type propertyThis makes it easier select one of the predefined object types.nnCloses #823n
Added title to Save File As dialogI'm pretty sure this used to be there by default, but maybe it wasnsimply lost or forgotten entirely.n

Added option to repeat the last export on saveAlso, unset the export file name when the map or tileset is saved underna different name, since this likely means the previously used exportnname should also be different (for now I tried to not be too smart aboutnthis).nnCloses #1610n

When selecting multiple objects, make sure one of them is currentThis avoids the problem that when changing any of the properties afternselecting or pasting multiple objects, the change will affect not onlynthe selected objects but also the previously current object (and thatnthe Properties view still displays the values from that previousnobject).n
tmxrasterizer: Added rendering of object layers (#2187)Also do not abort rendering if not all TMX files inside a world can be loaded.

Fixed tileset view to keep position at mouse stable when zoomingAlso, the selection is no longer reset when changing the scale of thentileset view or the Wang template view, by usingn`scheduleDelayedItemsLayout` instead of resetting the model.nnCloses #2039n

Fixed MainWindow::exportDocument to use the right pointerWhen saving a file other than the current one, it would anyway attemptnto export the current one. This bug would have affected the automaticnexport when using the Save All action.n

Fixed the Rename Property actionWas broken by the removal of private slots, because the connectionnstill relied on the SLOT() macro. Now modern-style connect syntax isnused.nnAlso fixed leaking of QInputDialog instances each time a property isnrenamed.n
Fixed a bunch of main window menu icon referencesCaused missing icons in the menus on Windows.n

Moved output chunk size into editorsettings sectionFor both the TMX and the JSON map formats.nnFor the Lua format, the this information was simply removed since eachnchunk already specifies its size and this additional information wasnonly for the editor. Lua files are currently not readable by the editor.nnFinalizes issue #2130n

Added dynamic wrapping mode to the tileset viewCan be toggled in the Tilesets view and in the Tileset Editor. Thendefault mode depends on whether the tileset is based on a tileset imagenor is a collection of images.nnCloses #1241nCloses #2127n

Python plugin: Added Tileset.sharedPointer() functionTo get the shared pointer from a Tileset* value, since this is needed tonpass it as an arguement to Map.indexOfTileset().nnAlso added trimming of trailing whitespace, which was causing emptynlines in the Issues view (affecting Python script output).nnSee issue #2191n
Fixed ability to create new tilesetsThe connection to the Save As / OK button was broken since it previouslynrelied on connecting to a private slot by string.n
Made the shortcuts of some Tileset Editor actions configurableThey were not registered yet with the action manager.n
Use std::unique_ptr some more* Return std::unique_ptr for Map::clone and TileLayer::copyn* Use std::unique_ptr for ownership of layers in AutoMapperWrappern

Scripting: Added initial access to tile stamp and tile edit previewThe current tile stamp can now be accessed via thenMapEditor.currentBrush property. If the tile stamp has multiplenvariations, this property returns the first one. To change the tilenstamp, a map can be assigned to this property. Support for stamps withnmultiple variations may be added later.nnA scripted tool can now set a tile edit preview via thenScriptedTool.preview property. Soon it will also be possible tonconveniently merge the preview to actually apply the change.nnIssue #949n

Simplified and optimized the PaintTileLayer commandWith infinite tile layers, there no longer was a need for the command tonresize and shift around the tile layers that kept track of the old andnnew tile layer contents.nnAlso simplified memory management with std::unique_ptr.n
Make more use of standard algorithms in LayerModel

Scripting: Added TileMap.merge for applying tile layer editsThis function makes it possible to prepare a TileMap() instance innadvance and then to apply changes to multiple layers at once to thentarget map.nnIt is mainly useful to apply the changes that have already been madenvisible through the ScriptedTool.preview.nnIssue #949n
Fixed compile against Qt < 5.8
Compile using GitHub Actions (#2193)Compile Tiled on the latest version of Ubuntu.
Removed unused and accidentally added header fileThat was one approach I tried to exposing enums to the scripts.n
GitHub Actions: Run an 'apt update' before the installHopefully avoids running into 404s while installing packages.n

Tileset view: Made sure there is always at least 1 columnWithout this, columnCount would get set to 0 when even 1 column wouldnnot fit, which was causing the column count in non-dynamic wrapping modento be used instead.nnAlso made sure the tiles are at least 1 pixel regardless of the scale.n
Removed usage of a deprecated QDir assignment operatorThe operator for assigning QString to QDir was deprecated in Qt 5.13.n
Scripting: Added a few new ways to interact with the UIMapEditor.currentMapViewnMapView.scalenMapView.centerOn(x, y)nTileCollisionEditor.viewn

Scripting: Resolved garbage collection issuesIf a QObject that was passed to the JavaScript engine is still alive,nthat does not mean that it can always still be turned into a non-nullnQJSValue. Hence, before we return a cached QObject instance, we need toncheck for this.nnAlso explicitly set QQmlEngine::JavaScriptOwnership on these objects,nbecause when they are returned from a Q_PROPERTY the ownership wouldnotherwise default to CppOwnership and the object would never get deletedn(which resulted in tileset instances still being around on shutdown).n
Scripting: Set a parent for scripted dialogsThe tiled.alert, tiled.confirm and tiled.prompt dialogs now have thenmain window as parent, which fixes their icon and positioning.n

Fixed build warnings on macOS with Qt 5.13.1 (#2196)src/libtiled/tileset.cpp:517:19: warning: 'swap' is deprecated: Use QList<T>::swapItemsAt() [-Wdeprecated-declarations]rnsrc/libtiled/wangset.cpp:596:5: warning: 'qStableSort<QList<Tiled::WangTile>::iterator>' is deprecated: Use std::stable_sort [-Wdeprecated-declarations]rnsrc/libtiled/logginginterface.h:51:1: warning: 'Issue' defined as a struct here but previously declared as a class [-Wmismatched-tags]rnsrc/tiled/commanddatamodel.cpp:489:19: warning: 'swap' is deprecated: Use QList<T>::swapItemsAt() [-Wdeprecated-declarations]rnsrc/tiled/changepolygon.h:100:9: warning: private field 'mObjectIndex' is not used [-Wunused-private-field]rnsrc/tiled/tiledproxystyle.cpp:126:24: warning: 'find' is deprecated: Use bool find(const QString &, QPixmap *) instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]rnsrc/tiled/tiledproxystyle.cpp:373:64: warning: 'foreground' is deprecated: Use QPalette::windowText() instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]rnsrc/tiled/tiledproxystyle.cpp:881:49: warning: 'foreground' is deprecated: Use QPalette::windowText() instead [-Wdeprecated-declarations]rnsrc/libtiled/logginginterface.h:51:1: warning: 'Issue' defined as a struct here but previously declared as a class [-Wmismatched-tags]rnsrc/tiled/issuesdock.h:31:1: warning: class 'Issue' was previously declared as a struct [-Wmismatched-tags]

Scripting: Added support for custom binary map formatsThe 'toString' member for scripted map formats has now been renamed ton'write' and may return either a string or an ArrayBuffer object.nnWhen an error happens during export a backtrace is now reported in thenConsole and Issues views.nnAlso, no longer fall back to Export As when triggering Export runsninto an error. Turns out opening the file dialog after the error dialognis just annoying.nnIssue #949n

Scripting: Added support for reading custom map filesEither binary or text files are supported. However, the scripting APInis still severely lacking, so actually setting up the map in the readnfunction is not possible yet.nnProblems due to missing API include:nn* Can't set the size of the mapn* Can't set up any tilesets, which means we can't assign any tiles unlessn  we have the tileset already open in Tiled.nnIssue #949n

Scripting: Added ability to set the size of a mapAlso refactored the EditableAsset and EditableMap a little, moving thenundo stack back into Document and the 'resize' method back intonMapDocument. This is to keep the Editable wrappers as small asnpossible since they are only meant to be used from the script.nnIssue #949n

Scripting: Made Map and Tileset modification API more completeAdded the following functions and property:nn* Tileset.addTile()n* Tileset.removeTiles(tiles)n* Tileset.setTileSize(width, height)n* Tileset.imagen* Map.setTileSize(width, height)nnMade the following properties writable:nn* Tileset.tileWidthn* Tileset.tileHeightnnAlso made attempted Layer and Tileset modifications report read-onlynerrors instead of silently doing nothing (in case of assets not loadednfrom a file).nnThe API now finally enables implementing a reader for certain custom mapnformats.nnIssue #949n
docs: Added a note on how firstgid works to the JSON page (#2202)
Added GitHub Sponsors funding option
Qbs: Added instructions for generating VS 2017 projectsCloses #1956
README.md: Updated website links to use https
Travis CI: Fixed the Linux AppImageDue to a missing library the linuxdeployqt tool was aborting, causingnmany files to be missing from the package.n
Travis CI: Updated the versions of Qt and Qbs

Worlds: Report pattern loading errors in the Issues and Console viewsPreviously these were warnings printed to standard output.nnDouble-clicking the reported issues attempts to open the world file.nnCloses #2201n

Scripting: Added TileMap.autoMapThis function enables manually triggering the AutoMap action with anspecific region and/or rules file.nnAlso made the rules file automatically reload when it changes due tonsaving the map to a different location.n
docs: Updated note about Python version on LinuxThe situation didn't exactly become any better unfortunately...n
Bumped version to 1.2.5 and updated NEWS.md file
Merge branch '1.2'Conflicts:nttiled.qbsn
Bumped version to 1.3.0 and updated NEWS.md fileThis marks the start of the Tiled 1.3 Beta.n
docs: tiled.executeCommand doesn't return anythingIt may fail to find the command, but in that case it raises an error.n
Fixed a typo in the Swedish translation (#2203)

Fixed undo for terrain brush on previously empty areaSince change 6ca522e1e7b96802a9484d7a467ced2918a0d577, the source tilenlayer used for TileLayer::setCells can have 0 width and height, but whenna non-empty region is given alongside that means we want to erase thatnregion.nnNow there exists two overloads for TileLayer::setCells, one that worksnas before based on the size of the given layer, and one that always setsnall cells in the given area. There did not appear to be a use-case forndoing the intersection.n

Fixed potential crash in Property editorA property change could result in the insertion of a null pointer, whichncould later get dereferenced because the map was not expected to containnnull pointers.nnCloses #2200n
Tiled Quick: Don't render hidden layers (#2198)Fixes #2197

Scripting: Removed the deprecated startup.js loadingTo make it easier to install single-file extensions, such files can nownalso be placed directly in the extensions directory, rather thannneeding to be placed in a sub-directory.nnAlso made some documentation updates.n
Added fit in view action
Updated the zoom icons and added one for 'fit-best'These are copied from the GNOME icon theme, as noted in the AUTHORS.mdnfile.n
Scripting: Grouped together all translatable script errorsAlso added some missing read-only checks and consolidated some filenrelated errors as well.n
Scripting: Added support for scripted tileset formatsAlso documented the support for reading maps and tilesets a littlen(example missing).n

Display Qt warnings and errors in Console and Issues viewsThis change intercepts any debug messages, warnings and error messagesnsent through the Qt library in order to display them in the Console andnIssues views.nnIt may be confusing because some of these messages may not be anythingnthe user can do something about, but this seems like the only way to getnscript errors that happen while calling functions connected to signalsnto be visible. We'll see if there's any messages that should rather benfiltered out.n
Fixed compile when using clang 7.0.0error: no viable conversion from returned value of type 'nullptr_t' to function return type 'Tiled::SharedTileset' (aka 'QSharedPointer<Tiled::Tileset>')n
Fixed compile on MinGWsrc/tiled/main.cpp:119:52: error: expression cannot be used as a functionn ERROR(qFormatLogMessage(type, context, msg));n^n

Small improvements to Fit in View action* Be more clear that it only applies to maps and disable the actionn  when a tileset is selected.nn* Fixed the area that it fits into the view in case multiple maps aren  visible as part of a world.n
Merge pull request #2206 from mateosss/mateosss/fit-in-viewAdded Fit Map in View action.

Use %n for plural translations in issue counter (#2212)With `tr(%1..., , n)`, Qt looks for two markers in the translation: `%1` for the argument and `%n` to select the right plural.rnQt Linguist flags translations that don't have `%n` and `%1`.rnBut, it makes sense to only have the number once in the translation.

Added UTF-8 encoding support for script files (#2218)
Removed a duplicate translatable stringWe don't need Tile Layer 1 because we already have a more genericnTile Layer %1 string that we can use.n

Fixed visible area changing when reloading mapThis seemed to be mainly due to the current view state not being savednyet when the reloaded map was opened. Since closing the old map firstncauses an unwanted additional switch of document, the state is now savednexplicitly before opening the new version.nnAlso, the new map is not immediately inserted at the right index, rathernmoving the tab to the right place afterwards.nnFinally, a rounding error was avoided when restoring the center of thenview, making sure it stays absolutely stable upon reload.nnCloses #2213n

Make shortcuts no longer translatableI currently know of no actual usage of this feature to change a shortcutnin a particular language. The only thing this seems to have done is toncause confusion and extra work for translators who will translate thennames of the keys, which causes the shortcuts to break since Qt nonlonger knows which key is meant.nnIf there are any keys that need adjustment based on language or keyboardnlayout, it's probably best to handle them explicitly somewhere.n

Scripting: Allow changing the size of a tile layer* TileLayer.width, TileLayer.height and TileLayer.size are now writable.n  Changing these properties directly does not affect the contents of then  tile layer.nn* Added TileLayer.resize(size, offset) to change the size and then  contents of a tile layer.n

Removed the pretty much empty tiled_zh.tsAccording to Weblate, this file is anyway a duplicate of tiled_zh_CN.tsnsince it considers zh_Hans and zh_CN to be the same language.nnUsing 'zh_CN' instead of just 'zh' has the advantage of matching thenfiles distributed with Qt.n

Scripting: Changed the way file formats write to filesRather than handling the return value as either a string or annArrayBuffer to be written to a file, the script can use the TextFile ornBinaryFile API to write to the file by itself. This also enables exportnformats that write several files, so the 'outputFiles' function is nownavailable for custom map formats.nnWhen the 'write' function returns a non-empty string it is now shown asnerror message.nnAlso made TextFile and BinaryFile use QSaveFile when writing, which addsnthe need to call commit() when done but avoids loss of data in case ofndisk errors or code errors.nnAlso fixed BinaryFile.OpenMode enum to be actually exposed to thenscript.nnIssue #949n

Changed 'Fit Map in View' shortcut to Ctrl+/Ctrl+Shift+J was already taken (by 'Layer via Cut') and Ctrl+/ seemsnlike an easy to remember shortcut for fitting the map to the view givennthe proximity to the other zoom-changing shortcuts.n
Updated Tiled 1.3.0 changelog and release date
docs: Added an anchor to Asset.macro

Fixed edit template and tile collision editor viewsThis broke in commit 3b27c6a39196ea253131bc52c66ac4fd052f272f.nnThe addition of making the map fit into view by default caused a nearninfinite scale to be set on these views because their map has 0 size,nmaking them appear entirely white and perform badly.n
NEWS.md: Added an issue number for the scripting support
Updated release datePrevious builds unfortunately included a serious regression affectingnthe template editor and the tile collision editor.n
Removed 'beta' label from version in documentation
Added snap build status to the READMEThe build is currently failing, maybe having this here would have helpednme notice that faster.n
snap: Fixed license fieldThe license validation does not accept the or later part.n

Tiled Quick: Don't compile/install by defaultWhen building with qmake, you now need to pass CONFIG+=tiled_quick tonget the tiledquickplugin and tiledquick to build.nnWhen building with Qbs, tiledquickplugin and tiledquick will only benbuilt when mentioned specifically using the --products/-p command-linenargument. Generally tiledquickplugin does not need to be mentionednbecause it will build as a dependency of tiledquick.nnAlso fixed the installation path on UNIX to be $${PREFIX}/bin instead ofninstalling into /opt, when using qmake.nnFinally raised the minimum version of Qt for tiledquickplugin to 5.6,nsince it's the minimum version supported by libtiled.nnCloses #2673n
Fixed Undo/Redo shortcuts to be configurableCloses #2669n

Fixed importing of keyboard settings (.kms files)This was broken since a QStringRef representing the name of the actionnwas referenced beyond the lifetime of the string it was referencing. Itnmay have worked sometimes, or a code change broke it after I had testednthe import.nnCloses #2671n

Made the shortcuts for the tools configurableWith the implementation being not exactly trivial this is really a newnfeature, but I'm including it in Tiled 1.3 anyway since it really shouldnhave been included in the initial release.nnCloses #2666n
Added a status bar to the startup screenDisplays the error/warning counters, news and new version notifications,nwhich are generally useful even when no files are open.n
Reload object types file when it is changed externally (#2674)
Windows: Fixed the shipped version of OpenSSLQt 5.12.5 was built against OpenSSL 1.1.1, whereas Tiled was stillnshipping with OpenSSL 1.0.2. This caused the news and update checksnto fail.n

Fixed small window showing up on startupIt was caused by the NewVersionButton, which can call setVisible(true)nin its constructor. Since that was before it got parented into thenhierarchy this caused it to become visible as its own top-level windownfor a split second.nnFixed by passing the parent already to the constructor.n

snap: Updated the method used to set the versionSee https://snapcraft.io/docs/deprecation-notices/dn10n

Avoid inheriting Properties from QVariantMapNow it's just a simple alias. This avoids issues with inheriting fromnQMap, which happen because its destructor is not virtual and inline,nleading to multiple definitions in case there's another library usingnlibtiled and QMap<QString,QVariant>.nnCloses #2679n
Windows installer: Ship the 'defoldcollection' pluginThis plugin got added in commit 28bceb2419d81c854145c2da7e9e0367defde,nbut I forgot to add it to the Windows installer.nnCloses #2677n

Fixed the tileset view to respect the 'wheel zooms by default' preferenceExcept when dynamic wrapping mode is enabled, in which case I think thendefault behavior of the scroll wheel is always expected to be scrolling.n

Worlds: Fixed issue with patterns when multiple worlds are loadedWhen multiple worlds were loaded that use pattern matching, the patternsnof each world were tested when determining to which world the currentnmap belongs, without considering their path. This could lead to adjacentnmaps from the wrong world getting shown.nnPossibly related to issue #2675, since it would also lead to the currentnmap not actually getting a MapItem instance. But I couldn't reproducenthe crash so far.n
Travis CI: Updated builds to Qt 5.12.6This updates the Qt version used by the Linux and macOS snapshots.n
Fixed stamp action shortcuts not being configurableCloses #2684n

macOS: Fixed black toolbar when enabling OpenGL renderingThe unified tool bar is not supported when using an QGLWidget ornQOpenGLWidget and leads to the tool bar rendering in black. Makensure to disable the unified tool bar when OpenGL rendering isnenabled.nnCloses #1839n
Made custom Flip and Rotate shortcuts apply to object actions tooExtends e2265f38b9cb442cbd6a42fc005d46e032a0d11e.n

Added shortcut to tooltips for all registered actionsShortcuts used to be only shown on the tool tips for tools. Now theynshow for any registered action, which includes most actions on a toolnbar.nnA few tool bar buttons were fixed to have their actions registered or tonuse an already available action instead of duplicating it, so that theirnshortcut is visible and can be configured.n
Issues view: Can now be hidden by clicking the status bar countersThe status bar button now works as a toggle, hiding the Issues view whennit is already visible.n

Use a single top-level status barSwap the editor-specific widgets in a single top-level status barninstead of having a status bar in each editor. This avoids the strangenplacement of the Console or Issues views below the status bar.n

Added initial support for projectsThe initial project is simply a list of folders. Each folder is scannednrecursively for files that seem to be one of the supported formatsn(based on their file extension).nnSince there's no automatic refresh at the moment, the Project menuncontains an action to trigger the refresh manually.nnThe last open project is automatically loaded on startup.nnThere's no way yet to remove folders from a project. Need to edit thenfile by hand for now.nnIssue #1665n

Projects: Added various missing pieces* Added Recent Projects menun* Added action to remove a folder from the projectn* Added small tool bar at bottom of Project viewn* Don't reset project model when adding/removing foldersn* Improved suggested file name and location for first projectnnIssue #1665n
Project view: Removed tool barIt looks a little messy and adds no new functionality.nnAlso prevented global project actions from being visible in the contextnmenu for subdirectories and files.n

Layers view: Fixed insertion position when using drag-n-dropDue to the change in how the layer list is reversed, the row innLayerModel::dropMimeData needed to be adjusted differently.nnAlso optimized it a little bit, since I noticed when dragging a set ofnlayers, each layer was reparented three times (to the same parent, so itnwasn't really noticable). It happened once for each column in the model.n
Removed superfluous semicolons to suppress warnings
Merge branch '1.3'

Project view: Enabled dragging for filesFiles can now be dragged onto Tiled to open them, and tilesets can bendragged into the Tileset view to add them to the current map.nnWith this the Project view essentially fully replaces the Maps view.n
Removed the Maps viewIt is obsoleted by the Project view.n

Simplified Project class, moved scanning to ProjectModelThe model seems a better fit for the scanning, especially taking intonaccount future asynchronous scanning.nnAlso, the model now keeps track of the name filter and updates it asnappropriate when file formats get added or removed. With a timer, tonprevent excessive scanning on startup and after reloading of scripts.n
Project: Moved the directory scanning to its own threadThis way it does not block the UI, which is needed since the scanningncan take a bit for large directories.n
Merge pull request #2685 from bjorn/wip/tiled-projectsAdded initial support for projects.
Travis CI: Reverted Qt version back to 5.12.5Just checking if the recent problem with launching Tiled on macOS isnrelated to the Qt update.nnIssue #2689n

Travis CI: Make macdeployqt more verboseMaybe it will tell us something about those missing libraries.nnAlso downgraded the QTCREATOR_VERSION to get us even closer to the lastnworking state.nnIssue #2689n
Travis CI: Fixed up argument order for macdeployqt
Travis CI: Updated Qt to 5.12.6 again
Travis CI: Enable ccache on macOS

Introduced sessionsThe session is currently implicit, being either the default session or anproject-based session saved alongside a project.nnIt stores the list of open files, the active file, recent files and thenlast state for previously opened files. This makes it easier to switchnbetween different projects, which swaps all these things along with it.nnAlso improved the start location for the open file dialog, which nownstarts at the active file, then the first recent file and finally thenuser home directory (instead of starting at the current workingndirectory, usually at the binary).nnIssue #1665n
Avoid use of deprecated QSet::toList(deprecated since Qt 5.14)n
Python plugin: Suppress compiler warningswarning: cast between incompatible function typesnnReported as gjcarneiro/pybindgen#25.n
Avoid use of deprecated QList::toSet(deprecated since Qt 5.14)nnUnfortunately, Qt versions before Qt 5.14 do not seem to offer anconvenient alternative.n
libtiled-java: Fixed writing of the tile type (#2704)Closes #2128

AppVeyor: Set up release-signing by SignPathOnly enabled for development snapshots and tagged releases.nnThis should produce signed installers at SignPath. I'm told they need tonbe manually approved there for now, but in the future hopefully theyncould be uploaded automatically instead of the unsigned installers.n

docs: Clarify can contain documentation and error handling (#2702)All can contain entries have been split into can contain at most onernand can contain any number. Additionally, there is now a note tornimplementors at the top of the specification listing how to handle parsingrnerrors. (More of a reminder on how to handle XML errors in general, sincernTMX is a form of XML.)rnrnCloses #696rnCloses #1754

Optimized loading of CSV tile layer data (#2701)* Massively reduced the amount of memory required to read CSV layer data.rnrn  On a map of 30,000 x 30,000 or more with one layer, tiled would takern  minutes (during which it was unresponsive). ~90% of that time was callingrn  destructors for the 900,000 QStrings allocated by QString::split.rnrn* Speed up CSV loading more by avoiding allocationsrnrn  By manually iterating, we can avoid allocating a QVector with width*heightrn  entries.rnrn  This speeds up loading times by 50% for 3,000 x 3,000 CSV inputs.

docs: Document all optional attributes, update some docs (#2705)All optional attributes are now marked as optional. All attributes haverna default value, if applicable. A new line was added at the top of therndocs to clearly state that all optional and default fields are correctlyrnmarked. Made the default value wording consistent throughout allrnattributes.rnrnAdditionally, I documented previously undocumented behavior in wangtile,rnand updated the supported encodings to include zstd.rn

docs: Alphabetize scripting API reference (#2720)It's faster to find the objects in the side bar when they're orderedrnalphabetically. I wanted to also sort functions and properties, but theyrnhave a consistent ordering, and it wouldn't speed up lookups by much.

libtiled: Unduplicated maxMargins and colorToStringTrying to enable using 'cpp.combineCxxSources: true' to speed up buildntimes, but this appears to be causing some issues still (many undefinednreferences when linking terraingenerator).n

Combine imagelayer and tileset image tags (#2713)Image layer images used separate code, so they didn't support the samernfeatures (like embedding). Follow-up on #2706rnrnCo-authored-by: Thorbju00c3u00b8rn Lindeijer <bjorn@lindeijer.nl>rn
Added automatic reloading of object templates (#2699)Whenever a template file changes, all objects that reference thatrnfile are synced.rnrnCloses #2676
